Reviews.Title: “Great Resort -Close to the parks”
Reviews.Author: MIchelle H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to be close to the theme parks and found a great rate on a large suite www.hotelroomking.com. (I book all my hotel there) The suite was perfect for the 4 of us, and we were able to visit the theme parks and head back in the afternoon to relax by the pool (which was awesome by the way) I have recommended this resort to other families looking for a clean place to stay with large suites.

Reviews.Title: “Best, hands down!”
Reviews.Author: clevelandm0m
Reviews.Content: We 'do' Disney every year in the fall, we always stay at Floridays. It meets our family's needs perfectly. Always clean, wonderful staff, great location, awesome pools...price can't be beat. Just the best, safe secure location close to all the action. Best Orlando resort, hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Jacques17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays Resort for 14 nights in April 2012. The stay exceeded all our expectations - the apartment was huge, amenities were excellent and we thoroughly received value for money for our stay. The resort is also within a short driving distance from all the major theme parks. We will definitely stay at Floridays again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Tassutq
Reviews.Content: Service was amazing! Cleeeeaaan and spacious! Very quiet resort had ample supplies when asked. Updated and all. We stayed in building B.... It was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday visit to Orlando theme parks”
Reviews.Author: DeepDoc
Reviews.Content: Floridays Resort Orlando Visit date : April 2012. General opinion : I would definitely stay here again. Pluses : My wife and I stayed here during our visit to SeaWorld, Aquatica and Wet ‘N Wild. We rented a car. Floridays Resort Orlando is within easy driving distance to the above. The grounds and room were very nice and clean. We stayed in a two-bedroom suite, C-510. The building was apparently fairly new. The check-in process was quick and easy (Michelle has the most beautiful eyes I have ever seen). We stayed here for three days. You can purchase theme park tickets here (much easier than the lines at the parks). The ticket prices are cheaper but not by much. We had a full kitchen with microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher, stove, coffee maker and most of the kitchen items you would need for meals. Minuses : The air conditioner will only go down to 70. The shower head in the master bathroom was terrible and clearly cheap, builder grade. Construction work was taking place right outside our back windows and the workers start at 7 am (i.e. Beeping construction equipment). The dishwasher was very loud. The small pillows on the king size master bed were TERRIBLE. Bring your own pillows if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Scott F
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at a 3 bedroom suite the service there is the best i seen on the east coast the staff is great the beds are confortable i will be going back soon

Reviews.Title: “great vacation but must have car”
Reviews.Author: aps115
Reviews.Content: Agree with other reviewers. This is a great location and very comfortable. Ideal place to "get away" from the theme parks. Visit the parks early and rest and recover in the afternoons when its hot and crowded, You could then easily return if you purchase a multi-park type ticket. Same day parking fee can be used at any park at no additional cost. Rooms are clean and spacious with helpful staff. Easy check in and check out. Lots of food choices etc close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: 121chiffchaff
Reviews.Content: We were attending a conference at the Convention Centre in Orlando and chose Floridays for its proximity to the venue and the price of the apartment. We were 6 adults and the apartment was just perfect. It was well fitted out with a great kitchen, as well having a washing machine and tumble dryer. This 3 bedroom apartment also had the benefit of overlooking a small lake with fountain (309B) and was really quiet. Being west facing we had the added benefit of the evening sun and on more than one occasion enjoyed a pre-dinner drink on the balcony whilst listening to the water fall from the fountain below - heaven! The beds were also of a high quality and really comfortable. All the rooms had good sized TVs (particularly in the lounge) and the staff we met throughout our week long visit were very helpful and pleasant and made our stay just that bit extra special. The pool was just fabulous. A great temperature and well designed to suit the more serious swimmer in one section as well as the kids water park area in another which seemed to keep everyone happy. The jacuzzi was very popular on occasion with good reason - great temperature and a really sociable size. The gym was well equipped. Judging by the range of guests from families to business men and women alike it is a venue that suits everyone. Located at the southern end of International Drive it is also great for access to all the Orlando attractions. Close to both Disney and Sea World and Aquatica and only about 15-20 minutes from Universal. The Premium Outlet located nearby and excellent supermarket complete the essentials. I would have no hesitation in recommending Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: cmcniel
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. Staff is great, rooms are beautiful, the pool is very nice, very close to attractions, great price, units have everything you need, beds are comfortable, had way more than enough pillows. I only wish we had spent a little more time there but we were at the parks all day, everyday. No need to bring towels, they bring clean towels everyday and have towels at the pool. Grocery store is very close. We rented a car so I don't know about the shuttle service. Would stay again for sure and would reccomend floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price - Great Rooms - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Autumn L
Reviews.Content: My family stayed her recently while visiting Disney. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were large, clean and provided plenty of space for our family of four. There is a kitchen and washer and dryer, which were added conveniences. It is very close to many restaurants and the premium outlets. The Disney resorts are not far either. There may be more "upscale" resorts in the area, but if you are looking for a reasonable price, nice clean rooms, a great pool and great location - this is the resort for you. I would stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “home from home”
Reviews.Author: noo1331
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at floridays from 4th april -28th april 2012, We chose this hotel because of the great reviews on trip advisor & we were not dissapointed. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in building B floor 6. Our room looked out over the pool, bar & cafe. The suite was large clean , with enough space for a bit of privacy when needed. The hotel cafe served basic but tasty food, they also had a starbucks which was great for me as i love my morning coffee. The hotels main pool is lovely though i feel it could be bigger considering the size of the resort as some days it become very busy & no sun loungers were available. We thorougly enjoyed our stay at floridays & probably would return though we did see some other hotels near by that we liked & would like to try. Ask for building B if you want to be near the pool though it can get a bit noisy at times, i guess other blocks would be a lot quieter .I emailed floridays requesting building B about 2 weeks before we arrived. I wouldnt hesitate in recommending floridays resort it made our trip even more fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the cancellation fee”
Reviews.Author: MontanaTravelMomma
Reviews.Content: We just cancelled our reservations and were saddened by their harsh cancellation policy- a loss of money of one night's stay plus taxes. This is excessive by industry standards greater than one month out with no flexibility. Sure, it is published information but certainly disappointing overall and makes me hesitate to work with them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: JerseyMillers
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review for anywhere I have stayed in the past, but I felt inclined to do so from my experience this past week at Floridays. First off, It was FABULOUS! I highly recommend the building we stayed in - Building B, higher floor (5th or 6th). It was central to pool and no noise issues at all. The suite was fully stocked including such nice amenities as a Keurig with cups. The staff was very helpful & friendly. They even printed my boarding passes for the trip home. I have stayed on Disney properties & other villa type places in the past in Orlando, and I would definitely stay here again on our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: Wheeler59
Reviews.Content: I really have no complaints about the resort. It was in a good location close enough to the parks, a Walgreens, and grocery stores that it was very convenient. There are some things you should know before you come, though. There is a bar, a small cafe, a Starbucks and a very limited market area. Go to the grocery store and stock up on necessities. House keeping changes your sheets and brings towels. Period. Do your dishes and pick up after yourself, you'll be fine. People who are complaining about the smoking rules are exagerrating, there are plenty of locations around the resort that you can smoke, including by the bar area. The pool was nice, my kids enjoyed it a lot. Overall a good value for familes and a nice alternative to staying at Disney, especially if you have 3+ kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations & Value!”
Reviews.Author: Maryland_MOM_0f_3
Reviews.Content: After researching staying on the Disney property for a family of 5, I finally found Floridays. What a fantastic option to staying off Disney property! The accomodations were spacious with nice decor and clean. With 3 children, it was great to have the space and 2 bathrooms! The staff was all very friendly and accomodating. The pool is fantastic and the kids loved it! I really don't think you can find a place this nice for this price anywhere in Orlando. Truly a great choice!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Webster Springs, West Virginia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: This resort is very nice. The suites are very large for the price you pay. I doubt you will find nicer lodging for the money. We stayed in building "B" and it was very close to the pool, office, game room, bar etc. The cafe is nice with basic offerings such as burgers, pancakes etc. A little overpriced but not too bad....hey, you're on vacation! The pool is really nice with zero entrance for the young ones. Heated too! There is some construction going on beside the resort (staff told us they are building an exit ramp from I-4 which will take 2 years) but nothing other than a few backup buzzers etc...no big deal breaker at all. This was our first stay at Floridays and really any place off of Disney property but we will def return. There is a Walgreens and Publix supermarket a short walk away although the walk is a bit long if you have little ones tagging along so keep that in mind. Overall our stay was pleasant and the staff was great, especially the concierge which handled all of our needs such as the shuttle to the parks, cabs, etc. We took the shuttle a couple days to the parks but a few times the kids were tired so we took cabs home. Shuttle runs to Universal Studios which only takes about 15 minutes. If you plan on going to the Disney Parks the shuttle will drop you off at Epcot and from there you can either ride the Monorail to the Magic Kingdom or the buses to the other parks. Cab fares (one way): Airport $43...Animal Kingdom $26...Universal Studios...$22.

Reviews.Title: “Best yet!”
Reviews.Author: Lancelott57
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels and this hotel is top notch.. We only wish the restaurants in the area were this efficient. The hotel was very helpful and accomodating. The pool area was our grandaughters favorite even over disney and animal kingdom. She would have been happy to just do the pool every day and forget the crowded parks. The rooms were very clean and comfy, roomy and spacious for a family of 6 or more...We were very impressed and would highly recommend the hotel to everyone. However stay away from the pizza, it was not good, taste was not good and extremely thin almost non-existent crust. Other than that, YAY to floridays~!

Reviews.Title: “Floridays for family Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: 2andd1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at Floridays. We chose Floridays over a Disney hotel because of cost and room layout. We had a 3 bedroom suite for 4 adults and 2 kids. The layout was perfect, the room was very spacious. Similar size rooms at Disney cost well over $1200 per night, we paid less than $200 here. The convenience of staying on Disney property would have been great but not for the cost. The drive to Animal Kingdom took the longest- it was approximately 20 minutes. Magic Kingdom parking lot was 15 minutes, Epcot was 10 minutes- this doesn't take into account the time it takes to get from the parking lot to the entrance to the park which was another 20 minutes for Magic Kingdom. We were there during a non-peak week so we didn't have to wait in traffic lines so it may take longer depending on when you go. For the travel reasons, if we go back in a few years we will probably stay on property and give up the room conveniences of Floridays- but for this time with young children the hotel was perfect. If we go back to Orlando for SeaWorld or Universal I will definitely be staying at Floridays again. I recommend it to any parent who wants some space for the kids to play and wants their own bedroom. All of the hotel amenities were great, the pool was perfect, the staff was friendly. Two thumbs up for Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: hrtitupsry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business due to the Rosen Shingle Creek resort being full for a conference I was attending there. However, I have to say that it was a great experience and I'm almost glad that I had to stay at Floridays during the conference. Bottom line, this is a very nice resort for the price. I stayed in a 2BR, 2BA condo that was relatively clean and VERY spacious. Positives: Full kitchen stocked with plates, tupperware, utensils, etc. Close to a lot of attractions (Sea World, Orlando Outlets.) Negatives: There were a few issues with the room, ie the water in the shower took a really long time to get warm, some light bulbs were burnt out, the sheets weren't clean when I arrived. I'm pretty low maintenance so this stuff doesn't bother me, but it may be a bigger deal to others. Either way the staff seemed very friendly and responsive, so I have no doubt they could have corrected some of the minor issues had I cared enough to notify them. Overall this is a great resort (especially for families), but I would definitely consider staying here again if I ever come back to O-town.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: TaorminaMilazzo
Reviews.Content: We (golf foursome) had a pleasure of staying in Floridays Resort for five days. The staff is courteous, friendly and knowledgeable. The units are clean and nicely decorated with comfortable beds. I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone visiting the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “First time”
Reviews.Author: nharris73
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 weeks, close to everything. Very good staff and service. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good, recommended”
Reviews.Author: readysteadycook
Reviews.Content: Visited here for two weeks in April 2012. Here is some feedback: Positives: - nice location at the quiter end of Int. drive - two pools - staff very helpful & pleasant - large 2 bed unit, well equipped, excellent kitchen & bathroom facilities - Really useful coach service to some theme parks - Plenty of parking - Not far from Outlet store, restaurants, supermarket. - Safety deposit box in the rooms Minor issues we had: - There is construction work taking place on the left side of the hotel, looks like a new road being built, there was some minor noise evident in one of the bedrooms mainly from beepers on the trucks & construction equipment being used, normally early morning - 'Confusion' over the daily ammenities for the bathrooms - some days we had, some days we did not, one staff member said we should not be having though reading through our daily resort fee brochure it said we should.. a minor point though we were nearly out of toliet rolls in two bathrooms at the end of our stay...

Reviews.Title: “Floridays”
Reviews.Author: prifamily
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed here from the 18th to the 22nd of april...for starters when checking in it was nice and quick was to our room in about 5 minutes upon arrival. The rooms were very spacious for the price... We had 3 adults and 3 children and were perfectly fine in a two bedroom suite...the employees were very hospitable and the concierge was helpful...the palms cafe is decent nothing to write home about and the pool was always crowded...the only downfall was parking, at night i had too park far away from our room which after a long day was not attractive...all in all floridays is a vacation in itself!!! Coming back in a couple months and will most likely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fun for family”
Reviews.Author: Mllyg
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Orlando for a long weekend with five adults, a toddler, and an infant. We stayed in a two bedroom suite (one of our adults was a last minute addition) and it was great. We had a wonderful experience and our kids LOVED the pool area. It is also awesome to have a kid friendly pool with such a convenient bar - we had a "happy hour" and watched the kids swim every night. This was preferable to many of the Disney properties to me because of the reasonable cost and the kitchen. We ate breakfast and dinner in the room every night we were there - we would definitely consider Floridays again....

Reviews.Title: “First time here.”
Reviews.Author: gramps66
Reviews.Content: We reserved a 2 bedroom unit. When we got there we asked for a 3 bedroom unit because we had 8 in our party. 4 adults & 4 children. We say other reviews that said they were not charge $25.00 extra per night as we were. When we got to our unit the housekeeping left alot to be desired. We did our shopping at Walmarts to make up for the items we needed in the rooms. The grounds and pools areas were well kept. The balcony was dirty and look out at constuction and I4. The room was very dated and needs to be up graded. The sign in lady said we were to be put by the pond but this was not the case. May or may stay here again. Will close for now.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Floridays Resort, April 2012”
Reviews.Author: tallahasseetraveler1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Floridays Resort. I would recommend it highly to anyone visiting the Orlando area. Everything was provided in our suite. The only thing I didn't like was the fact that our building (F) was located the farthest from the main building.

Reviews.Title: “1st time visitors”
Reviews.Author: theTerryfamily
Reviews.Content: The Terry family, Wolverhampton, England. I'm sure after reading the reveiws a lot of you were like me: "on the whole this place sounds good, but theres a couple of issues that concern me". I can honestly say that the experience we had was very good; we are a family of five-- myself, my wife (five-months pregnant), and three children, 16 12, and 9. The condo had everything we needed, from room space to cooking and cleaning appliances. The resort pool, spa, gym, front desk, bar, and cafe were great; our only negative was the price of the food at the cafe. We saw security walking around a couple of times which I'm sure gives everyone, especially families, peace of mind. The staff we spoke too were great, they always helped us as best they could. The location is excellent for all the parks-- my own personnal opinion is that we chose correctly hiring a car (we were not going to bother initially because of the trolley buses available), but having the car gave us much more freedom to go when and where we wanted to. I would definitely recommend Floridays to family and friends. Thanks for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommended! Excellent spot for location, price & comfort!”
Reviews.Author: JYPayne
Reviews.Content: We're still here (came for 2 weeks & leave on Saturday) so I'm writing this for you while it's fresh in my memory. Firstly this place is absolutely superb value for money. The apartments are two or three bedroomed with two bathrooms including a huge jacuzzi bath. Fully equipped Kitchen, washer & dryer, dining area, comfortable sofa & chairs, TV in every room and a balcony. Hair dryer in each bathroom too. Totally home from home comfort for the same price as you pay for a standard bedroom with just two double beds in it at the rip off Disney resort hotels. I've stayed in both the Dolphin and All Stars previously so speak from first hand experience. Hot tip from me, after a few days you're 'parked out' so to escape the over saturation of Disney etc it's an absolute haven to get away from it by NOT staying in a resort hotel with it down your throat 24/7. Even with young kids like mine (6 and 8) you do need to escape it after a few days - trust me on that, you'll thank me for it I assure you. Staying at Floridays be sure to ask for a room from the third floor upwards. The reason for this is becauseprice along on the ground floor apartments are completely closed in by a protective black screen which is claustrophobic. The second floor apartments all have a 4ft brick wall instead of railings on the balcony so when you're sat down you're staring at a solid wall - awful. Kids will also be standing on chairs to look over the wall, I've seen it - dangerous. From floor 3 upwards you have railings so you can sit down & enjoy the views of the lakes & watch the turtles bobbing about in the water etc. The bistro cafe is basic so don't expect anything other than fried junk - burgers, pizza, chicken wings etc. the Caesar salad is pleasant enough but this is not by any stretch of the imagination a restaurant like described on the website!!! It's a few chairs & tables inside a shop and a few outside on the patio by the bar. I emphasise not many, literally about six or seven tables, absured for the size of the resort, so get there very early. Lots of restaurants nearby though, some very nice ones on Vineland Avenue, literally the first right hand turn from the resort. Go out exploring, it's brilliant fun! There is a Bennihana restaurant within walking distance which is handy & quite good fun. If you haven't tried Teppanyaki style cooking then give it a go, it's fresh & enjoyable. If you want to be near the main pool and the bar/bistro then ask them for a room in either building A or B. but to be fair, it's not all that far to walk from the other buildings, just with the intense heat it feels a bit much that's all. Once you acclimatise it's nothing. You won't go wrong with this resort, it's excellent value for money. Smart, well maintained, clean. The staff are friendly & helpful and the best tip anyone can give you is buy your park tickets in the USA and absolutely NOT in advance in the UK despite all the sales blurb. We saved almost £400 buying them here & you can get great deals not only from the hotel concierge but from no end of shops along International Drive, don't let the travel agents in the UK rip you off. Booked this hotel through booking.com and delighted with their price, do some price comparisons and I'll wager you find their deal to be the best. With that and reading the comments left on trip advisor I booked this hotel well informed and we have not for one moment been disappointed. I strongly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays - loved it for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: KoolkatMichigan
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Floridays was quite nice and more than expected for the price. Traveling with three adults and two children, the two bed, two bath was perfect. After reading reviews, I wanted to have a room in building B, 3rd floor or above. (close to the pool and have a view). We ended up in building B but on the 1st floor. We were facing the pond and actually enjoyed this room very much. No waiting for elevators, and only the first floor balconies are screened in which was great for bugs. People do walk past your room but we enjoyed listening to the conversations. We had a four and five year old traveling with us and the location in relation to the parks was perfect. The pool was heated and the girls loved the pool. We would go to the park in the a.m. and then head home for a few hours for naps and then go back to the park. We packed a little cooler to take to the park so we didn't buy hardly any food at the park. One day we took red bulls into the park (for the adults) and sooooo many people asked us where we bought them. They were disappointed to find out we brought them in ourselves. The hotel food at the palms cafe was a bit overpriced. $5.50 for a beer and I think $7.50 for a mango margarita. One night I had a blackened grouper sandwich and it was $12.50. We did order a pizza also and it was about $19 for a large. It was burnt and the cafe replaced it no problem. Since the rooms are more like a condo, shop at the publix for groceries. Don't forget the drinking water because we used our bottled water for the coffee and then wised up and bought a gallon of drinking water. I wasn't fond of the tap water. Be sure to buy or bring with you the kruger K cups if you drink coffee. They supply a few and offer them in the cafe to buy but it's cheaper just to bring them. All groceries are a little bit more expensive down there (compared to MI). bring some of your favorite dry goods if you can fit them in your bags. Also bring a few dishwasher cubes. They supply you with 1 dishwasher box of powder for one load. Again, this is just one more thing to bring that's no big deal and will save you from buying it at the publix. There aren't a lot of dishes in the condo so we ran the diswasher each day. There are little shampoos and soap there but they won't replace these once you run out. We will be going back to Floridays again for our next Disney trip; especially since we alternate days at the park with days at the pool. They do have pool towels so we didn't need to bring the towels that I packed. If you're having a pool day, get to the pool early if you're picky about your pool spot. We needed to be near the kids and those locations for beach chairs fill up. It wasn't too bad but I'm crazy organized so I staked our pool spots before 9am. We weren't at the pool until 11am. On the flipside, if someone had moved our stuff than that would have been fine. unless your sitting in the chair, all chairs are up for grabs, even it it's my chair I'm saving. If this hotel had a spa, it would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms/not so good pool area”
Reviews.Author: al l
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom/2 bath suites are excellent. Kitchen is very well equipped. Comfy beds. My onlly complaint is the pool area....it is tiny and has too many palm trees blocking the sun. Those need to be cut down. More loung chairs need to be at the main pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Beautiful Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gina S
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort. It was beautiful, comfortable, affordable and a great location for those planning on visiting all the parks...Disney, Sea World and Universal!! They had a great kids pool and had activities at the pool for kids on the weekend!! Would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect condo-style accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Shriram N
Reviews.Content: Our family loved Floridays' two bedroom condo-style accomodation. It has full fledged kitchen, dishwasher, washer and dryer. Everything inside. We did not have to go anywhere else. All rooms have TVs. Calm, clean and nice. Close to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: P456
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night in the Floridays Resort after arriving from Europe. The hotel is easy to find and premises are well kept. At the entrance is a Benihana Japanese Restaurant. Our 2BR Suite was very well appointed (jacuzzi, washer, dryer, full kitchen...) and the amenities were good (coffee, detergents, shampoo,...). Breakfast / coffee bar (setting, menu) not completely in line with the rest of the experience. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY PUT THIS PLACE ON YOUR MUST STAY AT LIST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bali_teman
Reviews.Content: our family of 4 plus mother & sister in law, recently enjoyed a 8 night stay in a 3 bed 2 bath unit at Floridays. The location on I drive was great with a Walgreen's and a Publix easy walking distance. The Idrive trolley stop is out the front making moving around simple, and the park shuttle had great options. All of the employees were great, however Wildo (concierge) was a definite stand out. The pool area is great, and having the grocery store next door made cooking a breeze and the washer and dryer in the room just one less hassle. Everybody was able to have their own space which was great! DEFINITELY PUT THIS PLACE ON YOUR MUST STAY AT LIST!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Damian R
Reviews.Content: We've returned to Floridays each year for the last 4 years and each time it never disappoints. Resort and staff are first rate and the location couldn't be better. Rooms combine the space and convenience of everything you get in a villa with the added benefit of having all the facilities of a luxury resort hotel on your doorstep. Perfect and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! One of the best places I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: SDubord
Reviews.Content: The TripAdvisor reviews are bang on! From the moment we checked in, we were amazed. The 2-bedroom suite we had was as big as a condo, very well appointed & equipped, with the usual amenities, and then some. Full kitchen (NOT kitchenette) with an island (with stools) as well as a full-size dishwasher. Better yet, an in-suite laundry closet to catch up on laundry... no need for quarters here! Best of all, a gorgeous 4-piece ensuite with jacuzzi roman tub and a separate large tiled shower enclosure. I've seen hotel rooms smaller than this bathroom! On top of all that, the price was more than reasonable, and the staff were always cheerful and helpful. My only regret is we weren't at the hotel enough to enjoy all the other amenities (pool, game room, etc.) But we'll definitely be back in the future to do so. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “OK for Families but not really for me.”
Reviews.Author: Astyrene2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot ot offer to families traveling together. The cost is low and the rooms are spacious but the decor on the walls (I hate that stucco inside wal stuff) made me feel like I was at Motel 6 or a Microtel....and the beds were terriblly uncomfortable......terrible. Now kids won't care so that's not a thing for me this did not work. Walls too thin...parking too scarce but for families this is clearly a good, safe affordable option..

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location convenient prices.”
Reviews.Author: Marcosuru
Reviews.Content: People would bend their backs to help you. Large rooms and complete kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great For The Whole Family”
Reviews.Author: 1dundee
Reviews.Content: In February we spent a week at this wonderful resort. There is always something going on for the whole family. We had a hard time dragging ourselves away long enough to visit the many attractions around Orlando. The employees all go out of their way to make your stay the best ever. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Travelling with family? Choose Floridays.”
Reviews.Author: edmontontraveller11
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in a three bedroom suite at this resort during a spring vacation. We really appreciated the location and found it easy to get to the theme parks as well as the interstate. Our room was clean and had plenty of storage for everyone. The sound proofing within the room was very good. We only noticed the people in the suite above when they were walking very heavily or dropped something on the tile floor. We were given a ground floor suite in building E. I was worried about the proximity to the pool but we were right next to the second small pool and enjoyed it just as much as the main pool and didn't have to worry about getting a chair during busy times. We would definitely stay here again if we go back to Orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and space for a family”
Reviews.Author: Frank C
Reviews.Content: Floridays was a very reasonable cost for a two bedroom suite for four. The suite was clean and in very good shape. The grounds were well kept, the atmosphere was quiet and family oriented. We had a rental car and found the location close to all the attractions, resturants and shopping. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: Amy F
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando frequently and stay in suites or condo style hotels to accomodate my family. I usually stay in different hotels/condos, but after staying at Floridays I will definitely be back! The resort was beautiful, rooms were spacious, clean and newly remodeled. Great location for us, just a few miles from Disney and Sea World. This resort was a great value and exceeeded my expeciations! So much nicer than any of the condos I've stayed at around the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cysmith16
Reviews.Content: Great kids pool, great quiet pool, Starbucks coffee, well-priced food, at an i-ride trolley stop. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good for 3 generation visit”
Reviews.Author: ValerieNosara
Reviews.Content: Taking our son and his children to enjoy the Orlando attractions, this condo worked perfectly. Lots of space with 3 bedrooms, and we were able to bring bkfst and dinner foods to prepare in the unit to minimize eating out. Disney Park and Sea World kept them busy all day and the pool at the resort was great for unwinding at the end of the day. Clean and well equipped unit well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Disney, Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: Tortito
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom condo and had more than enough space. The location is close to SeaWorld, Premium Outlets and Disneyworld. Although don't bother trying to get to Downtown Disney after 4:00. There seems to be only one way in and one way out. We sat in traffic for two consecutive nights moving only a couple hundred yards in 20 minutes. We finally just gave up. The resort grounds are nice as is the pool. There are a few restaurants around but you will need a car to get anywhere. Overall nice stay and we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What makes Floridays number one in Orlando?”
Reviews.Author: PhilliesFan097
Reviews.Content: Floridays success is based on the friendliness and competency of the staff, the size of the rooms (apartments, really) and the affordable price. Travelling as a group of 4 (2 adults and 2 kids), the staff made things easier for us--the concierge arranged the theme park tickets and local transportation and Lisa at the front desk--super helpful, treats guests as friends--checked us in for our departing flight and printed out our boarding passes while we were in Tampa. The Lobby staff was very cheerful and kind. The 2 bedroom suites are the perfect size for a family of 4. They're nice--not lavish--but well equipped for cooking (if you wish) and doing laundry in the suite so you can pack less clothes and bring them home clean. The main pool is fun--the poolside restaurant is a bit small and service is slooooow--probably due to size constraints--hard to run in and out for something quick. If you prefer not to walk, it would be best to get a suite in a building by the main pool...but we were in the building farthest away and enjoyed the walk--kids were counting the small lizards they saw on the palm trees...landscaping was nice. One thing to keep in mind, the housekeeping service includes trash removal, towel and bathroom restocking and bed making--that is it--it is enough if you know that going in--but don't expect full cleaning every day or you'll be disappointed. A vacuum is provided... Overall, if you are travelling with children, want plenty of space at a reasonable price--this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, poor housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Mirggus
Reviews.Content: Location is ok, you need to have a car. Pool is nice and sunbeds good. We had a 3 bedroom suite on 2nd floor and our balkony was just horrible. Concrete wall so high that only adults could see out. (Standing on their toes...) Room was ok, little old and used. On resort fee you get basic housekeeping, which includes making beds, taking out the garpage and new towels. We were not pleased by the quality of housekeeping. One day we called to reseption to ask if they are coming at all and were told that no housekeeping is included to our resort fee. When we told that we have paper that proves that it is included, the reply was oho... Almost every day the housekeeping arrived after 4 or 5 pm, just the same time as we did after a long day in parks. The ladies who did cleaning were not friendly and did not do good job. Sometimes our bed was not done and other day there was not enough of towels or some trash had been left.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays is a great place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Iansam344
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a family of four, this gave us space to relax after busy days at theme parks. The rooms were very clean and well appointed, with lots of wardrobe space and large master bathroom. Lovely to have a balcony as not all places in Orlando offer this. The pool area was lovely and perfect to cool off after sightseeing. Great location, not snarled up with traffic and easy to access SeaWorld, Disney and Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a good suite”
Reviews.Author: DarrenA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family (4 kids) because of the good reviews, and it lived up to the hype. Large suite, comfy beds, and reasonably close to Disney, all for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel... a must visit”
Reviews.Author: Lorna S
Reviews.Content: enjoyed the hotel as much as the attractions. excellent service. double check prices of cabs if you get a quote from the hotel it may differ. always answer any questions you have and very knowledgeable about attractions. if got to disney buy tickets day by day and see how you like it because they are non-refundable Sea World is the way to go and bush gardens... 114.99 for sea world and busch gardens for 14days (per person) well worth it... looking forward to going again in the new year

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to check out the Hype.”
Reviews.Author: Ulliboo
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travellers to Orlando, and have stayed in a few hotels and condos in the same area as Floridays. For this stay in April, we had 2 nights to make up before we moved to our regular condo resort. Due to the great reviews on TA, we decided to try this resort. I'm going to start out by saying, if you have not had any other experience staying in a condo resort in this area, Floridays would probably come off looking very good. But as I had the unique opportunity to stay at 2 resorts in one trip, I can make some quick comparisons. Location: This resort is on the south end of International Drive, but very cose to SeaWorld, Aquatica, and the Disney parks. You will likely be better off renting a car in this area, as there are not a lot of restaurants within walking distance. A Walgreens, and Publix is very close, and you could walk to these. The Premium Outlets are also only a few minutes away. Rooms: I found the rooms to be nice...just nice. The are relatively new, and the furniture is in good repair. We were 4 adults and 1 child in a 2 bedroom, and had plenty of room. The porch is not screened in, and you can only fit a few chairs on it. Now the down side...the beds were extremely uncomfortable, with what could only be called "crinkly" linens ! My son asked us to stop moving around in the bed at night as the linens made soo much nosie !! I was grateful that I only had 2 nights to spend on them. Grounds: Very nicley landscaped, but not a lot of "lushness" as was prsent in our next resort. Pools: The main pool was very nice, but I did think it looked larger in the pictures on line. There is a sand area for kids to play in, and towels were readily available in a hut by the pool. There is a second small pool at the rear of the resort, and it was very nice. Restaurant: Yikes...only eat here if you have lots of time ! Limited tables to eat at, and service is next to none. Smoking area is at the restaurant, and there were a few people puffing on cigars while people were eating. If that's not your thing, be aware. In all, the resort is very nice, and the price is right. I would recommend it to others, but I myself will continue to go across the road to our favorite resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian G
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were very happy with a quick two minute check in. We arrived at our room and were very happy to see the room was in great shape, very clean, and was a little bigger than I expected. We were very ahppy to be in the pool within 20 minutes of pulling into the resort. The pool is a good size and is kind of split between a kiddie area and a grown up side. We didn't have any issues with our room and were very glad we had a dishwasher as well as a washer and dryer. We received clean towels, trash service, and had our beds made everyday. There was a good size safe in the room so we felt safe leaving our belongings in the room. We were also happy that there was Publix grocery store as well as several drug stores within a five minute drive. There is also a nice outlet mall close by and a few restaraunts but we found ourselves driving North on most evenings for dinner. The staff I met was very nice and helpful. The orning we left we were able to checkout within five minutes. There is a $12.50 per day resort fee that no one mentioned to us but we saw it in the fne print when we booked our stay on Expedia. This was for parking and wifi. We didn't have any issue with parking at the resort but it was a slower week. There is some construction on the south side of the property but they didn't start until 7am and they were done most days by the time we got back around 4pm. My son enjoyed watcing the tractors anyways. We didn't eat or driink at the pool bar but it looked nice. There is also a nice little sand area by the pool s the kids can get that beach feel. Hot tub for the grown ups and a swim pool that was always empty. We plan to stay here again in the future and were very happy with our stay, he cost, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MaxineFlorida
Reviews.Content: We had a three bedroom facility that was very spacious and comfortable and it was shared by 6 older women on a reunion weekend. We had plenty of room and the spacious kitchen and dining area gave us an opportunity to eat some meals in and time to visit. This was our second visit to Floridays and we will certainly go again. It is an excellent value for outstanding accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin.. and a bit more”
Reviews.Author: Alistair_Alex_Fraser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a 3 bedroom condo with 3 kids for a fortnight. Spacious place, 4 TVs, DVD player, well equipped kitchen, Keurig coffee maker, washer dryer etc. Clean and friendly with a cafe on site that serves Starbucks coffee (it's not a Starbucks). Easy parking. If in Orlando again we would go back to Floridays without any hesitation. Any drawbacks? Well the pool area can get a bit crowded - but it was still ok, and we were there over a combination of Easter and springbreak. Agree, not smart timing.... You do need a car. The resort is very centrally situated for the theme parks, however they are scattered across an area that takes up to a 20 minute drive.There are not a huge number of restaurant that are within walking distance (Benihana at the entrance is good) so a car is also good there. Overall, particularly with a family, Floridayst really ticks all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “not more than 2 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: crystaljj
Reviews.Content: great resort?no don't joke......big apartments with old furniture,no service at all, not clean, no restaurant, great location but a very cheap hotel. Old swimming pool area, very very little gym, old sheets on bed and 8 days without a changing...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort, good location and very comfortable appartements”
Reviews.Author: StephaneL34
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 11 nights with my family in April 2012. We were in buiding B, next to the pool but with a view on the adjacent lake, so the ideal location. Our stay was excellent, we really appreciated the location, the fantastic swimming pool with water games for children, the friendliness of the hotel staff, The apartment was very spacious, and comfortable. The resort was full, but at no point did we hear our neighboors, nor did they complain about our kids, so the noise insulation must be perfect :) I only have positive things to say about this stay and would highly recommend this place to my friends. We go to Orlando every year since 1997, and the quality standard of the Orlando hotels is not always equivalent to other areas even for reknowned brands, but with Floridays our expectations were really exceeded.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Heather S
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from an 11 night stay at the Floridays resort. We decided not to hire a car and found that this was certainly not restrictive for what we wanted to do. The free shuttle to the parks was fantastic and made everything very accessible. Suite that we stayed in was extremely clean and very spacious. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly and we certainly would stay here again if we went to Florida. Furnishings were of a very high standard and there was everything that you could need. They even provided washing powder for the washing machine and dryer and an iron and ironing board so that we could wash as we went along. Well equiped supermarket is within walking distance and resort was extremely well situated at the quieter less hectic end of I Drive. Pool area was great and certainly this is an ideal place to stay, we have a 10year old and a 4 year old. Area feels very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays is Ace”
Reviews.Author: robert m
Reviews.Content: this hotel has self catering suites which are huge, jacuzzi, washing and drying machines full compliment of cooking very comy beds very clean well furnished, staff at this hotel are all 5 star, willing to help with anything nothing is too much, always smiling always friendly and very professional the lady concierge is just a darling arranges all the transfers to the attractions does everything for you, take a helicopter ride when you are there is only a couple of hundred yards away and it is awesome and very cheap. this is one place i will stay at again .

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort, Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: jerseytraveller_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights during the week of April 9th with my wife and teenage daughter. There really isn't much more to add to the number 1 rated resort in Orlando, there are plenty of photos to go along with the glowing reviews. What in my opinion would make my rating an excellent would be softer beds, a larger pool and fitness center to coincide with the size of the resort. The condo was spacious and clean, staff very friendly and the location was excellent with a Publix within walking distance as well as the prime Orlando outlet. We rented a car so we made a trip to stock up at the Super Walmart so I can't comment on the cafe near the pool. All and all, a very relaxing vacation. We stayed in building A on the 4th floor. There is a smaller more quiet pool near building E.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: GatcB
Reviews.Content: Floridays was a great resort. Location fantastic, we visited Universal, Disney and golfed. Everything under 8 miles away. We had 2 BR unit, kids aged 10, 13. GREAT room size, large master BR/bath, 2nd BR smaller but great for kids. Kitchen nice, made breakfast and went to parks etc. Laundry if need it. Pool great for older and younger kids plus bonus pool. grounds well kept. Had to move due to construction noise, but move was made easy - staff courteous. Cafe was pretty good, very convenient and relaxed. Staff did not know golf in area, had to find on our own. Lighting in rooms poor, very dark had to buy a brighter light bulb! but otherwise fantastic place to stay. Lots of rooms, space, 3 TVs, made for no family issues...everyone happy!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect paradise”
Reviews.Author: MissRaini
Reviews.Content: Proximity to all Disney theme parks! Seaworld and Universal Studios too. Orlando Premium Outlets are walking distance away, grocery store Publix around the corner. Rooms are excellent clean and feel like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Value, Some Cleanliness Issues, FOUL Water”
Reviews.Author: Gregory K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two room suite from 15-18 April 2012. Our first visit, since the hotel we normally stay at was unavailable. Staff was very friendly and the location is convenient to local attractions - about a 10 minute drive to Disney World property. Our two room suite was fine for myself, my wife and 16 year old son, but the furniture seemed a bit crowded. We requested a room on the top floor and had no noise problems, despite the construction going on all around the property. So on the plus side, an adequate ‘base of operations’ for visiting the surrounding resorts. And the Publix supermarket right next door is very convenient for stocking the kitchen. There were a few negatives, however. First and foremost, the water. To be blunt, it smelled like it was pumped directly from a swamp. Borderline nauseating. We used bottled water for all drinking, and taking a shower was frustrating because the odor of the water competed with the soap. We left all looking forward to getting home and taking a shower where you came out smelling clean instead of musty. The appliances left something to be desired as well. The sink compactor jammed the first time we used it and stopped up the drain, though the maintenance staff fixed it while we were away at Disney. The electric stove burners were all warped, and pans were always wobbling when you cooked on them. We ran the dishwasher once, and saw that the soap was still sitting in a glob at the bottom when the cycle was done, so we hand-washed everything from there, using the machine as a glorified drying rack. Another thing is the odd ‘service fee’ you are charged daily for things like having your beds made and towels changed (the extent of room ‘cleaning’) . This fee does include Internet access, which most other suites charge extra for, so we did not mind. Still, it was a bit off-putting that additional cleaning (vacuuming, dusting and such I assume) is billable. And speaking of cleaning, when we arrived there were children’s handprints and smears on the glass tables, and my son stepped on a splinter of broken glass on the carpet, after which we found a few more pieces of glass on the floor. So I assume they don’t give the rooms a good cleaning between visitors, which we found unsettling. If we hear of an improvement with the water quality and cleaning we would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, family friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cumberlandri
Reviews.Content: We flew in to Orlando and stayed for three nights at Floridays before heading south for the remainder of our vacation. The "room" we stayed in was amazing and had absolutely everything a family could need. We ended up in a three bedroom apartment which included two enormous bathrooms with a tiled stand up shower and jacuzzi tub in the master bathroom. The master bedroom had a king size bed and BOTH guest bedrooms had two full size beds each. There was also a pull out couch. All told you could easily sleep 8 or more in the 3 bedroom "rooms". The room also included a full kitchen (stove, microwave, toaster, full fridge), center island, dining room table, washer/dryer and TVs in every room. The main pool was a blast for our kids and they even enjoyed the Arcade room. The room was well kept and maintained and because of how big they were we couldn't hear any of the neighbors. Great value for the price we paid and is some place I would recommend for anyone (especially families) that is looking for a fun relaxing LARGE place to stay in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families who need room to move.”
Reviews.Author: Patricia Griffi... G
Reviews.Content: Floridays is a great resort. We stayed in the 3 bedroom suite. It was nice to have room enough for my family of 5. The washer/dryer was great and it was a clean and friendly place. We were in building F which was a walk to the pool (might have asked for a closer room to the pool if we had known). Close to supermarket-Got sandwiches there for lunch and breakfast foods/waters to keep down some of the cost of visiting the parks. Overall stay was great/great value-we will stay there again. I have already recommended it to family memebers.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays Resort a great place to stay....:)”
Reviews.Author: Suanne709
Reviews.Content: My children and I have stayed at the Floridays Resort for last Easter Break and for a few days after Easter this year, 2012. The rooms are spacious and have everything you need, even a blender and a washer and dryer. The Cafe has good food and even a little Convenience store. There is a Game Room, a nice pool and a Pool Bar. Besides having all of these conveniences, the staff at this Resort is fantastic. Everyone is courteous and helpful! They always made time to speak to myself and my children; we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Quite rightly No 1 for families”
Reviews.Author: JuliaHLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week break in Florida and stayed at Floridays for 5 nights. I would definitely stay here again. The apartments were spacious and well equipped. Enormous fridge, full cooker, microwave etc etc. We had a two bedroom suite which had a sofa bed as well, so could easily sleep 6 people, although it may be a bit cramped for that number of adults...but certainly excellent value. We were were in building C and it was close enough to the pool and main facilities but probably a bit quieter than building A or B.The staff at both reception and at the concierge were very helpful and a request, when we had a problem with the toilet, was dealt with immediately. The pool is a good size and very good for children of all ages. The pool area and public toilets are very clean when you consider the number of kids at play. My only criticism is the shortage of sun beds created when guests leave but do not remove the pool towels off the beds. I have been to hotels where there is a voucher system and you receive your voucher for next day towels when you return your wet towels. This would work much better and stop a shortage of somewhere to sit, which we experienced on a number of occasions. The bar is good and serves a good selection of meals and drinks and next door is a small on site shop with milk, coffee,water and snacks etc. We used the shuttle to go to Universal and once again it arrived promptly and was hassle free. There is a Benihana Japanese Hibachi restaurant at the entrance to the property which was great fun. There is also a large Publix supermarket and other stores just around the corner. You can just about see the Disney fireworks from the property as well. Overall a great stay and excellent value when compared to similar properties operated by Hilton and Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT BASE LOCATION FOR EXPLORING THE SUROUNDING THEME PARKS”
Reviews.Author: gnashie
Reviews.Content: The apartments are located at the southern end of I Drive and are an easy 45 min drive from Sandford Airport. But unfortunately we drew the short straw again and were the last of 2 British planes to let their passengers off the plane, needless to say we then spent a very tedious one and half hours clearing immigration through what can only be described as very officious system – bearing in mind you now have submit all your details electronically in advance and pay for the privilege of being treat in such a dogmatic and bureaucratic manner. When picking up your hire car don’t get suckered by the very nice girls running the hire car pick up desks you don’t require any of the extra’s they are flogging on a commission basis, all you need for the tolls is change - I think it cost about 8$ in total to drive from the airport to Floriday’s. So it was with great relief when we arrived at Floriday’s some 4 hours after stepping of the plane and were given an outstandingly warm welcome by the receptionist and efficiently and very quickly checked in. We had a 2 bed apartment; it was big, clean & spacious - packed with everything you would ever want to find in a self-catering apartment, a real home from home with all American cons. The accommodation is situated in 6 apartment blocks dispersed over well-kept grounds with ample parking outside of each block. We were allocated a ground floor apartment in C block, which faced the perimeter wall and overlooked some waist land, but as we intended to spend as little time as possible in the apartment this did not bother us. We found the pool area to be a little on the small side, but perfectly adequate for the time spent there and my granddaughter loved the water play area. I think the other guests are correct about the sun lounger and chair criticism, as there is nowhere near enough for all potential guest that may turn up at the pool and I guess the management plan on that not happening. It is ideally situated for all the theme parks and local amenities within a 5 min walk, there is one of 2 shopping malls in the area with a big Publix supermarket, a fantastic cheap takeaway pizza place, Venezuelan Café, an average Chinese takeaway restaurant, quite a good Outback Steak House and a Mac Donald’s – within a 10 walk there is a big shopping mall with all you could want. All in all a great friendly place to base yourself whilst visiting Orlando. Would defiantly go back and highly recommend it – The only pain is getting in the country!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever!”
Reviews.Author: JohnOrmond
Reviews.Content: I discovered this place when my family came for a visit. I fell in love! My husband and I stayed here for a weekend. We loved the resort and thought it was a great value. The unit is stunning, it has all the amenities of the other units, but is perfectly located and it has a very private balcony. The higher floors can view the fireworks from different theme parks - make sure to inquire about the time of firework displays! It is our getaway paradise - and it is available for anyone. There is no question why this is the # 1 rated resort in Orlando, with it's first class accomodations, great customer service and proximity/free transportation to all the attractions. Come and experience it for yourself, whether for a long weekend or for several weeks. Why book 2 hotel rooms when you can have a large, pristine, 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo (with additional sleeper sofa in living room), full kitchen, jaccuzzi master bath for the same price? By the way, did we mention there is room service and a great bar/pool area?! The decor is West Indies (Tommy Bahama look) and the upkeep is immaculate. "Stay Interesting, my Friends!!!" Erica and John

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort! Love all the space, but service could improve”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBeachfamily
Reviews.Content: We always love staying at the Floridays resort, its our family's choice when staying over in Orlando. This time we had to work the NPE2012Trade Show at the Convention Center and wanted accommodations close but not too close to the IDrive craziness. We love the size of the rooms, and all the amenities, you can't ask for more! This is the first time though that we noticed a real lack of attention when the room was cleaned in the mornings. The kitchen sink stopped up from what looked like an old smelly problem, so we immediately called in the morning before leaving to have it attended to. When we returned that evening the sink had been unclogged but dirt was all around and dripped on the floor from the kitchen into the guest bath and the toilet seat was left up with what looked like drippings from whatever was used to unclog the drain. Sand etc. was on the seat and floor from the clog. The maid had already been in as the beds were made, but other than that you never would have known. The smell from the nasty sink still permeated the room, so we called to get it cleaned up while we were out to dinner. Would have expected that the maid or the plumber would have made sure they cleaned up after a repair, but it seems like the bare minimum is taken care of daily - beds, towels and garbage. A body could be on the floor and I think they would walk around it. One of the elevators was out a couple of times, which you didn't find out until you sat in there waiting on it to move, so this was the first time we weren't really impressed with the service, but otherwise we'll be back again....

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay at 'Floridays Resort Orlando'”
Reviews.Author: Kaval2012
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic 2 week Easter break at Floridays Resort Orlando and were very pleased with our stay. We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment and it was more than big enough for 4 adults and 2 children. The location was very nice, a really short drive to Sea World and not far from the other parks. We had a rental car, so I can't comment on the shuttle service. Publix and the Premium Outlet Mall are less than 5 minutes driving (walking distance). There was ample parking spaces outside every building, and there was no parking fee. We stayed in building C, which had a beautiful view of the lake and main pool – a 2 minute walk to the pool, gym, bar and café area. We had breakfast in our apartment every morning, but tried the Cafe Palm for snacks acouple of times. The food there was ok, maybe a little expensive compared to what you get. The kitchen was well equipped- including kettle, toaster, coffee machines, dishwasher, washer/dryer, oven, grill, microwave, food processor, electric can opener etc. As far as housekeeping goes, they came every single day and changed our towels, made our beds and took out the trash. Full housekeeping took place once a week. I took my own dishwasher tablets and detergent for the washing machines – I wish I hadn’t as housekeeping supplied and replaced these. The shampoo, conditioner, body wash and body lotion supplied by housekeeping was of very good value too – which was replaced on a daily basis (if only I had know I wouldn’t have taken my own). We had our own vaccume, but never used it. My kids liked the game room and it was nice that you could rent DVD's there. The pool area and games room was so much fun for kids and teenagers. They had a little "beach" area by the pool too, were the kids could play. My kids liked the game room and it was nice that you could rent DVD's there. My husband used the fitness room a few times and said the equipment was top notch, but no free weights. The little contact I had with the front desk, was very friendly and professional. We were all very happy with our stay at the Floridays and I would recommend it to anyone. If we visit Orland again we will definitely be stopping at Floridays - A WICKED STAY – ENJOYED BY ADULTS, KIDS & TEENAGERS. Thanks Floridays………..we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK in my view”
Reviews.Author: CasaMurguia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late march 2012, we loved the location at the very end of Int Drive, away from the hustle of the crowds really. The facility is well located and as other reviewers have stated it is beside the premium outlets for all the great shopping. Our room was in block B which is very close to the pool and reception area, for such a big complex we would have expected more pools or a larger one. It felt like we were in Spain with people taking the chairs and beds at 7am before they headed to the parks - this was not very nice really. The pool was cold, very cold, the temperature was in the high 80's but the water was freezing. The suite was a good sized two bed, it was tired and beet up a bit. We had plenty of space for four but the comfort was not really within. The bathrooms were big but again tired, the shower heads were some of the worst I have ever used in the US. Overall for a number 1 on trip advisor I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: kingmoonman
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four night stay. We were on the second level. All second level rooms have a stucco patio rail which you cannot see over when sitting in the living room. All first floor rooms have a screened in patio. Floors 3-6 have metal patio rails which you can see through. Pros: +Very clean. +Comfortable furniture. +Excellent location. +Publix grocery store < 1 mile away. +Liquor store < 1 mile away. +Small pool not as busy as the main pool and quite nice. Cons: -Room noise. The walls and floors are thin. -Elevator noise. The second bedroom can across from the elevator shafts. -Car noise. -Dated bathroom fixtures - heard running squeaking toilets from above, below, and on our floor. -Large pool isn't that large. The advertisements are a bit deceptive. Chairs gone by 9. -Questionable security. In the hotel booklet they tell you the pizza ads people are sticking into your doors are from bad vendors. It makes you wonder who else is running around the complex if they can't keep people they don't want off the property. -Ask for the second floor if you don't want to see outside while sitting on the couch.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays was Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Christa F
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay at this resort. It was spacious and clean. We are a family of five and we had more than enough room to spread out. The suite reminded me of a luxury apartment home. We will definitely stay here again, when we return to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Loved this hotel and a great price too”
Reviews.Author: Wendy E
Reviews.Content: We stayed in November 2011 and had a wonderful time. very well located next to premium outlets for all the great shopping. Our rooms was in block F which is at the rear of the complex a way away from the main pool and reception but we just took the car to the pool as there was ample parking near reception. this was walkable but with a small child her legs tired easily.the pool was cold although said was heated but was still usable. all of the staff were friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble . The rooms were stunning and i cant believe how well equiped they are the only thing i needed that i didnt have was a frying pan to cook bacon so i cooked it in the oven instead,NO Problem. Going back to the USA again this year but we are going with family so need a hotel that has smaller rooms too otherwise i would be staying here again ....LOVED IT! free wi-fi too

Reviews.Title: “A+ location, amenities and service...perfect for families.”
Reviews.Author: ebalestro
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Disney traveling with our toddlers. Our son is 2, our daughter is now 4. Floridays offers many fabulous reasons to choose them for a Disney vacation, it would be impossible to highlight all of them. As someone who has traveled extensively in my career, I have become very choosy with my hotel selections. I was apprehensive about Floridays because it seemed like such a great value, but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of everything from the room to the pool to the top-notch customer service. We stayed March 1-8. Room was very nice size, we had a 3 bedroom suite in building A. There was no view to speak of, but when you're in Disney doing parks all day or spending afternoons by the pool, I am not sure this matters. Rooms were nicely furnished, plenty of closet and drawer storage. The kitchen had granite counters and stainless appliances, and a KEURIG coffee maker (such a plus) Everything felt very clean and new, I found nothing that made me doubt the cleanliness of the hotel. Washer and Dryer were used almost every day, we were able to pack lightly because we knew we could wash our things. My only "complaint" was that the bathtub in the room was a jacuzzi whirlpool tub, which was very difficult to bathe the young ones. The 2nd bathroom only had a stall shower. But I wouldn't consider this to be a big downfall. The pool area was fantastic, the zero entry spray-ground was ideal for parents with wading toddlers. Having the outdoor cafe and bar with plenty of table seating was also a plus for families. Service took a while, but if you ordered ahead of time you could still enjoy the pool while you waited. Prices were not outrageous either. A game room and arcade, in addition to a RedBox video rental unit, were great too. Everyone I encountered on the property was fantastic---The Floridays staff seemed to enjoy their job, and would go out of their way to say hello or ask if you needed anything. We had two small maintenance issues in the room that were addressed within SECONDS. I've been to Hyatts and Four Seasons where it could take days. Location, location, location...the old cliche but totally true here. Less than 10 minutes to any of the parks we wanted to hit, which was fantastic. Just a five minute drive to Downtown Disney. Publix and walgreens are literally across the street. We ordered groceries to be delivered upon our arrival, but the convenience of having shopping nearby was great for the rest of the trip. All in all, I would recommend this property and will likely choose again if the price is right. I cannot understand why people spend the same amount or more on a Disney Property when all you get is 2 beds, a TV and a tiny room....at Floridays you are getting more for your money, and the drive to the parks was absolutely a non-issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here!”
Reviews.Author: Vickie B
Reviews.Content: We love it here. We have 2 sons - 12 and 10 -- and this is a great resort. Close to most everything and a great outlet mall nearby. Staff is friendly, the rooms are spacious, the pools are very nice and clean. We used the free transportation to Sea World this time. The food at the Palm Cafe is good. The Kitchen is well stocked for nights when we cooked in. We will visit again next time we are in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Garfieldontour
Reviews.Content: Just back from 12 nights over Easter break. Very good resort to use as base to visit Orlando area. Reception and especially the concierge were very helpful with directions, tickets etc. We had 2 bed suite and it was perfect for our family of five. Daily Towel change and beds also made up daily. Full clean every week. All included in resort fee. Based on previous reviews I asked for block A or B but busy period and put in block C overlooking the lake and the swimming pool which we thought was much nicer. Only two minute walk to reception/ pool area. Tip - In any block try and avoid rooms overlooking car parks as can be relatively noisy at night. Construction work on new road nearby started 7.30am but did not bother us as we were up early anyway. When finished should improve access to the resort as existing entrance easy to miss at night. Only complaint would be the market place restaurant which was not great. Food OK but not a very comfortable area to sit and eat. However seemed to be used mainly as take out or by families using pool area. Pool area was busy as Easter time but we never failed to get sun loungers. Resort also supplied towels at the pool hut to use around pool area. Pool itself not deep and very child friendly. However no pool attendant or life guard. Nice gym but did not get a chance to use - too busy at theme parks, resort pool or day trips to both coasts. Resort is on southern end of International drive and is much quieter than northern end. In my view you do need a car here. Theme Parks - nearer to Disney than Universal but very accessible to both(15 minutes). Ask concierge for best directions as Idrive traffic heavy at times and there are faster routes. Check out Gatorland as we thought it was brilliant. (total cost EUR115 for five of us and we spent almost full day) Shopping - Premium Outlet closeby on Vineland, (another up by Universal). Mall at Millenia on Conroy Road worth a visit. Restaurants - Outback, TGIF and Bahama Breeze all close by to drive to. Cheese Cake Factory in Mall on Millenia was our favourite. Airport - 20 minutes Overall would definitely go back again to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Triledgy
Reviews.Content: Love it!! Close to all the parks and shopping. Not far from the airport. Rooms were spacious. Only complaint was we were on the ground floor in building A and was a little noisy as people were coming and going. The doors are also loud as they close with a loud bang. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but too much noisy”
Reviews.Author: Marcia_Midori
Reviews.Content: Good hotel but the noise coming from outside is annoying. It's being constructed a new public street in the back of the hotel and the workers start to work very early in the morning and during some nights. We weren't adviced about this in the check in.

Reviews.Title: “Easter at the Floridays”
Reviews.Author: Merete508
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays over Easter, and were very pleased with our stay. When we book hotels, we always look for suites, so that the adults can have some adult time after the kids go to bed. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment and it was more than big enough for a family of 4. The location was very nice, a really short drive to Sea World and not far from the parks at Disney World. We had a rental car, so I can't comment on the shuttle service. Publix was less than 5 minutes away and the Outlet Mall was close too. There was good parking possibilities outside every building, and there was no parking fee. We stayed in building D and I think we used a maximum of 3 miutes from our building to the main pool and lobby. We had an apartment facing a parking lot. In the evening we could actually see some of the firework from Magic Kingdom from our balcony. I realize that it's better to be at Magic Kingdom to see this, but it was quite nice anyway.. :) We had breakfast in our apartment every morning, but tried the Cafe Palm for lunch a couple of times. The food there was ok, maybe a little expensive compared to what you get. The kitchen was well equipped, my husband made really nice dinners for us a couple of nights, and didn't miss anything. The pool area was so much fun for our kids (3 and 5). They had a little "beach" area by the pool too, were the kids could play. The only downside about the pool area was that it was really crowded, and that it was hard to find sunbeds. Seemed like everyone else was up around 6 and put towels on all the sunbeds and then hit the parks. The days we spent by the pool, we could see sunbeds with towels on them, without people there, for over 3 hours. As far as housekeeping goes, they came every single day and changed our towels, made our beds and took out the trash. If you wanted full housekeeping, they charged $40 extra a day. We have 2 kids, at 3 & 5 and stayed for over a week, and the housekeeping that was included was more than enough for us. They gave us more shampoo/conditioner/body lotion if we vere out. We always left them a little tip, and they gave us new detergent and dishwasher soap. That was all we needed. We had our own vaccumer, but I never used it. My husband used the fitness room a few times and said the equipment was top notch, but no free weights. My kids liked the game room and it was nice that you could rent DVD's there, but kind of unusual not having that option directly on your TV. The little contact I had with the front desk, was very friendly and professional. We were all very happy with our stay at the Floridays and I would recommend it to anyone. We will be back! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodation for big families”
Reviews.Author: nfjfmfsf
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with 6 kids in the age of 7 to 19 years. For big families it's a good place to stay. It's near the theme parks, shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “No Wow factor and not clean”
Reviews.Author: falcon38
Reviews.Content: selected this hotel mainly on assumption that number 1 rating on trip advisor must be good. On the plus side the rooms were very spacious and the wi fi good. However cleanliness was disappointing. several hairs greeted us in the bath. greasy lights above kitchen island. rubbish outside door remained for 6 days. apartment was dark. the pools were smaller than would be expected for a resort of this size. i normally stay in 4 star hotels. this seemed to me like a low three star. the drawer in the bedroom was so rough i had to place a towel in it to protect clothes. very good location and staff were pleasant. toiletries cheap and nasty. as they have a non cleaning policy (trash and tidy) policy be prepared to vacuum and clean yourself if there for more than a few days. its a mystery how this resort is ranked so highly.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays review Easter 2012”
Reviews.Author: Woolly71
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to use as forward operating base for visiting the Disney and Universal parks and Cape Canaveral ( you have to go there) . Effective location that's easy to get to from the airport. It has spacious rooms and lounge area, comfortable beds , jacquzi , adequately equipped kitchens and close proximity to a variety of restaurants and supermarket along International Drive. The rooms are clean and the staff very obliging with nothing being to much trouble. The lady at the conceierge is a mine of information. Pool size is adequate for the late afternoon swim. It does get crowded during US school holidays but that is only to be expected. I accept the rooms are getting a little tired and could do with a make over but that wouldnt put me off staying there , after all all you want is a bed and some where for breakfast and a swim. The rest of the time we were in the parks. We compared it to other hotels on and off the Disney Resort parks and it won hands down on issues of cost, space and location. We will be staying there again soon. Cheers J
