Reviews.Title: “Family friendly accomodation”
Reviews.Author: debstarlight
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean on the surface, but I found a dead lizard between the TV in the master bedroom and the wndow, so I doubt they thoroughly clean the rooms. However, the rest of the two bedroom suite was in good condition, despite also needing a good thorough clean. This property is very conveniently located, however I highly recommened a rental car if staying at this location. Although the shuttle is reliable, it can take a very long time to get to your destination. The emenities in the suites are quite good. I liked the convenience of having a washer and dryer in the room. Additionally, the kitchen area is great for family gatherings, if you are traveling with a larger party I agree with other reviewers that the main pool area gets too crowded, and seems to close early. You will be hard pushed to find a place to rest by the pool on busier days. Note that as others have mentioned, the hotel does in fact charge a daily fee for amenities which I believe is based on the number of people in your party. $50 for its amenities (compulsory). If you do need extra supplies, other than what is in your room at check in, you will need to make a request to the front desk. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again simply because I like the convenience, and the suites are a great size for a family.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off....”
Reviews.Author: rogersraj
Reviews.Content: I booked a three bedroom suite which was quite spacious. However there isn't much room to hang your colthes nor drawers for clothing. The shower is small and there is no lower tap so that you can adjust the water temperature before using the shower. So its like turn on the shower and you then make a run for it before the cold water hits you. By the first morning when I left for breakfast, $1005 was stolen from my room along with my son's camera. There was very little reaction from the hotel front desk and they did not pick this incident up with the local police. Beware, the hotel charges $50 for its amenities (compulsory). It does not offer much besides the pool and game room. The hotel offers no resturant beside the Palm Cafe which is a small and offers a fast food type service. Not much options for food there. Do not stay here its just not worth the money. I am still a guest here only because they charged my card the full amount on check in. Room service only takes out the garbage and tidy the bed. No additional body wash, no shampoo, no conditioner, new sheets are at a cost. There is a little card in the room that tells you this.

Reviews.Title: “Good family accommodation with easy access to theme parks and malls”
Reviews.Author: LucieJScott
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at Floridays - the apartments are large and very well equipped, although looking a bit tired and dated - perhaps it's time for a makeover and freshen up. The main pool area gets too crowded with not enough sun beds but the smaller pool area is under used so there's always space but no bar for a lounging G&T. If you get a room with a view over the pools that's great - if you get a room with a view over a car park - we got the latter - not so great - so ask for a pool view when you book. The gym is v v small and doesn't have air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay overall!”
Reviews.Author: mpdneal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the end of March 2012. In general, we were very pleased with our stay at Floridays. Room - Our room was certainly spacious which made it the best part. With two children it was nice to spread out, unpack our stuff and just enjoy our time away from home. My biggest complaint/critique with our stay was the cleanliness of our room. The room in general just needs a good ol' cleaning, thorough. Lots of dust on the furniture, etc. The furniture was pretty banged up as well. Lots of scratches and knicks. Pool area - The pool area is nice. Plenty of clean pool towels always available. The pool was a little smaller than I expected, and it got full at certain times of the day. By the middle of the afternoon there was a lot of trash on/around the pool deck (straws, wrappers, etc) which was kind of gross. I never really saw anyone out there tidying up so some sort of pool attendant would be nice to see. Nothing worse than stepping on trash when getting in/out of a pool. The poolside bar offered some nice pool drinks but they are pricey and add up quick. The front desk staff was super friendly and cordial. We would definately look into staying again when in the Orlando area. I'm sure things get overlooked at times..but, a little advice to the Floridays people, your rooms need a good cleaning every now and again. You have a great thing going. I thought the maid service person was really sweet thought. She thoughtfully placed my son's teddy bear under the covers with head on the pillow. My son always got a kick out of this when we returned to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for a family trip to universal”
Reviews.Author: griffindork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 2 daughters for our spring break trip to Universal. We rented a car, so I can't comment on their shuttle service. Early access to the park was an important perk because otherwise our wait for the forbidden journey ride would likely have exceeded 2 hours. As far as the room, it was really lovely- spacious, with a sitting area, decent kitchen, 2 bedrooms and 2 baths, even a washer and dryer. The pool was large and nice- nothing spectacular, but we enjoyed an afternoon there. We drove about 15-20 minutes to get to universal each day, and it was nice to stay away from the bustle of the park. If we ever go back to Orlando, I would likely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “And you would stay anywhere else, why??”
Reviews.Author: Lynn M
Reviews.Content: BRAVO!!!! We travel a lot, so I believe that I my opinion of Floriday's Resort is spot on; it is, without a doubt, the best place to stay in Orlando. Nothing compares. From the moment we arrived till the moment we left, we were enchanted. We will never stay anywhere else. Best of all is that it is close to all the major attractions!

Reviews.Title: “3 night trip to sea world”
Reviews.Author: Kevin F
Reviews.Content: overall really nice clean rooms. big and spacious. pool was great for kids. staff was friendly. only complaint would be that it is a little pricey, but to be expected for spring break.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: shaknzmom64
Reviews.Content: Can't begin to say enough about Floridays! I'd say this was the best choice we could have made. If you are like our family it should work great for you too. We: * Are a family of four, including a college student and high school student. * Are a middle income family that usually pinches pennies * Spent 7 days in the Disney World resort parks * Bought food at Publix (within walking distance) and ate breakfast, and sometimes lunch, in the condo. Saved us a ton of money. Everything about the place was great....two bedrooms, two baths, washer/dryer, full kitchen, soaking tub in master bath, etc. The staff was very professional and helpful. There was a slight billing snafu, that I noticed when we got home. I called to ask about it and they immediately saw what I was talking about and fixed it within 24 hours. These types of mistakes usually make me suspicious and/or frustrated.... I liked this place so much I didn't give it a second thought. We didn't use the main pool as we were too busy. It seemed to be mostly smaller kids. There were families 'parked out' by the pool from sun up to sun down. The smaller pool, closer to our unit, was more of an adult pool. We wanted the flexibility of coming/going as we pleased so we rented a car and didn't use the shuttle service. I was a little concerned that it may be far from the parks but it was a 10 minute drive. Literally just down the street. Room service was great. They were very accommodating when we asked for anything. Starbucks onsite (although those employees seemed less than happy to be there), movie rental (Redbox type machine), game room, major names outlet mall within walking distance..and more. We would stay there again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Floridays”
Reviews.Author: sue2004
Reviews.Content: Loved Floridays, Stayed there 5 times now and standards still high. The only down side i have exprienced is that the aircon isnt that great in the master bedroom, and the pool although has a lot of chairs and loungers , could do with a few more. We sat waiting for chairs/loungers and saw some with towels on and after enquireing found no-one had been on them for over 3 hours. Think maybe management should hire someone to keep an eye on it. Though we did go during spring break and it was really busy, we usually go in Sept when it is quieter so no problems then. Other than that will still stay there as the apartments are really a home from ome with all facilities you have at home.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Floridys!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel37209
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and it was actually better than the first! We arrived around 2:30 and they were very happy to check us in early (14 stays at Disney resorts and they hardly ever had our room available on time!) We had the 2 bedroom/bath, for 5 people and suited us fine. The few issues we had were taken care of quickly even the day that housekeeping missed our room and we called about 5:05 and they said they were done for the day but they quickly brought us fresh towels. Location is great, it is close to a Publix grocery but also not far away is a walmart. The decore is not something I was fond of but its just for a week and woulnd detour me from coming back. We were in building E which was towards the back, and had a view of the pond, enjoyed watching the turtles! Even though they have a 12$ resort fee I believe it was a good value!

Reviews.Title: “Where to stay when visiting DisneyWorld.”
Reviews.Author: cindy98075
Reviews.Content: Floridays Resort was extremely convenient for our recent visit to the Orlando area. It's very close to SeaWorld, Disney, Universal and the highway entrance. The rooms were clean, air conditioning worked very well and the staff are very helpful. We usually need two hotel rooms which gets expensive. For less, we got a three bedroom condo with two baths and a full kitchen. It's right next door to a Benihana, Walgreen's, and a Publix grocery store. There's a McDonald's, Outback and numerous smaller restaurants in the shopping mall two blocks down. The best pizza ever made is at Singing Sam's which is behind the Walgreen's.There's also a large outlet mall half a mile down the road for all the things (like lighter weight clothes) you forgot to bring. The shuttle runs on a very limited schedule, so I wouldn't count on it. A car would be handy.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Alternative to Disney Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Raesa1
Reviews.Content: It was very nice to be near Disneyworld, yet not IN Disneyworld. It offered the option to have a 2 or 3 bedroom unit in a resort that offered resort-like amenities. Two swimming pools provided a nice escape from the hustle and bustle of the parks. The fully-equipped kitchen units allowed for in-house cooking. A pool cafe offered standard menu options and take-out. The menu could be improved somewhat as well as the design of the seating space. Staff were very gracious and attended to any and all requests. Furnishings were a bit dated and could be modernized. But all in all, it offered a lovely experience. Although pricey, it likely was below the cost of the traditional park hotels and offered more space and value. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “best value for families, great location”
Reviews.Author: breggie
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights, couldn't have had a better experience. Family resort atmosphere, obvious that staff are exceedingly well trained. Pool and Cafe food service great. LARGE 2 bedroom 2 bath suite for $185/night all inclusive. i WOULD recommend that one rents a car (we got a great deal on Hotwire, way better than Orbitz by 50%) and enjoys the flexibility necessary for going to the theme parks as you wish and when you want. The shuttles from the hotel are infrequent and limit you severely; for example, Magic Kingdom was open until 1 AM but the last shuttle back to the hotel was at 9:45 PM, even before the fireworks at 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but .....”
Reviews.Author: mjcrooksmomof3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights during spring break at Floridays. The condo was very nice and had all of the amenities expected. The staff was very polite and the concierge, especially Wildo, was so helpful in arranging shuttles and getting tickets for Universal. We were so park crazy that we did not use the pool or gym but both were very nice. Limited maid service came daily and gave us fresh towels, made the beds, and emptied trash. Our only negative experience was that we returned to the condo at 10pm one night and our door was not closed. Fortunately nothing was taken and the front desk was apologetic. The maid had not secured the door when she left. Kind of a big faux pas for a resort where people are gone all day to amusement parks. Other than that it was a very nice resort but I suspect not the best in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and conveniently located for WDW”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time reviewing resorts for our stay in Orlando. We settled on floridays and overall very happy with our choice. Rooms was big (we are a family of 5) and very comfortable. We had a couple of problems with the fridge and door which were fixed very quickly. Staff were very attentive and friendly and the kids lovers the pool even when really busy. Location was perfect with supermarket and outlet centre within 2 mins drive of the resort and WDW was an easy 10min drive. The only letdown was the cafe food especially breakfast which was poor quality and limited in choice. We bought breakfast from the supermarket and eat in our kitchenette every day.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: Darlene H
Reviews.Content: Although this property is decent, it was not a good value at the price...

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Excellent Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: Dana1957
Reviews.Content: We recently spent some time at Floridays Resort in Orlando. We were a group of 3 couples who needed to kill some time until our flight back home and wanted something other than 3 conventional hotel rooms as we wanted to be able to spend time together. Floridays was perfect! We booked the 3 bedroom suite - each room was very clean and comfortable. With the addition of the livingroom/diningroom and complete kitchen it was so much nicer than having 3 separate hotel rooms. There was also a washer/dryer and dishwasher. We took advantage of the resort shuttle to go to Disney and it worked perfectly. The food at the cafe was delicious, although be prepared to wait a bit after ordering. It was definitely not fast food. Sitting around the beautiful pool was very relaxing, and having the bar close by was an added bonus. The second pool, which happened to be closer to our building, was also quite nice. Depending on which building you are situated in (we were in the furthest away) be prepared to do a bit of walking! This is a large complex! (I believe my GPS indicated that it was half a mile from our building to the main entrance.) There is a Benihana restaurant right next door, and the outlet shopping is just a short drive away. The staff at Floridays was VERY friendly and courteous. When we requested additional towels, they came up right away. And when we ran out of the supplied Keurig coffee and wanted to use a regular coffee maker, they brought one to us. (We had already spent a week in a house in another part of Florida and wanted to use up some of the supplies we had left.) Would we return to Floridays during our next visit to Orlando? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Should be better for this price”
Reviews.Author: srr3306y
Reviews.Content: I booked this property as a package deal through the Universal website thinking I might get a bargain or some perks. Although this property is decent, it was not a good value at the price and it offered nothing in the way of usable perks at Universal. The early admission to Harry Potter is basically a hoax since they do not tell you have to get there at 7 to take advantage. The City Walk thing is worthless and it is pretty far away. Floridays itself is just OK. The rooms are pretty much as advertised, but the beds and bedding are poor and the pools are way too small for the size of the place when it is full. They also have big screen TVs, but the SD analog signal renders them lame. Service was fine all the way around. BUT... they left us with a really bad taste in our mouths when they hit us with a $12/day resort fee on the way out. REALLY? This was a package deal, and its not like you can opt out of it. Just put it in the rate and be done with it. This little deception make it unlikely I will return or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: NativeJoe
Reviews.Content: Large rooms Great beds Excellent staff Very clean Great pool Best stay in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “9 Days that the Floridays”
Reviews.Author: 593John
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to use as a base while we went out during the day to various parks and entertainments. The Floridays was excellent for this. Lots of space, very clean, washer and dryer in suite. Excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Condo Living at a GREAT price!!”
Reviews.Author: 10sChick
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about renting a suite at Floridays. It is a very spacious condo and the full kitchen and laundry capabilities in the room are so useful for longer stays! The hotel is VERY clean, the rooms are nicely decorated and laid out well and all the staff was very friendly. The master bath is killer! A couple of small nit picks are that they don't provide but 2 dishwasher soap pouches and only one laundry soap package. I didn't ask housekeeping if I could have more, but they probably would have. Just a heads up to that there's not even the most basic thing in the kitchen (like salt and pepper). Also, there is no airport shuttle to the hotel and it's a $50 cab ride which hurts. But these are minor issues in the overall scheme of the ammenities that DO come with this fabulous place. it's a great location and you can readily get to Walgreens and a grocery store right up the street. The outlet mall around the corner is SUPER nice too. Very high end outlet shopping. I would most certainly stay here again!!!! I couldn't live with myself though if I didn't issue one big fat warning about Dollar rent-a-car. Floridays has a partnership with Dollar and they provide a promo code which gives a "too good to be true" discount on a weekly rental. It was half the cost of anywhere else I called so I was like "awesome! sign me up!". It was nightmarish dealing with the Dollar agency offsite from the Airport at the Palms Resort. It was required that I use this location (and not the airport) when I made the reservation and since they were "just up the street" on International Dr., they had me call them once I got to the hotel and they'd come get me with their complimentary shuttle. They assured me they are open til 8pm, but be warned that shuttle service ends at 6:30pm. That was really important information that they left out since I called at 6:35. I actually called many times before 6:30 while waiting for my luggage at the airport, but no one picked up or it went to a FAX machine which was super annoying. The one woman desk at the Palms Resort is a long LONG ways away on International drive in the heart of a God-awful area traffic that continues til past midnight. The lady at the desk was a real Ms. Nasty to work with and delivered high pressure sales on all the insurance, etc., that is NOT included in the quoted price. They mysteriously dropped my reservation since I didn't pick up at the airport so I got a no-show charge. What the? Then I was advised that now there would be a charge to drop off at the airport when I left. I was ready to break something. In the end I was out the same amount as I would have been using Enterprise (who I love) right from the airport, plus I was out $50 of cab fare and 2 hours of my vacation getting there and back. It was painful and stressful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall well maintained and very children freindly.”
Reviews.Author: andrewv45
Reviews.Content: Good size 2 bed condo's. Good pool. Well maintained. On site restaurant/snack bar/coffee shop is downside due to snail like service. (not good with kids!) Most amenities in apartments and good supermarket less than mile away. Short drive to airport and all parks. Family freindly Benihama next door (better to book0

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the land of hotels”
Reviews.Author: Beth O
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay with 2 adults and 2 teens. We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite. PLENTY of room for everyone. Hotel was full but you would never know it! It was very quiet at night no noise from other suites. We could not believe it!! The grounds of the hotel were very clean. Pools (2) were great busy but not overly packed or crazy. Used the workout facilities. Small but perfect for the away from home workout. Also very clean!! We satyed in the D building top floor. Easy to get to either pool. Very family oriented felt very comfortable walking around after dark on the property. Perfect location to all parks... Universal, Sea World, Aquatica and of course Disney. Publix grocery store is just up the street so very convienent to stock the kitchen with whatever if you wish. Very close to many many resturants, premium outlets as well right up the street. Staff very friendly and accomodating. Defintaly would stay here again. Do not hesitate to book here!!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel - Best Value”
Reviews.Author: ibchicago
Reviews.Content: The property is wonderful and staff is very friendly and helpful. Had a 2-bedroom suite and it was large, well furnished and well maintained. The master bedroom is large and masterbath was huge. Second bedroom had 2 double beds in it. The free shuttle bus to and from Disney Epcot was convenient. Highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrence G”
Reviews.Author: terrence30
Reviews.Content: Not sure if words are available to describe my stay at Floridays. Upon our exit from the shuttle via the airport, the cleanliness and the landscaping were jaw-dropping. From the knowledgeable concierge and front desk staff to the friendly workers, my family felt like home for the entire 10 day stay. The close proximity to the all the main attraction and the outlet mall was excellent. The shuttle service to all the parks was very well organized and very easy to use. The Floridays Resort will always be remembered by the Gaulton Family. I have already recommended you guys to several of my friends. If I ever return to Orlando in my life time, I know where I shall rest my head. Thanks for a lifetime of memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KarenHDE
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our week long stay in Orlando. Floridays was by far one of the best properties we've stayed at in Orlando. I have 3 kids, 2 of which are teenagers. Staying in an affordable 3 bedroom suite was just what we needed! Everyone had their own space and they have requested to stay here everytime we go to Orlando. Parking can be inconvenient when returning late. The property is only minutes from all the parks. Staff is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: verispicey
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in a two bedroom condo. The condo was very clean and spacious. The kitchen could use more cooking utensils and place settings.There aren't a lot of dishes so you have to wash them each time you cook. The mattresses are horrible. I did complain upon leaving and was told that management knows about the problem and that building A was getting a renovation this coming september. The pool area is fabulous for all ages and very clean. I would stay again and definetly would recommend staying in building A because it is closest to the pool area. The only negative would be the mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy Z
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at your resort! The staff was friendly and the rooms were spacious and clean. We loved that the whole family could stay in one place and not have a bunch of hotel rooms. We enjoyed the pools and the amenities. The only downside was that the shuttles from the parks left too early in the evening for you to view the parades and fireworks. All in all....great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Barely Better Than Motel 8”
Reviews.Author: Tarsu
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 6 night stay at Floridays with my wife and daughters family which included a 2 year old and a 4 year old. The front-desk staff are polite, professional and willing to do whatever a guest needs. The Concierge was quite accommodating as well, but I simply cannot excuse the problems areas listed below:: THE GOOD: As stated earlier, the staff are very polite. The gameroom is nice. My 4-year old grandson enjoyed playing the air-hockey game. The pool is very nice for small children. The zero entrance and spraying toys were a hit with the children. There are plenty of clean towels around the pool area. The food at the cafe was good (We had a couple of pizzas). The beds were comfortable and the linens were clean as were the towels. THE BAD: Upon arriving we found our 3-bedroom suite in building C (floor 4) to be dirty. The floors had not been cleaned as there were food crumbs throughout the kitchen and living-room areas. This is inexcusable. The in-room safe had been left in a locked mode. We waited for somebody to come up and open it but the wait became too long, so we opted to call the next day. The man who arrived to open the safe was very polite, professional and had the safe open in just a few moments. The point is... the room was not prepared for our visit and because of this, it caused us time and frustration. The kitchen was missing all of the frypans. When I called the front desk, they apologized and sent one to the room right away. The pan they sent looked like it had survived a war. It should have been disposed of years ago. The non-stick coating was nearly gone. I would not use a pan like this at home. There was one light bulb out over the table (still out to this day), and the dust on the hanging lights over the kitchen island was thick enough to grow plants. The wide-screen television in the living room did not work properly. The colors are out of adjustment and could not be adjusted to make the decent proper. The picture does not fit in the screen area and the remote control batteries were held in with black electrical tape. The furniture in the living area is in need of replacement as it is nicked-up and worn. The pool area restrooms were not maintained throughout the day. The cafe coffee is good in the A.M. but later in the day when I purchased coffee, it was cold in the carafe. Trash was full and floors were quite dirty. Along the walkway to our building there was a plastic bag and a used Skoal can that stayed there during our stay. These may seem to be small things to some, but I consider this inattention to details that add up to a less-than-average establishment. The one thing that would make this a better hotel for kids (as there were a lot of little children at this hotel) would be a play area with a play-set. Other than a big area of sand, there is no playground equipment of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: MJH1948
Reviews.Content: Returning to the Floridays resort for the 2nd time and was as impressed as on our first visit. Stayed in Block D, overlooking lake and small swimming pool. This is one of the quieter blocks, away from the busy main pool area. Still not far to walk if you need supplies. Our two bedroomed apartment very clean and just as their advert. Had a problem with the new coffee machine and they sent someone round to check in straight away. The location is absolutely perefect for shopping, theme parks and eating places. My only slight grievance is the introduction of the 'resort tax' of $15 per day. They say the resort now has free wi-fi but I don't pay that per month for the internet!! Certainly bumps up the end figure on an invoice. However the resort tax would not put me off going back to this great resort. It is good value for money. The apartments are wonderful and location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Sheila M”
Reviews.Author: Sheila M
Reviews.Content: We had a party of five adults and when we got to our 3 bedroom suite we were amazed at home much space we had. The overall impression of Floridays resort was awesome! Would definitely recommend this as a place to stay while in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: javajava1
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. We had a 3-room suite. The room was clean, comfortable and HUGE! Bonus: Keurig coffeemaker in the kitchen. The hotel is located close to the outlets - walking distance even. The pool is great. Overall, this was one of the best hotels I've stayed in while on vacation with family.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Floridays!”
Reviews.Author: Ansar_Hassan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Floridays Resort in Orlando. It was everything that I hoped it would be. I would highly recommend it to any family going to the Orlando area for some fun in the sun. Here is what was so great about the resort: 1. Great rooms - We had a super-spacious 3-bedroom suite which was ideal for my and my extended family. 2. Great pool - Clean, heated pool in two locations. 3. Great location - Could not be closer to so many attractions including WDW, Sea World, Universal, outlets, restaurants, Publix grocery store. 4. Great staff - Very responsive staff to whatever little concerns we may have had. 5. Great value - For a 3-bedroom suite, we did really well. I cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back again!”
Reviews.Author: lg123082
Reviews.Content: The property was exactly as the guests' photos showed. Suites were good size with all the amenities of home. The kitchen was very functional and outfitted quite nicely. Mixing bowls, enough pots and pans, etc. to actually make meals. The suites were very clean although a bit dated. Beds were a little soft for our liking. Bathrooms were great. Washer and dryer was a necessity! The staff was wonderful. We asked to be closest to the main pool which has the little water park and was put in building B which is the building next over from the pool. We were there over spring break and the lounge chairs were full by morning so get to the pool by 9 am. Publix is the next block over for groceries and supplies and the Premium Outlet Mall is around the corner and they open late! All in all a very convenient location to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort close to many of the Orlando parks and activities at a third of the price of others”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne72712
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3-bedroom suite at Floridays for the week of our Spring Break (March 18- 24, 2012) and was very pleasantly surprised that it was even better than I imagined. The property is beautiful, well-kept and clean. It was less than a third of the price of staying in a Disney or Universal hotel room on their properties and you get all the amenities of home plus some. It was very large and clean with a full kitchen, dining, living room and balcony. The master bedroom had a nice king bed and the master bath had a wonderful hot tub that was truly big enough for two. The other bedrooms had two doubles in each and their own bathroom in the hallway. A washer and dryer was nice to have on a week long vacation. They have 2 pools - one with a really nice childrens area. There is also a coffee bar featuring Starbucks product. The huge Orlando outlet mall is literally right behind you along with grocery stores, convenience stores and restaurants very close by. It is on International Drive in the heart of Orlando activity - right down the street and around the corner from SeaWorld and a couple miles from Universal and Disney parks. I was very pleased with this resort and would highly recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in all aspects...perfect resort.”
Reviews.Author: crowes96
Reviews.Content: We were amazed at the quality of Floriday's Resort! For the price we expected the standard "run of the mill" hotel pretending to be a resort! What we received was a resort who underestimated their beauty!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: M B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel met and exceeded all of our expectations. Staff went above and beyond. Will most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “we would do it again!”
Reviews.Author: cmck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in Building B on the first floor and were so pleased with our experience. The grounds were beautiful and the staff was very attentive. When we arrived to our room, the front desk called to make sure that everything was satisfactory. We asked for a crib and they brought us one in less that 5 minutes. I am extremely picky about cleanliness and Floridays can not be beat. The floors, furniture, linens, towels and kitchen utensils were all great. The room was spacious and we enjoyed the covered patio in the evening. The Palms Cafe had good food for lunch and we ordered dinner from Benihana's which is found at the front of the resort. The only complaint from one of the people that stayed in our room was that the pool bar was extremely expensive. We enjoyed the grounds and the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Caseyestrella
Reviews.Content: In our research there are very few places in Orlando that can accommodate a large family without costing an arm and a leg. Therefore this place is really meant for families with children. A romantic couple might feel out of place here. We had a 3 bedroom suite which handled my husband and me, 2 boys ages 11 and 14 and grandpa. Kitchen was well stocked and large. Bedrooms were also very good size. We were in building B which was perfect for getting to the pool and game room. Kids loved the pool which never seemed overly crowded. Towels were abundant and we were always able to find a place to sit. Pool area was also kept quite clean. Front desk dealt very quickly with our missing TV remote and called to follow up that everything was ok. I really liked Floridays but we are very self sufficient people. We stocked our kitchen at the closely located Publix and Walgreens. We also had our own rental car. If your are looking for Luxury resort with tons of amenities you might be disappointed. The hotel is very close to all the parks but I think the convenience of a car in Orlando is necessary. We never needed the on site dining since we either prepared our meals or went out. The dining is not full service with waitstaff. For food or drinks at the pool it has to be ordered from the nearby bar and it comes out in containers to go if needed. Lastly, there is a little sign at the front of the rooms stating what their maid service does. They only make the beds (no sheet changing), replenish towels and take out the trash. If you require additional cleaning the hotel says arrangements can be made at an extra charge. We did not find this a problem as we are pretty tidy and spent a good deal of time out. Overall we were very pleased and would come here again if traveling with additional family members.

Reviews.Title: “Big suites & Good location”
Reviews.Author: Serendipity_Usa
Reviews.Content: Followed the reviews on TripAdvisor and booked Floridays for 5 nights in a 2 bdr suite for the last week of March. It was easy to find and about 20 minutes from Orlando airport. Check in was simple but since we didn't check in until about 8pm, buildings A, B and C were booked - which turned out to be just fine since they are close to the noisy main pool area. We chose bldg # and room 307 overlooked the pond which was nice. It was also right next to the smaller "quiet pool" - which is only quiet if there are no screaming kids in it. But for the most part, it was pretty quiet and relaxing for adults with a few kids in it. The small pool is open from 8am - 10pm and had plenty of seating and a small hot tub. The suite itself was nice, two bedrooms with two separate baths..the master one had a jacuzzi tub which we did not use. It has these awkward folding windows between the bed and bath which allow you to watch tv from the bath but also allows lots of noise between the two rooms. the kitchen is full with the basic dishes and cookware, full sized fridge with icemaker. They leave you 6 k-cups of coffee for the kuerig maker, one small bottle of dish soap, two packages of automatic dish soap, a sponge and one small box of tide for the clothes washer/dryer. Note: there are no spices of any kind, even salt/pepper. The clothes washer is small - like enough room for 6 items so don't wait until your last night to do laundry. The location is right on International Drive but at the far end and close to SeaWorld. It is very close to a 7-11, a Publix grocery store and the outlets are just down the block. You can use the I-trolley to get around, there are stops just in front of the hotel but we had a car so did not use it. We booked the car through the hotel link to Thrifty and it was about 50% cheaper than other rates! It was an easy pick-up and drop-off at the airport and well worth it. There are hundreds of restaurants around so we did not bother with the hotel cafe - we did eat several meals inside the room as well. Not much to do here for kids, except the pools and a small video game room. Inside the suites are DVD players (rent RedBox movies from the 7-11 for $1.00, instead of $5 from the resort) and you can hook up the PS3 or whatever to the tvs. One tip about SeaWorld/Aquatica - just buy the SeaWorld ticket online and save a few bucks then inside the park, you can get an Aquatica ticket for $25 at the "upgrade booth" just inside. This was my first trip to Orlando and while I enjoyed the area, I think I would try another place in the future - one not so huge.

Reviews.Title: “Would do it again”
Reviews.Author: Mogo5
Reviews.Content: Great resport overall, staff were very nice, after a week's stay on check out we requested for an extended checkout and got till 12, then we called again and explained that our 1 year old was still sleeping so they gave us half an hour more. A good place for a family stay, my son loved the pools and we have no complaints at all. We will definitely come back to Floridays on our next Orlando vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite vacation!”
Reviews.Author: lthomas175
Reviews.Content: My family loves this hotel condo. We have stayed here for the last 4 years in April for a week. The rooms are very large, clean and comfortable. Beds are comfortable. The laundry is great and we love having breakfast on the outdoor terrace. Great location on international drive - easy to get to Disney, Seaworld, shopping, restaurants, Tampa and Cocoa Beach. The pool is awesome - great area for the little ones with shallow water and nice water features and a large area for the older children, too. There is a DJ with music and games during the day and even a sand area. Towels are provided although they do run out sometimes. The bar next to the pool makes fruit smoothies that the kids love.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay at the Floridays”
Reviews.Author: champbj
Reviews.Content: Stay went without a hitch! Everything was as promised.....Room was comfortable and well-cleaned and attractive. Location was a bonus, convenient both to Universal Studios and Disney, as well as to shopping and restaurants. Publix is only 1 block away so it is easy to stock up the refrigerator. Outlet mall is a short drive also. Only improvement would be more equipment in the exercise room. We had a hard time getting a machine....2 treadmills, 1 cross-trainer and 1 bike is not much equipment for a property of this size. Overall, a really good resort at a really good value! Would definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room and attentive & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer0620
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only in a 2 bedroom suite. Excellent room- clean and spacious with all the kitchen amenities and a full fridge. Really don't have a bad word to say!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Amazing hotel for large families!”
Reviews.Author: Jill R
Reviews.Content: We traveled on a last minute trip to Disney with 4 children under the age of 4. My husband was arriving at 9pm from the airport, but me and my children met my parents earlier around 2:30. The room was perfect- 3 bedrooms, a full kitchen, washer/dryer, living room, balcony, etc. The staff brought up two cribs and a high chair. The room was clean, the pool area is ideal for young children (a gradient slope for kids to walk in as they please), the hotel bar offered food at a reasonable price and there was a Starbucks. There is a Walgreens, a publix, Dominoes, a 7-11, and an Outback literally within a mile. Very convenient to stock up on food and baby stuff. My husband needed a taxi which they arranged for 4:30am Monday and it was right on time! The concierge is Wonderful! He helped us get a Princess luncheon at Disney immediately and we booked within 24 hours. The service was great at the hotel, we did feel bad since we felt the bar/food area was under staffed since it took over an hour to get an order of chicken fingers, but we did go at prime time. Our only constructive thoughts would be the Shuttle service and cleaning crew. The shuttle is punctual, right on time, courteous, and expedient, but I think they need more times to come home since sometimes they get booked quickly. With the cleaning staff, we left for Disney at 8am and arrived back at 3. We called 3 times for them to clean the room but they never arrived until 4 (while I was there with 4 kids under the age of 4). They made the beds and left. They did not wipe down any countertops or tables. I found them at the next room and asked for cleaner. So the woman proceeded to show me how to use the degreaser and pillowcase to clean the counter and tabletops and bathroom counters. They again have so many guests and that is probably why the cleaning crew is so busy!!! Wonderful stay and miss it already! Would stay again. Oh and the AC works so incredibly well!!! Bring a sweater!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at this Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Snowpatroller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two-bedroom, two-bath unit that was very clean and well maintained. The full kitchen was great for meals as it gets tiring and expensive to eat in restaurants for three meals per day. There is a washer/dryer inside the unit and this was heavenly with all the family laundry. Great pools for the kids on a few days where our feet were killing us from walking around the amusement parks all day. The layout of our unit was nicely designed for families and the kids had a separate bedroom, not adjacent to our bedroom, so we could sleep in a little and enjoy the vacation. Floridays has an onsite cafe that was very useful for meals and snacks and the location is convenient to all the major parks in Orlando. There is so much to do in Orlando that we plan to return for another visit and Floridays will definitely be where we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional property and experience”
Reviews.Author: fiat1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for the first time during spring break 2012. In the past we've stayed at one of the Disney World properties or a Marriott hotel in the area. I highly recommend this property over any other place we've stayed. Not only is the price better, but the quality of the accommodations and staff is superior. The suite is larger than the other hotels and the kitchen has all the amenities you need. The suite we had was well maintained and everything worked properly. Most importantly, the staff truly provides world class service. Every staff member, from the maid to the maintenance crew to the front desk, exhibited a courteous, professional, and caring attitude. In addition, there was follow-up to ensure all requests were met in a timely manner. I know it seems like I'm "gushing” on, but it's rare that a business really does exceed expectations. When it does for me, I do my best to make sure the business is recognized. My only concern is that this property will become so popular; it will go downhill or become too expensive. So do me a favor and stay somewhere else. But if you want quality service, accommodations and a good deal, Floridays is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “The management went out of their way to help us....”
Reviews.Author: tomvand123
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 golfers from Ontario We stayed there last year and were impressed so we booked again this year. We had a great stay with wonderful service and upon leaving and getting to the airport discovered one of us had left a wallet in the room. We called from the airport and management located the wallet ( and some other items we forgot) and hand-delivered to us at the airport without charge. That's good service.... love the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: CLB00000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays resort while vacationing in Orlando. We received an upgrade to a three bedroom/two bath apartment which was great. Check-in was easy with the staff being very helpful. The apartment was clean and spacious. The maid we had was fantastic and took care of us daily. They provide trash removal, remake the beds, & fresh towels which was all we really needed. We had groceries delivered through an online link on the resort's website & they were waiting for us upon arrival which was really convenient. Amenities such as two pools, game room, fitness center, and in room washer/dryer were very nice. We requested building C which gave us a view of the pond & pool and was within walking distance to both pools as well as the cafe. The resort location was convenient to all the local attractions-just 5 min from Sea World & Discovery Cove, and only about 20 min from Disney. The only drawbacks were that our door had been damaged previously & didn't feel as secure as it should have been and we ran into security escorting two teenagers from our building who had trespassed onto the property. Just wish he would have escorted them from the property not just the building. Otherwise a fantastic location & would consider returning again when visiting the Orlando area. Great value compared to onsite Disney resorts which we have stayed at numerous times in the past.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to America”
Reviews.Author: webby21
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in America so I do not have anything to compare with but I found the whole experience amazing, the people were so friendly and polite and genuinely wanted you to "have a good day", the transport up and down International drive was excellent service, cheap and very clean to travel on, every 20 minutes or so and the locals that used it were very helpful and nothing was too much for the drivers We did have an issue with the bedding at the resort but the staff acted very quickly(within 5 minutes) and they deducted 2 days resort fees as a good will gesture, will definitely be going back for a return visit but for longer and with grandchildren

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: nicki143
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean resort. Everything you need is right there. Great for multi-families, you don't feel crammed in, and have a little privacy from others that are in your suite. Due to full kitchen, we were able to make a lot of our meals thus saving a lot of money on eating out. All the bathrooms and kitchen were granite tops, and newly remodeled. No "mildew smell" typical of hotels, and the place was immaculate! You can spend a full day at their pool. The kids loved the Kiddie side. Also they have an area of the pool with beach sand, if you need to feel a little sand under your feet :)

Reviews.Title: “great rooms and facilities”
Reviews.Author: skyflierpr
Reviews.Content: we really liked our room, it was spacious and had everything we needed. the check in girl was really nice and they even call to make sure you are happy right when you get to your room. only problem was a horrible vomit smell in our hallway which we called about but never changed. we had to hold our breath every time we left/arrived the room. Also the maid service during our stay all they did was make the bed and fold the towels.. never cleaned out our trash can or cleaned up any of our mess. I expected a little more on this. In general the facilities and room were great and for the price I will most likely go back.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Great visit”
Reviews.Author: MJH48
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home having spent 3 nights at the Floridays Resort. In the past year the resort had notchanged. It is still exceptionally well maintained. The staff are welcoming and friendly. The accommodations are super. We had a two bedroomed apartment this time, which has all the amenities as described in their advert. The pool area is busy and suits families. However we were located in Block D which was in the quieter area and there is a little pool to lounge around. The distance from Floridays to the Premium Outlets is less than 5 minutes and is walkable if you don't buy too much!!! There is a brilliabnt Outback Streakhouse which served fantastic steaks. All groceries can be purchased from Publix also right next door to Floridays. The disney theme parks can be reached easily and the busy International Drive is just a short drive north. Floridays is situated in the quieter end of Int.Drive which is great. This Resort is amazing and perfect for all ages. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “We experienced Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: Renee1981
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Orlando as we experienced all the theme parks. First of all the good, the apartment itself in our case a 3 bedroom was excellent. Large, clean and homely. It was the perfect size. It was well equipped with almost everything we needed. The pool area is kid friendly and really designed solely for the kids and family. It is mainly shallow not overly deep and with a number of water spraying devices to be enjoyed. The apartment is well located, about 300 meters from Publix ( Supermarket) and 500 meters from Outback ( restaurant which was really good and not expensive to eat at. The bad...well really it was the people...the exception being the front office staff ( they were excellent from start to finish) First of all the Concierge...what was their problem??? 1. Ask for a recommendation for Dinner, I requested somewhere with ribs and told them we were a family. They organise Texas Brasil $28 cab ride away on the way there and $48 on the way home? WTF ??? by the way Texas Brazil is not a family restaurant and there Ribs are dreadful ! But the card concierge gave us had us seated right away...I wonder why! $279 for dinner 3 adults 2 kids 1 bottle of wine ($43) We use Conceierges car service R J Tours Transportation who charge us $28 there and $48 on the way home....same distance, different price = argument and complaint. All we can say is don't get in a car driven by a Haitian driver, you will be ripped off. (Be careful there are lots if them....after 2 days of them I decided to never get in a vehicle driven by a Haitian ever again and didn't...shame really! Second Concerge problem, ask to be booked on shuttle to Magic Kingdom...no problem it leaves out the front of the hotel in 20 minutes, its called the Orlando Trolley......The Orlando Trolley does not go to Magic Kingdom, it actually just travels up and down International drive.. So we finally get on the Magic Kingdom Shuttle from the hotel and organise pick up for 6.15pm..so we are there at 6.05pm and are told there is no seats available, wait for the next shuttle ...This is after our name was booked on the 6.15pm shuttle. It appears first in best dressed wether your names in the list or not. Finally on the night before we left, we decide to order room service from the Palms Cafe...dinner for 5...half way through ordering Edwin (employee) decides to become a smarty on the phone. Edwin tells me I'm ordering from the old menu and not the new menu and I cant have what Ive ordered. So I tell Edwin ..Im ordering off the menu in the room which is all I have to go on and he keeps being a smarty. Even when he delivers the new menu to the room he wants to be smart. This all ended up with us ordering off a local restaurant instead. I really do hope our experience was the exception and not the rule here, as the apartment is perfect. Unfortunately the staff at this resort are of the opinion that being the No 1 resort on trip advisor means they don't have to try at all. ( Again the check in and out staff are not included in this, they were fantastic ). In conclusion, we recommend staying somewhere else...their are so many choices in Orlando you don't have to take second best, or put up with people problems, enjoy your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Linda L
Reviews.Content: The layout of the lobby, complex and room as neat, clean and spacious. Our room easily accomodated 6 people (4 adulst, 2 kids). Definately family friendly environment. Most of all the staff was wonderful. Everyone we encountered while on our stay was kind, gracious and outgoing. We would definately come back and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Our family trip to Florida”
Reviews.Author: Debbie L
Reviews.Content: I know this is a little long but I like more infor.We had the best time staying here at Floridays. It is close like to everything. There is a Publixs grocery store about 5 blocks away (walking distance)where we went and bought groceries, beer, wine, water and breakfast foods and snacks and is connected to a strip mall. In the strip mall there is the BEST Pizza, and gift shop, Liquor store, Subway and a few more stores.At about 8 blocks away(walking distance) is a huge outlet mall where we bought discount tickets for a few things we were going to do. McDonalds is about 6 blocks away. There is a Trolley that runs to and from down town Orlando. There is a pick up right in front of Floridays. Tickets can be purchased at the hotel for $4. per day and a schedule where it travels to. They do sell the trolley tickets for up to two weeks. We rode it just one day. You get on and off as you want. There are shops every where this travels. Make sure to look if you want to ride the Red rail or green rail. You can transfer for free. Down town Disney is only a few miles away from Floridays. Disney parks are close by also. We rented a car so we drove everywhere. The hotel rooms are spacious and clean. They come and replace your towels and make your beds and empty your garbage daily. The room also come with a washer and dryer which I didn't think we would use, but we did a few loads. They have two pools, a smaller one with less traffic, and a larger one which was busy most of the time, a lot of fun. There is a bar right there next to the pool just to kick back and relax and listen to the music. One night there was a guy singing which was very nice to listen to. I do have to say we did not do the whole Disney scene scene we have been there a few times before and the boys are older, we traveled to Kennedy Space center which was great then to Cocoa beach that is only 45 min for Kennedy center. We then traveled to Clearwater beach which is about 2 hours from the hotel.....well worth it. Just beautiful!!! Went to down town Disney and had a great time, went to City walk that to was a lot of fun. All in all I would highly recommend Floridays, I felt it was the best bang for the buck, I also liked that the kids had their own room as well as the parents.

Reviews.Title: “Already booked another trip to FLORIDAYS!”
Reviews.Author: MominIOWA50362
Reviews.Content: We LOVE Floridays! Our family of 5 checked in on a busy Friday around 5pm. The front desk was very efficient and the process was easy. We witnessed an obnoxious and demanding man checking in at the same time - the front desk dealt with him professionally and did not give in to his unreasonable demands. During our weeks stay - we spent a few days at the pool area and loved it! Perfect poolside lunch, great bar service, awesome smoothies for the kids (flavors changed daily!), weekend games for the kids by the pool, etc. etc. We also enjoyed the gym (ALL the machines worked which NEVER happens - even in an upscale hotel!) and the short walks to Publix grocery market. OH - and to the Outlet shopping:) We used the deck area in the evening for family card games and just hanging out. Our ONLY complaint would be the lack of loungers poolside. Could use a few more loungers...... We have already booked Floridays for our next Orlando visit. THANKS for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gerrenstree
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a 2 bedroom suite recently, my husband, mother in law and myself. Plenty of room to stretch out and not trip over each other and enough space to also find some personal space when needed. The grounds and buildings looked well maintained, as well as the pool areas. There are only a few minor complaints that I have, task lighting in the kitchen area could have been better, a makeup mirror in bath and a full length mirror would also been helpful. But we did appreciate the ceiling fans and flat screen TV in the living room. The location was great and very convienent to many of the parks and to the airport. We will definitely consider staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ken518
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in early March 2012. For a 2-bedroom unit we paid only $143 a night. How can you beat that?! The whole experience was great and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “VERY good, though not perfect”
Reviews.Author: vacaystaymaster
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have written of this sort for a travel experience, but I think Floridays is worthy of taking the time at add to the reviews... I checked TripAdvisor reviews thoroughly when selecting Floridays and found the reviews to be very accurate and helpful. We were there for one week March 15th-22nd. First, when traveling with kids, the 2-bedroom condo was great-- plenty of space, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen with all needed items including corkscrew. Well-kept and clean. Pricing for the unit was also very attractive. The pool area is very good, with an excellent zero-entry kid's area with splash features, etc. Staff was always attentive, friendly, responsive to requests. We were in Bldg B, which is close to the pool, cafe, etc. Bldgs A and C also very close and convenient. Buildings D, E, and F were not as far from the pool as some reviews lead me to believe-- easily walkable though some reviewers talked about driving to the pool form the back buildings. I don't think that would be necessary at all. Pool is HEATED which is great-- stayed at Animal Kindom Lodge last year and that pool was not heated-- pretty cold in early March! I appreciated nice, comfortable water temp here. Room service was reasonably priced and food was delivered in a reasonable period of time. Having the washer and dryer in the room was GREAT-- we didn't have to pack as much stuff, just did a small load every day or 2 days. Not much noise -- did not hear anyone in adjoining units. Our rooms did not overlook pool but I don't think there'd be much pool noise even on that side, especially higher up . Now, a few small complaints -- but not significant compared to the upside of this resort: 1) maid service was erratic-- one or two days no one had come by 4 PM when we returned to the unit. Usually we were there when they came at 9 AM or at 4 PM so it isn't as easy to have them make beds, etc. 2) Sink in the master bath drained very slowly-- slow enough to fill the sink bowl if you left the water running w/ drain open. I called twice for service, and someone came quickly, but I was not able to wait around while they were there; found that the problem was not resolved either time. Inconvenient but not disastrous. I decided not to worry about it and other than shaving whiskers not rinsing down the bowl due to slow drain, not a big problem. 3) installed hairdryer in master bath did not work-- short in it. Staff brought a hand-held which worked fine. Small matter, but I hope they do fix that dryer for the next visitors. 4) Check-in time is 4PM which meant we had to wait a bit-- nut in retrospect, it takes time to clean and prepare a 2+ BR condo unit for the next guest after someone has been in there a week. 5) Was not able to get the room assignment requested (based on other TripAdvisor recs we requested blg B, 3rd floor or higher, with west view to see Disnet fireworks) but that was a very minor thing-- enjoyed our room a lot. They also offered to check availability for our request and let us move later if we wanted, but we liked the room and didn't want to pack up for a new room. Nice that they offered to try and get us the assignment we wanted even if it meant moving us after a day or so. Bottom line-- I enjoyed the stay very much and felt the cost was very reasonable for the amenities. Well-located, we were able to reach all destinations quickly and without difficulty. Staff was always friendly and helpful w/ all requests, directions, etc. Good heated pool with nice area for kids. I would most definitely stay there again, or recommend to others-- as I am doing now. I spoke with several people there who have stayed at Floridays every year for 5+ years in a row-- must be consistently good. Five stars from me and my family. Not perfect-- but what is? Well worth the price. Would like to be there right now.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of room for a family of 7”
Reviews.Author: Erin D
Reviews.Content: The 3 bedroom suite was very spacious and clean, and provided enough room for my husband and I and our 5 teenage children! The pool area was wonderful and the location is close to everything. I have not one negative comment, we will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure Why it's #1”
Reviews.Author: GJRiles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with son and friend during a long weekend golf outing. Picked it because of the #1 rating in Trip Advisor. As I read with another reviewer, not sure why it was top resort as there are so many resorts in the area. The property was quite large with a tone of buildings rooms, reasonable priced. Rooms were large but I have also stayed in another place similar to Floridays with same size rooms. Our Room had a funky smell almost moldy smelling, once you were in room for 10 minutes you couldn't smell it but everytime you walked in the door you clearly did. Pillows were small and not too comfortable. Staff was friendly, however room service was lame. Our place was near small pool and we stopped by for a quick dip and their were no towels nor person maning the pool area. For what we did it was fine since we spent little or no time in the resort. If I was staying here for extended period time or with my entire family for vacation I may have rated it lower. Since there are so many options within the Orland Area, I do not think I would stay here again or recommend it to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, immaculate small condo resort for families”
Reviews.Author: WiensFamilyTravels
Reviews.Content: The cleanliness of this property, from the rooms to the common areas, impressed us and made our stay very enjoyable. The condos are large with balconies (we stayed in building C third floor). The fact that we had a washer/dryer and the kids had their own room with two double beds gave the parents privacy and the kids loved to relax in their room and watch TV at bedtime. Master had California king and was lovely. Linens were very nice, beautifully washed and replaced every day. The pool area is really magnificent and we appreciated the lush landscaping and some shaded areas - important for fair people like ourselves who burn easily and WONDERFUL for small tots who should never be in strong sun. The patio/bar area as a direct extension of the pool is just amazing for families. Front desk staff were very helpful and pleasant. A word of advice: room location, view, noisiness will vary from building to building and will depend on your tastes; some people like a quiet room away from the action and some people like to look out on the central and boisterous pool area. The rooms are given first come, first serve, The earlier you arrive, the more choice you may have. However, all buildings are nice and very clean. Location was excellent for us, a bit of quiet oasis, and we rented a car but a shuttle is available - WDW, Sea World and Universal all very close. Large grocery store and large outlet malls just a block or two away. We had every breakfast in the room, on our patio and saved a great deal on meals by preparing in the room, very well equipped kitchen, so we splurged on nice dinners out. This was a very reasonable hotel with good value for a spacious condo situation.

Reviews.Title: “Pretending good service but not really.”
Reviews.Author: Matcha0902
Reviews.Content: I felt rating of this place is not what you expect. I had problem with my master bedroom drawer which keep opening by itself and almost hurt myself few times but they didn't seem to care too much to fix right away. Asked about how to get to down town for NBA game at the front desk, told as to use cab which cost $90.00 return but we took local bus which cost us only $12.00 return. They said some people had problem so they don't recommend but they should at least give some options to the guest. Bus driver was very nice and helpful. We even had few people helped us how to use free bus in down town. Everything else about this hotel is not more than 3 stars for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort - nice size suite - great value!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: My family of five recently stayed at Floriday's for a week's vacation. We very very happy with the location of the resort - just a 10 - 15 minute ride to Disney Parks and very close to grocery store, pharmacy and restaurants. The staff was excellent and friendly. Our two bedroom suite was a nice size - pleanty of room for my kids to stretch out and enjoy themselves. The suite had everything you could ask for - full size fridge, washer and dryer and dishwasher. Our dishwasher did not work but once we reported it, a repair person was there right away and had it repaired in minutes. The pool is a nice size - kids had fun in the splash area. Our room did have some stains on the carpet but other than that it was clean. Housekeeping services only include fresh towels and they make up your beds - actual cleaning is an extra charge. Overall, I'd rate this hotel as a great value!

Reviews.Title: “FIRST AND LAST TIME!!! Terrible staff at front desk, very noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Martinkir
Reviews.Content: We got an extra charge for receiving packages and they didn't comunicate that to us. Unfortunately we could not guess when packages will arrive. For sure they do that to have extra income. Very unfriendly Staff at front Desk - Ms.Yanira was very unfriendly and unpolite with the answers given. We also received 2 messages on the phone from the front guest services the first 2 days with information about check out time. We felt like they wanted us to check out before our departure date when we stayed for 7 nights. On the room we also heard other peolple from outside as well as elevator doors (and we were quite away from it). Parking is very tough. We left our car all nights 70 mts away from our bulidng entrance

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaClarke90
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent, a 5 minute drive from Sea World, and Aquatica. No more than a 10 minute drive from the main shops and restaurants on International Drive, and the Universal and Wet and Wild resorts. There is also a Publix supermarket right around the corner. Although I believe the resort offers shuttles to the major theme parks, we had a rental car and could not have done without it! Accommodation: A group of 5 of us stayed in a two bedroom apartment. The accommodation was very roomy and very clean. There was a big kitchen area with a washer and dryer and they also provided washing tablets as well. There was a dinning table and living room area opening onto a terrace. The master bedroom was amazing, huge and comfortable bed, amazing bathroom with Jacuzzi bath and shower. The only slight let down was the quality of the sofa bed, which was very lumpy and bumpy, but definitely not a huge issue. We stayed in Tower F, which was a fair bit away from the main reception and main pool. There is however a small pool area by this building which was very nice, quiet and clean, so was perfect for us. We were given a ground floor room which we normally would not be happy with, but the resort seemed very safe so we felt secure enough not to make a fuss. Everyone was extremely friendly and always happy to help. For the money Floriday's resort is such good value considering other hotels I looked at before booking. I was very pleased and would definitely return. Great for families and groups.

Reviews.Title: “Do we really have to walk out to driveway area to walk to pool?”
Reviews.Author: dmking79
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I do not know why this hotel is rated #1 for Orlando. I've stayed in alot of places in Orlando, and will continue to look for a better #1 spot. The rooms are large, we got a 3 bedroom with a King, and the other 2 bedrooms had two doubles, two baths, a nice kitchen and a comfortable living area. So if it's only the room size you care about, it is nice for $200 bucks a night. However, the resort is large and in order to walk to pool or go for coffee, you must wait for elevator, and then walk out to driveway and walk up the street. For us, we slept here, but did not end up enjoying any amenities for $200 per night.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing oasis in orlando”
Reviews.Author: Oceansplaher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 3 days of our florida trip, was immediately impressed by the size of the suite it had a large fully equipt kitchen area, dining area and lounge area. Two large bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, the en-suite bathroom had a huge spa bath and seperate large walk-in shower. Everything was clean and in good working order. The complex is very big, we stayed in building F which was furthest from the main pool, but there was a smaller pool near to our building which was clean and had lots of towels, and the pool temperature was comfortably warm. Overall a great resort, we did not use the main pool but it did look nice and clean. As a couple it was more than large enough for us and would be ideal for a family, very good value for money, not much more money than a standard hotel room. We found floridays to be ideally situated on a quieter area of international drive, adjacent to Vineland Road that we were previously unaware of, this makes both the disney parks and universal/seaworld park locations very accessible, with or without a car and in within walking distance of prime outlets, also a 24 hour publix nearby if you want to self cater or good quality restaurants it you would rather eat out. We will not hesitate to stay in Floridays again and will recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great Value, Great Location just don't count on Cafe for food!!”
Reviews.Author: thespottedtraveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived on March 7th for a week of spring break fun with my kids. We rented a car, and check in was easy. Its about 20-25 minutes from the airport on International drive. Our 3 bedroom suite was bigger than I expected. The kids jack and jill bathroom was huge with enough room for 3 teen agers to leave their junk everywhere. The Master bathroom was also very big with a closet, safe, and a big jacuzzi tub. The tub fills fast and was luxurious!!! The shower was nice size, and the bathroom counter was big and spacious. The kitchen has all the utensils needed for cooking breakfast prior to going out for the day. We also bought drinks and such for the kids and the regular size fridge was great. We were in building A right across from the bus pick up and the pool, this turned out to be ideal!!! The room was just restocked with towels each day and the garbages dumped, no other cleaning done, which was fine with me. The pool is smaller, and does not have enough space for all the guests. I am assuming they are expecting everyone to be gone all day, we came back early for some sun, and there was no chairs and no place in the sun, kind of disappointing/ The only down to this resort is the cafe!! We ate there one night, waited 40 minutes for our food and it came out in card board boxes with plastic silverware, and cost as much as hitting up a regular restaurant with real dishes!! The bartender works very hard, and is commended by me for trying to speed things up, but the people working in the back just didn't have what it takes to keep the customers happy. So we tried again to eat at the cafe, it was 9pm after a long rainy day and we were all too wet and tired to go to a restaurant... well we didn't get our food till 1030pm!!!! The bartender couldn't believe it... he had to go back there and make our food for us!!! He comped us our appetizers and drinks, the poor guy, however that was the last time we bought anything at the cafe!!! It just wasn't worth it. Overall a great value and great place to stay!! Just plan your meals and food without counting on the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: DFWGuy1
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place for families; we got the 2 room suite and it was very spacious and clean with beautiful views of the lake. My favorite part of the suite was the fact that the master bedroom (and bath) was completely separated from the other bedroom by about 15 feet. Perfect for parents who want a small amount of privacy. The staff was very friendly also. We did not have time to use the other amenities on the property as we spent most of our visit at the tourist attractions in Orlando. fyi--I am giving 5 stars for value because we booked the suite online at a large discount to the standard rate; I probably would not have made the reservation if we had to pay the standard rate though.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Steve F
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for a family of four traveling with two large teenagers. Definately more like a condo than a hotel with tons of room for everyone. We found the kitchen and in room washer and dryer really convenient. We used the smaller pool at the back of the property, warmer water, less little kids and no smokers on the deck. We did not use room service or the restaurants and were a little disappointed that the Starbucks was not a regular, full menu Starbucks. The Outlets, restaurants and grocery store were very close. The grounds and buildings were clean. Our kids used the fitness centre, they would have like to have had a small basketball court. We would stay again based on good value for dollars spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with the family”
Reviews.Author: robndani
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great place. The pool area is great for all ages... even a little sandy beach area. The rooms were clean and roomy. The only negative thing is trying to eat with young children. There are no high chairs or a real dining area. The food at the pool and at the "quick market" was very good, but we always had to take it back to our room because we had booster seats. I think that they will bring a high chair to your room if needed though. We even needed a large piece of furniture removed to accomodate 2 cribs and they did it quickly and pleasantly. Overall great experience... going back this year!

Reviews.Title: “Just as the reviews said!!”
Reviews.Author: brijulkat
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel it feels more like a condo, this is a hotel for people with family or group of family members. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We stayed at the 2 bedroom suite, our children shared a room. There was no need to argue about sharing one TV or keeping others awake! The kitchen was fully furnished, very spacious over all. We had a lake view and a balcony which is not mentioned in their website but it seems like all rooms have a balcony. It was certanly a plus. The main pool is great for children and adults (they provide beach towels), theres a bar near the pool for refreshments and food in case you do not want to go to your room to make food. I would stay here again no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great place for families with young kids that need extra quiet and separate rooms to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: snowbunnyBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful, clean, spacious resort. The staff was courteous and attentive and met all of our needs. We enjoyed the 3 bedroom suites as each of our children got their own room and no one was keeping anyone awake! We will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: bobby195
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and it had everything you could possibly need. The furniture and furnishings were all of a good standard, and the kitchen very well equiped.The furnished balcony was an added extra we were not expecting. The reception staff were very friendly. We stayed for 3 nights on our way back from a holiday on the Gulf coast, and the appartment was half the nightly cost of our hotel room there. The washer/dryer was handy - nothing to do but unpack when we got home! The supermarket is just next door and has everthing you need.The pool area was not too crowded, with plenty of clean towels available. The only negative was the lack of lighting in the appartment blocks at night. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: canuck642011
Reviews.Content: Easily one of the best places for families. If you are looking for a luxury hotel you might be disappointed. We found everything was functional and comfortable. The rooms are condo style with lots of space. The full kitchen and washer and dryer make the stay much easier than just a hotel room. The beds are comfortable and furniture is ok but a bit worn. Not bad but more suited to families than business. We stayed in unit A which is next to international drive so there was some traffic noise with the balcony door open. We could occasionally hear footsteps from the unit above us but it was not constant and it was not bad enough to disturb us. Other than that it was very quiet. The pool area is excellent and the take out style food spot was not bad. Prices were not outrageous and the quality pretty good. The location is pretty central but you are not surrounded by other hotels so it feels a bit secluded.
