The facilities are nice but it is a bit more basic than some of the newer complexes that hotels have become. Publix and a drug store are a five minute walk and we stalked up there very easily. The shuttle was convenient and made a car not a requirement to stay here. The staff is excellent from check-in to check out we were very impressed. You felt as if everyone really wanted you to have a great vacation. It went beyond training as they all seemed happy and genuinely anxious to help. The concierge staff was simply the best. This was during march break so you know that workloads would be at maximum but you would never know it. They were all so friendly. I think this must have rubbed off on the guests. We have stayed several times in orlando and have usually encountered rude or inconsiderate guests around the pool, in line for a shuttle or next door to us. but not here. It made the stay one of our best ever. We hate to go and would definitely stay again on a return trip

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but hard to get to Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: 60922Familyof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we wanted the two room suite and it was very large and nice and quiet at night, but a little difficult to get to the Disney parks from there. The bus was so prompt and didn't wait even 5 minutes so we got left behind at Epcot along with two other families one night. The maid never dumped our trash cans . The room was very comfortable and the bed was very comfortable and for the first time ever I didn;t have to use ear plugs to sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: louandkaren
Reviews.Content: the resort was excellent and the suite was 5 star... the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would stay there again as the value for your dollar went a long way

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home for same cost as Hilton or Rosen Centre”
Reviews.Author: Mel D
Reviews.Content: Spacious Clean Rooms, Complete Kitchen, Washer and Dryer, Living Room, all the conveniences of home. The staff was friendly and very accommodating, the pool staff had lots of activities for the kids. I really didn't know what to expect being the rate for this property was actually less than a room at the Hilton or the Rosen Centre. I am glad we stayed here instead and will book future stays here when traveling to the Orlando - Kissimmee area. Make sure you book a room with a pool side view.

Reviews.Title: “Picked the wrong days?”
Reviews.Author: keeperof4
Reviews.Content: It seems we did not pick the right days. I chose Floridays because of the #1 rating on tripadvisor. When we arrived I was surprised not to pass trough a security gate.A resort that caters to children with no security gate?? Front desk staff was friendly, we were placed in building D. As we were taking our luggage from our car to the unit a minivan almost hit one of my children while speeding through the parking lot, the lady driver could clearly see us. I can see that if people think they are checking into a hotel why they would be somewhat impressed with the units. They are just average condos for this area. Our unit was clean,(Finger prints on the tv) worn but acceptable. After returning the first evening we were greeted by the couple next door fighting. This went on from approx. 9pm to almost midnight and he kept turning the tv up to block out her voice, which was futile because she continued to get louder and louder. Our toilet ran on and off until finally I had to turn it off. After I managed to get a few hours sleep I was expecting a nice hot shower.The bath is basic with walk in shower whirl pool tub. What I got was 4 flows of either extremely cold or hot water from the shower. When I turned on the bathroom fan I thought it was going to fall from the ceiling. Being fortunate enough to be invited to another resort for the day we proceeded downstairs,and to try to put this behind me. I was welcomed by management and cleaning staff arguing with each other,not the right time to bring the problems to there attn.!! What another great start to my vacation. Returning that evening around 5pm, we arrived to find cleaning staff in our room. No big deal but a little late in the day I would think.I took my kids over to check out the pool ,and a family arrived and proceeded to throw a foot ball right in front of us almost hitting my daughter in the face. No apology basically telling us that the pool was no theirs. No problem we had spent the day at a far more spectacular facility.Let them have their time!! Now for our second evening. From 7 til approx. 10pm the people next door again continued where they left off the night before.(It appears someone likes the track!) Outside the door it was a continuous flow of running? , shouting, doors slamming as what appeared to be people arriving for the sporting events. Finally around 11pm , getting settled down, I figured I was in for at least one deserving night's sleep seeing as now I was going on 3 nights of my vacation without any sleep due to other inconsiderate and rude people. At approx. 1:30 am someone decided they were going to go swimming the gate must of been locked and they ended up almost in a brawl in the parking lot. Finally there friends? arrived to take control of the situation,no security arrived. In two days I can't recall seeing security in this ungated?? facility. The last morning my daughter went to turn on the hair dryer in the main bath and it began to smoke,I unplugged it and left a note for house keeping. I guess no previous guests used the shower bath fan or hair dryer ?? I am glad that by the reviews many received and enjoyed a wonderful stay at Floridays Resort, it appears the staff and management go out of their way to provide adequate vacation experiences for their guests. It must be our bad luck whenever we travel at some point we always end up having others around us that consider themselves more important and lacking respect for those that are paying and deserve to have the same accommodations.Before leaving I wanted to bring the difficulties we encountered to front desk,but as you guessed there was some one there arguing about resort fees that are CLEARLY STATED!!! I must disagree with tripadvisors #1 rating! I am not sure how this is determined.There are far worse misleading places to stay as we found the hard way. I can assure you that I have and will continue to stay in far superior accommodations than provided here for the same or less price. There are several gated resorts in this area that I have visited that provide far superior accommodations for around the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Floridays Resort”
Reviews.Author: Mary J I
Reviews.Content: Floridays Resort is very clean, well maintained with wonderful employees and comfortable rooms. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, felt like home”
Reviews.Author: rxlaurenrx
Reviews.Content: Looked up multiple resorts in the Orlando area close to Disney and universal and saw Floridays also was pet friendly! After reading the reviews on trip advisor I booked this place. I'm so glad I did! The rooms were clean and fully equipped with a kitchen. No sign that pets were even staying here at all. It was very busy when we went in march, so parking after 8 was not easy to find right out front. We parked at the building next to ours, it wasn't very far an extra 5 minutes or so. If you are going during a busy time, be sure to get up early to find a seat by the pool because it gets crowded early. Other than that it's a great place

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, loved it, kids loved it, huge rooms, wow”
Reviews.Author: MXEditor
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for 5 days, we were in Bldg D. It was excellent - the property is clean and spacious, the room was HUGE! Seriously I have never been in this big of a room down here. It was 3 bedrooms - awesome. Full kitchen, all amenities were great! Had some small issues with the TV/DVD and it was fixed right away...the pool area was so much fun for the kids they were there all day and night when we weren't at the parks. Publix and Walgreens are within walking distance, we prepared excellent breakfast(s) and saved a ton. Brought home leftovers from all the great restaurants and ate then at the pool for lunch. Staff? Hardly ever saw them, never needed anything!! Would recommend especially for families with kids. Top-Notch value.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay, Again”
Reviews.Author: Carter27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful week in Florida, spending 4 nights at the Floridays. We had been there 6 years ago with our sons. We were once again thrilled with the suites and the staff at the Floridays. They were more than accommadating, even arranged for a late checkout for us without any issues at all. The breakfast was included in our package and each morning the food was delicious and the staff at the grill were very pleasant. Our only complaint would be the entrance to the resort is difficult to see and the actual sign is past the entrance, we passed it a few times and watched others do the same. This "temporary" entrance was temporary when we were there 6 years ago. We will return here on our next visit for sure!

Reviews.Title: “We love Floriday's!”
Reviews.Author: Plumms2
Reviews.Content: We are going on our 3rd year staying at Floriday's. We stay at least 3-4 times per year. The price and what you get you can not get it. The staff is awesome. We are looking forward to many more visits.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Customer - 2nd Visit to Floridays in 2 years!”
Reviews.Author: McFarlandHFX
Reviews.Content: My family (3 boys, ages 11, 9 and 3) has now stayed at Floridays twice in the past 2 years. I can honestly say that when we stay in Orlando we do not even consider staying elsewhere...Floridays is THE BEST PLACE TO STAY IN ORLANDO! The rooms are exceptionally clean and comfortable; the pool is great for adults and kids of all ages and the restaurant serves great food. Honestly, I cannot find anything bad to say about Floridays, perfectly situated near all of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: itsjustlynn
Reviews.Content: We booked and stayed for 5 nights. We checked in quickly and efficiently. There are a few buildings and we asked not to be directly over the main pool (as other reviewers suggested). We were assigned to building E on the top floor (6th) overlooking the pond and fountain. It was peaceful and very nice. The 2 bedroom 2 bath was clean and had all the home comforts needed for our stay. When you are in a busy park all day it's so nice to come back to some peace and space. You are charged an extra $12 per day for the maids to make your bed, remove the trash and replenish the towels. They don't bother you early in the morning and don't make a lot of noise outside the room. We did laundry, cooked and enjoyed the big bath and shower. It was great except for the very small annoyance of having smokers below us on the balcony. It's next to a grocery store Publix and a pharmacy walgreens - close enough and far enough from Universal and very close to Sea World and Discovery Cove. We didn't eat at the hotel or ask for any services so our 4 star above on service is only because we have to put something in to submit the review. This hotel is definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Families and big groups”
Reviews.Author: jaql33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 3 bedroom apartment with 6 adults and there was more than enough room! Everything was there for you to feel right at home and not the mention the price was fantastic. Orlando is very spread out so if you are planning on staying at a non-disney property (if you were planning on visiting Disney World) then this place would be the right choice to make!

Reviews.Title: “Just want we wanted”
Reviews.Author: hideandseek23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited in September 2011 and we loved it. When we arrived we were greeted with a big smile and offered to take our bags to our room. The reception was lovely and big....but when we got into the rooms we were amazed. 2 bedroom apartments were more that what we expected. The only down side is that we didn’t have a view but I was glad to have a room with no noise as I am a light sleeper. We used the shuttle bus to the parks the first day that we got there and called up 30 minutes before it was due to leave and they happily added us onto this. We cancelled a few times as couldn’t make the time we booked and there was no trouble being added onto another bus. There were a few shuttle services going to different parks throughout the morning and a few coming back at night (depending which park you visit) We used the taxi service on a few occasion and the first time we used it we were not impressed. The gentleman did not have change of $20 dollars (my boyfriend seen he had change – looks like he was looking for a tip) we were going to give him $15 dollars for a $12 trip. The maid service was great and had fresh towels/clean bin/beds made every day. The food was very tasty at the pool area and not bad priced. There is the option to rent films for a few days and think this was roughly $3 per DVD. Flordays in a bit out the way from all the attractions so it’s hard to get about without a car. We used the I-Ride a few times which stops at 9pm ish. So we ended up having to get taxis. Taxi is around $25 dollars to universal studios to go out at night time and around $15 to Pointe Orlando. I would have loved to have stayed again when I return this year but I had to go with somewhere closer to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Neslunja
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here last spring when we brought our young children to Disney for the first time. Floridays far exceeded our expectations and made our holiday perfect! The layout of the suite was ideal (2 bedrooms, 2 baths, living room area and kitchen). The suite was important to us, as our kids still nap, which would have made a normal hotel room layout miserable. Having all kitchen amenities was very convenient. There was a small convenient shop on site, but a full size grocery store (Piggly Wiggly) right down the street. The pool was our favorite. A very large and fun zero entry children's pool area, perfect for small kids. Very good location, close to everything. I believe they offered shuttles to some theme parks, but we rented a car.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: There is no criticism I could make of Floridays. I read all the reviews prior to booking and they are all accurate . The quality of the apartment and the quietness at night is excellent. We travelled the length and breadth of Orlando and everything is relatively close by and easy to find by car . I would definitely recommend Floridays to the business traveller and holidaymaker alike.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays, the place to stay with a family”
Reviews.Author: hola2010
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with a family, the multiple bedrooms and bathrooms make it very convenient, as does the fully equipped kitchen, the washer and dryer allow lighter packing from home. Beautiful resort with 6 large buildings. For pool view stay in B or C.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Floridays!”
Reviews.Author: brightgirl1
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying here and we were just as happy as the first time. Check in staff is very friendly and helpful. Our 3 bedroom suite worked beautifully for me and my husband, our toddler, and my parents. (The only down side is that my husband and I had to sleep in separate beds. We gave my parents the master bedroom and we took one of the smaller rooms, but the beds are really too small for two adults to sleep in comfortably.) Wifi worked great. For those with kids, PBS is channel 99, took us awhile to find that!!! Great location, close to everything. Literally our only disappointment was that the pool was too cold for our toddler to enjoy it. After 10 minutes he was turning blue and shivering. They said when we checked in that the pool was 86 degrees, but I think it was colder than that. My son's pool at swim lessons is 90 degrees and he does fine with that. This seemed way more than 4 degrees cooler. My parents ate breakfast at the cafe one day and said it was really good. Anyway, that's about it. I'm sure we will probably be back. Love this place!!! A couple small negative to report: our shower head did not work right. My husband managed to fix it. But we also had to turn it off REALLY hard in order for it not to drip. Also, one time we got on the elevator and there was a big bag of garbage left in there. Another time we got off the elevator and there was a staff member sweeping up broken glass everywhere. He didn't warn us to watch out for it, and my little one almost went right into it before I could grab him!

Reviews.Title: “Average "hotel" better ones definitely to be found in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: DisappointedCanada
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Floridays in Orlando. According to previous reviews it is the "number one" hotel in Orlando. In my opinion it is average...nothing great about it and nothing too bad about it. We have been going as a family to Orlando for 15 years and we have stayed at several different resorts in the Orlando/Kissimmee area. Where Floridays is located is good...but we have stayed previously at the "Fountains" next door to Floridays and Vistana Villages across the road from Floridays and I would stay at either one of those resorts before I stayed at Floridays again. Honestly, it is just a "bare bones" resort, nothing fancy or fun. My kids are older now and they enjoy tennis and pool...not just video games and an air hockey table. Floridays just has two pools and the "children's pool" is quite busy but the quiet pool is OK...there are no fountains or slides on the property. As far as our unit was concerned..don't be content with a unit on the second floor! (the balcony is half stucco). We were and we were disappointed about how dark the unit was. When we arrived the check in was very quick and easy! When we got to our unit we knew the unit had been cleaned throughly because the smell of bleach and disinfectant was overpowering. After opening all the windows the smell left the unit 24 hrs later. The unit is smaller than others we have been to in the Orlando area. Master Bathroom is very large and a big waste of space. The unit was a 2 bed room for 6 people yet the cutlery and dishes were only enough for 4 people. All in all it was just OK but I would not return to this resort. My favourite resort out of the many we have been to ( Orange Lake, Vistana, The Fountains, Vistana Villages, Westgate, Westgate Lakes, etc...) Vistana Villages is the best as far as location, amenities, unit size and a beautiful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “10 days of excellence.”
Reviews.Author: Cdnexpat1011
Reviews.Content: Very easy. Have travelled the world, single, couple and family. Best bang for your buck and excellent through and through. As long as you are driving the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “You'd be crazy not to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Runwaychic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4-night visit this week (March 2012). We've stayed on Disney property before, and weren't sure about staying off-site. But, with the price difference, and the wonderful reviews on Tripadvisor, I figured it was worth a try. Boy, we were so glad we took a chance. Floridays is an uber-clean resort - staff is accomodating and friendly, and the prices were competitive. One of th reasons I was concerned about staying here was the price seemed too low for what we got (the 2 bd/2bth condo). Once we checked in, our concerns went away. The rooms are better than the pictures, really. They are impeccibly clean, roomy, and have all of the amenities you need for cooking, doing a load of laundry, etc. Since I don't want to repeat what is already in the 4-5 star reviews, I wanted to make some comments that might help you make your decision. First, the reason I didn't give Floridays 5 stars is because of 2 things. First, the building location (E) was near the "quiet" pool, but a fairly far trek to the fun pool. Not that we couldn't walk it, but I was sad that we weren't in a closer building. Second, the onsite food situation is odd. There is onsite starkbucks, but not a full-blown starbucks (don't expect to be able to get a frappe or specialty drink). They just brew starbucks brand in the cafe. Also, the meal options do show breakfast/lunch/dinner that is available via room service, but there is no option to really eat anywhere onsite. This is fine since you'll probably eat out (or in your room), but for nights you just don't feel like cooking or going out, there is nowhere to really go. Another note -- we had a 5-year old with us, thinking we'd put him in one bedroom and us in the other. The bedrooms are actually fairly far apart, and (for us, at least) the room with the king bed was furthest from the front door. We just didn't feel safe leaving our son alone in the room nearest to the front door. We wound up putting him on the pull-out couch right outside our room, which was fine. But, this also posed a problem because the slider to the patio was right there, so we stacked pillows, etc. to make sure he couldn't escape at night. Paranoid, I know, but we just didn't feel right having him down the hall. So, if you have the same line of thinking, be prepared. Other that those minor things, our overall experience was wonderful. I would recommend you look here first before booking anything more pricey, and not as roomy. This is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: LORAGATES
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great ! We wished we would have planned for a longer stay. Mike and Danielle are fabulous at the bar. Housekeeping was great!! Price was on point. Just an overall good experience , best Ive had in a while. Its nice to see the owner that takes pride in their property. If i had to stay anything it would be that Id love to see a playground and a better return guest rate. This resort wont disappoint and its in a perfect location :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jelemiranda
Reviews.Content: I read a couple of reviews about this place that werent all that good, but this resort was perfect! we were there for 12 nights. The staff was wonderful, and the room was WONDERFUL. loved it. Clean/Spacious

Reviews.Title: “Wish i could live there”
Reviews.Author: mgtkav
Reviews.Content: can not recomend floridays enough. Im a clean freak and this place was soptless. this place is a condo/hotel, which i had never heard of. you have a lovely kitchen and dineing area, but if you you dont want to cook you can get room services. how great is that. there are two heated pools, bar etc. the staff could not be nicer and so close to everything, especialy the outlets!!! If you going to orlando, stay here

Reviews.Title: “clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Melissa K
Reviews.Content: This resort was very clean in the 2 bedroom suite we stayed in and out in the pool area. The suite had plenty of room for 5 with 2 very clean bathrooms and 2 bedrooms with comfortable beds. The room was refreshed daily with clean towels provided. We had no problems with the wi-fi and were able to use internet with ease in our room. The employees at the front desk were very friendly and there was a concierge (SP) desk to buy Sea World and Universal Studios tickets. We did not use the shuttle service to the parks as we had our own vehicle. Any problems we had were handled quickly, like when our key card wouldn't work an employee came within 10 minutes to let us in the room. The pool area was very clean and plenty of pool chairs were available. The kids had a great time in the pool. I HIGHLY recommend this resort to anyone staying in Orlando. It was located on International Drive very close to Sea World and Magic Kingdom and Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised - Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 8-night Orlando vacation (Feb 25 - Mar 4, 2012). We've been to Orlando a few times and have always stayed on Disney property in one of their "deluxe" resorts or vacation club "villa" properties. This is the first time we stayed off-site. I found Floridays while researching all the suite-style hotels that were within a 10-15 minute drive to the Disney parks. Needless to say, when I saw it was the #1 rated hotel on TripAdvisor, I was intrigued yet skeptical. After spending the past week in one of their 2-bedroom suites (2 adutls, one child), I can honestly say we were blown away by the overall value of the resort. For half the price of a Disney Deluxe hotel, we got a huge, beautiful suite that was even bigger than I had expected. Plus, it offered every amenity (refrigerator, stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher, washer/dryer, etc.) we could ever need. The hotel buildings & grounds were attractive, well-maintained and clean. The pool was much bigger than I expected and the entire pool area was very attractive, relaxing and had a much more "tropical resort" feel than I was expecting. The main pool IS heated (I read reports that claimed it wasn't). The location of this resort was also wonderful. It's on the south part of International Drive, so it's away from the hustle & bustle and congestion that Int'l Drive is known for. We brought a GPS, but I didn't even need it to get to the parks - the resort is a quick 10-15 minute drive to the parks requiring one turn - hang a right from Int'l Drive onto 536 (World Drive) and that's it. The staff was extremely attentive and friendly. All in all, I would recommend this resort to anyone (especially families) looking for the most bang for their buck near the parks. It really is a much more attractive resort than I had expected.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: oneiljh
Reviews.Content: The place was everything it was advertised to be. We have 2 small children so the kitchen, in-unit laundry, 2nd bedroom and 2nd bath were such a benefit. The staff were exceptional. The proximity to the publix, pharmacy and outlets was a real bonus. Travel to Disney was effortless (just check the gps route as it may not always be the best option).

Reviews.Title: “Floridays delivers”
Reviews.Author: samlydia
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay here and I must admit was still impressed with this place. The condo is very spacious and clean. The beds are comfy (not quite Hilton) but close. Pool is awesome. We came this time with our 2 toddler grandkids and 19yr old son no one was on top of each other. Kids loved pool area and game room. You will need a car to get around but Floridays has shuttles available for theme parks. Only a little complaint was housekeeper knocking on door at 9am but technically our fault we did not put sign up but thought that was a little early for light housekeeping. We will definitely be back in May to try out the 3 bedroom condo.

Reviews.Title: “what at brilliant base for ur hols”
Reviews.Author: joe w
Reviews.Content: we found this a very comfortable and pleasant place to stay from the reception to the bar staff were all very helpful and pleasant poolarea was great and the appartment was a great size very clean everythink u need and good for chilling out after a day out at the parks or whatever ur doing was also quite close to a fair size supermarket was a couple of mins drive away there was one on site with basic essentials which was ok would just like to say again we found this place very very good to stay and would most deffinatly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Floridays Resort”
Reviews.Author: Katrina5655
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay for families. I took my 15 year old granddaughter and 11 year old grandson. Full kitchen and washer and dryer. Two full baths Had no complaints except whirl pool did not work. Pool area was plenty large enought even through they have 5 buildings. I would difinately stay again. Close to all parks and attractions. Plus shopping and food. Grocery store about a block away. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: jedi4
Reviews.Content: After an exhausting day of schlepping the kids around a theme park I can’t imagine a better place to come home to. Clean, quiet and comfortable, our 2-bedroom suite with full kitchen, washer and dryer, balcony and Jacuzzi tub had everything we needed to relax and prepare for another day on the go! The front desk staff and concierge were extremely helpful. We asked to have a light bulb replaced and a toilet unplugged during our week-long stay and a repairman was there within 30 minutes. A tour bus from an outside company left us behind and the concierge went above and beyond to contact the tour company and arrange for a cab to take us to meet the bus at an alternate location. There was a small store within the resort. If you have room in your luggage (doubtful!), it would be great to bring some dishwasher & laundry detergent. You will be provided with enough for a couple loads only & it’s expensive to buy at the hotel. The swimming pool, fitness room and small café/bar area were all quite nice and never too busy. If you like to have a nice restaurant at your hotel, you will be disappointed with the café. We had the takeout pizza one evening which was pretty good. It’s an easy ten minute walk to a grocery store, pharmacy, Subway sandwich shop and Outback Steakhouse. We discovered the I-Ride trolley was a great way to get to SeaWorld and to the Premium Outlet Mall for $1.25 a ride. It comes every 20 minutes to a stop on International Drive near the hotel. The hotel shuttle is a large bus that picks up people from other resorts. Be sure to get to the bus stop early or you may be standing on the bus. We found the 7:30 am shuttle to Universal was less crowded and gave us time to stop at Starbucks for coffee before the park gates opened. The shuttle is free to Disney, Universal, SeaWorld and Aquatica. The SeaWorld shuttle leaves Floridays quite late in the morning so we took the trolley. The resort does not have an airport shuttle. If you’re looking for a reasonably priced, family friendly resort in Orlando, I think you’ll be pleased with Floridays!

Reviews.Title: “There's no better place to stay while visiting Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Wifeydifey
Reviews.Content: My family of four visit Orlando and Floriday's at least twice a year. The accomodations are huge, well stocked and very clean!! This place is perfect for a family with children. It's a condo so you have a full kitchen and washer and dryer. The place is spotless!! Beds are comfortable and the price can't be beat!! The staff are all very pleasant and truly care about their guests. Christopher Bentubo, the assistant manager, is fantastic and the front desk staff are so pleasurable. My family and I will not stay anywhere else when we visit Orlando! You can't find a better value.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Fort Lee, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “SUPERCALIFRAJALISTICEXPEEALADOCIOUS...”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: Demographics: Asian American family. We have unique palettes and unique needs. He is a father, she is a mother, son is 8, daughter is 6, we are residents of New Jersey. Intro: First of all I must say a few words... I LOVE this space... I am a social butterfly to the point of being annoying... I wake up ridiculously early... sometimes 4:30 am, sometimes 5 am... most of these interactions were early in the morning... Sorry night staff for night experiencing your kindness and wisdom... Background: My family has vacationed annually at Floridays for the past 6 years, (we missed last year for health/economic reasons). We stay in the B building. This is my first review of a space for tripadvisor. This year our trip was from Wednesday February 22, to Wednesday February 29th. (a good time to miss a few days of school, and get the cheapest airfares) Experience: Over the past 6 years, the space has remained the same... it's getting to know the people behind it all that makes it all so much better all the time... The resort is so close to Publix and the premium outlet malls... Moms and shoppers... pay close attention to that... On vacay, I'm the shopper of provisions... so I appreciated that. My wife loves to spend my family's money, so she practically lived at the outlets while we were goofing off at the pool. I have 2 children... a 6 year old princess and an 8 year old demanding "prima don", the male version of "prima donna". As much as I hate to say it, my son had a nighttime accident in bed, actually during the week stay he wet his underwear two times. Housekeeping and having washing machines en suite were critical to making it "no problem"... The only thing that got a little getting used to was... having more than 6 light switches in the common space... I still to this day can't tell you which switch went to which fixture/fan the like. This trip I met a lot of people and will quickly profile how they made my trip better... Identities sort of masked... to protect the innocent... Front desk: 1. JC: checked our family in. Most professional and kind, the night shift front desk guy... always willing to help when he could. Believe it or not, I call him my mystery (my wife has never met him) friend... He to this day is one of the few people who can consistently make me smile. And we've already been home for almost a week... 2. NF: like a second aunt to my children. made sure my kids were happy, the princess of service and smiles 3. Binz: the queen of all service. Cafe: background: I am a starbucks junkie and probably spend 200-300 a month in NJ on starbucks... Your next best options are the K-cups and use the in room Keurig coffee machine... SWEET... I mainly ordered hot chocolates for my kids, and one breakfast platter. All the smiles and momentary full stomach was deeply appreciated. Caveat emptor, (buyer beware) Their prices reflect the convenience... 1. Foster: one heck of a laugh and laugh maker... Possibly takes more water out of the pool, if he did a cannonball like me 2. All the folks were very accommodating. Not that you should do as I did, but I asked for cooking oil, and fried some frozen dumplings in olive oil... ROOM AMENITIES: Being able to cook in your room, have an awesome coffee maker and pack a bag of food is and always makes our family vacations bearable. We packed 16 individual servings of homemade short grain (sticky) rice. Without it, my wife goes into SRW, (sticky wife withdrawal). We stay in a cavernous 3 bedroom space, travelling with a family of 4 is underwhelming, in the past we have slept 9, (six adults and 3 infant children) in the same space. Concierge: 1. Nilda: she overheard a conversation I had at the cafe. I am a ketchup snob, and only enjoy Heinz ketchup. She saw me the next morning and brought me about 6 Heinz ketchup packets from home. AWESOME! 2. The other partners at the concierge desk always were helpful and kind. Efficient and smiling. Love em all! Engineering: 1. BC: the salt of the earth. Willing to give his shirt off his back to help his fellow man, or woman... Misc: 1. RA: in her dungeon, always pumping out the right paperwork to make our lives better and richer. Great smile and disposition. 2. Carlos: code name for the pool guy... his real name really starts with a K. Kept me in stiches, talking about all the the fun things that he's seen in the pool... secret secret... we all have some secrets. To Floridays and beyond... We spent 2 days at Universal, and 2 days at Disneyworld. The parks are about 10-20 minutes away. Very convenient. We spent 4 days at the pool and playing air hockey and other amusements in their arcade. The guests were AMAZING. Met a family from Norway poolside and my son was a kindred spirit to their son. A match made in heaven. I met a big guy from Uruguay, we had an instant bond as well. Such a family friendly and guest friendly haven... What a joy, and what a relief... Can you tell that I hate family vacations? The only reason is my children always expect more each and every trip... That is one thing that is hard to deliver... All the best to those at Floridays, and to you patient folks who have read this review for the past 123 seconds... Good luck to you and yours, and enjoy Floridays as we do and will do in the future... Final cost to me for this amazing experience: drum roll please... PRICELESS

Reviews.Title: “Location, Peaceful, Clean, Spacious, Courtious”
Reviews.Author: RKeeney
Reviews.Content: Home away from home. Very nice. Checked out - returned for another night. 3 adults stayed 3 days in 2 bedroom 2 full bath suite. Bldg E, 208, 511. Centrally located to everything on International Drive. Lovely area of spacious rolling green, -not crowded. Hotel has 6 buildings well spread apart, 6 floors each, all with balconies. Farther buildings have own pool and towels are supplied. Security patrolled, spacious grounds, peaceful atmosphere. Full kitchen with service and seating for 6. Full size refrigerator is pristine clean with ice maker. Washer/dryer, with soaps supplied for dishes and laundry. Keurig single cup coffee maker with 6 Green Mountain supplied, very good. (Pleased to find this as I always bring my coffee maker and supplies, so it saved time). Jacuzzi for 2 in very large master bath, with separate shower. ++ Clean! ++ (Could use new shower heads). Beds are OK. Extra pillows, blankets. Functional, not fancy, but nice and in very good condition. It was nice to find the DVD player is 'region free' -will play all CD's so, if you have the time, bring your movies! Cable is basic. Hotel has it's own store with basic supplies. Restaurant is pricey. Good menu, will deliver to your room. Publix grocery is nearby. Gym has cardio and machine weights. Any problems are quickly and professionally addressed; keys, phone, extras... and the front desk even helped with my computer problems. Check in/out is super fast and pleasant. The Point is the sister property with single room suites. I gladly recommend Floridays Resort! Pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Theme Park base for Families”
Reviews.Author: MikeInThornhill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort with my wife and 2.5 year old son for seven nights from Feb 25 to March 3. I found out about this hotel from it's #1 rating on TA, and booked a two bedroom suite, bundled with a mid-sized car from Dollar, via Expedia for $1007. I think the posted room rate was $149/night, so I feel like I got the car for free.  Floridays is centrally located for families visiting theme parks, about 25 mins from the airport on the south end of International Drive between Seaworld (15 mins) and Disney (25 mins). There are 3 tolls on the highway between the airport and the I-Drive exit, so you will want to have ~$5 USD cash for the drive. There is a plaza next to the resort with a Publix grocery store, Walgreens drug store, Subway, and Chinese take out (Citrus Gardens). Some reviews called it walking distance, and while I suppose you could walk it, I can't imagine doing that while carrying anything heavy in the heat. There is also a Benihana in front of the resort, and a 7-11 gas station across the street. The Premium Outlets are just a few hundred yards down I-Drive on Vineland and there is a McDonalds there. Lots of options for food nearby, including the Palm Cafe in the resort (which we didn't try). We checked in around 8pm and got room 107 on the ground floor of building C, which is a short walk from the family pool area between buildings A and B. There is lots of free parking around each building. There no porters to help with your bags, but our building had two large luggage carts stored near the elevators.  Our suite was great! It had a fully equipped kitchen with everything you might need to cook almost any meal, dining area with a table for 6, washer/dryer, and living room with a pull out couch and  flat screen TV. The small bedroom had two beds, and the master had a king, both had CRT TVs. The master has an on-suite bathroom with a jacuzzi tub that opens onto the bedroom so you can watch TV while you soak. There is also a safe in the master bath closet. We were a little worried about the noise from the hallway and elevator but didn't find it to be an issue as the master is located at the back of the suite, and my son sleeps like a rock under any circumstance. We also had a balcony with table and two chairs overlooking a lake with a fountain. All of the ground floor balconies are screened in, but higher floors are not. Some reviews complain about the sound of the fountain, but I actually appreciated the white noise.  Service at the resort was good. Check in was friendly and quick, and they called us an hour later to make sure we were happy with the room. The maid service was ok - they just make the beds, remove trash, and replace towels (there were always lots) - if you want additional cleaning you have to pay a fee. There are always lots of beach towels at the pool. A couple of pointers - if your party drinks a lot of coffee, bring kriug refills with you, as they only provided 7 for our entire stay. They also only provide two loads of dishwashing detergent and one load of laundry detergent, so if you expect to be doing more than that bring some. You could probably buy all of this stuff in the shop in the main building, but I bet it would be expensive. Wifi is free fast and reliable, but there is a resort fee of ~$12 per day that you pay on checkout. I called one night to report a couple of burnt lightbulbs and they were replaced the following day. The pool between buildings A and B is great for families. It has zero entry with water features for kids, along with a deeper section for lane swim, and a small hot tub. The pool is heated to ~83, so it's warm enough to swim on cool days and in the evenings it is open until 11pm. No Lifeguards. There were lots of lounge chairs available, and an arcade for rainy days off the pool area. There isn't a tonne of shade, so bring sunscreen, The music played in the pool area is lively, so the rooms facing the pool might be a little loud.  One misc note, I always find the water in the southern US has a smell to it, so I bought a lot of bottled water for drinking and making coffee etc.  Check out was painless, I didn't even have to return to the main building. I just called to confirm the charges and left the room keys in the room.  To sum it up, Floridays is a sure thing. Good location, great suite, efficient service, all the amenities you need, and the price is right. We would definitely return, and will be recommending Floridays to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Another Admirer”
Reviews.Author: Dofnay
Reviews.Content: This was rated #1 on tripadvisor and It is worth it. We stayed a week with 2 seniors, a mother and grandson and were comfortable in our 2 bedroom suite. The pools were great for our 6 year old and the staff were so good, especially the concierge desk. We didn't go to Disney this time, but the Hotel is close to everything. We were in Building C which we found very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Bestshopper
Reviews.Content: Staff was courteous and room was very clean. We stayed in a two bedroom suite. It was very spacious and had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “spacious but otherwise just average”
Reviews.Author: audeli
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a week in a 3br unit. it is a good size for 2 families (5 adults, 3 kids). the unit is not new, carpet is showing its age, there were a few holes (quarter-sized holes through to the base floor) not sure what happened. "full kitchen" is a joke, with the full sized fridge/freezer the only saving grace in my opinion. there were some cheap pots and pans and cooking utensils-they are more for show than for use (in terms of quality). there was not even a salt and pepper shaker. i think the setup is little better than your regular hotel due to the extra space, but you cannot really cook anything substantial here. if you just want to have a quick breakfast w cold milk and cereal in the mornings for the kids and coffee for the adults, it's fine. oh and the coffee they only give you 2 keurig single serve cup for starter-after that you are on your own. the washer/dryer comes in handy, although the washer is sooo tiny it fits only about 10 light pieces of clothing. i think the entire time we were there the washer was always running. the bedrooms are of good size. we used the hot tube/jacuzzi quite a bit after long days at the park it feels good, but also it's because besides the tub they only have shower stalls which is impossible to give toddlers a bath in (no removable showerheads). the building we're in (D) was very quiet as it is far from the main pool. We were never disturbed with any noise until the last 2 days from our upstair unit we heard some pounding noise early in the morning (8am-ish)-sounded like kids running around or pulling furniture. we loved the palm cafe, esp the bar. they make really nice cocktails there, and their food wasn't half bad either. my husband loved their chicken wings and margaritas. i had the mediterranean salad which was excellent. i have to say something about front desk staff now-before arriving i called to add our friends' names to the reservation so they can check in before we arrive. it took 3 tries to get this done. i was given the run-around the first two times, sending me to different people's voicemail to leave messages. nobody called back either time. third try i actually told the guy not to transfer me and to help me on the spot or else, which he did, right then and there. which made you wonder why the previous 2 people were not willing to help me if it was that simple. bottom line is if it's cheap enough for you to overlook some of the things i find lacking, then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Winning55
Reviews.Content: Just back after staying a week in Floridays. Fantastic hotel in great location. Westayed in a 2 bedroom apartment. It was spotless and was in great condition.and would strongly recommend. Special mention to Chris the duty manager. Very helpful,friendly and efficient. Thanks for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good place with good rooms”
Reviews.Author: dhnBrazil
Reviews.Content: Floridays resort have apartments with 2 and 3 rooms. We stayed in a 2 rooms that have a loot of space. The resort is near of all Orlando atractions. The consierge have tickets to the parks avoiding lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable, fun and clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Astrovan1999
Reviews.Content: Floriday's was exceptional in every angle. Not only was the room, super clean, it was roomier then initial thought it was. They take pride in making your stay special. The housekeepers always stocked the room with your requests. The pool/hot tub area was super clean and they were never low on towels. The furthest park away was only 7 miles!! Can't WAIT to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Aeroarrow
Reviews.Content: My family ( two adults, two teenagers) loved this hotel. It was quiet and clean. The pool area was well maintained and clean and warm with plenty of chairs and towels. There was lots of parking available when we went (Feb 2012) The staff was friendly and attentive. Rooms were well taken care of and kitchens were stocked well. We stayed in in the D Wing which was perfect for us. It was a short walk to the pool but that allowed us to stay away from the busier A and B wing. They would be fine as well if you had smaller kids but the walk was no big deal for us. My only minor complaint would be the beds could have been a little more comfortable but they were not bad.

Reviews.Title: “#1 for a reason”
Reviews.Author: 2banonymous1
Reviews.Content: We went on a trip to Orlando at the end of December 2011 to the beginning of January 2012. We spent half of our stay here and half of our stay in the Animal Kingdom Lodge in a safari room overlooking the safari. If we had it to do over again, we'd stay here the entire time. The rooms were very spacious and close to everything. We had a 2 bedroom suite. It had a king size master bedroom with a walk-in shower and a huge triangular-shaped jacuzzi tub. The other bedroom had two full size beds, and a full bathroom immediately adjacent to it. Yes, there are shuttles: one to Epcot, one to Universal and one to Sea World. But, you need to make a reservation the day before or you won't get on! We went to Universal and Disney, and it is only about 2 to 3 miles to either of these The price of the rooms here were 1/3 to 1/5 of what we paid to stay on the Disney property, and I think we had four times the space at Floridays that we had at the Animal Kingdom Lodge, even in the "deluxe" room. We felt compelled to stay on Disney property because everyone else said we had to to get the full experience. Don't listen to them. Stay here instead! The onsite restaurant isn't much to speak of. But, it has good coffee and pool-side drinks, and you can walk to the Bennihana's next door.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Megan53590
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel! We loved our stay. There is full-size kitchen-dishwasher, fridge, stove-oven, microwave, washer, dryer. Very clean. They provided a coffee pot when requested. Dish liquid, 2 dishwasher packets and one laundry detergent provided for a 5 day stay. Bring extra laundry detergent if you plan on doing more than 1 load.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for a great vacation.”
Reviews.Author: CanadaSunshine19
Reviews.Content: They are number one on trip advisor for many reasons and they want to continue to be number one. The food at the Palm resto was great,the staff was great,the room was great. It is a great place for a vacation,well situatued,well kept grounds and pool. Great for couples and families.room for up to six people per room at no extra charge. I do recommend this resort and thank all the great staff for making us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Second time was just as great as the first!”
Reviews.Author: Mark I
Reviews.Content: I love Floridays for our family of six! Last year we booked a three bedroom which was HUGE. This year, my 11 year old daughter slept on the fold out couch which she said was surprisingly comfortable and we all felt that the two bedroom had plenty of space! Very clean, beautiful landscaping, well maintained appliances truly make this home away from home...except this home is minutes away from all the Orlando amusement parks. A+

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay at a Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mvg608
Reviews.Content: I hope the Floridays keeps their rates reasonable. Because, if they do, there is no better place to stay in Orlando. Beautiful hotel, nice spacious room. Full kitchen, washer/dryer in room. Very good service. Needed service in room a couple times and help arrived in minutes. Everyone was nice and helped with a smile. The shuttle to the theme parks could have more trips per day. There are only 2 trips up and back. This is a small complaint. The pool area is wonderful. My family loved this hotel. Please do not change Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: BlueHenLaxAlum
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 day stay at Floridays with family which includes a 15 year old and 13 year old. The 2 room suite was ideal -especially the extra bathroom. We used the kitchen and ate several meals at "home" which added to the vacation. I would definitely recommend this property to anyone, I wish I had discovered it sooner since I have been to Orlando several times in the past 10 years. One word off topic - Universal is a 2 day park at best! Trust me, my wife and kids are theme park (roller coaster) junkies and this park was over and done with by lunchtime of day 2.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing location a short drive to Disney.”
Reviews.Author: chris b
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to escape the crowds at Disney at the end of the day, this is the place to stay. A short enough drive to the parks that you can come back relax in the pool and grab some "non-character" dinners and head back for the fireworks. The suite was the perfect size for our family of four to spread out. And the place was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Floridays for Swedish family”
Reviews.Author: Johan S
Reviews.Content: Great place; value for money, clean, helpful staff, large rooms, good location, and the kids loved the swimming pool!

Reviews.Title: “I think the condo owners or staff must be writing the reviews themselves”
Reviews.Author: OneColdCity
Reviews.Content: I think the condo owners and staff of this resort have figured out that if they write positive reviews (several every day!) we will read them and book into their hotel thinking that we are getting an amazing deal. At the end of your stay there is a reminder on your bill to keep them #1 on Trip Advisor. Read the positive reviews with that in mind: they may be advertisements. If you want to see what REAL travellers experienced, read the "Average" and "Poor" ratings. This service at this place was dreadful; the buildings new but are not as good as others in the neighbourhood that we have stayed in on past trips. I would have expected more than what we found for being #1 on Trip Advisor. Compared to the glowing stuff reported on TripAdvisor, I was horrified. We could have stayed at nicer resorts with more amenities and better service in the same area for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family!”
Reviews.Author: babaProvidence
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay & both trips were wonderful! This is a great family-friendly resort...rooms are good size & accommodates our family of 3 adults (grandma along) & 2 young kids (4 & 8) perfectly. The staff was warm & welcoming & rooms were clean. There's a full kitchen & Publix market just around the corner, so not every meal has to be eaten out...which we love & saves a bundle! The kids love the pool & the resort is centrally located to many attractions... Disney is only 10 min away! We've always rented a minivan so I have no opinion on the shuttle services to parks, but if you can swing a car rental we've always been happy we had one. It's fairly easy to get around, the front desk is happy to hand out maps as well as car rental agency. I highly recommend staying at the Floridays!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this property.”
Reviews.Author: Ron S
Reviews.Content: The personal and friendly service I received while attending a recent conference was exceptional. Everything was perfectly in order. The food, whether a meal or a light snack, was gormet quality. The hotel is connected to the very exciting Florida Mall. You won't want to miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Floridays! Our trip was a little unconventional - my immediate family (me, my husband, and our 2 girls), my mother, and my mother-in-law and father-in-law. It was great to have 3 separate bedrooms so we could all go to our rooms when we needed alone time. I looked at Disney properties and I was amazed that they didn't have anything near the size or price to accommodate our family. Everything here exceeded my expectations! My kids loved the pool and I loved the washer and dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit with Floridays. Still a great value”
Reviews.Author: Karen V
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable. Our bed was not comfortable and I think they will need to upgrade their beds in the near future. The in-suite laundry was very nice and the service from the cafe was a nice feature also. My only recommendation was to choose a room on anything other than the first floor. The traffic and noise made it difficult for us to sleep at times. Other than that, the room was quite clean and had everything we needed to enjoy our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Really happy, Tripadvisor does it again!”
Reviews.Author: SuzieSparkles
Reviews.Content: I have used TripAdvisor every time I have traveled and never been disappointed, this recommendation was no exception. Except for the taste of the water which one daughter did not mind, but myself, my husband and other daughter did not like, everything was great!! Highly recommend and will go again!!

Reviews.Title: “All you need for a Family holiday in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: beetleboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights during a family holiday to go to the parks. Excellent location, with Seaworld being momnets away and Universal and Orlando a short Drive. We were travelling a family with three young children, who enjoyed the pool on the few occassions we could use it. THe accomodation a 3 bedroom appartment, was spacious with a fully equiped kitchen and there is a small mall nearby with a larger Supermarket for all your grocery needs.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort so far”
Reviews.Author: firejoe1220
Reviews.Content: This is the best resort we have ever been to. The staff was excellent and the 3 bedroom suite was spectacular. The rooms were clean and spacious. If you are staying in Orlando, this is the place to hang your hat. We could have easily stayed here for an extended period of time. The price was unbelievable for what we received and comparing this facility to others we have stayed in around Florida, the Floridays Resort was hands down the best.

Reviews.Title: “There is no comparison!”
Reviews.Author: michelle33461
Reviews.Content: We went back to Orlando for the weekend and were very pleased that we got to stay at the floridays again. We have stayed there 4 seperate times and have tried other places before but nothing else compares. We will never stay anywhere else. Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, all the hype is 100% accurate”
Reviews.Author: Felipe A
Reviews.Content: WOW!! <--Those 3 letters perfectly describe Floridays Resort, from the second you come into the lobby, to the last goodbye. Seriously! Service is EVERYTHING in a hotel/resort, and Floridays definitely excels at it. Folks working there seem sincerely happy and are extremely helpful. Our first "shocker" was the young gentleman that helped us take our bags to the 2-bedroom suite we rented... it was past midnight, our kids were exhausted and crabby, and he was so nice and funny that by the time we got to the suite the kids were giggling! Then, when we offered him a tip, HE REFUSED IT (now, THAT is a first!) and stated that his reward was joking around with our kids ("Your kids made my day!") Yes, [sadly] shocking nowadays, but sincere and wonderfuly refreshing. The suite was GREAT! Tons of space, great beds, great--and lots of--pillows, TONS of towels of all sizes, a fully-stocked kitchen (including a Keurig coffee machine and several k-cups)... and the list goes on and on and on! We were planning to stay 1 night, and ended up staying 2 because we really wanted to spend an extra night in that suite (we had nothing planned for the next day). Something that worked really well for us was ordering breakfast to the room that 1st morning. They have a small, but well-appointed list of breakfast choices. The French toasts that the kids had were delicious, and the breakfast sandwiches that my wife and I had were freshly made and very satisfying. This got us on our way to Disney early and with a full belly! Highly recommended, and for about the same price of a breakfast elsewhere (but in your pajamas! :-) ). Also, the gentleman that brought us our food order was extremely polite and a true pleasure to talk to. To sum it all up: all the reviews and other people's positive comments are very accurate. We've decided that we'll be back, but next time for a few more days!! BTW: we stayed in building E, on the 6th floor, and had a nice view of the fields behind the hotel, with cattle roaming around (!!) It was quiet and we had lots of parking space because that is one of the last buildings in the resort (i.e., towards the back) I will most likely request the same building next time we are there. Also, there is a small pool right next to it (we didn't, however, have time to enjoy it this time around). As a side comment: I was in a "luxury hotel" (Sofitel) just a few months ago, for a whole week, and the service at Floridays is 100 times better. Quite a contrast, to be honest... I would pick Floridays over that so-called-luxury fiasco any day!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: GatorFamily4
Reviews.Content: Floridays is like a home away from home while on vacation. It is very clean, comfortable, and very friendly staff. It is so much better than a basic hotel room and the value is great.

Reviews.Title: “BEST ORLANDO RESORT IN EIGHT YEARS”
Reviews.Author: longwinter43
Reviews.Content: Our family quest to thaw from the harsh Alaskan winter was a complete success by staying at Floridays Resort in Orlando FL. Over the past eight years we have used various properties for vacations up to 15 days to include Shades of Green, Residence Inn, Raddison Resort and most recently Mike Ditka Runaway Beach Resort (don't go!). Although priced above each of these locations, Floridays is 10 times the value based on their outstanding accommodations and world class staff. The suites are fantastic, location is ideal and their personnel truly welcome each guest. Save the rest of your time by booking Floridays now!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay! Feb.13th-17th,2012”
Reviews.Author: lizter3
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in a two bedroom condo in building C (which overlooks a pond) for four days. The balcony has a table and two chairs, it's average size.The condo was private,clean,quiet and spacious. The beds were comfortable not the best but comfortable. Everything we needed including a dishwasher,ice dispenser in the freezer, and a washer and dryer.The front desk staff were probably the nicest and most professional I have ever met. There are two pools and both are very nice. The games room was a real plus for down time. The fitness room has everything you would need and more. One observation I had on the negative side was the staff at The Palm Cafe were unfriendly. They never spoke and I thought it a little tacky having a fairly large sized bowl for a tip jar when service was far from diserving one (just my opinion). Thanks Floriday's staff for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Chris O
Reviews.Content: Floridays allowed me to have a very relaxing staycation! The villa was very clean, stocked with all utensils and everything, and the bed was comfy! A very nice time all around. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Kate062
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in January, I booked because of reviews but would not stay again. The room was very spacious but very old and tired. When we arrived the room had a strong bleach/mould smell. The door was dented from being opened by a metal bar and some of the appliances didn't work. I had altered our booking via email before arrival but they had no record of this and I was treated like it was my mistake, (I should have bought emails with me). We ordered room service after arriving back from Disney, it took over an hour and kids were asleep by time it arrived. If you have a large family then you will have plenty of room and it will be a cheap stay. Overall I would say this is a budget hotel so try elsewhere if you prefer quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for various activities in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: MortenM
Reviews.Content: We visited Orlando for various theme parks with two teenagers. Nice place to stay - large apartment. There two pools at the resort - great for an hour relaxation after a long day at a theme park :-)

Reviews.Title: “Floridays suites”
Reviews.Author: drmom69
Reviews.Content: Very large, clean two bedroom suite w/ full kitchen, pots, pans, mixers, cutlery... Full size dinining table. Washer/dryer in room. Very neat and clean on arrival. Check in easy. Lighting in rooms not great. Starter supply of coffee and laundry detergent given. Had to really argue w/ front desk about getting additional coffee w/o charge. Otherwise, each time we called for a problem in the suite (ie lightbulb burned out) front desk called back to ensure it was done in timely fashion. Pool fun, had activities for kids Saturday morning. Lots of smokers at pool, kind of annoying.

Reviews.Title: “We would absolutely recommend staying here!!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie W
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks in a 2 bedroom apartment slightly away from the pool area. My husband and I plus 2 teenagers. The room was amazing, so much room for us all, clean and tidy with everything you could possibly need. We hired a car for 4 days but found the rest of the time it was handy to all the theme parks that we wanted to visit, using the shuttle to get there and back. Staff were always friendly and helpful. For those that don't know Florida during the winter, we found the weather was fantastic in this area for us as 25C degrees is similar to our summer in New Zealand. It only rained one morning (late January/early Feb). Lazing around the pool was truly a sublime experience with the cafe handy and great music to add to the ambience. One thing I would suggest... if you wish to have a quiet stay, choose an apartment not overlooking the pool area, as we did. The music was great but not everyones choice. Jackie Waters New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Great Space Near All the Attractions!”
Reviews.Author: Tturner
Reviews.Content: I was in Orlando for a real estate conference and the company booked this condo for us. It was a 3-bedroom with a living & dining room + full kitchen and washer & dryer. The condo was very attractive and spacious. It had a top notch pool area and a restaurant on site. There is a trolley that comes by every 20 minutes that you can ride to any of the attractions. It's very inexpensive - $1.25 per ride or they have multi-day passes you can buy and special rates for kids. This is a great place for families vacationing and for business people attending conventions. They also offer free Wi-Fi, which was a huge plus!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ReadytoTravel2012
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed every aspect of our stay at Floridays! We chose this resort soley on Tripadvisor's #1 rating and we were not disappointed! Floridays is #1 because they earn it, everyday! Wow, customer service, they way it should be. The grounds were immaculate, the 2-room suite was very spacious, comfortable, nicely furnished and clean. The pool, incredible - the hot tub, suberb! We can't wait for our next trip - we will definately be staying here again. The location was close to everything - we did alot of exploring Orlando while there. The area was very nice - felt very safe at all times. Grocery store conveniently located close by, box rental dvd close by - DVD player in the room, too. Only one item to note - in earlier TripAdvisor postings a $5 daily drink was mentioned - that is no longer the case, Margaritas were $7.50 - good but small.- would have really enjoyed $5 drinks like that! WiFi was provided and appreciated. . . Overall, absolutely no regrets - can't wait to go back -

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: Just spent a nice weekend in Orlando at Floridays. Don't be turned off by the reasonable rates. I usually stay at the nicest place I can find and this served our needs for a lot less $$. Six of us in a 3 bedroom, we didn't feel cramped. Staff is great and the poolside bar is a good place to relax even in the middle of February.The only fault I could find was the mattresses in the room we had could use an update. Stay in Bldg A if you want to be close to the pool and cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbcapecod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays as a part of the national annual meeting of our breed club for the Coton de Tulear dog breed. Our Club negotiated a great price, and the hotel exceeded all expecations. Huge two BR suite (we only used the master). Fully equipped kitchen. Washer, dryer. Beautiful dining area, large sitting room, a screened Florida room. Master bath very large. Everything very clean. Excellent service. It was a bit too cool to use the lagoon like pool, but the poolside bar and grill was welcoming and had good fare. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Panicbuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here sept 2011 and can't say enough great things about the place From the moment we arrived we was treated like proper paying customers with care The rooms / condo's were really big and so clean all fitted kitchen also washer and tumble so can clean own clothes Some evening spent by the pool bar and again felt comfortable great service and even met 2 cops We did email before we arrived to request rooms in which they did so again top hotel Must make a mention for Lisa Marie on front desk she was so helpful along with other team members from phoning ahead to booking restaurants and directions to and from places Would deff return to this hotel without a doubt next time in Orlando as price reflects this hotel you get what you pay for Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Best value in 40 years of vacations”
Reviews.Author: FRO_12
Reviews.Content: Very nice property, huge suites, big bedrooms, well appointed amenities. Cafe/mini store is good quality. Very nice pool. Access is easy to all parks via International Drive and Rte. 4. Helpful staff. The price / quality ratio can not be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “A very lovely place”
Reviews.Author: CeceMarie
Reviews.Content: As you can see from other reviews this is a very nice place. The rooms are actually typical vacation-type condos: well appointed, w/ cleaning basics such as dish cleaning supplies, nice b.room items (incl 2 oz. sizes of conditioner, bath gel, shampoo, lotion). Nice staff, clean, nice pool. Small snack-bar type rest. on site. Since this place seems interested in details, I'd offer the following suggestions: In master bath shower, there is only a soap dish, no place for shampoo and conditioner. I can only drink de-caf, and I drink tea, but the complementary coffee in the room was caffeinated, and when I asked, was told this was what was available. So tea drinkers, bring your own! We were offered service the first day, at 4:45 p.m. By that time we were tired and if felt odd to have someone making our beds while we were in our rooms. I know this is a big place, but from our experiences, Floridays may be understaffed in this regard (we were here on a fairly quite time of the year). Finally, the resort fee seems disingenuous: The room prices are very good, but a fee of this type for 2 pools (1 small and not heated) is a bit silly. There is a game room for the kids, but one has to pay to use the arcade type games. That's as far as the 'resort' aspect of Floridays goes. I'd respectfully suggest the management simply raises the room rates a bit, and cut this rate. It seems that some folks don't know about this rate, and get upset about it...and I can see why.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Floridays because we were so impressed by last years stay, the house cleaning left a little to be desired this time but overall a great place at a great location for our family of five.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey Y
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our Orlando stay and wanted to ensure we wrote about this awesome hotel. From check-in, to check-out, the staff and stay was over and above. We used the concierge service and was really impressed with the friendliness and help we received during our visit. The shuttle to and from Disney was wonderful and the tips for travel to Seaworld on the public transit was great. The suite was spacious and clean for our party of 8 and any request we had was granted quickly and efficiently. The only complaint we have is of the Cafe experience we had for dinner on Monday night. Granted, it was the first day of their new menu, but the food was satisfactory and the time it took to get our order well-exceeded 45 minutes. The cafe itself was not busy and there appeared to be few staff working that evening. Otherwise, a wonderful experience and will absolutely stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Way too nice”
Reviews.Author: MikeTA
Reviews.Content: At the time of my search for a hotel in Orlando, this hotel was ranked #1 out of 340+ Orlando hotels. I can certainly see why. The rooms look brand new, and are bigger and nicer than my own home. Our two-bedroom, two-bath suite had a full kitchen with an island, a glass dining room table, a nice living room with an HD TV, additional TVs in the twin and master bedrooms, and a master bathroom with a separate shower and jacuzzi tub. The kitchen/dining room had everything you would need to fix a home-cooked meal, so this would make an ideal spot for someone looking to pick up some groceries to save a bit of money while on vacation. The service was extremely friendly and helpful, and their pool cafe had some good food and snacks. The location was great as it is right on the shuttle stop and plenty close to Disney, though it wasn't within walking distance from much. On top of this, the price was outstanding. I can only guess that this hotel is starting off with some low prices while they complete their renovations (for example, their intended main entrance is just a dirt path at this point, which needs to be excavated and paved)... but they certainly are getting the word out. Absolutely #1 in Orlando for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: thegasgod_slcut
Reviews.Content: Just arrived today and was a little apprehensive of what it would actually look like when we arrived. It looks just like the pictures show. Very clean, Mediterranean feel. Friendly staff, grounds and pool clean and beautifully landscaped. Rooms are a little tight, but still quite nice. Noise has not been an issue, and there are a lot of children here. I would highly recommend this resort for families you are very close to all parks and the pool set up is great!. Very reasonable price. We paid $130 per night for a 2 bedroom condo. One king and two doubles, 2 bath. Washer and dryer, nice little patio. Really a great place. I'm sure we will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort at Floridays!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaReid
Reviews.Content: Before we left for our trip to Orlando I looked at photos of the resort and I was impressed. I was more impressed with the fact that Floridays was just as good, if not better in person! We had an amazing overall experience at Floridays Resort! There were 6 of us on a four day trip to Florida. I was hoping to stay at the resort for much longer but we will go back next time we’re in Orlando! Floridays Resort had so much to offer from the great eye catching building and rooms, the friendly staff and the variety of amenities from a huge pool(s)/hot tub, fitness center, game room, restaurant/bar and more all for an incredible value! Perfect for couples, families, friends, you name it! And great for a long or short stay; business or pleasure. With the convenient location and onsite shuttle we were able to attend a Wedding and see many of the attractions nearby: Sea world, Universal, Disney, City Walk etc. It’s also very close to shopping, a wide variety of dining and nightlife. We stayed in a spacious 3 bedroom 2 bath, (both baths were large & the master had a Jacuzzi tub and separate shower) with full kitchen and large balcony. Our condo had modern finishes and was equip with washer/dryer, dishes, silverware, coffee maker, detergent etc. The rooms were very clean, comfortable, and serviced by a friendly staff daily. To sum it Floridays was beautiful, fun, convenient, relaxing and a great price! Nothing else compares. We will definitely go back to this resort our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mophair627
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write a review for this great hotel. We stayed there in August 2011. We booked it because of Trip Advisors #1 rating. They definately deserved it. When we arrived we were amazed at the spaciousness. For a family of 5 we had more than enough room. 2 bedrooms, two bathrooms, the master with a jaccuzzi, pull out couch, a large full kitchen with all the amenities, and a washer/dryer. The room was very clean and temperature was comfortable. Plenty of closet and drawer space. We enjoyed the main pool with the different sprinklers. Even my 3 sons, the oldest 12, enjoyed the pool which was very clean. I also enjoyed the full bar next to the pool. The staff was very friendly and helpful and check in was a breeze. The cafe had a nice selection of resonably priced food. The hotel was centrally located to all attractions, plenty of shopping, supermarket and drug store around the block. We would definately stay here again. And the best thing the price was amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent overall experience”
Reviews.Author: Scianoir
Reviews.Content: Booked in here as part of a last minute vacation after researching it on Tripadvisor and noting it's high rating. In order to keep this review brief, all I will say is that the high rating of this condo-hotel is thoroughly deserved. The whole experience from checkin to checkout and everything in between was superb. All the staff members that I dealt with were clearly keen to be helpful and to do their bit to maintain the reputation of this resort. Hopefully the high standard that this resort achieves for a reasonable price will be maintained.

Reviews.Title: “The staff were very professional and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Mandy1611
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days in a three bedroom apartment with our three children. We found the service from the staff very professional and helpful.....nothing was too much trouble. With daily free shuttles to the Disneyworld and Universal Studios getting around was easy! The apartments were roomy and well equipped with a full kitchen and laundry. The rooms were serviced daily and the tariffs we very reasonable. Finally, the pool area was fantastic!!! The kids loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Lill1271
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice resort. Our unit block was far from reception & the pool & we actually got in the car & drove to the pool, so if you don't have a car make sure you request the block close to these. This would be a very long walk in summer. Disappointed with the cleaning services. They did not provide a toilet brush & our toilet was not cleaned for our entire 8 day stay. We also accidentally left the stove top on in the morning, came home at about 8pm & it was still on. This goes to show the lack of attention paid by the cleaners. I also called & asked for a tea towel to dry the dishes & was told they provide paper towels only so we used a hand towel to dry dishes. We would still stay there again as it was close to everything & the bedding was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation and convenient to all Theme Parks”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Floridays for 8 Days during our Trip to Orlando. We didn't utilise the facilities of the resort except for a quick swim and spa one late afternoon. We had our own vehicle and did all the Theme Parks. Parking was a breeze and plentiful and location to Theme parks was great.
