The reason for my stay was that we were there to prepare our new villa for the rental market, the rest of my family were arriving on our 8th night in Florida and were hoping that the villa would be ready for them to use but alas the beds were not delivered on time so I asked if another 3 people could stay the night in our suite and again was told no problem (and amazingly no charge). We had a wonderful stay in a very clean and spacious suite. I would highly recommend staying at this resort. Our only problem was as other guests have mentioned, the new Keurig coffee makers. I phoned the front desk and asked for a conventional coffee maker and they brought one to the room after about 10 minutes, so problem solved.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort... but staff needs to take care of smell by the elavators”
Reviews.Author: BBHayden
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed for 5 nights over Thanksgiving weekend. The staff was great and extremely courteous. The rooms were immaculate. The resort is conveniently located to Disney as well as the airport. The only compaint we had was that every time we took the elavator to our rooms we got a whiff of trash odor. Not good. The trash room is located right next to the elevator. We addressed this with the staff so hopefully others do not have to experience this. You would think they could get their hands around the issues. Overall a good experience once we got past the elavator rides..

Reviews.Title: “Just Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Easson B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were lucky enough to take our three children aged 16, 13, and 8 to Walt Disney World. We had travelled from New York across to Chicago down to New Orleans and then across to Orlando. We pre-booked and didnt know what to expect other than from previous reviews. What can I say when I walked in the room it was fantastic, full king bed for wife and I, ensuite with spa, full kitchen, two double beds in kids rooms and awesome views. The service desk was excellent and helpful, the amenities brilliant from the pool to the bar loved it all. Being from Australia some found it unusual that we were swimming in the pool when it was raining but loved it. Close to all shops and Disney World with free shuttle loved staying there and would do it again anytime. Hope the Ozzie dollar keeps above parity.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: ProfEW
Reviews.Content: Floridays Resort Orlando was an excellent choice for my stay of 8 days. It was located only a couple of miles away from the Premium outlets at Vineland Avenue and only about 10 min to 20 min from all the different theme parks (Disney, Universal and Seaworld). It is also located about 20 minutes away from the Airport. There is also a supermarket just next to the hotel on Vineland Avenue which made things so convenient for us. We were also very pleased with our 2-bedroom apartment which came with everything we needed like a full kitchen, washing machine and dryer, etc... The hotel also provided a free shuttle service to and from the major theme parks. The service level provided by the front desk and concierge was excellent and made our stay there that much more enjoyable. We did not use the pools and other facilities much (as we visited 7 theme parks during our stay) so I can't comment on it. There is a daily resort fee which covered parking, shuttle service and the use of the resort facilities (this is a common feature of most hotels around this area so don't be suprised). Oh yes, Wifi is also included! You will not regret staying at Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice accomodations, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: T1T2
Reviews.Content: Very nice 2 bedroom-2 bath accomodations. The staff was very accomodating and helpful. Main pool area was nice. Very convenient to use the trolley for other sites on international drive. Would definitely come back but probably not stay on the first floor (kind of loud and sidewalk runs along the patios, better privacy on 2nd floor or higher). Grabbed breakfast from the cafe, and had dinner/drinks by the pool one night and thought it was pretty good. If taking the trolley- kids 12 and under are free- resort sells all day ride passes for $4.00 which is also convenient. Trolley service does go to Sea World and Discovery Cove is just across the street too so saves on parking and driving too.

Reviews.Title: “December stay for AAU”
Reviews.Author: LisaMSantaMonica
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our room when we checked in. We were tired after traveling and it was so nice to have kitchen stocked with supplies for cooking or eating so we did not have to go out if we did not feel like getting dressed up. The market is just around the corner, which makes it very convenient. Also pizza place, subway, etc.... The lobby was beautiful, all decorated for Christmas. The master bathroom is very large with a jacuzzi tub and a shower. We were very happy with the way the unit looked and was very comfy after a long flight. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful too. Only thing I did not like is the Keurig coffee makers. I would prefer an old fashion coffee maker. And there were no shower caps in the bathroom, but I am sure the front desk would have them. All in all it was a beautiful resort. This resort is close to all the amusement parks and shopping and restaurants. We would definitely stay there again, if we go back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Friends home away from home”
Reviews.Author: gallwp
Reviews.Content: what a vacation value in Orlando. Our best friends, my husband and I shared a 2 bedroom unit with full kitchen,dining room, 2 full baths in unit A. We were able to have a leisure breakfast then catch the hotel's shuttle service to both Disney and Universal Studios. Located on the I-Ride system we were able to enjoy all the entertainment value offered on International Dr. We are seniors so it only cost a quarter per ride. No getting lost or driving in a strang city. Much less expensive than renting a car and paying for parking. Our unit was well taken care of and the staff was outstanding answering our questions and taking care of everything we asked with a plesant smile. We will return again.

Reviews.Title: “disney vacation family of four”
Reviews.Author: lshboston
Reviews.Content: we just checked in yesterday(dec3rd). our flight landed an hour early so I called and they allowed us an early check in. The women who checked us in was very pleasant and helpful. the lobby was decorated beautifully for Christmas. my husband and kids are at the pool now it looks just like the pictures. so far so good. If we can get the same rate we are thinking of extending our trip one day. we are in building b the location is perfect for us. I will right another review at the end of my stay if I have any updates.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: OU8MINE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays for 1 week in mid October in a 2 Bdrm unit in building C. I booked through AAA and could not beat the price at Floridays. The units at Floridays are a great value considering what others charge per night for similiar units. Our unit was clean with a great view of the lake and pool and plenty spacious for our family of 4. The "refresh" housekeeping was plenty adequate for us and I would think would be more than enough for most. We did cook in our unit and found plenty of utensils, pans etc. to get the job done, however, the pans are showing some wear. Our non-stick pan was pretty rough to the point my wife would not use it, so I called and within 10 mins someone was at the door with a pan - great customer service. Also, the handles on some of the pots were loose, so I had to use a butter knife to tighten the screws - no big deal, but I shouldn't have to do it, and for management, this could be a huge liability issue for you if someone dumps a pot of boiling water on themselves due to a loose handle. My only other issue was the coffee maker. They have switched over to single cup Keurig coffee makers which probably seemed like a good idea in theory, but if you have a couple of coffee drinkers in your group it is painful. Each cup takes 3 mins to brew and when you are waiting for that first cup and have to stand in line, that can seem like forever. If you can stand the wait, go next door to Publix and buy a box of K-cups for your stay. We brought coffee and filters from home and were suprised by the single cup maker, but once again I called, and within 10 mins someone was at the door with a regular 12 cup coffee maker - again great customer service. It sounded like they were going to keep a stash of the old style coffee makers around for requests like mine. That's it for my negatives and they are really minor - overall we could not have been happier with our unit. The location is also wonderful, you are really close to everything. We had a rental car, but it looked like you can get around without via the trolley and resort shuttle service. Publix grocery and the outlet mall are around the corner as well as a few places to eat - also the outlet mall has a huge food court with a variety of options. Floridays was exactly what I was expecting, a nice property, well located with clean, modern condos and good customer service at a reasonable price. I have stayed on the Disney Resort and you get so much more for your money here. I would stay here again and not hesitate to recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Jeff8897
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights over the Thanksgiving holiday at Floridays and had a great time. The resort's location is superb; within easy driving distance to Walt Disney World, Sea World and the Universal Orlando theme parks. A great supermarket and loads of shopping and dining opportunities are even closer. Check-in was quick and efficient, and our two-bedroom unit was clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the larger pool area and left for home with no complaints. If you're planning an Orlando theme-park vacation, take a look at Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could have been better...”
Reviews.Author: perfectvue
Reviews.Content: I was on a family vacation here this past Thanksgiving week. It was smaller than what I had envisioned. But it was clean so no big deal. We were placed in the F building which was the furthest from the main entrance. Which was fine. We were close to the little pool and it was never crowded there. The main pool was a 15 minute walk away and was very festive with music playing and a little more crowded. The only room service you got was that they emptied the trash and replaced old towels daily. The employees were nice and pleasant. But I only had one issue with this place. They locked the thermostat to 72-76 degree F only, If you wanted it hotter or colder you would have to call them every time because their system won't let you change the thermostat within that 5 degree range. After calling them twice to change the temperature we just bundle up in the morning til it got warmer during the evening, Even when it was set at 76 degree it still didn't feel like 76 degree inside the room unless it was warmer during the day. Very inconvenient. I don't recommend staying here on colder days especially if you don't want to wait on maintenance. I've stayed at many other resort condos in Orlando and this has never been an issue. Very cheap on the hotel part. So if this is an issue for you don't stay here because there are many more option in Orlando. Overall it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for park hopping”
Reviews.Author: sandiPoconos
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for all of your Orlando adventures. Great pool and the turkey dinner in room was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not so good if you need coffee in the morning”
Reviews.Author: sammie5698
Reviews.Content: Everything said on Trip Advisor is spot on. This should be the number 1 ranked hotel in the area. We just returned for a four night stay in a three bedroom suite. The hotel was inexpensive for what we stayed in, crystal clean, very convenient and easy to get to the parks, grounds were fabulous, staff was amazing and helpful and things couldn't have been better except for the Kitchen. While the kitchen was fully set up for cooking simple meals the hotel provided a Keurig coffee pot and service. This is a coffee pot that you make one cup at a time in using a prepackaged coffee packet. The hotel provided the first two packets free ( ie two free cups of coffee for 8 adults) and after that, you had to go to the Marketplace on site and buy single 1 cup packs for $1.65 apiece. Or you could buy made starbucks coffee at the Marketplace which we did after day one since we had four plus coffee drinkers in the group. Given a choice since we were eating breakfast in to save money, a regular coffee pot would have been preferred so that we could have gone and bought regular ground coffee at the close by Publix and made a pot every morning. I do not know if this was the situation in every room, but in a three bedroom suite that sleeps 8 adults, two cups of "free" coffee did not go very far and while we do like starbucks coffee, all things considered would have preferred to have an option for brewing our own to save some $$$$. That said, I cannot say enough about this place. Would definately go back and recommend to family groups but might tote my own coffee brewer next time. Place also had a small washer/dryer- major plus!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a vacation in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Jorgen036
Reviews.Content: We, a retired couple, staid for eight nights and it were a very pleasant stay. The suite was spacious, clean and well maintained. It is a first class facility with very friendly and helpful staff. The resort has a well-equipped fitness centre. The main pool area has fountains as a playground for kids but the fountains give a nice atmosphere to the area. We will stay there next time we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, Didn't love it”
Reviews.Author: Asusnyder
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to write a less than glowing review, but I also appreciate honest reviews so I have to be completely honest. My family didn't love it. To be fair, we spent our first few nights at a brand new resort...Wyndham Grand Bonnet Creek, so the bar was set plenty high. We wanted to give Floridays a try as well because of the Trip Advisor ratings and because our famly of 6 would be better able to spread out for a few days. We were disappointed. The room just didn't seem clean. The carpet seemed dirty and it's probably do for a refurbish. I found hairballs behind doors in a couple places. If we were staying there longer I probably would have put the cleaning closet to use and given it an overhaul myself. I also found my allergies acting up by the second day, probably due to it being a pet-friendly property. I should have asked for a room where pets had not been allowed as many hotels do have some rooms set apart, so that is my own fault. On the positive side, we loved the washer and dryer in the room. The staff was also friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend again and again,close to it all in orlando”
Reviews.Author: lalaland954
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay.family friendly acommendations,and close enough to all parks,clean,and friendly staff.affordable for a big family.Sent many friends and family to resort and all said same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: slpmom07
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Floridays. Its a very nice place, great price, well located, nice amenities, clean and updated. Nice pool - kids were able to swim because it is heated to 83 degrees. I did not mind that there is only light housekeeping because I don't like people in my room while I am there. There is a washer and dryer so if you are determined to have fresh towels everyday you could always throw them in the machine. But really, do you wash your towels everyday at home? The only thing I didn't like was that the suite is long and narrow so there is not a ton of room around the dining table and in the living room. I have stayed in other 2 bedroom condos that have more sq footage or a different layout that is a bit more spacious. Also, this is hard to describe but to get to your room you walk along an outdoor walkway - you are not walking down an indoor hall the way you would in a hotel - this is not a problem but one of the bedroom's windows is right on the outdoor hall so you hear people walking right by your bedroom window. It was not a big deal for us because it was pretty quiet when we were there but some people may not like this. The staff at Floridays are top notch - very friendly and helpful. Took the shuttle service to Disney one day when hubby went golfing - it is a good service, takes 10 mins to get to Epcot but from there you have to take a monorail to Disney transport hub and then another monorail or Ferry to Magic Kingdom. Not doing that again if I can avoid it. Lots of people, lots of waiting (60 mins from hotel to MK) for something that would have taken me 20 mins to the gate by car. Bring your own pool towels, some Keurig coffee packets (they provide a few but you can buy at Publix around the corner if you don't bring extra and don't want to spend a lot at the convenience store onsite) and if you have little kids, plastic cups/bowls or do paper, cause the dishes are the real thing.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: Gqjanitorial
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, functional and convenient. The Floridays is our family's choice for resort living while in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location if visiting both Disney and Universal”
Reviews.Author: Bobalicia
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, and perfect if you need 3 rooms and a full kitchen

Reviews.Title: “Animals allowed in room without disclosure caused my pregnant wife to become sick.”
Reviews.Author: Jschwarb
Reviews.Content: Very important that guests know that you allow animals in room. By the second day we started to see the pattern of allergies on my pregnant wife, kids and myself. The couch cut my right heel due to a protruding staple on lower edge. The condo is very pretty so a real shame about allowing non-disclosure of pets to ruin our stay and overall experience. In the old days requesting a non-smoking room was important, now it appears animals must be asked about. My wife is still sick and has had to go on her nebulizer. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: phinz
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Floridays. This time we booked a package through Orbitz and the rate we got for a two bedroom was less than some of the hotel rooms in Orlando. Even though it was just the two of us, we enjoyed all the room of the two bedroom, two bath. We requested the same room we had when we stayed there in June, never dreamed they would really try to honor that request since I was so specific. Sure enough they were working to get the room next door with the same view. They just had us wait to make sure it had been cleaned satisfactorily--about 5 minutes. On Thanksgiving day we had a leak under the kitchen sink which was running out in the floor. We called and the leak was fixed immediately. They were friendly about running our boarding passes for us, which saves lots of time at the airport. The room was clean and furnished nicely. The grounds are very nice--maybe not quite as nice as some of the timeshares, but for the service and excellent rates, who cares. It is in an excellent location. Hope to return in June with our extended family.

Reviews.Title: “Super family friendly resort”
Reviews.Author: Hollyvla
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised to find such a reasonably priced resort in a great location with all of the comforts of home. It is perfect for families who need kitchens and laundry facilities. The pool was outstanding for kids and never overcrowded. We were there for Thanksgiving and could tell they were pretty busy, but parking was never hard. The food at the cafe was reasonably priced and delicious, but pretty simple. Good for a quick meal or eating by the pool. My only complaint would be the lack of enough light in our unit. This usually doesn't bother me, but it was very noticeable here. Even with all the lights on, it was hard to see in the master bath. Otherwise, it was a great experience, and we would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: JelloSalad
Reviews.Content: My wife mistakenly booked our visit through TripAdvisor, which actually meant she used Expedia. The AAA price was significantly lower. Floridays staff was extraordinary in helping us to cancel the Expedia reservation and rebook directly with AAA, even though it meant they were making less money. The suites are excellent and spacious (full kitchen, washer/dryer), and everyone was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service and location”
Reviews.Author: Theresa0004
Reviews.Content: When planning a vacation to this area, how does one go about choosing? So many options. For our family, we wanted it all.... price, location and ammenities. Floridays Resort delivered on the promise. This is the place to stay if you want convenience and value. We won't stay anywhere else when traveling to the Orlando/LBV area. We were so impressed with how large the units were and LOVED the washer/dryer. With many airlines charging for bags, we were able to pack light and bring carry-ons, saving us about $200. We frequented the local grocery store, Publix, located just around the corner from the resort. Internet worked great. The daily "refresh" was perfectly suitable for our needs. A vacuum is located in your unit which is very convenient. Loved the balcony. This place hit the mark and we're so glad we found this gem and can't wait to return......

Reviews.Title: “check the details before you book....”
Reviews.Author: Irish_JC
Reviews.Content: I booked this based on 2 main things - 1. it's no.1 position on tripadvisor 2.price having looked at the reviews it seemed like a solid choice although the number of glowing reviews from people who had only submitted one review made me a little weary anyway,i'll go from the start of the trip.. at the moment there's a temporary entrance - no big deal although it's easy to miss at night check in staff extremely friendly and helpful i had written a request when booking to have a crib in the room. when we got there it wasnt there so obviously personal requests written are not actually read. a call to front desk sorted it and a friendly guy had one up to us in minutes. i travelled with wife and baby so another factor in choosing floridays was for the apartment and facilities that go with that. the apt is very well equipped. cooker,microwave,dvd,tv(x3),washer/dryer,dishwasher one thing i found a little disturbing was the clientele we witnessed first couple of days. i expected a "family" vibe but when checking in there were some rather loud groups of guys on some balconies drinking,playing music etc... they're on hols,its no crime - but just not what i expected and then when walking into our building the next morning there were 3 or 4 people walking out with beers and rather loud foul language... doesnt bother me too much, but around kids it isnt nice and again,not what i expected. location is good in that it's on the disney end of i-drive,close to a good supermarket. downside is you've to drive 10/15mins up i drive to main food,shops it could be a little out of the way for someone without a car next problem with the apt was the first morning we woke up we went in for a shower and noticed the floor move a little. yes - the dreaded COCKROACHES ! 2 of them that seemed the size of mice.. rather than call reception, i visited them about this. person i spoke to apologised and said they would have it checked out. i never heard about it again no assurance,no confirmation they checked,no discount,no offers. this left a nasty taste in the mouth for the week. it also made me actually check carpet etc- the place could do with a makeover. carpets are very grubby at the edges the other big issue I have with the place is the sound proofing. or lack thereof. you'll hear people walking outside,cars parking and people walking in apt above you. on the plus side,tv is nice...apts are spacious with adequate furniture and 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms. price was quite cheap comparatively so maybe i shouldnt be so critical. but next time I think i'd aim for HGV. looked a LOT nicer car parking is fine. pool area looked great although i didnt use it. so overall kinda nice,very friendly staff,good facilities... but let down by other factors. and no WAY this is no.1 place in orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bang For The Buck”
Reviews.Author: mmell01
Reviews.Content: So, this isn't Vegas Or Walt Disney Resorts but it's above average and very good if you have the need for a suite. We have 5 teens and needed 3 rooms plus the cot. The fridge and stove allowed us to avoid some of the painfully overpriced Orlando meals and we are not just talking about eating on Disney property either. Everyone is in on the soak-the-tourist and many don't expect you will be coming back twice so heads up on the expectation of quality. So a couple of elements on the stove didn't work, the AC didn't get pushed all that strongly to the front bedroom, the TV connection fell off but I was able to put it back again after a few minutes, and they want to charge you for extra dishwasher soap and coffee. Very small things if you consider it was essentially a nice, clean, room if not the spectacular palace from the photo shots, and where else can you stay next door to Disney for a week, seven adults, $1200 ? This is by far the best bange for the dollar I could find and if you need the space and to save money feeding a large quantity of hungry teens this place is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for families”
Reviews.Author: Teachermind
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience, nice clean spacious rooms. Kitchen had everything we needed. Kids had fun in their own room and enjoyed the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great staff, wonderful chef.”
Reviews.Author: Randyhcc
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Floridays with my family. They were impressed by the service, accommation, and staff. Palm cafe provided delicious inexpensive meals, that were delivered on time. I was impressed by the quality and quantity of the meal.

Reviews.Title: “5 star value at a 4 star facility”
Reviews.Author: adw96740
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Outstanding value.  Outstanding customer service at the front desk. Great pool. Great sandwich shop. Spacious and comfortable rooms. Cons:  Housekeeping service was minimal at best and no cleaning supplies in the rooms to even do light wipe downs and clean ups yourself.   Housekeeping frequently left carts blocking walk ways. Late night noise from parking lot effected sleep (on 2nd floor) so would request high floor next time if on parking sides of buildings. Overall: 5 star value at a 4 star facility

Reviews.Title: “Nice place; doesn't deserve the #1 rating”
Reviews.Author: bobert24
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty nice place, but it's in no way deserving of the "#1 hotel in Orlando" rating it gets here on tripadvisor. The rooms are nice - probably 3-star rooms with 4-star decor. We had a 3-bedroom condo, and it slept 6 comfortably. It had a full kitchen, which was nice - the full-sized fridge gave us plenty of room to keep drinks and leftovers cold, while the oven and microwave were great for reheating. The bathrooms were confusing, though - the master bathroom, accessible only through the master bedroom, had 2 sinks, 1 for each person that room could hold. The other bathroom, which was between the 2 other bedrooms, had 1 sink for the (up to) 8 people that those rooms could hold. Both bathrooms were one big room - the toilet, shower, and sink were all in the same place, with no way to separate them. If one person is using the bathroom, it's pretty much useless for anyone else. The master bathroom also had plenty of counter space, but the other one barely had enough to hold a few cups and a bar of soap - hope you weren't planning to put any toiletries in there. Add in the complete and total lack of towel racks/shelves/anything, and you'll end up keeping your clean towels on the floor. Full disclosure - they gave us a handicapped room, so maybe they just felt that handicapped people don't deserve reasonable bathroom design. The pools were nice, as were the hot tubs. We went in October, so they weren't very crowded, but I can imagine that they would be in the summer (honestly, what in Orlando isn't?). The complex is huge, so don't expect them to be right next to your building, but the walk's not bad. The location is good - Disney World is a few minutes away, and Universal is ~15. There's a decent selection of restaurants ~10 minutes away - closer would be good, but I can see how they would have had trouble getting a plot of land this size closer to the restaurants, They do have free scheduled transportation to and from the parks every day. I don't think reservations are absolutely required, but I would certainly recommend them. You can get the times from the front desk, or they may have them hidden somewhere on their website. The transportation was good, but run by a 3rd party. This is great, because there will always be enough room for everyone - if there are too many people to fit on a bus, they can have another one there in just a couple minutes. It's also horrible, because you never know what kind of vehicle you're going to get. Our first day, we rode a nice comfortable bus to the park, but crammed into a 15-passenger van for the ride back. If you've never climbed to the back seat of one of those, trust me - it's a different game than walking down the aisle of a bus. All in all, not a bad place to stay, but not as good as their site, and these reviews, would have you believe. 3.5/5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & hospitality”
Reviews.Author: shazoz
Reviews.Content: I spent four days last month at Floridays with my parents, while visiting my daughter, who is in college outside of Orlando. I had a choice of booking two hotel rooms, north of Orlando, closer to the college or this condo, which even though being south gave us the comfort of a kitchen and relaxing on the balcony. Ummm Hard choice right? I had already booked a car so the extra 10 minutes on the I-4 wasn't a big deal at all, especially as how convieniently this resort is to everything. I would not hesitate to come back here again. The girls on the front desk are some of the most personable & friendly staff I have ever dealt with. ( I have travelled all 5 continents now) I felt at ease from the moment I walked through the front door & nothing was ever a bother & no question was too stupid. I explained my parents had travelled all the way from Australia for this trip and all we really wanted was a room with some sort of a view. please, no carpark. NOT a problem, I have the perfect room for you! I was so suprised by her attitude. She was so happy to be able to help me make this special! We all know those staff who can make us feel like an idiot. You will not find them here. The condo was very spacious, 2 bedrooms, 1 with a massive king bed, whirlpool bath, shower big enough for 2. (Yup! My folks scored that one) The second bedroom 2 queens with a large enough wardrobe,plenty of hangers and a second bathroom next door. Flatscreen Tvs in both bedrooms and the lounge area. Beautiful balcony over looking one of the lakes. My only peeve was there were three of us booked into the room, yet only two chairs for the balcony. No biggie, we dragged out a captains chair from the dining table and cocktails in the afternoon, watching the ducks and tortoises was a hit! (The dining table sat 6 mind you) The kitchen is fully equipped with all of the plates, cups, glassware, pots & pans you might possibly need. Unlike other condos I have stayed in there is no extra charge for this, it comes standard. I could never understand why places charge you for a "vacation pack" That is why I am renting a condo. Duh! There is a Publix supermarket, 7-11 and drug store within a 4 minute walk to pick up supplies. You are no more than 5 minutes from I-4 and 3 minutes from the outlet stores. Yet it is quiet enough to be away from the hurdy-gurdy of Orlando proper. The pools and main hotel areas look great, I just didn't use them so don't feel like I can comment honestly. I asked for a late checkout on our last day at the last minute, as we were flying out at 7p.m. and it was absolutely no problem, no extra charges. Wow I was expecting at least $50 to be added to the bill. Yes there is a resort fee, but they are up front about this when you book. Read the fine print. We had a few maintanance problems while we were there, but nothing I felt important enough to call down for, really trivial stuff. I left a list with the front desk when we checked out, and I have full confidence they have been addressed. I have never done that at any other hotel I have stayed at. This is the feeling I got from Floridays. Whether I am right or wrong I feel that they really do care that, we the travellers, enjoy our time with them. I really feel like they want us to be happy and more importantly to come back. I feel like posting this review will be like telling the world about a hidden secret, and next time I try to go there, it will be 10 times the price and booked out. but I felt they really did deserve the compliments. so here it is. Job well done, Floridays!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great quality for the money”
Reviews.Author: LaPenita
Reviews.Content: This is our second time here. The first time was for 7 days and this time for 10 and we've enjoyed both times. this time we booked a 3 bedroom suite, plenty of room for 4 adults and two children, 6 and 7 yrs of age. Staff have been very accommodating, kid friendly pool and environment, perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: ErinBailey
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay this past weekend. Close enough to all of the attractions to make it super convenient. Pool area was nice too. Bathrooms were very spacious! We had a 3 bedroom that worked perfectly for the 6 six adults and 2 kids in our party.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: Lauraboyles143
Reviews.Content: Comfort, convenience, and value! 2nd time to stay and still impressed! Why would you stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family with small kids.”
Reviews.Author: Clifton J
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days with my wife and two children, ages four and six. The two bedroom, two bath condo provided plenty of space, complete with a full kitchen, dishes, glasses, and silverware. The large pool was very kid friendly and heated so my kids enjoyed swimming and playing everyday in late November. No problems, no issues, no worries, had a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding as always!”
Reviews.Author: clevelandm0m
Reviews.Content: We love floridays. Always stay there, always will.

Reviews.Title: “JUST WONDERFULL”
Reviews.Author: ponnimus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays for 13 days with our two kids on 4 and 6 . Pools were clean and water temperature was just right! The apartment (two bedroom unit) was just what we needed. Spacious and lovely beds. Walgreens and Publix nearby. The hotels shuttleservice worked great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays Resort Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Judy P
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed great service and the friendly staff! The rooms were very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: Family of five stayed here for 6 nights, stayed in a two bedroom unit. The room was nicer than expected, very clean with nice amenities. The master bath was large with a very nice tub. The grounds were well kept, staff was nice but we had no issues during our stay. We will definitely stay here again, the rates were fantastic. Beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It Really Is Good”
Reviews.Author: IggySydney
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a long trip around Florida and I have to say that Floridays really is as good as the reviews. Admittedly, there are quite a few tower blocks on the complex, but it is well spread out and you rarely see anyone - with no noise, either! Rooms were big, perfect for our family of 4. Everything exceptionally clean, a little dated (not tired), but really, given the location and purpose of our trip, who cares. Full size kitchen, dining room and living area. Bedrooms big and very comfortable and bathrooms huge. Pool was good, though we were so busy out and about, we did not really spend much time there. Great location for the various Disney parks and there is a shuttle bus that takes you there from the resort, which was great, but we ended up relying on taxis mostly and occasionally the i-trollley. There is a Walgreens and Publix supermarket about 10 minutes walk or the i-trolley ride, which goes basically door to door. Every bit of junk food, lolly, etc your kids have ever seen on an American TV show, all there. Bliss! (Cheese from a can is seriously under-rated.) Additionally, there is a large outlet mall - Ralph Lauren, Coach, etc. We bought masses - with the dollar at parity, it is very cheap - go with empty suitcases. There are a few restaurants around - Benihana actually at the entrance to the resort. If you stay, make the effort to go to downtown Orlando. There are some great restaurants - worth making the effort for. As ever, the trick to Disneyworld/Universal is to go early. Be there 15 minutes before the park opens. Harry Potter was amazing, but VERY crowded, even at 10am. We got the park hopper tickets but, to be honest, given the logistics to get from one park to another, whilst not excessive, will take at least 30 minutes. Would recommend doing all the Disney parks. However, kids and husband were not overly impressed with the water parks. Wetn'Wild in QLD better, apparently. During our trip of a month, we stayed everywhere from uber trendy hotels in Miami, very grand resorts in the Bahamas and some down-to-earth places in between. Floridays is not grand, but it is really well located, the staff are seriously helpful and nice. When we returned there on our last night, before heading home, it felt really good to be there again. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good spacious accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Bluejeans01
Reviews.Content: I booked the 2 bedroom suite for a family of 5 for six nights and we were pleasantly surprised by how spacious it was. From the outside, the resort is rather unspectacular and at first we thought we had picked a dud. On entering the 3rd floor room however, I began to understand the very high ratings the resort had on this site. Pros: -The queen sized master bed looked so enticing after a long flight and was always well made on a daily basis. The separate beds in the second rooms were huge! -The air conditioning remained a wonderful remedy for the heat. -The staff were always ready to assist before you even asked. -The resort was so comfortable that once we decided to stay in all afternoon! Great huge microwave, fridge/freezer and kitchen utensils. -The resort is close to Publix, a supermarket, which stocked virtually everything we needed. We shopped so much given that the prices were great that it was a welcome relief that our suite was by the lift on the 3rd floor (which was usually nice and quiet all through). --It is also close to Outback Steakhouse which a taxi driver said was the best around (sadly I didn't manage to visit) and Benihana and the south branch of the Premium Outlet (although we decided to take the 20min drive to the other branch). -The shuttle service to the attractions (SeaWorld, Universal and Disney). Cons (more like little blips): -On arrival, no one offered to assist with our suitcases until we asked. As the saying goes, ask and you shall receive; and we did receive assistance without fuss. -The rooms are not really cleaned; only the beds are made and towels replaced. -The TV's were a bit dated, but few would care really as there wasn't much time for TV watching (managed to catch the Manchester United v liverpool game there though which was wonderful). -I ordered some dinner from the cafe and requested that they ring me when it was ready so that I could pop down to pick it up. 50mins or so later, no one had rung. I went down to the cafe only to be told that the food had long been ready (getting cold in the corner) and they had rung me repeatedly but no one answered the phone. I explained that I was sat next to the phone for nearly an hour and no one called. I had a look at the slip which he had printed out and noticed that the room number on it was wrong; clearly they had been ringing the wrong room! I drew the fellow's attention to this, but unbelievable, he said nothing and rudely walked off! He was the sole embarrassment to a fine resort. -The shuttle service only departed after 10am, so if you want to beat the initial queues and get there by 9am (as we did on day 1), then I suggest you take a taxi if you don't have a car. If so, you'd be advised to get the number of the taxi from the airport and use them or the taxis outside the attractions instead of booking through the resort ($25-$28, as opposed to $40 per trip). Also, the shuttles have a fixed early evening return time; which is no good if you/the kids want to see the famed Disney fireworks display at 9pm, for example.

Reviews.Title: “Great - in line with other reviews”
Reviews.Author: frank a
Reviews.Content: Reviews on Trip Advisor were spot on. The property met all expectations in terms of amenities, room type, convenience and comfort. Staff were responsive to requests, and any small issues were resolved quickly. We had a rental car so we found navigating Orlando theme parks and shopping a snap as everything is a short drive away. Suites were well appointed and functional. We stayed in a two bedroom suite in Building A on the top floor. The only criticism I would have is that the beds need to be replaced. They are of average to slightly below average comfort. New pillow top mattresses would make a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was bigger than an apartment!”
Reviews.Author: memphis_m
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom suite in building E. We paid $139 a night in October which was a great value. The two bathrooms, two bedrooms, three tv's, kitchen, and a balcony were more than enough room. If you needed to stay here for a week or more you could do so easily. The location was just down the road from Sea World and everything else. If I have to say anything negative, I would say the small cafe is way overpriced. We ordered a large one topping pizza and a salad for 4 and it was $60 with no drinks. There are plenty of places to eat or buy food nearby. We paid twice as much for half the room in Clearwater for the rest of the trip. We will be back on our next stay to Orlando. Thank you TripAdvisor reviewers for a good recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: CarlaTAlmeida
Reviews.Content: We booked the 2 bedroom suite and I was truly surprised with the size of the place, nice spacious and clean rooms and a very well equipped kitchen. The resort is also located close to a PUBLIX, a Benihama, an Outback and a Premium Outlet, which is very handy. Best part of our stay was the attentive and courteous staff, they truly go above and beyond to make you feel comfortable. Will be certainly staying there on our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Good,but it could have been perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando at least four times a year and I confess that I was looking forward to stay in number 1.I cant say I was disappointed.The rooms are large,well equipped,quiet.Great pool area.What I dont like is the " light service" offered by the hotel.They dont run the dish machine,they dont clean the room,just provide fresh towels and make the bed.When I asked the front desk employee about the crumbs that have fallen on the floor ,I was told that I could feel free to use the vacuum cleaner stored in the closet!!!I guess I were on vacations!!!And,by the way:why should I pay an extra resort fee???

Reviews.Title: “Spacious accomodations”
Reviews.Author: MNtraveler077
Reviews.Content: Spacious accomodations, so for a family that needs a bit more room than a standard hotel room, this was perfect! Washer/dryer and full kitchen were added bonuses. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room, but when we were there, it was really nice to be able to have lots of space.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for families. Fantastic customer service.”
Reviews.Author: MarkandBrendaK
Reviews.Content: Floridays, building A, was the perfect base for our Orlando theme park holiday. Spacious, clean rooms with very good cooking facilities. After several weeks of having to share a bed our teenage daughters really appreciated getting their own douoble beds. Resort is nice and close to theme parks, restaurants and outlet stores. In our email feedback to the resort we mentioned some concerns about an expensive overseas phone call. They promptly contacted us, apologised for the problem and provided a substantial refund.

Reviews.Title: “Too Good To Be True - But It Is”
Reviews.Author: DisneyNut4
Reviews.Content: I booked because of the great ratings and was crossing my fingers. I was so excited to see that we had a beautiful 2 bedroom (Apartment). We didn't hear any noise from other rooms. Groceries are on site and a store very close by. I would definetly stay agian. AAA discount is the best price we could find. You do need a car to get around to the parks in my opinion. And make sure you get a 3rd floor or higher. We had a 2nd floor in Building C and we didn't like the balconey because the wall comes up higher and make you feel like your in a box you can't see anything when sitting down. Higher floors had a rail not a wall. We would have sat outside more to talk or relax if we were up higher. Lesson learned for next time. Couldn't believe the great price for a 2 bedroom with full kitchen and washer and dryer in the room

Reviews.Title: “A Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: Carla V
Reviews.Content: The resort was very nice and the staff very friendly, Our room was very clean . I do wish there was a regular coffee maker in the room clean. My only complaint is I was not made aware of the additional $12.95 resort fee per day until I checked out I didn't quite understand what I was being charged for. If I recommennd this resort I will definately warn anyone about this fee

Reviews.Title: “JUST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: kabange c
Reviews.Content: Just perfect, the must in orlando, my new home in orlando, i come back with more friend

Reviews.Title: “great 2 bedroom for price of regular hotel room”
Reviews.Author: dah22002
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this resort. This time was just as good as the first. The best part is the condo set up....2 bedrooms and 2 full baths with kitchen, dinning room seating 6, and balcony. The master bathroom even has a 2 person jacuzzi tub. All for $140/night. My two teenage boys say they never want to stay anywhere else. Plus free wifi that worked great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great place!”
Reviews.Author: gkgreb
Reviews.Content: So glad to see we weren't the only ones who enjoyed our stay at Floridays last week! We paid FAR less than we would have at a Disney resort and I am certain we got more for our money. The staff was friendly and helpful (we had a light out in the shower stall) fixed it within an hour! We slept well on the soft beds, as did our 2 children in their own room! TV is fine, didn't watch much anyway. There is a Keurig coffee machine in the kitchen, if I had known I would have brought my own supply, but the Starbucks brewed coffee in the Palm Cafe was a nice treat that my husband walked down for every morning. We stayed in Bldg. C...no complaints, close enough to the pool, very quiet. Clean, well maintained, well stocked. Close to parks. The only complaint we had....the "temporary entrance" makes it easy to miss upon your first arrival, and too many speed bumps~although I'm sure it's a safety thing, just annoying. Excellent stay...can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: UkShony
Reviews.Content: We booked here due to the reviews and were not wrong it is a great place and did not want to go home.It really is home from home everything you could wish for. Staff very friendly and always pleasant. we had a problem with the jaccuzzi pipes leaking and it was very promptly sorted.We had asked for building f and top floor and got it- just wanted to say thankyou it was our anniversary and as soon as we checked in congratulated us. thankyou Floridays for a wonderful stay, we will see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: nadine12
Reviews.Content: The unit sparkling clean, all furniture seemed new, beds were comfortable, plenty of pillows. Did not use the pool or restaurant or shuttle to Disney (we rented a car). Location was close to highway to get to Disney and Universal (which were both only a few miles away). Would highly recommend and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: MarylandGirl72
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from Floridays Resort (November 2011). We stayed for 6 days, and used public transportation (I-Ride) to tour International Drive (Rt 4) where there is lots of shopping and restaurants. The Resort provided a free shuttle to Universal Studios!! We loved that Floridays is conveniently located on International Drive. Actually that's one of the reasons I chose this resort, as well as the great pool/bar and suite amenities. There is free wi-fi throughout the resort. Our 2-bedroom suite was spacious, yet cozy. It gave a great apartment feel. The whole time there, we called it "home", because it sure felt like home and not a "hotel". The staff was friendly, courteous, and attentive!! Choose Floridays!! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Nankasp
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to Disney Land with our son and daughter-in-law. We stayed at Floridays. When we got there we noticed the air wasn't working. They sent a technician right away. The unit had frozen so he had to shut it off and let it unfreeze, and fortunately it was cool out so we could open the windows and sleep comfortably. While we were at Disney World the next day, they came and fixed everything so that when we arrived back at the hotel everything was working fine. The suite was great! We had 2 bedrooms, two bathrooms. living room, dining area, and kitchen. It was great to be able to eat breakfast before we left for the day as it helped eliminate one more stop before we got to the park. We liked it a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location”
Reviews.Author: DMallyon
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Floridays the last two years in a row. This is an excellent resort -- perfect size for a family, lots of room. Pool area, games room, convenience store all well equipped. The master bedrooms with the ensuites are fabulous, just like being at home. And the in-suite laundry is heaven! You can't find a better resort for the value you get at Floridays. I wouldn't stay anywhere else, and we've been to Orlando more than a dozen times. If you are renting a car in Orlando, this resort is perfectly placed -- 10 from DW, 20min from Universal on the freeway. The Premium outlets are literally around the corner, along with 24 hour Walgreens, a large Publix grocery store, 24 hour McDonalds, Outback Steakhouse, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value - great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: carolwertz
Reviews.Content: The Floridays resort is an exceptional value for the price. The hotel is spacious and so are the rooms. The value is excellent and the staff is fantastic. This is our 3rd stay at the resort and surely will not be our last. If you are looking for a family friendly hotel or one where you can have multiple sleeping rooms within one room - this is it! I travel frequently for work and this resort more than exceeds my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Momofthe3Cs
Reviews.Content: Service of all staff was amazing. The answer was never "no" if we needed a driver it was taken care of. They do offer shuttle service but at 8am and 10:15. No one mentioned it stops at another hotel before going to destination. Pool is great! Fun play area with zero entry for kids. Business office pay by minute Internet & 75c copies

Reviews.Title: “The greatest place in Florida”
Reviews.Author: Larry W
Reviews.Content: Our stay was one of the best weeks vacation we have had with our family (grand children). The staff at Floridays could not have been better to our family. We especially liked the shuttle to the parks this saved money, time, and best of all nerves. Thank You Floridays for a wonderful vacation. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with family! Would definately go back!”
Reviews.Author: C3Js
Reviews.Content: Floridays resort was an excellent place for our family of 4 to stay on our recent trip. Spacious suite, clean comfortable room, full kitchen and handy shuttle transportation to Disney and Universal Studio's parks. Pool area was lovely. Great value at a reasonable price. Thanks! C3J's

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: sneaky_wan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Floridays for 4 nights during our recent visit to Orlando. The main purpose of our stay was to visit Walt Disney World & Universal Studios. Getting around was easy enough with our rented car. Supermarket and pharmacy is nearby. The main touristy belt, I-Drive is about 5min drive away. We were pleasantly surprised that there was washing machine and dryer machine in the room. Was certainly useful when we can clean our dirty clothes from the long day at the theme parks. Kitchen was well stocked too and we got to cook our our meals in the room as well. We got a 2 bedroom apartment (i think it's the smallest rooms they have on the property) which was spacious, clean and well-maintained. Overall, more than happy to recommend to anyone who's thinking of staying here. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: Gudrun T
Reviews.Content: Just came home from a wonderful Florida vacation and normally I would leave it at that but I just must recommend this hotel. My husband and I and our three girls, 13 year old, 6 year old and a 9 month old stayed at the Floridays resort and had a wonderful time. Great service, clean hotel, great pool and nice location. But it it necessary to have a rental car and a gps during the stay, no matter where you stay in Orlando, at least if you have kids travelling with you. We got a great deal on Hotwire and ended up in building A on the first floor. Usually I ask for a room not at the first floor but it ended up being the best thing for us. NO BUGS...which I thought came with first floor rooms. I would stay at building A, it is close to the main pool but also private. We were not at all bothered by other guests, did not hear them at all...Would recommend this hotel to everyone but in particular to families with children. Guest services were great and tended to all our needs, recommended restaurants (I highly recommend Bahama Breeze btw) and we bought theme park tickets there. If I have to try to think of negatives about this resort I might come up with very minimal complaints: The only thing missing from the apartment which would have been nice was a high chair, but I was not expecting one to be there anyways and never asked for one. Don´t stack the glasses, they will break...and...hmmm.....If we ever go back to Orlando we´re staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place!”
Reviews.Author: LLKN
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Floridays and it wouldn't be our last. Friends of ours stayed here last year and said it was great so we decided to give it a try. The rooms are very spacious. We stayed in a two bedroom, two bathroom suite. It was great to have a fully equipt kitchen and laundry right in the unit. We only took half the amount of clothes we needed because we were able to do laundry half way through the week. The property has two pools. A large main pool that is heated and a smaller pool that is not. Both very well kept. There is a huge grocery store that is about a 10 minute walk away in plaza that also includes a Walgreens, a pizza place, a Subway, a Chinese restaurant and a liquor store. Oh and for you shoppers, an outlet mall with 150 stores about a 15 minute walk away. The property is also located very close to Disney. It was about a 15 minute drive away. The rooms are very clean and well kept. Nothing is dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for families”
Reviews.Author: InspireMI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays for a family vacation (2 adult couples) and had a great time. The resort was well appointed and location was fantastic. Close to Sea World, Universal, and ok for Disney but I would stay on campus because it is massive. The 2 bedroom suite was amazing with a kitchen, balcony, and a 2 person hot tub in the master. It would be hard to compare this to anywhere in the US at this price. (around $160/nt) The pool is great and the staff is very frendly and helpful. Highly Recommended for all groups more than 2 couples.

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay, but resort fee to high”
Reviews.Author: travlwithfam
Reviews.Content: great location, close to everything. staff very attentive, even at 12 am in the morning, when we arrived. :) you should book a unit in building c, if you like being close to pool etc, but not too close. rooms are great, neat and clean, with everything you need, even an oven to make your favorite cookies :) housekeeping is a bit lame, very late in the afternoon (4pm) - and doesn't do cleaning. they change towels, remove trash and make beds. so, vacuuming your bread crumbs and cleaning the bathroom floors etc. is on you.... but that was ok for us. wifi is good, TV is ok (not what you are used to from back home, though) most frustrating thing for coffee lovers: they only have the one cup-keurig coffee makers, comes with a starter kit of 1 decaf, 2 regular coffee, 1 tea. that's it! if you need more, you are welcome to buy the expensive refills at the shop (publix around the corner does not sell this brand!). no regular coffee makers, no coffee pot or tea pot you could use to brew your coffee in. I think, that should be included in $15 of daily RESORT FEE !!! The RESORT FEE is just hidden costs that add up and make your stay more expensive. just skip the resort fee and make the price of the rooms a 'real' price. Also, there is a list of items on the inside of one of the kitchen cupboards. take a minute and review the list, let the front desk know if there are any missing items etc. we had a lot of items on our list that were missing, miscounted etc... Other than that, just great. Loved the weather, loved the location!

Reviews.Title: “great stay with the best stocked kitchen I have experienced”
Reviews.Author: cztim
Reviews.Content: Perfect if you want a trip to Orlando with a nice big room and kitchen! with a decent pool and close to the shops and bus routes

Reviews.Title: “Superior hotel on International Drive Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Angela407b
Reviews.Content: Most convenient location in Orlando, so close to parks, airport, with well equiped units. 2bed 2bath unit with full kitchen, free WiFi and numerous tvs. Pool facilities great for small children and games room for those a little older. Convenient poolside cafe and onsite catering facilities. Have been before and will return

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: rita_hermann
Reviews.Content: This has been our second time at the Floridays this year. We did not hesitate to reserve again as we travel with three children and the hotel is very convenient with two bed rooms and two bathrooms as well as a fully equipped kitchen, washer and dryer. Even a high chair for the dining table as well as a pack´n´play was delivered. Last time we had a room in the very last building so this time I requested a room close to the pool and we got a pool view room in building B which was very conveniently located next to the pool as well as main facilities. The hotel provides every amenity possible to make your stay comfortable. The accommodations are modern and close to everything. A fantastic Publix supermarket as well as a Wallgreens and the Premium outlet are all within walking distance. Also it is only a 5 minutes drive to Downtown Disney. In the evenings they had life music at the bar by the pool and people were having drinks or coffee and listening to the songs, which was neat. Probably the only thing that I disliked was the housekeeping as our maid only made the beds but never cleaned anything else. In general I would highly recommend this resort and I will definitely stay there again on my next Orlando visit.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: funeralsinger
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the middle of everything. However, we were in the first building facing the bus stop and pool. So it was very noisy at all hours. The beds were slightly uncomfortable.The rooms are nice and big and for a great price. However the showers don't have anything to hold your items except a small soap dish, and the master bedroom design is a little awkward, and extremely hot, would never cool off. Also, the beds in the extra rooms are twins that can be put together as a king, and the brackets on the bottom stick out in prime toe stubbing position. The food was good, the kids loved the chicken tenders, wanted them every day. This was our second visit and the first time was in a building furthur back. I would recommend asking for a building towards the back, unless you like noise.

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel at bargain prices, STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: kern22101
Reviews.Content: Fear not, Floridays deserves all the 5-star ratings it gets. It is located smack-dab in between Disney and Universal, about a 15-minute drive from each. The rooms are immaculate, well-appointed, and BIG. A 3-bedroom suite w/a full kitchen and porch cost $135/night (be prepared, they sock you with a $12/day "resort fee" as well as all of those nasty hotel taxes so, the real price ends up being nearly $31/day more than you think it will be.) The hotel has a nice, big pool with some water-sprinkler things the children like as well as a surprisingly good, poolside cafe. The rooms are seriously luxirious, they have shampoos, soaps, dish sponge, TIDE, and dishwasher soap waiting for you when you get there. The beds are very comfortable and all the appliances work well. My only suggestion would be to ask for extra towels. For some reason, the 6 of us kept having to make due with 4 towels and I never remembered to call and ask for more until people were dripping wet.

Reviews.Title: “steeler nation "An excellent family value"”
Reviews.Author: NormanCohen
Reviews.Content: We were able to get an affordable three bedroom suite with a full kitchen. The rooms were clean, beds comfortable, and a lot of space. This was important to us as there were six of us including "kids" ages 20, 16, 14 and 10. The location is central to Disney and Universal along with many of Orlando's restaurants. Go Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel for a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: jpandco
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults + 2 kids 10 and 12) just came from 10 days (9 nights) in Orlando. The hotel location is not as convenient as the ones inside the theme parks BUT it was way cheaper, and much much better than the Disney ones we have gone previously : the condo is huge with 2 large bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, ... and very well equiped with even dishwasher, washing and drying machines,... They tell you they only give you a starter kit for the different washers, so we bought the necessary at the store one block from the hotel. But at the end, they provided the replacement each time we used them. The service was supposed to be basic (beds and change towels) but it was absolutely perfect : we are used to stay in hotels from 3 to 5 stars and this one reached the 4/5 star service with no doubt. Don't know if that will be the same in busy season, but we had nothing to complain about here. I said the location is not as convenient but it's not bad at all : 7 minutes from Seaworld, 20 minutes from Universal (didn't go to Disney but seems the same) with our car : that was probably less than waiting for the bus and the long ride you have from most Disney's hotels to the parks. Only difference, you pay for the parking and it's expensive (15 to 20 usd per park and per day). But it was so flexible... Kids enjoyed the very well maintainded swimming pool (the big, we didn't try the small one). Restaurants and stores very close (5 minutes walking). Didn't try the food at hotel but prices shown were very reasonable. For our next stay in Orlando, we will definitely go back to this resort

Reviews.Title: “family from ksa”
Reviews.Author: deasrtman
Reviews.Content: nice apartment good location for the hotel the pool area not big engh the room service not quilafy

Reviews.Title: “Great place and very good location.”
Reviews.Author: RoncoFamily
Reviews.Content: This condo resort is well located in Orlando. The staff is always thoughtful and kind. The place is very clean. I would recommend this place without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Skburton
Reviews.Content: Four women rented a 3 bedroom 2 bath condo. It was fantastic. The room was lovely, the beds were comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Best Part of our Vacation”
Reviews.Author: IamaTravelingfool
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay particularly for an extended period of time. We stayed in Orlando for 2 weeks. Normally I would have gone crazy being anywhere away from home for that long, however, it just felt like a home away from home. Nice accomodations and very nice staff. The location was excellent for getting to any of the theme parks. A very nice stay. We would stay there again if we ever decide to return.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays was close enough to the action yet far enough from the crowds.”
Reviews.Author: Shaib02
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Oct 28-30 and it was amazing. We had a 3 bedroom for our group of 9 adults and there was plenty of room. The room was beautiful clean and felt like home, we were on the 5th floor of the D bldng. Check in was 5 mins tops and our room was spacious providing everything we needed. We were able to buy groceries & cook the evidence weekend. There was a Wal-Mart, Publix, and outlet mall within 10 mins of the resort. The resort was clean, quiet, and had plenty of great amenities. I look forward to returning the next time I'm in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent spot to stay in Orlando for familys”
Reviews.Author: kansasbeachbabe
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days and two nights at Floridays. I had overheard someone mentioning how nice of a place it was, and that it was comparable to the Mariott, and they were right. We rented a two bedroom two bath condo with a full kitchen via their websight. Since it was off season we got this unit for under $130.00 per night. The unit had 3 large flat screen tvs, slept 6 and had a lovely balcony. The view from the balcony was of a cheaper condo unit at the resort next door when you looked past the palms, but there is something about looking out through the palm trees that made it fabulous. The unit was spacious and clean and the kitchen was well equipped. They even had a Kerig coffeemaker! The unit had a washer and dryer and a large jetted tub in the master. The pool was heated and had lots of tables and loungers around it. The staff was very nice. The only bad spot was their "grill" which produced poorly cooked $10 hamburgers. For that price I would have preferred a fully cooked burger made of fresh meat, without any pink tomato slices. Overall it was a lovely resort that we will stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: GB_Norfolk
Reviews.Content: As a family of four (2 adults, a teenager and a 10 year old) we have over the years traveled much of Europe and America. We are not a picky bunch with really only 2 key criteria; 1. Cleanliness and 2. Value for money (this includes facilities, location, space, etc. for the money paid) Floridays met both criteria very well. The rooms were clean, light and airy. The facilities provided within the rooms more than met expectations. As for location, none of the parks are more than a short drive away plus if you like shopping (2 of us do) there is an outlet mall and supermarket only a few minutes away by car. The staff were friendly and helped us get the best value park tickets plus provided some helpful hints on the local area. In summary we would recommend this as an excellent place to stay for families. If there are any negatives these would be: The on-site food bar could be improved (not bad though) and there is a daily room charge which, although not excessive, is not advertised clearly and not part of your pre-paid/ordered room bill.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for the family”
Reviews.Author: kimadca
Reviews.Content: Had a great time staying at the Floridays. Clean, very nice furnishings. Jacuzzi tub in master bath. Perfect location would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: marinochka13
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort. We have been to many hotels in the area. We travel to Orlando almost every other year and this hotel really stands out. It has all the amenities, the rooms are really clean. They have entertainment at the pool. Very very family friendly and it is very clean. I think this is the only place we will stay from now on whenever we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Gibbo1967
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Floridays Resort in October 2011. Booked a two bedroom suite for my family .The apartment was spacious and spotlessly clean.Cannot fault the apartment ,the only slight criticism would be the location of our block which was a liitle too far from the main pool and amenities.But overall a suberb place to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a family vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Kari J
Reviews.Content: Concierge service is awesome here. Very helpful. The location is nice. We rented a car which was alot nicer than having to only travel at certain times of the day. I would recommend 4th floor or higher for the view. Pack Keirig singles. $1.60 a piece in the giftshop. Loved the washer and dryer in the room! Whirlpool tub is great at the end of the day. We were sad to leave...can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Business Location”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: Planned a 4 day business meeting in Oct 2011 at Floridays including breakfast, breaks,and lunch each day. Also had a buffet dinner-reception the first night and everyone is still talking about the food. Steve and his group did an excellent job! Very friendly and helpful staff. The suites were also nice, very clean and very spacious. Next time we come to Orlando, we will definitely be staying at Floridays!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: juliesuki
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 2 weeks at the end of 2009. Returning this month & cannot wait!!!!! Could not fault this one bit! Cleanliness is top notch, Staff are always on hand to help and nothing is too much to ask. Location on International drive means you are relatively close to all the parks. Go on give it a try!!!!!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: L C
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in Oct 2011 with family. Rooms were spacious and clean. Full kitchen very well appointed. Very nice pool and hot tub area. Upon entering our room after check in, we discovered the bathroom was flooded. After notifying the desk they quickly changed our room and were waiting for us at the new building with new room keys and a smile. Very impressed with entire staff, especially concierge. Easy check in and check out. Centrally located within a few miles of most attractions and lots of dining choices. No airport shuttle. Free parking at hotel and a rental car really comes in handy to come and go as you please.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: icewomanLondon
Reviews.Content: Spent a total of 13 days at Floridays. Check in was quick and straight forward. Please bear in mind that on your arrival they hold roughly about $500 on your credit/debit card for any additional charges you may incur during your stay and as long as you do not incur any charges, the money will be replaced when you check out. There are hotel fees to be paid at check out too, about $10 per day plus tax. We were a family of 5, stayed in building B with a pool view. When our balcony doors were opened you could hear some noise from the pool but it didn't bother us at all. Pool was lovely, opened from 7am till 11pm which was nice after a long day at the parks. Children had lots of fun using it. Concierge in hotel lobby were very helpful at sorting out any concerns and booking shuttle buses to the theme parks. The hotel is situated at the south end of International drive which happens to be the very quiet end, is near to Publix (grocery store) and Walgreens (pharmacy) and a few other shops, about a 10 min walk from hotel. We choose not to drive on this trip and relied on the I trolley as well as the local Lynx buses, there a bus stop right in front of the hotel. The I trolley is good if you only plan on going up and down International drive but if you plan on venturing out then the Lynx buses would suit you better. The lynx buses were not as frequent as we would of liked which made journeys seem very long especially with young kids so if you can afford it I would advise you to hire a car, it would make getting around easier and quicker. The housekeeping service at Floridays is very limited as other reviews have made mention of, beds are made, trash bag changed and towels replaced. Their policy is to do a full clean, 7 days of you being there, if you wish for your room to be clean thoroughly everyday then you have to pay extra for that service. They provide you with a vacuum cleaner, mop etc and a few starter kits for dishwasher, washing machine etc. Overall we had a good stay and would recommend and stay there ourselves again. Hoping to return there on our next trip. Hope this review helps you.

Reviews.Title: “NICE CONDO - MIDDLE OF THE MAGIC”
Reviews.Author: AmandaB72
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 14 day holiday, when we arrived we were placed in Block F , we wanted to be a bit closer and Gabriel on reception was extremely helpful and moved us to Block C overlooking the lake & far view of pool. Room was very nice, clean, we had towels changed daily , amenities replenished & trash removed everyday, bed linen changed after 7 days, hot tub on master room is wonderful, the only downside was we were in room 307 near the lift and some guests were not very courteous at 4AM by shouting through the hallways, also one night we were kept awake by rowdy guests ( you know who you are !!!- selfish) by 3.30AM I had had enough and on calling reception they were very prompt in sending over security and the problem was dealt with, please note this was two nights out of 14 and it was unlucky and the staff had it sorted !! , of course you don't mind excited children when they come back from the fireworks etc but grown ups should know better !!!!???I recommend a top floor room and one not near the lifts if you are a light sleeper. Anyway, we found the location to be excellent right in the centre of the magic, front desk were very helpful in printing off directions if required, we also had to call down as we blocked the toilet and this again was dealt with promptly. All staff were helpful and polite from the cleaning staff to the Palm Cafe staff. Pools were lovely, a little bit tepid on a chilly evening but a lovely beginning or end to a hectic day, not too crowded in October, pool towels provided and ok not big but big enough and plentiful. We didn't use the shuttles but saw them at the resort all the time, just remember to book your place the day before if you need to use it, the I ride trolley stops right outside also. We ate once from the Palm Cafe and it was very nice, a little pricey but it is a hotel, Starbucks coffee is also available there and they have a little store which sells basics, which is very handy. All in all a lovely resort, helpful staff and close to Mickey & Friends , Shamu , Harry Potter at IOA and we had a fantastic time and hope you do to.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays - Great in October 2011”
Reviews.Author: sunshinestateman
Reviews.Content: 5 Night Stay in the 3 bedroom Condo was fabulous ! No Issues. Staff was friendly and every request I made was greeted with a smile and resolved quickly to my satisfaction. We will make Floridays Resort our "home away from home" while in the Disney/Universal area from now on !

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best..!!”
Reviews.Author: Stagster
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay at this resort. Everything was excellent, good reception staff with every wish catered for. We had a three bed condo which was vast - 5 large beds, 4 TV's and a great jacuzzi bath..!! We stayed in block C and overlooked the lake, just a short walk to the lovely pool, which our kids really enjoyed. The hotel shuttles worked really well for us and where always on time. As for food, we used the on-site deli, the Domino's pizza (next door) and the Outback Steak house, all within walkiing distance. Just a 5min walk away is Publix supermarket where we stocked up on all the things we required to stock our large fridge/freezer. Opposite the supermarket is Premium Outlets which offers designer shops at discount prices, including a Disney outlet (cheaper than the parks). Would really recommend this resort to families as it was great to return to a large spacious condo after a busy and hectic day at the parks, everbody had their own space. If you stay here you will not regret it..!

Reviews.Title: “More than we had hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: auntmamie
Reviews.Content: Based on Tripadvisor reviews (Floridashirl in particular) we booked a 3-bedroom suite for our family of six. The accommodations were very clean and roomy. Lovely dining table, full kitchenette which includes dishwasher, fridge and dishware, washer and dryer, huge bathrooms plus jacuzzi. Quiet, well-kept facility with 2 pools and a hot tub. Staff very attentive and courteous. As an example, we needed two more towels. Within minutes of asking for them at the front desk, there was a knock at our door, and a nice gentleman handed some towels and facecloths to us.Very convenient to Sea World and Disney. We would book again in a moment, if we had the time and money!

Reviews.Title: “Best lodging in the orlando area”
Reviews.Author: stbutler
