Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location in February 2011 for a trip to disney parks with family. This was more than we expected. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and everything was perfect. The pictures on their website was exactly what we saw once we arrived. The heated pool and hot tub was nice after a long day at the parks. Kids enjoyed the game room almost as much as I did. Great experience, will stay at Floridays for every Orlando trip from now on. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tom759
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Kids loved the pool. Close to all the parks and the staff was very helpful. It was great having a kitchen to cook dinners and the washer/dryer was great after getting soaked at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: Angela972
Reviews.Content: What a value! Everything you need! 2 Adults and 4 children comfortably slept in our room. Super clean. Beds a bit uncomfortable - not the best, but not bad. All in all, a great resort for the money. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jax72
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for families. We stayed a couple of nights. Pool was fun for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great family accommodation with all the comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: Carmen M
Reviews.Content: We chose the Floridays based on Trip Advisor reviews and it lived up to all our expectations and more. The rooms were exactly as pictured. We stayed in block B which is closer to the front of the resort and handy to get to the main office where you get the bus and pool area, cafe etc. Shuttle Bus service was convenient, polite and on time each time we used it. All equipment provided was in good condition. Apartments were very clean and comfortable. Free WIFI was very handy. Pool was lovely. Food reasonably priced and delicious and fresh. Beds made and towels delivered fresh each day. My only minor suggestion for improvement would be to have a clock on the wall in each apartment to make it easier when planning your day (there are alarm clocks in the bedroom) and the inner bedrooms were a bit dark - could do with a light on the ceiling rather than lamps. Overall experience was great - highly recommend to any aussie family with kids wanting a comfortable place to stay with good access to the theme parks and shopping outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Michelle787
Reviews.Content: This resort has an I-trolley bus-stop in front of it. This is very convenient for those who are not driving. Beds and pillows are very comfortable. Rooms are very clean and spacious. I would love to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: mommytwotwins
Reviews.Content: Rooms are just as pictured on website. Tons of room in the 3 bedroom unit. Pool was very nice. It's great having a full kitchen and washer dryer in unit. Two HUGE bathrooms great for our party of 7. Saw fireworks from our balcony. Great location to all theme parks and lots of places to eat on International Drive. Will will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissRachelCarr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous. Our apartment was overlooking the fountains and we got sunshine on the balcony in the mornings. The apartment is just like a home and super clean. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is huge with a jacuzzi. Above all the staff are so helpful and friendly they will do anything for you. I would live here in a heartbeat! Thank you floridays!

Reviews.Title: “This Is The Place”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: A quality apartment style room, reasonably priced and convenient access to Sea World, Disney and Universal. The service was great and it provided the perfect place to unwind after a day of adventures. Onsite pool was a hit with the kids and the adjacent bar a hit with the parents. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Floridays to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly impressed”
Reviews.Author: MPG007
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to find a two bedroom apartment at a reasonable price in Orlando and Floridays kept getting highly recommended. Given the very reasonable price, I was not expecting much but I was remarkably surprised. Our experience of Floridays was quite excellent. The person checking us in could not have been more accommodating. I asked for a quiet room on a high floor and she was able to give us a corner apartment on the top floor away from the swimming pool. The room was clean, well maintained and well stocked with all you would need - kitchen with all utensils, washer/dryer with small detergent, LCD tv's in each room. The hotel is excellently located between the parks and the restaurants on International Drive and is right next to the lovely outlet malls. We will definitely consider staying at Floridays again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: annemariehol
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment 6th floor with balcony overlooking lake. watched disney fireworks every night sitting on balcony. apartment had everything you need. full kitchen inc dishwasher and washing machine / dryer . hairdryer/iron , wifi, very comfortable beds. loved the jacuzzi feature in bathroom. room cleaned every day. beds made, towels changed and trash emptied. it was an apartment so wouldnt expect a full clean every day, staff were fantastic any time i approached reception inc concierge who always helped book transport to and from parks, pool was great and used it daily.location was perfect for all parks and shopping. best restraunt close by was bahama breeze. area is made up of 6 blocks and we were block d. i have read reviews about the blocks being far from reception, this is rubbish. a 2 min walk from our block to pool which is where reception is. there was 2 further blocks from us but only another couple mins away. to sum up this hotel - was best we have been to and lot better than renting a villa in orlando as it has everything you need and location was great. will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: dancingfeet
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 week stay at the Floridays Resort and loved it!! This was our first family visit to Orlando with two teenagers aged 12 and 16. We decided not to hire a car and were a bit unsure if we had done the right thing but as we were only going to the Disney parks we were so glad we hadn't. There is a shuttle that takes you to Epcot every day and from there you use disney transport to get to the different parks. This was great for us and worked out really well. You have the i-trolley right at the front entrance to the Resort and it is only two stops to the premium outlets or just one stop to the supermarket or the Outback Steakhouse, which we loved. We usually returned to the hotel on the 6.15pm shuttle and then the kids went in to the pool and we ate a few times from the resort cafe which we found was quite good value. Our apartment was spacious and clean and well equiped. We found the dishwasher didn't really work that well but really that is the only negative thing I can say about our entire stay. We are all really glad we stayed at this resort for our first trip to Orlando and we are hoping to return in a couple of years and will not hesitate to return to this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but rated too highly on tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: roffer
Reviews.Content: I read through the great reviews on tripadvisor and anticipated too much from this decent property. There are alot of good things to say about this hotel: - the three bedroom suite has spacious bedrooms/bathrooms - the pool looks great and has good hours (we never used it) - the kitchen is fully stocked and ready for use - the three bedroom suite has a really nice jacuzzi/bathtub feature - the outdoor terrace has a ceiling fan and is nice for unwinding in the evening - the beds are very comfortable - the property is centrally located to Disney and other parks However there are some negatives that many reviews gloss over: - the water pressure in the showers is very low, which makes it unpleasant and difficult to wash off or relax before hitting the hay - the hot water runs out early in the morning - a three bedroom suite for 8 only comes with 5 towels on a daily basis - the 'dining room' table is large enough for six, but you can't walk past it easily - half the buildings are in the back of the property and require traversing six or so parking lots to access, speed bumps and all - there is no bell service for bags, you need to find a luggage cart and haul your own luggage - there is only one luggage cart per building (with probably 50-60 units per building) - the staff, although very friendly, does not explain much when you check in (like where to find a luggage cart) - the master bedroom has a shuttered window to the bathroom that cannot be locked; perhaps a feature that is better suited for couples without kids - low lighting in the rooms makes the unit seem slightly seedy/depressing - pets are allowed to stay, which means the barking dog next door can be your early morning wake up call In all, this hotel is nice, but seems to be too highly rated on tripadvisor given some of the property's challenges. If you go in knowing all the pitfalls but still book because the large suites are a good value then you will probably be happier with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excllent”
Reviews.Author: DebbieWiganUK
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous hotel caring staff couldn't have been more hospitable nothing was too much trouble for them. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and the washer dryer a godsend with a twelve year old in tow. Wish I could pick this hotel up and drop it in between 15 and 20 on idrive and I would gave found heaven .already booking out next trip see you next year Ray .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: damnws6
Reviews.Content: This resort is perfect if you are going with family or a group of friends. It is a very nice place to stay, and would definitely stay there again. It's not the best property I've stayed at, but it is very, very nice. The rooms are beautiful and VERY clean. Kitchen came with everything we needed to cook. Pool is very nice, BUT crowded, however that is too be expected. The food shop was very good, all the cooked to order food was delicious and the bar is good as well, however it is a little expensive give the price of the rooms and it closes pretty early (10pm). The hotel staff was great, when we first checked in we noticed the safety lock on the door was broken. I called, and within an hour it was replaced. My grandparents-in-law got locked out of the room, as me and my wife were out an about. Since the room was in my name, they called and I told them they were with me and boom, they were in. Very nice, as her family doesn't speak English, so they were patient. I felt safe the entire time. BTW, if you plan on going to the pool/game room/bar often, request a room close to the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “It was "just okay"”
Reviews.Author: Michelle V
Reviews.Content: I booked with Floridays since it was listed #1 hotel in Orlando. We knew that we wanted a to have a full kitchen and a seperate bedroom for our children. I will certainly admit that the unit had more than enough room for a family of 5 (we got the 3 bedroom unit). I found the beds comfortable and the master bathroom was spacious and had a great whirlpool tub. The location of Floridays was also great. We had rented a car and Floridays was very central to Disney and Universal. However, I am just not sure why this hotel is ranked #1. I didn't find anything particularily special or amazing about it. It was a place to sleep and make breakfast in the morning. The pool isn't spectacular compared to other hotels in Orlando. Housekeeping often didn't change our towels and one time took our dirty towels and never replaced them with new ones. This is a minor complaint and in no way ruined or spoiled my trip - but when a hotel is ranked #1, you would think that is wouldn't happen. I think for the money we paid Floridays was a good choice., I just wish I wouldn't have had set my expectations so high.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaWD
Reviews.Content: Spacious and clean. Much more than we expected! Full kitchen, washer and dryer, jet tub in master bedroom. Very nice pool. Only about 3 miles from Seaworld and 7 from Universal Studios. Close to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “great value and separate room for the kids”
Reviews.Author: MayorOfAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We started at the Hard Rock Hotel to be close to Universal and Harry Potter and paid $250 plus plus tax plus $15 for parking plus $15 for wifi plus $25 for a fold away bed. But then you walk to Universal and get front of line passes. At Floridays, we paid $152 plus tax and the kids each and a double bed and we got a king with our own bathroom with a spa tub for two. And you get a kitchenette. I was expecting much shabbier but it was all clean and working with nice towels. We had or own car which was convenient but there are shuttles and there is a stop on the International Drive "trolley." Sorry to be a big city snob, but trolleys ride on tracks That's what makes them nice. If it has rubber wheels and runs on diesel, it's a bus.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, great pool, dark rooms”
Reviews.Author: macsdottir
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here for 5 nights in October. The staff were lovely and couldn't have been more helpful providing advice about how to get to places and internet instructions. Our 2 bedroom apartment was very comfortable although it would have benefited from lighter more modern furniture as the rooms were a bit gloomy and a kettle (yes, I know this is very English of me but I took my own tea bags and wanted to boil a kettle in the morning, not mess about with a saucepan on the hob!). The bathrooms were great though as was our giant king size bed. The pool area was very nice although this was not high season so I can imagine that during the summer months it would be very busy. The snacks and drinks round the bar are also very expensive. You're better off nipping to Publix round the corner for your poolside requisites! These are minor niggles though as we had a really good time here and left feeling very relaxed. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: jose m
Reviews.Content: The resort was a great deal for the $$$. We needed 2 rooms and the price was right for us. The main pool area is very nice with a kid friendly area as well as lap area. the second pool is also nice next to the lake. There is a small distance to the main pool depending on which building youre in but you can definitely enjoy the pools as well as the bar and cafe on the premises. The game room is decent size to enjoy with the kids. I thought LOCATION was GREAT with convenient access to all attractions, groceries, restaurants, etc. The interior of the rooms are a bit outdated and the girls were upset that there was only one blow dryer in the master bath but at least there is one. Overall it was the right choice for what we needed

Reviews.Title: “Loved it....”
Reviews.Author: rayida00
Reviews.Content: The resort was just what we needed. Our family came from North Florida and Alabama to spend some much needed time together. We have 2 special needs children who needed extra space and attention. We reserved a 3 bedroom suite and the resort assigned a handicap accessible suite to us. This suited our needs perfectly and we were able to have family time and alone time when necessary. Special needs children sometimes need their own spece to re-group and this suite was perfect. The meals we ordered from your restaurant were really good and were not cold or greasy or even skimpy. We order both breakfast and dinner, both were equally tasty and well prepared. Room service was good with plenty of fresh towels daily. The price was very affordable for the our family and we did not feel we paid too much. Thank you for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities but attitude of staff let them down!”
Reviews.Author: ALeeKAt-
Reviews.Content: RESORT 4/5 Some buildings are a hike from the reception office (where the shuttles leave from) and pool. We were in building C, only a short (3 min) walk from the pool and reception. Pool has lap area, kids area, smal pool and a hot tub. Cafe and bar near the pool serves Starbucks coffee, snacks and meals, cocktails. Games room for the kids and a gym. Room service is available and you can order meals to be left in your room to heat up when you get home. ROOM 4/5 Spacious 2 bed, 2 bath (1 spa) suite, with kitchen, living room, balcony. Big TV with lots of channels, plus a TV in each bedroom. Wifi worked in our room. We had a balcony overlooking the lake and the pool. The lights in the showers didn’t work – we informed reception but nothing was done about it. Rooms weren't cleaned but towels and sheets were changed. LOCATION 3/5 We came to Orlando for Universal, which is a bit of a trek on the bus (50 mins on the way back on the 6.55 or 7.30 bus but 25 mins on the 8.20 bus (one less stop). 20 min self-drive but pay for parking. Close to Sea World and Disney. SERVICE 1/5 Katie, who checked us in, was fabulous. Very friendly and helpful, and gave us a late check-out 1pm (cf 11am). However, we received a message on our last night reminding us to check out at 11am. We enquired with reception who confirmed our late check out. Housekeeping knocked on our door FOUR times between 8am and 12.50pm to ask when we were leaving, and we returned from the pool wet and cold to find that we had been locked out of our room at 11am. Nobody explained that the keys are automatically deactivated at 11am on day of departure. Maria was very unapologetic and actually quite impolite. She was complaining about other staff in the presence of guests. On checkout, we again were served by Maria so I waited for her to ask how our stay was in order to redeem herself, but she was again rude to us. VERDICT 3/5 The attitude of one particular staff member lets this place down.. Unfortunately Maria ruined our experience and her frown is etched in my mind as my parting memory. I will choose another resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goggles38
Reviews.Content: The Hotel provided exactly what we needed. We were a group of 10 people so a little space was a good thing. We rented two 3 bedroom suites and found them to be more than enough room for all of us. I looked at a lot of places for this trip and this was the best value by far for what you got. The pool was good and the transportation to the parks was easy and reliable. Just remember to add your name to the list a day before. The pool on the property was large and great for kids and adults alike. Food at the little poolside bar was good. Overall very happy we picked the Floridays. If I had one complaint it was that they did not provide complimentary coffee in the rooms. They gave you a couple packs to start but did not replenish if you used them. A really small gripe at that.

Reviews.Title: “Multi Generation Family = Perfect”
Reviews.Author: WildBlueYonderWife
Reviews.Content: Our party ranged in ages 3 -67. I knew after a full day at the parks everyone would need their “space”. The property was perfect for just that. The youngest and oldest could nap while the rest of us enjoyed a movie in the living room. I will admit I was a little leery when I was quoted such a low rate and all the amenities that were provided. We were so pleasantly surprise! Clean, professional and relaxing! This property needs to share their formula of success with Disney Resorts. Even with paying for a rental car & $14 dollars a day to park at Disney we came out money ahead. Publix grocery& Walgreens right around the corner to stock the fridge. Bottom line Trip Advisor came through again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Robin R
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best place for a family to stay. The two bedroom suite had everything we needed and more! The location was great and easy to get to. I read several reviews that influenced my decision and was very pleased! I will definitly stay here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: dave5400
Reviews.Content: There were two of us, but I booked a 2 BR suite anyway, just for the spaciousness, as we stayed four nights. Beautiful landscaping, wonderful pool, patio with sliding door, screened in, with overhead fan on patio area, wonderful bar and grill right next to the swimming pool---very accomodating suite with kitchen, refrigerator, washer and dryer, two bathrooms, of course this is the two bedroom suite, but I would advise it even for a couple, if you are staying more than just a couple of nights---the only minor drawback was that this resort, like any Florida resort, I assume, has a 12 dollar a night resort fee, plus a sales tax, naturally---the point is that the 115.00 a night was of course not 115.00 a night, and be careful if you add drinks and dining onto your room tab.....BUT, even with the extra charges, I would stay at Floridays anytime and for any reason. We highly recommend it to anyone, singles, couples, groups. Just figure that the room rate is not the end of the story when you add up your budget for your nights here---add a few more dollars, but still well worth it. This is one of the best places we've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel - close to some attractions.”
Reviews.Author: product-of-canada
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for families with kids. We were in a large suite with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, kitchen, family room, and balcony. The sofa in the family room area is a sofa-bed, providing another bed if needed (which we did for the kids). We stayed in the second bedroom that was immediately adjacent to the hallway (with a window to the hallway), which was a bit noisey in the evening. We go to bed early, and we could often hear families with loud kids walking by as we were trying to sleep. I needed earplugs. We were also close to the elevators, so you could even hear them being used. This hotel was close to a couple of sights, including: a helicopter ride attraction practically across the street; Sea World; Orlando Premium Outlets on Vineland Ave. The latter outlet was our favourite shopping destination in Orlando, and it's less than a 5-minute drive away from this hotel. Although it's not as big as the Prime Outlets in Orlando, I found it had a better selection, it was less sprawling, less busy, and more importantly, had better prices. For you Canadians out there, it also has a Lululemon outlet store.

Reviews.Title: “perfect holiday hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AlanBai
Reviews.Content: When i reached the hotel, i realised i left my passport on the plane and immediately the staff called the airport and the airline and located my passport for me. They even wrote down the contacts for me in case i needed them. They advised and ensured that i will be able to retrieve my passport on the departure date. They are all well-trained, polite, friendly and helpful! Perfect! The hotel room we stayed was the 2-bedroom suite. Spacious, well-equipped and clean! Bathtub was included too. 5 of us stayed over and we are all satisfied with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: jjandhb
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week in building D, 5th floor, two-bedroom two bathroom suite. Room was very quiet and comfortable. Location is central to all theme parks - no more than 20 minutes from lot to lot by car. Publix supermarket is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Mauricio C
Reviews.Content: Exelent rooms, good housekeeping and location. Staff very effective in problem solving.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - The highlight of our month long holiday”
Reviews.Author: Dianne D
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 travelling to Florida from Australia. We stayed at Floridays for 11 nights late September after previously staying for 5 nights at a Disneyworld Resort in one tiny little room. We opened the front door to our 3 bedroom unit at Floridays and nearly cried for joy at the huge amount of space awaiting us. The kitchen and washer/dryer were a godsend, The Publix is a short walk away and we ate breakfast and dinner in our unit every day. The I-Ride trolley is just out the front and is very handy to get to Seaworld, Wet n Wild, Ripley's, Wonderworks and the Premium Outlet Mall. The resort shuttle bus is very useful too and it's free. The pool is beautiful and the kids really enjoyed the poolside games. The staff were all very helpful and all guests were really friendly. I would highly recommend this place to families. It's really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “we will never stay anywhere else again”
Reviews.Author: dozy_11
Reviews.Content: it was perfect for a family -we have a teen and a toddler and we all loved it - lots of space - spotless - staff were unbelievably nice helpful and friendly - couldn't do any more for us rooms were huge - relaxing and even without a car it was perfect for public transport aswell as courtasy coaches -

Reviews.Title: “A terrific value”
Reviews.Author: AngelifeDecorate1
Reviews.Content: This resort is a great value for a large party of travelers. The kitchen area was great for breakfast and dinners. We put dinner in the slow cooker (which we packed and brought to Floridays) and it was ready for us when we got back from the parks. We stayed in a two bedroom suite with our children and grandkids. The master bath was perhaps the largest master bath I've ever been in! We could have fit the crib in there! lol The inside (master bedroom and guest bedroom) were both a tad dark. Front desk help were friendly and made us smile. Disney parks were seven miles away, and parking at Disney was another $15 or so. Overall, we found Floridays to be a great value and I would do it again. The pool area was great for the kids, and the hot tub felt good to our sore muscles! We had two (maybe three) issues - the toilet gave us trouble so we had to phone the front desk for that, and help arrived in about an hour or so. Also, one of the lightbulbs was out in the living room, we phoned the front desk, and they were up in 5 minutes! The mattresses were too soft for our preference. Might be time for the resort to replace them.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: Catherine O
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find out the maid service is an EXTRA charge and the only service included in our room fee is pick up trash and change towels. There was black mold in the shower and the staff did not leave the correct amount of towels or a bath mat most of the 7 days we spent there. I would NOT recommend this resort as they give the least amount of service and feel customer service should be an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “extra fees charged”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: When we checked out of the hotel, we were charged $11.25 plus tax for a "RESORT FEE". This fee was charged every day during our stay! This was not a tax, but for the starter coffee, self serve parking, WiFi at the pool and lobby, and replenishing of in room amenities. The starter coffee was for one regular and one decaf and one tea bag on the first day and was never replenished. Our "amenities" were replenished only once during our stay. We were charged this fee each day! They basically increased the room rate we had agreed upon and paid for in advance. I felt cheated, however, the staff is trained very well to explain very politely how they cheat you even though their being polite comes off as phony!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay any place else in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: H S
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip this year to the resort, and to be honest we cannot imagine staying anywhere else. The pool is excellent to cool off in all day long, with very long pool hours (7am to 10pm) which is ideal when you return from the parks. There are always available lounge chairs for those that don't want to go into the water, and the bar/cafe are just steps away. The suites are a huge amount of space for the money you are paying. They do not make you feel cramped in the least bit, even if you choose the smaller of the two options. The full kitchen allows you to cook some meals in, instead of always having to eat out. And the washer and dryer are a godsend, especially when we all know how hot and sticky it gets in Florida! Final comment is on the location - it is on International Drive (the good and safe end of it) and is only minutes away from Sea World, Disney, Aquatica and the major highways. This place is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Floridays Resort”
Reviews.Author: mikmcl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays for three nights in October. We had a two bedroom suite which provided more than enough room for 5 of us. We ended up putting our two little ones in their own bedroom and our older daughter slept on the pull out coach. We had the large bedroom and master bath. After coming back from the parks or pool it was nice to have 3 TV's to watch while winding down before bed. The rooms were very clean, housekeeping did a great job and the kitchen had everything we needed. If anyone is considering the Disney resorts and they have a group larger than 4 people they may want to consider Floridays. The suites come with a full kitchen and are extremely large. We never felt like we were on top of each other like we are in other hotels. The pool is very nice and the desk staff and concierge service were excellent. The only complaint I can think of is that they ran out of coffee one morning for our room. It does not give you a luxury hotel experience like you might get at some of the 5 star resorts but it is the best place around for a family hotel outside the parks. I will definitely plan on returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed all the times I've stayed there!”
Reviews.Author: Rosin314
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time staying at Floridays and I am never disappointed. I will be staying there again in November with my family and it will be their first time at Floridays. I know they will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for the money”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays last week (October 2011)......it was very nice and comfortable. Pool was very clean, rooms are clean and well taken care of. Staff was friendly and accommodating. No complaints, I would stay again. The only issue I had was that our washer somehow overflowed from the wall connection (we hadn't yet used it), so on the last day when I planned to do the laundry before we moved from Disney to the beach with our 4 very young children, I could not do any laundry. Stuff happens, no big deal, but I think they should have accommodated us in some way. We didn't discover the problem until 11:00 PM when we returned from Disney, so repair at that hour with our kids trying to sleep was out of the question. We checked out the next morning at 10. I feel we shoud have been financially compensated in some way (even if it was just the reimbursement of the $12 resort fee for our stay since we weren't able to use all ammenities in our room) but no......all we got was an "I'm so sorry!" from the desk person. Not really acceptable to me. Anyone travelling for 2 weeks with young children understands the need to do laundry! We specifically booked a resort with laundry for our time in Disney because we knew we'd need it before travelling to a cottage on the beach. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays is an excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyX5
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd visit to Floridays. The property is beautiful, the pool is great to cool off in and for the kids to play. The suites are like your own apartment complete with washer and dryer which allows you to pack less for your trip! We bought breakfast foods at the Publix around the corner and ate every morning in our suite. I would definitely stay at Floridays on any future trips to Orlando. If I could find any fault, it would be that it is not gated, so anyone could come on property which could be concerning since the doors to the suites lead directly outside. All in al I still give it a 5. We stayed on Disney property also during this trip at an upper class resort and preferred the suites at Floridays!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay for extended vacation”
Reviews.Author: Melanie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks at Floridays Resort on our first trip to FL ... Family of four. I was very nice, clean, new - really an amazing value. The pool area was nice and clean. The workers were all helpful, especially at check-in. We liked having the extra space - kitchen area - so we didn't have to eat out as much. It is also very conveniently located ... Near a grocery store, drug store, lots of places to eat - plus it was only minutes from SeaWorld / Discovery Cove. It was about 20 minute drive to Disney - but a very easy drive. We found our way around very quickly because of the location on I-drive. We had looked at many different possible locations online, but we were so happy with the stay at Floridays. If you want to be close to the pool, ask for building B or C. The only slightly negative comment is that the beds were not the most comfortable I have ever slept in ... Not horrible - but not like 'home' either.

Reviews.Title: “good tripadvise !”
Reviews.Author: thomasmarkerttt
Reviews.Content: went here because of trip advisor ratings. nice place, located near all the attractions. friendly staff, good concierge, nice pool, good wi-fi... all good ! only thing to point out is that there is no full room service... they make up beds and bring new towels... fair enough will probably come again next year !

Reviews.Title: “Un clean - dead snake at the parking corner in building A”
Reviews.Author: kmideg
Reviews.Content: The location was good, the rooms also , however the bed covers were dirty and had blood spots on them. I asked the fron desk to change them but they didn't take action , the lady honestly at the front desk didn't care and gave me a bad look. The guest room ciling (roof) start leaking water drops on the bed which become more and more within time. I didn't complain this until the check out because I felt that they won't care and the master room with the living room were enough for us. On the road at the parking in the corner look at the ground you will see a dead snake been sequeezed by cars may be, my kids scared to see it even dead and wanted to leave the resort, I was lucky they saw it on the final night.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic resort!”
Reviews.Author: Leezerpeezer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights in Floridays in Sept/Oct 2011. This is a fantastic resort. The apartments were very comfortable and spacious. They were absolutely spotless and had everything we needed for our stay. The pool areas were lovely and were generally nice and quiet. The hotel is situated on International Drive and so is accessible to everything. There is a trolley service which goes up and down International Drive and there is a stop just outside the hotel. However, we would recommend a car to go places as the trolley can take a long time as it stops in most of the hotels on the way down. The staff in Floridays were very helpful and friendly and we booked all our theme park tickets at the Concierge's Desk which was really convenient and good value. We couldn't recommend this resort enough. While there were only two of us, the apartments would be ideal for famillies.

Reviews.Title: “will never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa W
Reviews.Content: Came here for a girls weekend with 4 other women, got the 3BR suite and it was MORE than enough room, everyone had a bed and the couch was still available! Shuttle is good, though with kids would recommend your own car just for convienence, they do not run every hour, just a few times a day, for adults this is fine but with a fussy kid I wouldnt want to wait! Do NOT be late picking up the shuttle at the parks, they cannot wait for you! The grounds are beautiful, the pool is great and has a nice kids area! I was amazed at how quite this place was! The suite we were in was clean and beautiful! Fully applianced! TV's everywhere! The price is amazing for what you get! Was recommended by my best friend who traveled with me on this trip, she had stayed previously with her sister and children, and will not stay anywhere else! I can't imagine staying anywhere else either... especially with my kids... why would you pay MORE for just a hotel room with a sink when you could have all this! I will say I understand the lure of the Disney properties, I have stayed there many times myself, but people I am telling you this is SO worth it! The kids will get plenty of Disney by being at the parks trust me they only care about water, not that the pool is shaped like a Disney princess! From having stayed at the Disney properties, most people take the shuttles and there is always a wait, just rent a car and bring a GPS you are only 5-10min from the parks staying here and the value is great, more $$$ to spend at the parks! There is a Publix right down the street so get yourself some groceries and make your own breakfast and keep snacks handy and it will save you some $$$ , you can even reheat anything later you bring home from dinner! They also have a grocery delivery service, though we didn't use it, where you can have your groceries for when you get there, this would be huge even if you just used it for diapers and stuff so you didn't have to pack it! Washer and dryer in unit, my plan is to pack 1/2 the clothes when I bring the family and wash mid week, cutting my packing in 1/2! I am not someone who normally fills this stuff out but I will tell you, I was so impressed I had to! So totally worth it! Hint, if you have kids, the A and B buildings are closer to the pool/cafe/front desk and shuttle. The closer you get to the F building which is the farthest away, the quieter it will be (think business trip or honeymoon) but it is a walk to the front and the pool from here, we drove our car and parked closer to the front, however this might be difficult during prime time, we were here off season! If you need the Disney experience I understand I've done it myself, enjoy paying for it though! For those of you like me who are on a budget and / or like the most bang for your buck and like to feel like you are at home, with all the amenities included, stay here and save yourself a lot of $$ and hassel!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice family resort at reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromNJ2
Reviews.Content: Great value for families at a very nice new resort on Inernational Drive, not far from Disney. We had a three bedroom condo the last week of September. Very tastefully decorated with jacuzzi tub in master suite and a king bed. Two bedrooms on the other end of condo, each with two full beds, and sharing a bathroom with a double vanity and shower. Fully stocked kitchen with granite countertops (includes dishwasher, microwave, plates, glasses, silverware, cookware, coffeemaker, etc.), apartment-sized washer and dryer, large dining table with glass top in separate dining area, nice living area with flat screen TV, regular TVs in bedrooms, and balcony. Resort is about five years old and very reasonably priced. Maid provides clean towels each day, empties the trash, and makes beds. You can pay extra for full maid service but if you straighten and wipe up as needed, that shouldn't be necessary. We had a little problem getting enough towels and a few other things for the room but when we called the front desk, someone from Housekeeping brought what we needed right to our room and Guest Services called afterwards to confirm we got what we requested. Very large, beautiful pool area. There is an adjacent cafe where you can get coffee, breakfast, lunch, etc. and various supplies you might need. Outdoor pool bar too. Game room for kids and a small exercise room. Staff was very friendly. Only downside is business center. It's run by an outside firm and you have to pay via a machine to use the computer for a certain number of minutes and pay 75 cents a page to print from it. It's frustrating to use and I would advise against trying to print your airline boarding passes -- that would probably run you 10 bucks for a family of four. This area of International Drive is still not real developed but there are drug stores, gas stations, a grocery store and similar businesses just down the road. If you turn right out of the resort and then turn right on Vineland, there are lots of popular chain restaurants. There is also a Benihana that shares the parking lot with Floridays. There seemed to be very good security patrolling the property at night. Good news for folks from the Philadelphia area -- there was a sign advertising a Wawa coming soon nearby!!! I think Floridays is a great value for families in particular. Nice, new, convenient to Disney and other attractions, and super-reasonably priced. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend Floridays!”
Reviews.Author: Sinns88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family and boyfriend. It was a fantastic location (recommended to us by our tour operator). We had a 3 bedroom apartment for 6 of us - and there was so much room! There were 2 double beds in each of the twin rooms and a massive king size bed in my parents room. Our bathrooms were huge with 2 sinks and a spacious shower. There was a kitchen with plenty of room, big fridge, washer/dryer, oven, microwave, kettle etc. Each room had a tv with all the channels, and the sitting room had a large couch and a bigger tv. Our room was cleaned thoroughly everyday - and it was properly cleaned with huge amounts of towels, new soap, vaccuumed and polished everyday. Reception were very friendly and helpful as it was our first time in Orlando. Pool was usually quiet as there's so much to do during the day. We only spent 2 days out of 10 by the pool but it was nice and quiet with plenty of room to relax. We would definitey recommend getting a car as there's so much to do and see in Orlando and the Floridays is down the quieter end of International Drive (which is good if you want to get sleep!). I would recommend this resort for families, couples, older couples, young people etc. Still can't get over the size of the apartment!!

Reviews.Title: “Florida Mall and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smithmb
Reviews.Content: What a great visit! From the staff at the Registration desk to the Staff at the local resturant, We have no complants!

Reviews.Title: “I WILL SCREAM IT FROM S MOUNTAINTOP...FLORIDAYS IS THE BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: Titabita
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely breathtaking! The accommodations, views, and staff customer service were by far the BEST out there. DO NOT waste your money staying somewhere else. I was a little hesitant at first because the suites were so inexpensive. I could not believe what I received for that per night cost. I will tell you...LUXURY! LUXURY! LUXURY! I felt like royalty at Floridays. The staff are the best. My family and I got "geographically misplaced" in this tourist town and the concierge assured our safe return to the hotel. I was so happy to be so well tended to. I say all this because someone helped me decide through reviews. Hopefully this knowledge will assist you with making the right (I mean ONLY) choice. Happy Trails....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value - comfortable with lots of space and central location”
Reviews.Author: EliseWilkinson
Reviews.Content: Floridays is an amazing value for the money. Wow, we got an incredibly spacious 3 bedroom/2 bath condo (approx 1100 sf) for $143/night with balcony. Master bedroom had king bed and a large bathroom with separate shower and jacuzzi tub. Other two bedrooms had two queens and shared a large bathroom with shower. All beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows. Individually controlled a/c. Full kitchen with granite counters, fridge, stove, microwave, and dishwasher. Stacked washer/dryer in unit. Lots of utensils, glasses and dishes. Cookware is limited, so I recommend checking what is available before you plan your meals (for instance, no large pot to boil pasta for 2-3 people, and only small frying pan). Customer service is excellent. Any question we had was cheerfully answered. The concierge went out of his way to print e-tickets for us. Every need was met (and followed up on by the front desk). Except for housekeeping, the customer service exceeded every expectation. I can understand why previous reviewers are disappointed with housekeeping. Here is what you need to know. Daily housekeeping is limited and includes only making the beds (with existing linens), replacing bathroom towels, and emptying trash. I was prepared for this, so not too disappointed. For short stays this level of service is adequate, but not impressive. The bed-making skills are basic at best - wrinkled sheets, covers a bit askew - but not that big a deal. There is a tiny (and I mean tiny) trashcan in the kitchen that is emptied daily, but no extra trash bags are provided. We found it helpful to save grocery bags to use for kitchen trash as there is just not enough room in that tiny trashcan for even a day's worth of refuse. Providing extra trash bags would be a simple, but very useful addition to housekeeping service. If you stay for a week, or have several kids, you would need to either be prepared to do some extra kitchen and bathroom cleaning or speak to the front desk about paying for extra housekeeping. Two packets of dish washing detergent and one packet of laundry detergent (nice unexpected touch) were provided. The main pool is very large, clean and nice and includes a hot tub area (6-8 people). There is a pool bar (which I didn't try), but we brought our own adult beverages from the room and no one questioned us. Plenty of towels at the pool (thin quality, but decent size). Plenty of chairs. There is also a second smaller pool at the back of the complex near building F. The main pool also has a small gym and a game room (limited video games and air hockey table). This is a large complex with 6 buildings. A is the closes to the main pool, F is the furthest away. We were in F. On the plus side, it is nice and quiet (away from International Drive). The downside is the long trip to main pool and entrance/exit of the resort. We had a lake view. I would not have accepted a room in this building with a view of the parking lot (far away and bad view would not be worth it). The smaller pool near building F is fine for some and borders on a man-made lake. However, if you have kids, or if you want access to a pool bar, you will need to go to the main pool. You can either walk (10+ min) or drive. The drive from building F to exit the premises was the only annoying thing about our stay. It is not a direct drive. You hit multiple speed bumps, stop signs and turns. It gets really old after a few days. This is a planning problem that the resort could solve by paving a back exit to International Drive. Resort is 10-15 min from the Disney parks; 5 min from Sea World/Aquatica; 10-15 min from Universal. Great central location. Resort provides park shuttles, which we didn't use since the times didn't fit our plans. Parking at Floridays is "free" as is WIFI. But, really its included in the mandatory $12/day resort fee. WIFI worked very well in our room. Overall, a great value for money. Clean and comfortable with a great central location. We will return here for our next Orlando vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We will always stay here in Orlando area!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays 4 years ago when they first opened and loved it then...this time was even better than before! The full kitchen, washer/dryer and spaciousness of unit is a must when travelling with kids. It is so close to the major attractions and other conveniences! The entire resort was well maintained. The staff went above and beyond for us. When we requested a change of sheets when we first arrived (my youngest spilled something within 5 minutes of arrival) they did it promptly. My 8 year old asked the front desk if a cart could drive us to the pool area from our building, and they were there in 5 minutes with a smile. I will only stay at Floridays when I am in the Orlando area from now on...

Reviews.Title: “Could live there”
Reviews.Author: meatybite
Reviews.Content: Check in/out was a breeze. Loved the room (it is an apartment). Full kitchen with stove, microwave, dishwasher, fridge and all cutlery & crockery. It is only about a 10 minute walk to the Publix supermarket so it was nice to have some more home-style meals in our room rather than eating out all the time. We did get a bit sick of the food at the hotel (quality is fine but limited choice). There is a Benihana near the hotel car-park that was just fantastic (the chef cooks in front of you and puts on a great show). The apartment also had a 6 person dining table, lounge area with flat screen TV and balcony. We had the 2 bedroom apartment which also has 2 bathrooms (1 with corner spa). Everything was very clean. Having a washer & dryer was just fantastic as we were travelling light and washing often. The pool area is just wonderful and we struggled to get our 11yo out of it. We were only there for 6 days and spent 4 at Disneyworld and 2 at Universal. Take my tip and book extra days just to enjoy this wonderful RESORT! The only downside of our stay was the transportation to/from the theme parks. There are limited times to/from Disneyworld and they only go to Epcot. It can then take you a while to use Disneyworld transport (bus, monorail or boat) to the other "worlds". There were more bus times to/from Universal. The bus services a number of hotels so be warned that the trip can take a while (best was 25 minutes and worst nearly an hour). We were also disappointed that despite being booked on a bus one day (as they insist), the bus left without us. The concierge said we were late by 2 minutes but my watch said we were dead on time. Since we were booked for the bus, couldn't they have waited 2 minutes for us? It then cost us $30 to get a taxi to the theme park.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cross River, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Floridays confirms all positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: Joshua F
Reviews.Content: We booked with Floridays due to all the positive reviews and we were not disappointed. The resort is close to all the major parks (only a 10-15 minute drive door to door). The pool area was well maintained. The staff were always courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CMc9_26
Reviews.Content: After reading the amazing reviews for this hotel, we booked a 2 night stay while in Orlando. This hotel lives up to its reputation. It was one of the best places we have ever stayed, and we can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “shame”
Reviews.Author: ippyi
Reviews.Content: second stay here and its a shame they let the cleaning slip. maybe they have made cut backs on staff or maybe they just have bad supervision but the carpet was so bad that we had to wear shoes all the time and not let the baby on the floor at all. had to ask three times for towels one day. such a shame because location is great, price not bad and style of rooms good.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be close to but not on the parks for a bit of peace and quiet, this is for you”
Reviews.Author: rjs121
Reviews.Content: We drove from Miami to Orlando to stay for a few days to meet up with some friends and wanted to be close to the action but with some peace and quiet. This location was spot on for us. Floridays is on International Drive next to a Hilton resort and amongst others of similar ilk. It was easy to find and there was plenty of parking. Checking in was easy and the welcome was warm. The directions to the room in one of the five buildings were clear. We were very impressed with the size of the room and the way that all the facilities were incorporated. It was clean and tidy. We can't comment on the cafe or the pools as we didn't use either although the cafe looked very reasonably priced. It would be difficult to stay here without a car. The shuttle service to the parks was more limited than we expected. There were also more charges for the business centre than we expected for e.g.printing boarding passes. We didn't experience too much noise and the bedrooms are furthest away from the general corridors but I'm not convinced, when full, there wouldn't be more disturbance. Overall however this was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in orlando”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: Floridays is an amazing place to stay in orlando. You have everything from a fully equipped kitchen to an amazing hot tub in the master bedroom. The overall appeal of the property is very tropical in nature and puts you in vacation mode immediately. The rooms are large and clean, well stocked with all you need to cook .WIFI is every where on site and the two pools are awesome . The location is perfect 5 minutes to disney and sea world and 15 minutes from Universal.And the prices for a 3 bedroom are a steal,especially in sept. oct. and november. Will definitely stay again and soon!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Amsta
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying 8 days at Floridays. This was my 4th time at this resort we have been very happy with it. The location is great- very close to Seaworld & also to Disney. It's on the quiet end of International and there is a grocery store very close- within walking distance. We drive from Atlanta so we've never taken the shuttle that they offer so I cannot comment on that. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. They have everything that you will need. It also has a washer/dryer which is very nice when you have small children and want to pack light. I always ask for the same building and they always accommodate this for me. We always have a very good experience at Floridays and will always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Can I live here forever?”
Reviews.Author: advantage2000
Reviews.Content: If you pay those outrageous prices for those run down hotels at dizney then you're a fool. I'm amazed at the level of quality here at such a low price. I'm still waiting for " the catch".

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Maria A
Reviews.Content: Floridays is an amazing home away from home! YOu have everything from a fully equiped kitchen to an amazing hot tub on the master bedroom. The overall appereance of teh property is in excellent shape and teh staff is very friendly and courteous. They really made my birthday trip an amazing one!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort!”
Reviews.Author: Deanarn80
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough about how wonderful this place is- loved it :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: stephanie f
Reviews.Content: Our experience here was fantastic! They let us check in early, as soon as we arrived. The bell service was great, he took our luggage to our room, showed us around the room and then later gave us a short ride to the end of the property to show us the path to the grocery store. The room is awesome. Perfect for a family and all of their needs. Washer and dryer, dishwasher, stove, everything. We bought groceries at the nearby publix and saved a ton of $$ on eating out. The bathrooms are absolutely beautiful and on the one night that it rained my son had just as much fun in the huge jacuzzi tub. The pool was lovely and the bar was very reasonably priced with great tasting drinks. The value is just amazing. This was a third of the price of the on site hotel we stayed at for Universal with 4x the amenities. The only thing I would do different is rent a car. The shuttle services to the parks get you there but aren't always very convenient, and the car that they called for our ride to the airport was GROSS. Smelled like smoke and had blood.....yes blood, on the ceiling. Not their fault but I am not so sure they should call those same taxis anymore! In the end I would return to Floridays for a winter get-away even if I wasn't planning to go to the parks because the stay there alone was wonderful! Thanks for the extended hours for a free late checkout too! Kept us from sitting in the airport for a few extra hours!

Reviews.Title: “Three bedroom suite was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Donna Y
Reviews.Content: Plenty of room for my husband & I, our two daughters and their husbands, and a two year old grandson. Clean, comfortable, very homey; had everything we needed. Full kitchen, good internet, nicely decorated. We all had a lot of fun in the pool, waterjet playscape, and whirlpool. Can't think of any negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Romantic, 1st Class, Close to Everything, Family Freindly”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Wow, This was the most wonderful stay that my wife and I have had since our honeymoon at the Biltmore Estate Resort in Ashville NC. The Room was so clean, beautiful Architecture and Interior decorating, the Kitchen was 1st class with granite counters and full service. We ordered up romantic desert and it was fabulous and the Staff was super friendly and accomidating. We loved our romantic getaway and it was close to everything within 10 minutes. We plan to bring our children back and stay at the same place. Thank You Floridays! 10 out of 10 Sincerely, Amy and Jimmy

Reviews.Title: “Excelent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Erick M
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious, comfortable and clean. It has everything you need like your own apartment (specially in the kitchen). Everything works well. The room was cleaned every day. Beds were a little too soft though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Whole Family!”
Reviews.Author: LizzWilson86
Reviews.Content: We are the type of family that loves to play together, and we loved our stay at Floridays Resort Orlando, especially the kitchen. We enjoyed making dinner together and even baked a home-made cake for our birthday girl! It was a great deal when packaged with our Universal tickets. What a special treat not to be stuffed like sausages in a tiny hotel room. The last time we stayed in Orlando four years ago, we stayed at a Universal resort close to the park. That hotel was plesant and the Tiki theme was cute, and we took advantage of the Luau. But, our room there had no charm whatsoever and it really put a damper on our fun. There were two adults and two kids and the room was so tiny we could barely move about without banging into furniture. We were miserable, and didn't sleep well at all. We woke up sore, crabby and stiff. You could tell the room was designed to motivate families OUT of the room and into the $$$ areas of the hotel and park. WHAT A DIFFERENCE AT FLORIDAYS RESORT!! From the minute we pulled in, we were impressed with how beautiful and well-kept the grounds were. We felt like we were at someplace more exotic than Orlando, that's for sure, and the break from the commercialism that is the life-blood of Orlando was a welcome relief. The kids were so excited to see the size of the room and really enjoyed the beautiful swimming pool! We were able to live comfortably during our visit, just like we were at home. There were five of us this time, four adults and one teen, and all of us had our own private space and our own TV. We could really kick back and BREATHE! Even the happiest of families need to spread out a little bit after being jammed into an airplane seat for a few hours, then packed into a rental car and cozied up on rides all day, right? The jacuzzi was heaven after a long day enjoying ourselves at Universal, and being able to relax at a real dining room table over a reasonably-priced, self-cooked dinner was divine. I felt like we were living a month of Sundays! We want to stay at Floridays Resort every time we visit Universal from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: mel100204
Reviews.Content: Easy drive to anywhere in Disney world. Close to restaurants and outlets. We had a 3 bdrm suite and it was perfect for our family of 5. We will definitely return. Building F is kind of far from the main pool, which was perfect for kids, but we had an easy walk right around the corner to the other pool. The only issue I have was that we could hear everything going on from the suite upstairs. When they opened their sliding door it was like opening ours. We could hear their conversations and could even hear them every time they heated something up in the microwave. It wouldn't have been a huge problem but it was from 2:30am to about 4 am one night. We never heard our neighbors next door. We will definitely stay here again, we will just ask for the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “second visit at Floridays was a good value for the quality and great location”
Reviews.Author: JudyWellsHicks
Reviews.Content: The location is central to everything. Large rooms with a tastefully yet subtle color theme throughout. Well maintained. My husband's favorite location( resort) in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 449Jenny
Reviews.Content: This resort is awesome everthing you could wish for and more. The apartment had 2 large bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and large kitchen with everthing you needed and more. View overlooking the pool. Friendly and very helpful staff, good shuttle service to all the parks. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle580
Reviews.Content: Following a 1 night stay at a Cocoa Beach hotel, we spent the next 9 nights at Floridays. We couldn't have imagined anything better. We would highly recommend this resort to anyone & would stay here again. We stayed in Bldg B in a 2 bedroom/2 bath. Our teenage son enjoyed having his own room & tv. We enjoyed our bedroom with a very comfortable bed & nice bathroom, including jacuzzi tub. Shopped for groceries just around the corner at the Publix supermarket & loved having the kitchen. I used the washer/dryer almost daily to keep up with our laundry. Enjoyed time by the pool as well. The rooms are clean & quiet. Customer service & the amenities are great. Even though we had a rental car, we did take advantage of shuttles going to Universal, Seaworld, & Disney. Great place & great value for what you pay for. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: OakBay1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Floridays on 2 seperate occasions in the 2 bedroom suite. The suites are large (although a little tight to get around the dining table). There are 2 full bathrooms and the second bedroom had 2 double sized beds. There are 3 tvs and a fully stocked kitchen as well as a washer/dryer (which so helpful) The resort is located on the quieter end of International Drive and close to everything that you will need. There is a grocery store just down the block and you are very close to outlet shopping, seaworld and aquatica. you can get onto the highway 4 easily and it's a quick trip to Universal Studios or Disney. We loved the following resturants: Magginos, Bahama Breeze and the Latin Quarter at Universal City Walk. This resort makes it easy to get anywhere you need to go. The resort pool is large and nicely kept. They do have a small arcade and small sundries store and offer food for purchase. You can also rent movies for the night to recover from your busy day! We will book again at Floridays and enjoy the service they provide. The rooms are clean and the grounds are well maintained. You can also get really great prices for being a facebook friend.

Reviews.Title: “we plan on staying again next spring!”
Reviews.Author: Bridgette Z
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel, it was like having our own condo... the bedrooms were so comfortable and clean, the balcony had a beautiful view, it is close to Publix supermarket so we did a lot of shopping for meals and snacks. The staff is very helpful and so kind, we loved all of them! They are so accomodating. They have 2 pools that were both very nice. I can't wait to stay here again next year :)

Reviews.Title: “Deceived by the photos posted on the web”
Reviews.Author: cynthiatanps
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked the Floridays Resort Orlando for our holiday for 4 nights in sep, just a couple of weeks ago. We picked that resort among the others that we have researched on as we were impressed with the photos posted, besides, the rental charge is reasonable. In actual, the resort is more run down. Lightings in the apt is pretty dim. Furniture is also old, a few of my friends were bitten, not sure if it was bed bugs...help! A broken glass was not replaced- my friend had a cut while washing it We were disappointed that the house cleaning did not provide floor - mat in the toilet until we tip her. Isn't this basic provision?

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: apiffer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Floridays with my wife and daughter, and the place is fantastic, the staff is very kindly and the place is clean and comfortable. The localization is perfect for who wants to go to Disney parks, and for the shoppers the hotel is less than one mile of Premiun outlet. I really recommend floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Lemery Family”
Reviews.Author: Lemery6
Reviews.Content: Great!!! We loved it. We are definitely staying here again next time we come to Orlando!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Place”
Reviews.Author: michellemybell85
Reviews.Content: This place exceeded all my expectations! The only thing that didn't work were the jets in the jacuzzi tub but not important at all to me. Kitchen was FULLY stocked (minus the food) with everything you need. Comfy beds, roomy patio, everything was great. I found Floridays to be in a great location. We only had a short drive to Disney, Universal, and Downtown Disney, minimal traffic on this end of international drive and located to where you can completley avoid I-4 to get to where you have to go! This is my new Orlando Hotel and will be staying here from now on. Too many bad experiences at other area hotels and being an annual pass holder there have been many disappointments...how did it take me this long to find this place!?

Reviews.Title: “Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: josie k
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable....pool fantastic very family friendly. Room spacious and plenty of room for our family of 4. Very nice to a little laundry and pack less.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: cinnabun1
Reviews.Content: Once again, Tripadvisor did not fail us. I booked Floridays for our Disney trip based on reviews, location and the price. For a 3 bedroom/2 bathroom suite for 6 nights, it came out to about $167 a night with fees and taxes. You cannot beat that for what you get at this hotel. First of all, like many of the reviewers say, it is the perfect hotel for families with kids (we have little ones). The conveniences of the rooms, the kitchen, the washer/dryer and the sprayground pool is absolutely perfect. The location is perfect too. About 15 mins from everything (including airport, Disney). Seaworld is about 5 mins away. And the supermarket is literally next door. In addition to the pool, they have a game room, exercise room and a little restaurant/store. The service is great, we had a couple minor issues with the stovetop and the door and they came and addressed them right away. They even followed up with a phone call. The staff there is very friendly and helpful. Do not expect a Ritz or a Four Seasons which I have stayed at, but do expect a nice, clean hotel suite with everything that you need and more. We definitely enjoyed our stay there and highly recommend it, especially for large families or families with children!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Family with Small Children”
Reviews.Author: mattnat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay at Floridays over Disney Resorts based on online reviews. I will say that we were NOT disappointed. Travelling with 2 small children (both under the age of 4), we wanted to stay somewhere that we could 1. have the ability to have breakfast and late dinners at the property and 2. not have to go to bed early because the boys fell asleep in the next bed/room at 9pm. Floridays was just what we needed. We were less than 3 miles from Walt Disney World and the shuttle bus got us to Epcot in about 10 minutes. The staff was friendly, courteous, and helpful and made the entire family feel special. The accommodations were beautiful and it was nice to have 2 separate bathrooms/bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room to stretch out in after a long day at the theme parks. The kitchen has everything that you need to make the kiddos breakfast before you head out to the parks and there is a Publix grocery store and Walgreens within walking distance to get everything that you need. The pool is beautiful and the children's area is perfect for letting the little one's play with other children and giving you an opportunity to have adult conversations with those from all over the world. We had a great time meeting a family from the UK and it was nice getting to talk with them. Overall, I would recommend this resort to anyone travelling to the Orlando theme parks and say that if you want to feel that you are "home" during your vacation, choose Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CGlenday
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I loved staying at the hotel. It had really good internet connection, a shuttle to Disney parks and a lovely swimming pool. The best part was the room!!! Big, comfortable, lovely bathroom and bathtub. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, fantastic rates, great value for large families!”
Reviews.Author: Noughton
Reviews.Content: Called Floridays directly after getting special rate offers on their website. Planned to celebrate our grandsons birthday at Disney, Floridays allowed us to access our 3 bedroom suite at 7 m in order to refrigerate the cake and food planned for his big day. They had bumped us UP to the 3 bedroom for the same price as the 2 bedroom too! This is not your typical hotel -- it looks and feels like a luxury town home . Full kitchen, large dining area large beautifully appointed bedrooms and even an outside patio with breakfast table. You can find deals and specials or call them directly and ask for their specials. Defiantly worthwhile for your stay in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Family Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: pryveteye27
Reviews.Content: Located on International Drive close to all attractions. Has shuttle service to parks. The pool is great for kids. Grounds are well kept and have little lakes and fountains. Ducks come up to your door if your on the ground floor which my child loved. The 2 bedroom units are roomy and beautiful. Would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Well Deserved Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rotanda S
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere was absolutely fabulous, beginning at check-in all the way through check out. My guests and I had a wonderful time just relaxing. The bedrooms and bathrooms were bigger than I anticipated and the maid service was very attentive. I enjoyed spending time at the pool with my guests and the Bartender was great and very informative as to what drinks to order. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a vacation or staycation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Judy C
Reviews.Content: The Floridays was a great place to stay if you were visiting all of the different parks and the supermarket was in the next parking lot which was very convenient. The rooms were spacious ... it was like having your own apartment with a great pool.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back”
Reviews.Author: Sandra12316
Reviews.Content: The 3 bedroom 2 bath apartment was very spacious and well equipped. The location is good. Housekeeping should be improved. Excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: FrozenMargNoSalt
Reviews.Content: We're from South Florida and we're in Orlando often. We've tried a number of places and we keep coming back to Floridays. Rates are good if you book far enough in advance. It's great having a condo with 2 kids...they have their own room and we have ours! Kids love the water fountains etc. at the pool and the game room is a big hit for them too!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect with toddlers!”
Reviews.Author: lindsey2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays with two children, 2.5 and 4.5 for a week. Other family members with small children stayed with us as well. We were located in building D which was convenient to the pools we where absolutely perfect for the 7 kids 6 and under in our group! The 3 bedroom 2 bath apartment was adequately equipped. We stayed in and cooked dinner almost every night. Very much enjoyed having breakfast before going to parks at our convenience in our Pj's in our room. There is a publix grocery store at 2 minute car drive away that we went to nearly daily. The publix also had a good assortment of non grocery items such as pool toys, OTC medicine, sunscreen, etc. Beware of Florida water as in general it has a metallic/sulfur odor which is notable at the hotel, disney parks and everywhere. We all drank and cooked with bottled water. Be prepared. We did not find the staff particularly helpful. This is much more like staying in someone else's condo than a hotel. Don't expect hotel like service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Orientated resort”
Reviews.Author: Dave_and_L
Reviews.Content: A very clean resort both accommodation and public areas. Great pool area for adults and children (secure) with pool towels freely available. Staff very helpful and genuinely pleasant. Nicely situated for all theme parks if travelling by car however free shuttle service available for guests to all parks.Located at the quiet end of International Drive next to junction of Vineland Avenue. Hotel is situated on main bus route along International Drive with a stop right outside the gates. Cost is $ 1.25 per journey per person running every 15 minutes till 10.30pm. Ample parking for residents. There are 5 accommodation blocks A to F, A B C closest to the pool the other blocks gradually further away with block F being a 10 minute walk to the main pool although a small quiet pool was close by. A change of block from F to B was requested and quickly and professionally arranged for us. Block B was ideal for us close to the pool area but still very quiet. A great place for families to stay. Publix supermarket and various other shops including Premier Outlets within a couple of minutes drive or easily walkable and bus service door to door. A must is a visit to Benihana Japanese restaurant right next door for a fantastic meal and fun experience where the food is cooked at your table with tricks included!!! Book a table through the concierge at Floridays and you get a voucher for a free dessert. The Olive Garden Italian and Bahama Breeze Caribbean restaurants on International Drive and Outback Steakhouse on Vineland Avenue are also worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Sheri R
Reviews.Content: We live close-by and just came for a weekend to get away and have the kids play in the pool. The rooms were spacious and there was plenty to do. The kids loved the jacuzzi in the room as well. We would like to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for family with teens!”
Reviews.Author: Meoladee
Reviews.Content: Once your children hit a certain age, hotel rooms just will not do for an extended trip. Floridays was the perfect solution! We had just enough space to spread out for everyone to be comfortable. The pool was great and the small shop was great for quick snacks. Grocery delivery setup via web was a great service! The location was close to all of the parks and we had a wonderful trip as a result. There is a shuttle that you can take but we chose to take a cab since it was so close. The resort does have a cab service right there at the hotel for your convenience but is a few dollars more than a typical yellow cab. Overall great experience and I would recommend them to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nil23
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort. Room: We occupied a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite. Just like the pictures on the website. Soap, shampoo and towels were provided. The couch was also a pull out couch with additional sheets pillows. The kitchen was nice and clean with the following: Fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, spoons, dishwasher, knives, bottle opener, bake ware and Tupperware. They also provide plates and glasses. They also provided coffee and tea on the counter, along with dishwasher and washer dryer cleaning supplies. Yes, the room also had a washer dryer which was nice! Room service was once a day. They provided fresh towels, removed the trash and made the bed. They DO NOT clean dishes. We were more than happy with the room service. Plus we cleaned our own dishes or used the dishwasher. I think they have additional services for a fee but I’m not sure what that was. We were very happy with room service. My only issue was with the décor. I wish that it was a little bit more updated! But regardless of the décor, the resort was excellent. POOL The pool was nice and it had a little kids section which was great. They provided towel at the pool. Right near the pool was a café and bar. The frozen drinks were about $6.50, small pizza was about $8.50, and hot dog meal (w/fruits and juice) was about $7. They also provide a pump to inflate all pool equipment. It is located right in front of the café. FACILITY: Pool, Jacuzzi, workout room, arcade, small bar and café. Location: In a CAR 2-5 minutes– Publix grocery store, Chinese place, sushi (ok), Subway, gas station, Walgreen, CVS etc... 5 minutes– the outlet mall. 150 stores. 10 minutes – Disney marketplace 8 minutes to gift stores, Denny’s and Waffle house. 8-10 minutes - wonderworks. 10-15 minutes to a Sam’s club 10-20 to the Holy Land Experience 10-20 to Disney’s Animal Kingdom 20- 25 to the Airport. It was an easy ride to all location. CUSTOMER SERVICE: The service was great. Everyone was very nice and had a great attitude. Tips: The gas station near the resort offered 2 donuts for a $1, coffee for a $1, etc... For a quick bite. The resort offers high chairs. We requested one for the room. The café also sells some pool equipment and medicine such as Tylenol, etc. The Publix grocery store sells beer and wine. A six pack of Yuengling was only $7. They also have pool equipment and Disney themed gifts. The balloon ride at Disney marketplace is about $18 a person. It goes up about 400ft. It was completely gated so kids can go on it. Not very exciting but something to do. Bongos is a good Cuban restaurant at Disney Marketplace. Animal Kingdom was really nice – About $95 a person. Parking was about $15. $50 to rent an electric scooter for the elderly with $20 deposit. Safari was excellent. Holy land Experience was awesome. – About $35 a person.
