Housekeeping service is VERY VERY minimal, The food by the bar/pool deff need some improvement, it took 35 mins to get an order of chicken fingers & fries, then another 15 mins to get a soda from the bartender. It seemed like the bar & the kitchen wer all a one man show. But overall the property is very clean. Dominick was very helpful A+ for him.

Reviews.Title: “wow, perfect”
Reviews.Author: mylittlerileybear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays for two weeks.The suite was excellent and extremely well equipped.We had a lovely view over the lake. Facillities are excellent,you dont even need to pack towels for the pool as they provide those for you. The food served in the bar is delicious and the bar staff are polite and helpful. The towels were changed daily and the beds made up,you can also pay a little extra for full maid service if you desire. The location is excellent for theme parks and is very close to a shopping outlet mall for those designer clothes and Publix supermarket We had a lovely stay and will definitely go back, it fully deserves all the excellent reviews it has received.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations... but a little over stretched”
Reviews.Author: Eire_10
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Orlando after 8 nights in this very comfortable resort. I decided to stay here based on the good reviews on tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The beds were very comfortable and the jet tub in the master bathroom is a welcome addition after a long day at the theme parks! House keeping were attentive but not intrusive which was fine with me...fresh coffee and clean towels are all I need! The kitchen was reasonably well stocked and the fridge, stove and all appliances were clean and in good working order. It might be nice if there was a separate service area for the laundry carts and garbage collection away from the guest accommodations. We usually had to share the lifts with the housekeeping staff and their large carts,but it wasn't a big issue. We stayed in a two bedroom unit and the layout was great aside from the fact that the children's bedroom was at the front end of the unit and the communal hallway could get noisy at night. We had to call reception at 1am to have something done about a noisy group close to us. They sorted it and it was fine afterward. One of our days was spent at the pool and although the pool itself is clean, warm and the spray park end is great for wee ones there definitely wasn't enough poolside space to accommodate all those there...packed sardines came to mind! Maybe another large pool on the property would be a good idea. The shop/cafe is well stocked and they do a great breakfast sandwich. I wanted to get lunch one day but was told there was a 45 min wait...not good. Maybe more staff at busy times? All in all Floridays is good value for the money and was a lovely base for our family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis210
Reviews.Content: We are grandparents and were traveling with 2 girls 10 & 8 and were very happy with the Floridays resort. We loved the pool area and thought the condo was extremely nice and was well appointed. The TV's in both bedrooms as well as the flatscreen in living area was wonderful. The pool area had plenty of chairs and we could always find one and we were there during spring break!

Reviews.Title: “Finally, the advertising matched the actual.”
Reviews.Author: AustralaiBobjay
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Australia to see the Arnold Palmer Invitational golf tournament and selected Floridays from the web site blurb--this can be risky but not in this case....From the moment we arrived early we were treated professionally and with courtesy . As we are in our mid sixties we were offered assitance on mumerous occasions. Great Area,beautiful supermarket within walking distance ,access to major attractions were easy to obtain by shuttle or cab.Had a fabolous 8 nights there,will return and recommend to our travelling friends. It's a pity some of the Australian service industry people don't copy Floridays staff. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “great room and spectacular service from bellman ray”
Reviews.Author: mrmaitai
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite and it was very nice. plenty of room, full kitchen, washer/dryer, whirlpool tub. we did have a few minor problems, but overall the trip was awesome. bellman ray provided superior service to me and everyone else in my group. had some problems with housekeeping (called for toilet paper and towels and no one ever showed up) and also reserved bus ride to universal and when we went to pick up our pass they did not have any information in reference to our reservation. i would recommend this hotel to friends and family but i would advisw to ask for ray whenever possible.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - great location for parks and in general”
Reviews.Author: flakmagnet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Floridays for two weeks, it was a perfect stay all round. We were lucky enough to have a condo built to hold 6 for the 2 of us! Whilst it could comfortably hold 4, maybe 4 adults and 2 kids, I am unsure as to how well 6 adults would cope there though! The rooms were lovely, clean and tidy, towels changed everyday, though things like having the bed and the other uneccesary extras made only happened once a week unless you paid extra for it (we didn't take that option, we can handle that ourselves!) The location couldn't have been better, on the south end of International Drive (a little south of Sea World) you were at worst 20 mins drive from all the major parks, but with the south end of I-drive being so much quieter than the north, there was no noise pollution etc from the road, it was fantastic! The rooms were equipped with everything we needed, fridge/freezer, cooker, microwave, blender etc, plus a washer and tumble dryer, all of the ammeneties were very useful. The pools were great, even in March, the main pool was a treat to go in and never too cold, and the Spa/Jacuzzi was like stepping into a hot bath, even when it first opened in the morning, fantastic! The staff were great and very friendly, the concierge's desk in particular were very knowledgable and I ended up asking quite a lot of questions of them! The nearest to a downside I can think of is that the free internet access in your room is Ethernet cable only, so if you've not got your laptop, you're out of luck. The business centre's rates are a little high in my opinion, though maybe I just needed to print a lot ($0.75 per sheet for printing seemed a little excessive personally, but it still came in very useful) Fantastic resort, and when we go back to Florida, we will certainly be looking to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: RivBoy5
Reviews.Content: great place, clean,neat everything was great no problems would definitely stay there again and would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Bravo - Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Mo2091
Reviews.Content: Resort - what a resort. I travelled with my family and our 21 month old baby. This resort was just what the doctor ordered. Friendly and responsive staff, professional front desk, requests for additional cooking utensils delivered right away and a call back asking if we received our request (whoa!!), clean and tidy rooms, the swimming pool - my baby daughter's paradise, less than five minutes drive to the premium outlet, and approximately 10 minutes away from Disney. By the third day, my toddler baby knew her way to the swimming pool. She was excited whenever we came back knowing that we would take her back to the pool. This resort was just perfect for value, quality, and service and we are definitely planning to return back to this hidden gem. I have no choice but to give a 3 star for the sleep quality as the bed was soft (imagine a water bed) and not to my preference - but then again, why would I beat up a perfect resort as the rest of the family slept like logs. Two Thumbs Up for you Floridays - you teased our mind and soul and now we hunger to visit Orlando back and flirt with you again (wink). Satisfied Canadian

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for traveling with large family”
Reviews.Author: momof4Indiana
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay from 3/21-3/25 at Floridays. We got a great rate on the 2 bedroom room which was very spacious for our large family(2 adults and 4 kids). It was perfect, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms so we all had space. The kitchen had all the necessities and we cooked breakfast and had sanwiches for lunch or supper depending on our schedule. The weather was cool so we didn't get the chance to experience the pool but it was beautiful. We had no problems at check in or check out, the staff was helpful and friendly. The cleaning ladies were very nice also. The beds were ok but the other positives made the overall experience great. The location was great, near the outlet mall, disney, seaworld, and a grocery store right around the corner. A really great place to stay, we are talking about our next trip already! The only drawback we could find was you had to pay for internet if you used their business center and didn't have a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: FrankFrankly
Reviews.Content: We had a nicely decorated 3 bedroom apartment on the ground floor. There were 4 double beds, a king bed, and a sofa sleeper, a full kitchen, dining and living areas, two large bathrooms, 4 televisions, free wired internet, and maid service. The location is within 5 miles of the Disney, Universal, and Sea World parks. We paid $187.42 a night plus tax. You can't beat that. We had the whole family there: 4 adults, 2 teens, 2 kids. Everyone had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sweettrip4
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at the resort but were checked in right away, we were also given some choices for rooms and decided on bulding B 6th flr, facing the pond (it was very quiet) the rooms were great and were equipt with everyday household items. The only issues I had with the rooms (as some other reviews had said) they could pay a bit more attention to cleanliness, and the beds were a bit hard for our taste. We had lunch at the resort one day and it was good, but slightly expensive. The pool area/grounds were lovely. The resort is very close to attractions/shopping. Overall the resort is very nice and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer hotel than what the cheesy name suggests”
Reviews.Author: cbck2333
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay at Floridays, with my family. We have 3 young children (8, 6, 3), and overall we were fairly happy with our stay. The overall hotel campus area is well-kept and clean, and the pool area was tremendous. The room itself was very spacious, and was perfect for our larger family. My wife and I enjoyed having our own entire room (King) and bathroom, and all 3 kids could have their own shared room. We also appreciated the free shuttle to and from Disney World which we took advantage of on one occasion. The resort is in a good location, very close to Downtown Disney and the Outlet malls and many restaurants. We also took advantage of the supermarket right down the street to stock on some in-room snacks. On the negative side, some minor irritations. Since this is mainly a timeshare facility, we didn't get full housekeeping service each day; the staff really only switched towels, made beds and took out trash. Secondly, on on the first day we had Starbucks coffee in the room, and on the second day it was replaced with Folgers. Kind of cheap for big coffee drinkers. Most importantly, the mattress in the master bedroom was relatively cheap. I wouldn't mark it as the best sleeping I've ever done... Overall however, the positives outweighed the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “If I could give it 10 stars, I would !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PoteauPets
Reviews.Content: Everyone from check in to conceirge was wonderful. The 2 bedroom condo with full kitchen was awesome. We slept like babies in our king size bed, and our nine year old daughter loved her room with two beds and her own T.V. The walls must be super thick and very well insulated because we never heard a peep out of our neighbors. We will most surely stay there again and highly recommend them to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful resort so make sure you read as many reviews as possible to get an acurate picture.”
Reviews.Author: Freedom_Fliers
Reviews.Content: We saw a lot of really good ratings for this resort and we were not disappointed. For an unbelievably low price we had a three bedroom, two bath unit with a kitchen, dining room, living room, balcony, and washer dryer combo. There was a king sized bed in the master bedroom with a large Jacuzzi and walk-in shower in the master bath. There were two double beds and a TV in each of the other two rooms. The kitchen was very well equipped, and since it was just after the holidays, my wife was even able to make a complete turkey dinner for her children and grandchildren who we were visiting and had staying with us. It was very clean and everything looked new. Because the weather was very cold, it barely reached 50o, we stayed in our unit for most of the time. But we had plenty of room, and even hooked up a WII game system to the huge flat screen TV. They had a very nice pool area, that we hear was heated, but we opted not to try out. There was also a game room and exercise area. The property is located between Disney and Universal, and Sea World and Auquatica are right down the road. There is a grocery store right down the road and plenty of shopping and restaurants close by. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. When we called and asked about the internet access they said we could come down at any time and pick up a cable if we needed it. About five minutes later there was a knock on the door and someone was dropping off the cable for us. We had a problem with one of our keycards and a short time later someone was dropping off a new set. We asked for extra towels and again someone else dropped off a stack of extra towels. Something to keep in mind is that this is a timeshare type condo area. The only thing that housekeeping does daily is make the beds and change out the towels, etc. Although they are selling the unused units off like a hotel room, it is still a timeshare. It is a luxury condo that is normally rented out like a vacation home so you don’t get daily maid service like in a hotel. There is also a daily condo fee that covers the shuttle, parking, internet, etc. (I think it was about $12.00 a day) That is how timeshares work. When I was checking this resort out, I’m pretty sure almost all of the travel sites were pretty clear, and some even highlighted this information at the top of the descriptions. I would hate to think people were giving this resort lower marks because of information they should have been aware of before they even made their reservations. But even though this is a timeshare location, there was never any high pressure sales pitch forced on us. If we wanted to attend meeting they would take $100.00 off the bill, but we were never harassed about it. We have had to deal with that before and we really appreciated not having that happen here. We were very pleased with everything and would definitely stay at Floridays again the next time we are in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A great home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Onmybreak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 3 year old daughter stayed at Floridays in a two-bedroom condo. I have to say we were very happy with the accommodations. We stayed in one of the newer buildings "E". Note, this building is not too close to the main building that has the larger pool, but we enjoyed a short walk through the parking lot to get there. If you prefer a closer walk you should request it when your booking. The condo was very clean and supplied all the utensils needed except we needed a frying pan which we got in a matter of 10 minutes after calling the front desk. We cooked breakfast every day and we enjoyed eating out on the patio. One other problem we had was with the AC vent in the master bathroom. It would make a very loud noise every time it would turn on and it disturbed our sleep. The following morning we called guest services and the maintenance person came in, couldn't fix it at first, but was determined to resolve the problem. By the end of the day it was fixed AND the front desk called each time to verify that the person had arrived and made a follow-up call to make sure we were satisfied and the problem was resolved. Impeccable customer service, it was refreshing! We had all the luxuries of being in our own home. Washer/dryer, comfortable beds, very nice kitchen and dining room table and comfortable furniture in the living room area. Aside from some noisy late night guests, we were extremely happy and I'm sure if we had called the desk to complain, they would have resolved that issue immediately. There is also a smaller pool near the back buildings where we stayed and it was very nice and quiet. The concierge service is great and you can purchase all your park tickets, etc. through them. Again, can't say enough about this place and a great value for the money we spent. SeaWorld is less than 10 minutes away and Disney is 15 minutes away, perfect location. Simple hotel rooms were more expensive so we felt like we got a great deal. Can't wait to go back again next year! Don't hesitate, great find. Cheap eats and great food - Bahama Breeze. Also, Carrabas was very good, a little pricier but not outrageous. Awesome soups.

Reviews.Title: “Great family no-frills resort”
Reviews.Author: BetChester
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the Floridays and had a great time. We had a three bedroom suite which worked perfectly for us. Our party was my husband, myself, our two children, aged 7 and 2 and his parents, so we were a party of 6. The three bedroom suite was perfect for us, we gave his parents the master suite and we took the other end bedrooms which kept any noises we might each make far enough not to wake the others. The full kitchen was great for breakfasts before we hit the parks. They are very upfront about the minimal housekeeping, and they do offer further cleaning at an extra charge. They are also very upfront about it not being super secure - don't leave anything in your car and use the room safe for valuables you don't take with you. We left laptops and cameras in the safe when we didn't need them, left golf clubs in the room with no problems. Housekeeping replaces towels and amenities (soaps etc) and makes the beds every day, anything more will involve a charge. We don't love our room being invaded and fully cleaned when we're on vacation so this was perfect for us. we asked for more paper towels and specific coffee (non-decaf) and they obliged no problem. It really worked out very well for our group and we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with service that goes above and beyond.”
Reviews.Author: familyofthree_10
Reviews.Content: I closely scrutinized several resorts, including reading all the good and bad on this site. I was still skeptical but when we got to Floridays I was impressed. Checked-in on a Saturday afternoon, no wait at check-in or check-out - fast service. Only thing at check-in that could have improved was a little more of an introduction to the resort itself. We easily found our room and we were pleasantly surprised. Very clean! I did a bed bug check and none found - no problems. Very clean new mattresses. I had also read about how noisy it could be and was worried because it was spring break week. I found it to be very quiet with the exception of a small dog that went crazy barking at 8 am every morning for a few mornings. Other than that no problem. I would say it's nosier to sleep in the bedroom that faces the outside walkway. You may hear carts being pushed up and down or people talking. Housekeeping and all the service staff went above and beyond. The front desk professionals were highly responsive. Housekeeping replaces the towels daily, there was dish soap (both liquid and powder for the dishwasher) and starter laundry detergent (no fabric softener). They provide a new sponge for any hand washing of dishes. They provide hand and bath soaps, shower gel, body lotion, shampoo and conditioner - which they replaced daily if needed. There are beach towels at the pool. No mold in the baths - very clean. In fact, I found we were missing a spatula. I called the front desk and they sent a new one right over. I found the frying pan was really badly scratched up with the Teflon coating fraying and asked if it could be replaced, they quickly did so with a brand new one. We didn't think there was internet in our rooms, but there is free internet hook up - you need to bring an Ethernet cable or ask the front desk for a cable. They will provide one at no charge if you return it. I thought that was nice. The fitness center was small and new, all LifeFitness equipment. 2 Elliptical machines, 2 treadmills, 1 recumbent bike. Weight machines that cover all the major muscle groups. I liked that they provided sanitary wipes to clean the machines (although they did run out of these), hand sanitizer, water, and towels. On one particularly busy day they ran out of everything, but eventually did come to replace them. Busiest time in the workout room seemed to be 10 am - 11 am. Pool was fabulous!! The main pool was very nicely heated. We had unseasonably cold weather and were there really so my daughter could swim. We didn't come to Orlando to do theme parks, my 6 year old really just wanted a great pool and it was. The outside temp was a windy 67 degrees but if you stood near the edge of the pool you could feel the heat from it. The water was like bath water -- definitely, really enjoyed it. there are 4 lap lanes on one end of the main pool and a great kids area for little ones. No life guard on duty but we didn't encounter any rough housing problems. The pool is 5 ft deep in the center. There's another smaller pool and hot tub over near the back buildings. The onsite market has all the basics, no butter, but everything else. Floridays is in an excellent location - you could walk to Publix - the supermarket which is new and nice. There isn't a full side walk to it so I wouldn't recommend it necessarily but it's very close. The refrigerator has an ice maker in it. There's also a McDonald's, Outback, and Panera nearby. I would buy bottled water because the water in Florida has a sulfuric smell and chlorine or something that is strong enough to change the flavor of your coffee. LOVED the Starbucks starter pack of coffee provided! It made one 10 - 12 cup pot. Beds were very comfortable. Slept great there. I had read the temperature boxes were locked, but ours wasn't and we had no problem adjusting it if we wanted. There's an in room safe. Also loved the jacuzzi in the master bedroom. All in all a GREAT vacation that was relaxing!! We were impressed by the excellent service. I was very impressed that every single staff member went above and beyond!! You just don't see that that often. For example, the man who brought the frying pan and the spatula also asked if we needed anything else and then offered to bring additional garbage bags (he could see we might need them). I was prepared for them not to take the garbage because I had read here that was a problem, but they fixed it. Good management at Floridays I would say.

Reviews.Title: “spacious, convenient, but where is the SECURITY?”
Reviews.Author: nerfdog
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at Floridays, our second stay in 3 years. We stayed in a three bedroom unit over looking the lagoon and pool. We loved the location of the unit and the view. We were happy to find the unit very quiet, no noise traveled through the walls, that is something that drives me crazy in hotels. Unfortunately, and I'm not sure why, when neighbors allowed their doors to slam shut it shook our door and was quite loud. You could hear a lot of noise through the door as people talked in the halls. We were so happy to have the dishwasher and laundry, and were told at check-in what to expect from housekeeping- not much! Our unit was basically clean when we checked in. We did spend some time in the sandy area by the pool, and the kids found cigarette butts in the sand- gross! Can't really blame the hotel for that. Our impression was that we were staying at a family resort, but at the pool area at certain times it got a little rowdy. Not sure if they were guests or not? Which brings me to our biggest concern with Floridays- there is absolutely no security. No other resort we have been to or heard about let the public have free access to the grounds, pool, cars and guests!!!! We were careful about leaving anything in our car overnight, and didn't feel totally secure walking around at night. We had multiple fast food menus slipped under our door each day! How hard would it be to put up a security gate? That is almost a deal breaker for us, but you get such great accomadations and location for such a relatively small price.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with our Floridays stay”
Reviews.Author: lewisvs
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay in a two room suite at Floridays. We were very happy with the location, the room, and the staff. We had a bulb burn out in the shower stall in the master bath on our third day there, and it was fixed within two hours of my call to report it. The concierge was very friendly and helpful, as were the other staff members. It was extremely conventient to have a full kitchen and washer/dryer. I was surprised at how well stocked the kitchen was as far as utensils go). It is extremely helpful to have that second bedroom for the kids, so that they can go to bed early and the adults won't disturb them by watching tv, doing laundry, etc. There are a ton of fliers under the door at all hours, which is a little annoying, but we never ordered from any of those places after reading other reviews. There is WiFi available in the room, but it is not wireless, so bring a network cable. They have a few at the front desk, but I had my own. There is a Publix and a Walgreens right around the corner, as well as an outlet mall. I would not recommend the Benihana restaurant that is located by the Floridays entrance. It is a total ripoff! Overall, I was extremely satisfied, and I would definitely return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Liveforholidays73
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Orlando where we spent 3 nights in Floridays for leisure & 4 nights in a much more expensive hotel for a work related summit. Floriday's wins hands down! Staff were very professional & helpful, I have stayed in many hotels & believe me excellent staff is very rare. We rented a 3 bedroon apartment & it was clean, fully equipped & very spacious. We were never disturbed by noise coming from outside or any neighbouring apartment. Location was fantastic & we took the i-ride if we wanted to go out eating, shopping, sight seeing. We all agreed that we would definitely choose Floridays Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Cancuck
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 week at Floridays. It is in a great location; easy walk to Publix grocery store, walk to Premiere Outlet Mall, and 10 minutes to DisneyWorld. The rooms were clean, beds comfortable, kitchen well stocked. The pool was a good temp. and there were plenty of chairs. The food at the market was decent, and all the staff were friendly. It is a huge resort with about 6 buildings. If you had problems walking it would be difficult to get around the grounds without driving. Walking for us was no problem, but we heard some people in building F complaining about the walk to the pool. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Holly046
Reviews.Content: I and my two children stayed at the Floridays Hotel for one week. The accommodations were clean with a nice sized pool to play in and a small arcade as well. Floridays staff where very pleasant, knowledgeable and helpful in getting us to where we wanted to go. I would definitely recommend this affordable hotel to anyone traveling in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Had potential to be better”
Reviews.Author: MamaCMamaC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit for 8 nights with 2 adults and 3 children. Found the room adequate but needed better cleaning. I must say that I am a very picky traveler and found that though the room "appeared" clean many of the doors to the cupboards had quite a bit of old sticky messes on them that were quite easy to see and doors around the unit had many sticky finger prints all over them. The floors could have used a better scrub and this was upon checking in. The beds are "made" daily along with garbage removal but bedding is not changed at all during your stay. My advice is to shell out the money for a mid week cleaning if staying a week or buy cleaning supplies along with your groceries. This would have been helpful especially since both tubs got a little scuzy after 8 days with a very busy family! Towels are also replenished daily but for some reason I had to call daily for facecloths!!! There is a dishwasher but we only got one pack of dishwashing powder so this may be another item to add to the grocery list. This resort is very close to the major theme parks, a short 10 min drive. There is also an outlet mall quite close as well as a Publix. The pool and hot tub seemed very nice although it was quite cold during our visit so we did not actually use it. There is also a Starbucks on site which was a treat and they give you starbucks to brew as well. Hotel staff are very polite and quite helpful! All in all, not a bad hotel for the price but had so much more potential. Management should look into including a mid week clean for quests staying the week which is done at many other places that we have stayed at in Orlando. Cleaning staff, like I said could also pay a bit more attention to cleaning when guests check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelingmylife
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights with my husband and our two children ages 1 and 8. The hotel was very clean and close distance to the publix and Walgreen. We didn't have a car so we took the trolley to eat at restaurants on international drive and the shuttle to the parks. I wish there were more shuttle times to the parks. They have 3 departure times for morning and night! I think they need more. The concierge lady was not helpful. We wanted to buy tickets for universal and iride trolley but she told us we had to wait for the next person and she didn't know what time they were coming. She said she had to leave. All we wanted was tickets and she was sitting at her desk on the computer. However the bellman RAY RAY was the best ever! He went beyond to help us! He arrange for taxi pickup for the airport and offer to hold your bags until we departed for the airport! He was the best! The rooms were big and comfy! They have everything you need just bring your food! I think next time I will get rent a car. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: redwalnut
Reviews.Content: Pretty good place to stay, especially for families. The kitchen and washer/dryer come in very handy. The washer/dryer are small capacity, so don't expect to do large loads, but it is great to have it. Great staff, great location. There is a "resort fee" (about $12/day) that covers parking, pool, in room internet, etc. Unfortunately, the high speed internet is not free in the business center, just in room. Parking could be a challenge during busy times, but it is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: Husker50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays twice and for the most part had a great stay. I'm a very particular when it comes to vacation lodging, so I wanted to share my experience. Both times we've stayed at the Floridays, we found the floors weren't very clean. The tile in the kitchen area was sticky or left our socks dirty. It looked clean, but it wasn't, so we cleaned it ourselves. But what was a little more bothersome was the dirty carpet odor in the dining/living area which had a hint of the smell of dirty feet. We didn't notice it at first, but after spending some time in the unit, you can smell the dirty carpets in the main area. Also, for the most part the unit is quiet. We could never hear the TV or conversations of our neighbors, just a small amount of plumbing noise. However, noise does come in through the windows. The buildings are set up with a courtyard area, so if there are guest scoming in late at night, their voices echo through the courtyard. All in all, I would recommend the Floridays, but be prepared for the possibility of dirty floors. However, we did find the front desk staff to be very accommodating, so if you ask to have it cleaned, someone would probably be sent to clean. Also, it’s very easy access to get to Disney, but getting back is a little tricky, so check maps and know your exits ahead of time. Also, there is mediun that blocks access to the Floridays in the far lane from the entrance, so be prepared to make U turns. So if management reads review: "Housekeeping needs to clean to tile flooring after each guest and carpets need more attention! You have a great facility, but dirty floors are your downfall!"

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe this rates so high on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: sara1146
Reviews.Content: After staying here for over a week, I am surprised at how high this hotel rates on TripAdvisor. We will probably not come back. While the pool is super nice, especially with a 2-year old (zero entry, very warm, splash pad type water fountains, sand play area); however, the lack of security at the hotel was a huge concern for us. The entire week we were there, we had flyers under our door at all hours and there seemed to be a lot of non-guest visitors. Anyone can drive into the property and into the elevators and while this didn't happen to us knock on your door. In the two-bedroom units, the first bedroom (with the 2 double beds) is right next to the room entry door and has a very large window that you can look out or in to the bedroom from the hallway. We kept our blinds closed, and curtains, but it was still a little unnerving especially when people were putting flyers under your doors. You can also hear everything going on out in the hall and a few nights we had drunk people wandering the halls. The rooms were a little beat up, but it was what I would expect for an older hotel. I think the $12 resort fee is steep for the service your get and the lack of hotel amenities outside of the pool and fitness center. After driving around Orlando there are a lot of resorts that look a lot nicer that we would check out before coming back to Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely resort with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SandieConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Excellent housekeeping staff. During our recent stay at Floridays, our daughter left her music binder in the room. Unfortunately, we didn't realize it until we were in North Carolina prepping for a musical theater audition. We called Floridays and were directed to housekeeping. Lucy Mena was nice enough to take time from her busy schedule and fax sheet music to us a few minutes before my daughter's music audition. There are no words to describe how grateful we are to her and to Floridays Resort for subsequently mailing the music binder to us. This binder contains many sheets of music that my daughter has collected over the last six years. Thank you, Lucy. Thank you, Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: tcgj
Reviews.Content: Booking on line is always a bit of a risk, but the reviews seemed to be good ,so we took a chance. Great rooms, fabulous ensuite to the master bedroom, and great response by staff to any questions we had. Would definitely stay there again. Didn't get to it, but the pool looked great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with promise . . . poor maid service!”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews from Trip Advisor, this hotel seemed too good to be true . . . and in same ways, it was. The property is well-maintained and has the added bonus of having a small store front selling everything from made-to-order Starbuck's coffee to sunscreen and breakfast foods. Our room was on the top level of the last building in this complex. We usually had to wait for an elevator because the cleaning crew used this to transport and "hold" carts while they serviced the rooms. The problem was . . . we would be gone all day and return around 5pm to find that the room still had not been refreshed! After the first time, I knew this was either mismanagement or a ploy from the cleaning crew to just hand over some towels to the guests and call it a day. The room was spacious and more than accommodating for the 5 people in our group. All of the appliances in the kitchen and laundry closet worked well and allowed us to have a comfortable stay. However, the smell of bleach in the room would knock you down!!! And, this odor stayed in the room the entire time! The answer from the front desk was that they could come and spray another chemical to try and knock out the first odor, but with a child with asthma . . . that seemed like a bad idea. The weather was too cold to actually use the pool, but it looked really inviting and would be great for families with children. I think this hotel has a lot of potential and from the other reviews everyone seems to have a good experience. My only complaint is that the cleaning staff only showed up on the last day of a 4-day stay without us having to call for fresh towels and emptying of the trash cans.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Irish68Boston
Reviews.Content: We originally booked the new Holiday Inn located in the Downtown Disney area but found that the Floriday's Resort was about the same price with the AAA discount and while the condo was further away from the Downtown Disney area we found it very convenient to area attractions since we had a rental car. The condo was a two bedroom/two bathroom with a full kitchen so it was much more desirable for three adults. We were three adults who booked online and our stay was from 2/25/10-3/1/10, check in time was 4:00pm but we were told that we could check in earlier and if there was a condo availale. We arrived around 2:00pm and were able to check in effortlessly, our location was in building F # 211. The building itself was quite a distance from the main pool/bar area but since the weather during our stay was quite cool it really wasn't a big deal to us. The parking isn't assigned but we had no problem finding a spot by our building at the end of the day. The condo itself was very nice and well worth the money, it sure beat staying in a crowded hotel room. There was a Publix grocery store very close by and we stopped in to stock up on what we needed for the next four days. A previous review mentioned being pressured with regards to a time share offer but no one ever mentioned it to us during our stay. The condo was very clean and well appointed and had a nice balcony with a table and two chairs. The view from the balcony wasn't that great, it overlooked the Operations Building but it was very quiet. The resort provides a daily refresh service which included making the beds, replacing the towels and emptying the trash. For an additional fee you could upgrade but we found this service to be just fine for the three of us. We didn't use the pool or any of the services so I cannot comment on them however while using my laptop in the lobby I saw a lot of people purchasing park tickets and getting directions. My Father in Law sat at the pool bar one night and said the service was great and the bartender was very friendly. We did ask upon check out if in the future we could request a location closer to the main pool and were told that repeat guests can often get a better location than we had this time. All in all the resort was perfect for us and given the full kitchen it is a great value for those who like to dine in occasionally during their stay. We cannot wait to return to Floridays in the Fall. My Father in Law mentioned that they offered him a discount coupon for a return visit but I wasn't offered one at check out so may just call them to see if I could get one since we plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: pepe_Lapu
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Floridays for a 7 nights vacation. We stayed in the 3 bedroom 2 bth floorplan for 7 nights. It was spacious, clean and well decorated. We had also in the unit a washer/dryer, so handy with a family! It was close to a Publix, a drug Store, Outlets and all the theme parks. Also the pool was heated and they have a nice bar and coffee shop with Starbucks coffee!! We will definitively go back to "Floridays"!!!

Reviews.Title: “More than expected, and we'll be back soon.”
Reviews.Author: LivingLifeWell
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband, 4 year old son, 15 year old stepson, and a teenager friend of the family. All the amenties the hotel listed were there and in working order. The resort is close to Universal and Disney, and several restaurants and grocery stores were literally around the corner, i.e. we saved a lot of money by shopping at the grocery store and using the resort's full kitchen to cook most of our meals. We even ordered room service one night, and we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food-- very good. The weather was cold, so we didn't use the pools. The only drawbacks were that the kids said they could hear people in the corridors at night (their bedroom was closest to the entrance of the room itself), and we had to get new keys because they did not always work. As a Florida resident I was very impressed with Floridays. Most Florida hotels do not go out of their way to give Florida residents their best especially when we request Florida resident discounts, but I felt like an honored out-of-towner staying at a high quality resort during the height of tourist season.

Reviews.Title: “Foridays exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: TXjanet
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the 2 bdrm 2 bth floorplan for 5 nights. It was my husband/myself and my 8 yr old daughter. It was very spacious, clean and well decorated. Loved the fact that it had a washer/dryer-very handy; less clothes to pack! It was quiet and close to the theme parks. We will Definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, beautiful roomy units, close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: janlaird
Reviews.Content: After staying in a Disney resort for a previous Orlando trip, my family and I were looking for more space, yet still wanted to be close to the parks. Floridays did not disappoint - we were in a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit and it was wonderful. The full kitchen was well stocked, including dish and laundry detergent, sponge and paper towels. Beautiful master bath w/jacuzzi tub made for some private relaxing after long days at the park. Would definitely stay there again. Only complaint would be that there isn't wireless internet in the rooms, but an ethernet cable is provided upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Have already recommended it to friends. We'll be back again this year.”
Reviews.Author: macarons
Reviews.Content: There were 5 of us - My parents, my brother in law, my husband & I and our 1yr old. We got a 3br apt and we loved it. It was amazing value compared to getting 3 separate hotel rooms. The apt was well furnished and the rooms were large. The main bedroom had a king size bed with an enormous ensuite bathroom with spa. The other 2 bedrooms had 2 double beds in each of them and shared the main bathroom. It was very clean & they made the beds daily - we were only there for 2 days though. They were very prompt in providing more towels & bringing up the cot & the high chair. They had not updated that we changed our booking to a 3br - but this was not a problem. Internet is also available, but you have to ask for a cable to connect to your computer. We didnt cook while we were there, but the facilities were very adequate for having take out. they had plates & cutlery etc, but we just bought paper plates & plastic cutlery because we really couldnt be bothered cleaning up that much after a long day at disney & shopping! On arrival, they really push for you to attend a timeshare meeting by enticing you with getting $100 back, but we declined this. Also, if you are a florida resident remember to show your drivers license as you get a discount. Overall - it was an excellent stay and we will be back next time we go to Disney. We have already recommended it to friends of ours that stayed there last week & they also had good things to say.

Reviews.Title: “great value.”
Reviews.Author: cici-brasil
Reviews.Content: What the hotel offers and what the hotel rates are really fair. No luxury but no promises also. Comfortable and well structured to cook, eat, wash and relax after a day on a park or shopping. I recommend! Specially for a family trip.

Reviews.Title: “family perfect”
Reviews.Author: yngmichcpple
Reviews.Content: Not a luxury hotel, but perfect for a family! Great stay for kids mid winter break!

Reviews.Title: “Floridays is Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: ShannonLK
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 7 night stay in a spacious, 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo. Buillding B -room 206. 3 tv's, comfortable beds/pillows, Jacuzzi in the master bedroom, full kitchen and lovely view of the lake The pool/hot tub were great! 84 F-pool temperature. Location-very close to Disney, Seaworld, Discovery cove, Aquatica and great shopping Publix and Walmart in very close proximity The front desk( especially Charolotte) was most helpful with our requests and always followed up to make sure they were followed through. Charlotte was extremely helpful in booking our return visit to the Floridays in July 2010. We have visited Orlando numerous times and this by far has been the best!

Reviews.Title: “amazing value and comfort for families”
Reviews.Author: sancrispino
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7-night stay at the Floridays Resort. We were 5 adults and 1 child and booked a 3-bedroom, 2-bath apartment. Spacious and clean. The master suite had a king-size bed and the other bedrooms had 2 double beds each, so plenty of room for everybody. Open living area (where we spent most of the time) consisted of kitchen, dining area and sitting area. TV in living area as well as in each of the bedrooms. Having the kitchen was very nice as we ate in a couple of the nights. It was also convenient having a washer/dryer. Staff was extremely friendly and the two times we requested something from the front desk, they responded promptly and followed-up afterwards. There was a restaurant in the resort (never tried), but we shopped at Publix just around the corner and had breakfast in the apt. Remember this is not a typical hotel, but more like a condo with housekeeping services. The resort has an excellent location, close to the major parks and lots of dining and retail outlets nearby. The only issue we had was getting onto the 4 - rush hour into the evening it was a nightmare, take International Drive whenever possible. If you're looking for a luxury hotel, then this is not the place for you, but for a laid-back family vacation, we could not find a better value and were very happy with our choice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “long weekend in orlando with family”
Reviews.Author: JoelTifton
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable and economical. Good check-in and out. Close to major resorts, grocery and restaurants. We didnt try the hotel's restaurant. This was more like a condo with several rooms and privacy for everyone. It was a busy place and very safe feel. We have booked another stay there ina few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: momofthree085
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the service and rooms at Floridays. The beds were comfortable, the room clean and there was plenty of space for our three children. The pool area was wonderful. Especially for the price, we would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: 2grandsonsgeorgia
Reviews.Content: We certainly enjoyed everything about our stay at Floridays Resort Orlando. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were beautiful and VERY comfortable. The entire family loved this resort and definately plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “nothing less than excellent”
Reviews.Author: mcknife
Reviews.Content: Hard to write a review on floridays without sounding repetitive. dont think there could be a better deal for families or groups than to stay at floridays. we stayed in the 3 bedroom apartment, huge, the website doesnt do justice to it, its much bigger than the pics. not a luxury hotel, but hey, for the price you pay i think you get a lot more than you pay for. clean, fully equiped, perfect location, quiet end of international drive, 15 min to all parks, sea world is 5 min. premium outlets around the corner, as a huge publix and walgreens. service is always friendly an helpfull. fast and easy check in and out. reservations whether from the website or directly with them were perfect and very patient and helpfull. nice swimming pool with a bar for snacks or a meal. when we left we all had that feeling of wanting to return as soon as possible. every time we returned from the parks it was the feeling of returning home instead of a hotel room. we saved money, time and stress by having breakfast and dinner at the apartment. i highly recommend it for anyone with family, kids get their own room with tv and all, privacy for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: mfaco
Reviews.Content: Very well located and spacius. If you need a two bed room, Floridays is the best you can have. The complete kitchen help a lot with the kids breakfast. A great swimming pool, but it was freezing outside.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward To Returning!”
Reviews.Author: IrishGal
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked in (at 1am!) to when we checked out everthing was perfect. The day we were leaving our flight wasn't until 4pm and the staff on reception very kindly offered to let us stay in the apartment as late as we wanted - we didn't even have to ask! Staff here are extremely helpful and friendly. Shuttle service was excellent. And the rooms - well - we couldn't ask for better! Great food in the cafe too. We've booked to go back at Easter this year and are counting down the days to our return!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PPants
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Orlando with my husband, 2 babies and parents and had a great stay at the Floridays Resort. We rented a 3 bedroom and I coudn't be happier. It was nice, clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. Any problems we had were fixed promptly. The location was great. You go one way on International Drive and it would bring you to Disney (around 10-15min). You turn the other way, it would bring you to Universal (around 15min) and Seaworld (5 min). The Premium Outlet is right around the corner as is the grocery store, drug store and more. Oh, and the price was great. We paid $143/night + $11.25/night resort fee (this is for shuttle to theme parks, parking, local phone calls, internet........) I would definitely return or recommend it to a friend

Reviews.Title: “loved the condo”
Reviews.Author: fourstaronly
Reviews.Content: Very clean 3 bed condo. Nice pool area free internet very close to the premium outlet mall. A good choice for a holiday

Reviews.Title: “GREAT condo right near DISNEY!!! PERFECT for our first disney trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: laura81274
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be more pleased with the Floridays Resort-from start to finish everything went smoothly from checking in to checking out ( I did NOT want to leave!!!!) We stayed in the 3 bedroom condo in Building F and the rooms were spacious, immaculately clean (this is one of the newer buildings!!) and I'm definitely looking forward to another stay!!! We spent most of our time at Disney and Islands of Adventure, all of which is within 10 minutes drive (we rented a car but they do have available shuttles)and SeaWorld is literally right down the street!! You could walk!! On our last day we drove to Clearwater on the Gulf Coast and before we left my husband went right to the front desk and they immediately printed out all the directions we needed-staff was excellent!! We only went in the pool once because we were always at Disney and it was very clean!! Would definitely recommend Floridays-GREAT job!!! Laura Paulsen

Reviews.Title: “A1 resort! A must for families!”
Reviews.Author: TWeb598231
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient, close to all the major parks- Universal, Sea World, Disney. Free transportation is provided for all but Disney. Trolley runs right by resort and takes you down International drive where there are great eateries, Ripley's, Wonderworks, putt putt, and more! Excellent staff, clean rooms, very affordable. Pool area is fantastic with heated pool and hot tub area. I highly recommend for families-small children or teens, this resort is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Value, location, comfort- A+”
Reviews.Author: trureviewnj
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week stay with my teenage daughters and wife. The hotel is as advertised, close to parks and well worth the money spent, which by the way, was very affordable. We chose the 2 room suite. A full kitchen, complete with utensils, dishes, etc., dining room area, living room and balcony or patio are all standard. The pool is heated and nice with a bar/convenience store/restaurant all within walking distance of it. The 2nd bedroom, 2 double beds with another bathroom outside was invaluable with teenage girls. At check-in, a subtle $100 discount is offered for previewing a time share offer. We did not attend, and there was no followup pressure at all. Overall, it was well worth the money, very clean and comfortable, and I would definitely recommend staying here to anyone. I will definitely be staying here again when I return to Orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Idael location for all resorts”
Reviews.Author: vosper66
Reviews.Content: Great loaction for all resorts within the Orlando area - Supermarket, Outlet Mall and restaurants all within walking distance of the Floridays resort. The 2 bedroom accommodation was excellent for a family of 5 including a baby of 19 months. They provided a cot as requested and there was splenty of room in the apartment which was suitably equiped for all our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Could not wish for anything better...”
Reviews.Author: ozkazz
Reviews.Content: We (self, husband, 2 sons 8 & 11) stayed here for 1 week last October. You really would be pressed to find anything better. Our 2BR suite was very roomy - the ensuite bathroom had a spa bath, toilet & shower, & the 2nd bathroom had shower, bath & toilet. Bedrooms well appointed, lounge/kitchen area well designed. Spotlessly clean, perfectly maintained, quiet, & modern... Staff were excellent, always helpful & accommodating. We only needed to hire a car for 1 day (to drive to Kennedy Space Centre) - the rest of the time we used the hotel shuttle service to Disney & Unviersal, which was excellent. (note that if you do miss the shuttle, you can phone the shuttle-owners direct and they will arrange a cab to pick you up). Excellent swimming pools for the boys - clean, family friendly, open till late. On site cafe had great pizzas, but other food at nearby shops. Value for money was outstanding. You will not regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we had hoped for.”
Reviews.Author: GrizzlyCountry
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Orlando before, but saw the reviews for Floridays on TripAdvisor. We read many of them, (even the negative ones) and decided that we would stay there. We loved the layout of our room (three bedroom suite) and the privacy that it offered to all of us. We were not bothered by any timeshare pitches. One resort employ winked at us and told us not to bother with the voucher offer that they were required to tell us about during check in! We did see questionable people stuffing pizza flyers through doors, but the info binder in the room warns of this, and informs you not to order from them. They list some reputable places in the binder that we did use. If you come here expecting a full service hotel with in house dining etc. you might be dissapointed. If you come here to stay at a home away from home, with privacy for the whole family you will enjoy it. The reason I gave the room 4 out 5 was there was some noise from above, (not much though) and the bed was a bit soft for my liking. (I know, it's a small complaint considering what's all happening in the world today) We didn't bring a laptop so we were pleased to find the computer room complete with internet and printers. It was great for printing boarding passes etc. The kids loved the pool and games room. We will definately be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, could do with a little tlc”
Reviews.Author: muttley123
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bed apartment for 14 days over Xmas and New Year with our 3 kids age 4, 8 and 12. Positives: The staff were always very helpful, even when we arrived at 3.00 am due to a 9 hour flight delay. We also asked one day to borrow a screwdriver to fit some new batteries in one of the kid's toys, and they sent the maintenance guy round straight away with it, even though it was New Year's Day. You wouldn't get service like that in the UK! The apartment was very clean, and was roomy enough for all of us, though the second bedroom was a bit small for 2 double beds/3 kids. There was free Internet in the rooms, and reception offered us an ethernet cable when we checked in. Apparently there is free wifi in the public areas, although we didn't try this. They offer you a $100 voucher if you go to the timeshare presentaion, but don't push it, unlike some places. The cafe serves a good range of breakfasts/snacks. The pool area was nice, though sadly for us, too cold to use it very often while we there. Ignore all the pizza flyers that get pushed under your door - they are usually poor quality. If you want a pizza delivered, ask the concierge for a recommendation. The location is good, at the bottom (quiet) end of I-drive, near to Sea World, and about halfway betwen Disney and Universal. There is a Publix round the corner, which has a great deli counter, and an OK Chinese restaurant/take-away and a Venzuelan cafe. It's also walking distance to Premium Outlets, though you might want to take a taxi back if you do a lot of shopping. The I-ride stops outside the hotel (stop 40), though be aware, if you are planning to use the I-ride a lot, that it takes nearly an hour to get to the Prime Outlets mall at the other end on it. Negatives: The apartment showed some signs of wear and tear - chipped furniture, decor a bit dated. Plenty of kitchen gadgets (coffee maker, toaster, food mixer ...), but the utensils were a bit limited if you wanted to cook - only one saucepan! Cleaning was limited to bedmaking, towel changing and trash emptying unless you paid $25/day extra. Beds were only spot changed during the two weeks - a couple of the pillowcases, but not the sheets. No cleaning equipment was provided, not even a dustpan and brush, so it's hard to clean up any accidental messes the kids make. We asked the maid about this, and she said that that was the way it is. I'd recommend they review their cleaning policy, as they are only making it harder for themselves to clean between guests.

Reviews.Title: “All you need, when you need it”
Reviews.Author: Travelfamilyof7
Reviews.Content: Family of 7 from Europe. Review ment for europeans. We had a great stay. All of our 5 children enjoyed this place. We were searcing for a place to stay that was big enoug for all of us. We used tripadvisor and ended up with 5 alternatives. In the end it was quite easy to choose. One thing was that we looked at ratings, but when Floridays had over 600 reviews and still had a score of over 9.0. As I said, it was easy. Floridays has nice big rooms with everything we needed. Big fridge, washer, dryer etc. We stayed for several weeks and got the feel of the resort as well as the whole area. You don`t need a rental car, everything is whitin walking distance (PUBLIX, GAP etc) We used the fitness room almost every day. The kids used the DVD rental machine near the front desk a few times. Nice during the cold periode we experienced. We planed to visit Aquatica and Sea World (given the age-span), and got great deals as well as good information. We went with the 14 day pass (same price as 3 single days) We used the shuttle service (included in your room price) to the theme parks. When we didnt, we used the I-Ride trolley. Ask Nelda og Phoenix at the concierge desk. All of the staff were very friendly. Phoenix, Ray and every other person we met from the staff did everything in their power to make our stay good. And they did. Even when the twins stroller had a flat tire and there was no way to get a new one, they pumped it up every day the last week of our stay. As with other places we have stayed, Floridyas will offer you to buy a condo. But in contrast to other places, they are not pushing you or calling you up at all hours. Every time we needed support (i.e. changing a light bulb) the front desk always called you up to check if everything was taken care of. We had a great stay, we will be back. Friends of us has already been to Orlando, they stayed at Floridays. They will be back as well. Remember (all european travelers): - Tax is not incluted in anything you want to buy. - Tax and insurance is not includet in rental car offers (if you rent car in the US) - bring plug adapter, European ones does not fit - Use the coupons when you can. We were unsure beacause we are not used to this system. But it saves money and no one thinks twice about it. - If you go to publix to shop for food etc. Look for good deals. In 2 weeks time you can save a lot of money. - Remember; if you go to any of the theme parks with infants, they do not provide you with hot water in the bottle or heat up baby food in the micro for you. They give you a cup of hot water for you to warm up your food. No worries when you plan for it. Best regards to all of the staff at Floridays. See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Sk13
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for a long weekend with my extended family. There were 6 of us, we were extremely comfortable, plenty of room for everyone. We had a 3 bdrm and it was HUGE. Cooked breakfast and dinner in the room on one day and the kitchen had everything we needed. There is a Publix right around the corner to pick up anything you need. A little past the Publix there is an Outlet Mall with great shopping. We were maybe 5-10 minutes from the Disney Parks. Not many restaurants immediately around the hotel but if you go down Vineland or take International down to World Center Drive there is every restaurant you can imagine within a 5-10 minute drive. The service at the hotel was great, check in was fast & easy and the push to go to the Time Share presentation was not bad at all, a polite no and we weren't asked to do it again or pressured into it. We only had one small issue (the smoke detector started beeping for the low battery), we called the front desk and they had someone there in minutes (this was at 7:30AM). They don't have full maid service, they will make the beds, take out the garbage & bring fresh towels each day. The room was very clean when we arrived. Sheets are wonderful and beds are very comfortable. There were TV's in each of the 3 bdrms and a nice LCD TV in the living room. The master bath had a stand up shower and a huge jaccuzi tub. The second bath had a stand up shower and a HUGE 2 sink vanity, plenty of room in each one to have 2 people getting ready at the same time without tripping over each other. The only complaint about the bathrooms was that there was no water closet. But not a big deal. Master bdrm had king bed, the other 2 rooms had 2 queen beds each. I believe the couch folded out to another bed but we didn't need to use it. They have computer access in the room but you do need a cord to connect your computer which I did not bring with me. I think they have wireless in the lobby but I didn't use that either. There were 2 pools (we did not use as the temps were in the low 30's all weekend) that looked very nice. We didn't visit the onsite restaurant or bar so can't comment on that. Overall we had a fabulous stay and if traveling with family or a group of friends again we would definitely stay here. The price was great.

Reviews.Title: “Postives and Negatives...”
Reviews.Author: FUNcations
Reviews.Content: My clients stayed at the Floridays between Christmas and New Years. She stated that they might consider staying at the Floridays again with some reservations. There were some things in their room that needed repair- a curtain in the bedroom had been chewed on or melted? Not a big deal, but looked really bad. The carpet in the bedroom was worn and had the carpet tacs sticking out. Again not a real big deal, they just had to be carefull not to step on it with bare feet. When she was in the hot tub in the bathroom one night she noticed how dirty the jets were. That was kind of disturbing. They also don't offer room cleaning during your stay unless you pay extra ($35 per day)for it. They recieved clean towels and had our beds made, but no clean sheets or bathroom cleaning, floor cleaning etc. It may have been ok for a 3-4 day stay, but after 7 days might have been nice to clean our room at least once. The Floridays is also a time share place so they wanted to offer them a $100 credit to listen to their presentation. They didn't use the pool (it was too cold) or resturant at the resort at all. It was a nice location, close to resturants and a grocery store, Walgreens, etc. It's the little things that make your stay. The Floridays needs some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mikepcon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Flordays in the Summer of 2009 having seen it recommended on here. Our party consisted of me, my two boys (14 and 11) and my mother (63). We booked a 3bed apartment through Hotelopia and the price was very good in comparison to other sites (£1300). One of the main reasons we chose Floridays was that it had the three bedroom option which was what we needed. Last time we stayed at a Disney hotel and had to book two rooms and they would not give us any discount despite there only being 4 of us. Following on from what I read on here we requested block B or C overlooking the lake and we got exactly that. We were on the end of block B so could even see part of the pool. I have read some reviews complaining about noise from the pool and also about the pool closing too early but I didnt have an issue with either from our location. There was not too much noise, but the pool does need to close at a reasonable time so young children can get to sleep! My only complaint about noise would be that at about 7am I could hear them getting the pool ready for the day and the noise of them scraping the chairs along the floor woke me up. With the exception of the pool, which was excellent, the resort facilities were not up to much. The "restaurant" had very little on offer and we only got something on the night we arrived. The games room was very small. The business centre was ridiculously prices for using the PCs. I cant remember exacly but it may have been something like $1 for 10minutes. I noticed one review saying you pay $7 for the ethernet cable for internet access in your room, but that is not charged if you return the cable. Wifi is not available in the rooms, but was in recpetion and by the pool (I think). The facilities in the apartment were excellent. There was even an ice maker in the fridge. We had few problems (toilet blocked, several bulbs gone and one bedroom locked itself) but they were pretty quick to sort them all out. They only did a full housekeeping service once in the two weeks (as expected) and failed to replace the towels one day, but we just grabbed some from by the pool. On occasions we ended up driving in to other hotels either by accident or to make a U turn. In every one of them we did not get past the security, but in Floridays you could just drive in and out without a problem, which is something they may want to look at. We used the shuttle service on two occasions. Once to Disney and once to universal. The universal one was very good and went very smoothly. Straight there and straight back without a problem. The disney one was more of a trek though. The coach stopped at several hotels on the way which meant it took a long time. The return journey was even worse. Nobody seemed to know what was going on and there was not enough room so we enede up on a different hotel shuttle, which made a detour to ours. A minor issue really as it got us there and back without too much of a problem. I did miss the Disney bus service you get with the Disney hotels. The location of the hotel was good as the supermarket, other small shops and even an outlet mall were all within walking distance. We enjoyed sitting out on the balcony of an evening and watching some fantastic lightening in the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good... needs a bit of TLC ....something just seemed to be missing”
Reviews.Author: P_MOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and three kids, ages 3-7. Not a 4 star for sure. Previous stay was at Reunion Resort (5 star definitely) so we wanted to compare if there truly was a difference between something less than a 5 star. Answer-Definitely Floridays Resort Review Negatives first -Staff was very polite and efficient. Although I got a bit irratated with the conceirge and the absolutely unacceptable charges for the business center. If you want to be a 4 star and attract a certain clientele, simple things such as printing a few tickets for your guest should be so challenging. -Games Room Games did not work sometimes, although front desk did replace tokens -Play room was closed for the entire 2 week stay. -Pool and hot tub was dirty most days with things floating in it, (straws, dirt, bark, etc) - no life guards,max depth is 5 ft , and the pool can get very crowded very quickly. - house cleaning , they were upfront with the level of housekeeping daily ,but probably would be wiser for them to start improving this as the quality of the rooms and furnishing is deteriorating quickly, this resort is only 3-4 year old. - Worst sales pitch from the timeshare folks we've ever heard. -no onsite restaurant full service restaurant. Although the cooks at the Palm cafe are very good, and take away meals were well done, - just missing some of the small details that make a difference. compared to other 4-5 stars. Positives -Great location to all theme parks and shopping - Great customer service at front desk, and conceirge most of the time. - simple check in and check out - Overall- floridays is trying to be great ,but needs more infrastructure (clean pools, working amenities, cleaner rooms etc). Aging before it's time. The BLUEGREEN FOntains resort next door looks absolutely luxurious compared to Floridays with it's LAZY River, clean pools, and new looks. Check them out as well

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: orlandolover69
Reviews.Content: I have been to Orlando 10 times before and have stayed in a variety of places eg. Marriotts and Sheratons but thought I would try Floridays this time as the ratings on trip advisor were very good. Out of all the places I have stayed this has to come in last place!! Our room was on top floor overlooking some waste land with electric pylons in our way. The room was not that clean and quite a long walk to pool. We were overun with leaflets being shoved under the door from pizza companies and no basic amenieties were left for us when we arrived ie. washing liquid, dishwasher powder. On the plus side the people that worked there were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful!”
Reviews.Author: FromSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: I always read reviews on Tripadvisor to decide on the hotels which I intend staying at. For the 1st time I totally disagree with them. I didn’t like The Floridays, Orlando at all. It’s AWFUL. How can they be considered a 4 star hotel? Reception was lousy: I called them because I couldn’t find the make-up mirror that is mentioned in their very own website, under furnishings. The girl from reception put me on hold several times as she was with other customers, until finally she said I had been misled and that none of their units had this mirror. They gave us a 2 bd/2bth suite at the far end of the resort. It was dark, with cheap and chipped furnishing, full of dusty and old artificial plants, uncomfortable beds, and terrible housekeeping. The only service they offered was: making the beds (terribly, by the way -see photo) and taking out the trash. We couldn't use the 6 place settings they proudly mention on their website, as they were dirty, scribbled on with a pen, and of very poor quality plastic. The water from the shower had a very strong smell of chlorine, as if we were showering with pool water. The air-conditioning was stuck, and temperature didn't go higher nor lower. There were spider webs around the bathroom and kitchen lights, and our door mat was filthy! But, wait......the worst thing of all, were the paper thin walls. I could hear our neighbor snoring all night long. That was really the limit!!! I surely was very disappointed. I can't understand the good reviews on TA. I’d never recommend this place to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back”
Reviews.Author: maryhelen68
Reviews.Content: I have been to orlando twelve times and stayed at lots of different place , this is the worse place I have stayed . Its more like a motel than a hotel , It got so busy at the weekends and everyone was but into the one building. both pools were not heated for the two weeks we stayed. I turned on the tap in the spa one night and it came off in my hands. If I had to name all the things that are wrong with this hotel I would be here all day

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Price, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: wmsrav4
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days before my cruise. Booked a 2 bdrm, 2 bath. Got exactly what I booked. Check-in was a breeze with friendly, helpful staff. Everything new and modern. One of the lamps wouldn't come on in the 2nd bdrm. I called the front desk and maintenance came in about 5 minutes and repaired the switch. There were no unexpected charges. The bill was exactly as I booked online. Great hotel, great prices and great service. Great ambiance!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JaneAustin71
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. The resort was very clean. Stay in Building C. It overlooks a small pond and the pool. The 2 bedroom suite was spacious enough for 4 adults and 2 teenagers. The hotel staff was very helpful. When we needed extra pillows, soap ,etc. they were very prompt with their service. The resort fee only included the removal of garbage, clean towels and making the beds. The room rates were very reasonable, even with the resort fee. Hint: The resort entrance is right after the Benihana, which helped find the driveway late at night. International drive isn't very well lit at night. The local grocery store (Publix), Subway, Walgreens and McDonald's is about 1 block away. The chinese restaurant around the corner isn't very good though (Chinese Citrus). I would definitely stay here again in the future. Only about 10 minutes from Disney and 3 minutes from the Orlando Premium Outlet mall. Also, the pool is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “loved this resort”
Reviews.Author: dee6010
Reviews.Content: 60 y.o.,four 30 somethings, and two children 4 and 9. Family get together. Requested a 3 br ste near the pool area. Stayed in Bldg. B which we loved. Daughter arrived 1st and early from SF. They graciously allowed her to check in 4 hours early. In the suite about 2 hrs. when the concierge called to see if the suite was suitable. I asked for extra towels and then tp another day and both were delivered within minutes with a follow up call to make sure we were OK. My son had a very important 4 hr. long conference and the front desk graciously provided an ethernet cable to facilitate the conference. I have NO complaints and will go back again. Great pool, hot tub, game room, exercise room. Close to Publix, the outlet mall and a few short miles from most attractions. Everyone was friendly from the front desk to the housekeepers. Good price. Very clean, well furnished, equipped kitchen. I just can't say enough good things about this place !! Recommended it to all my picky friends.

Reviews.Title: “Just as nice the 2nd time around.”
Reviews.Author: suppowife
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Floridays, and, again, we had no complaints. We stayed for 6 nights. Me, my husband, our daughter and her 3 children stayed in a 2 bedroom unit. It's roomy and comfortable. We used the shuttle to Disney the first two days and the only complaint we had with that was with broken seatbelts. But, we complained to them and the seatbelts were in good working order the next morning. Thank you Sterling. We only used the shuttle for two days because their return times did not match up with our return times. The check in staff is very nice and accommodating. Location is very good with getting to the parks. Plenty of outlet shopping close by. Also, restaurants...although we didn't have time to visit them this trip. Publix is also just around the corner now. This really is a great place to stay !!!

Reviews.Title: “a good place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Cuca60
Reviews.Content: I stay at Floridays by ten days, with my family. We enjoy the hotel. The three bedroom apartment was enough for us (6 people). Everything was right and we recommend this place. CARLOS PACHI - Brasil.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place”
Reviews.Author: falconmiamidade
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort during a weekend get away to Disney World and I have to say that this is an excellent choice for families. The suites are very comfortable and they offer full kitchens. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The check in/out staff were very professional and courteous, Natalia Pelaez made our check out a very pleasant experience. We will definitely stay here again, keep up the great job!

Reviews.Title: “Last minute trip, accomodating resort”
Reviews.Author: 06thornburgr
Reviews.Content: Few reasons why you should stay here. 1. I came to this resort to meet my girlfriend's family for the first time. Not only did i booked a stay at this resort the night before i had to make several changes to my reservation at the last minute. They were extremely friendly and willing to help. I ended up with a three bedroom condo. 2.
