Extremely relaxing- friendly atmosphere, the resort has several six story buildings each building has a nice courtyard and the hallways are open so you can see the courtyard below. Inside the room was spacious and open, had a full kitchen dining room and living room. Master bedroom had a huge king size bed and bathroom with a juzucci tub! is idea for a family, the other two bedrooms had two beds each and televisions. The only downfall is no wifi in the room but they do provide ethernet cables so you can connect in the room. 3. Front desk staff is amazing- very accamodating anything i wanted i got ad they called to make sure i got it, they even have a bellman to help you carry your bags to the room. the best thing of it all is they remember who you are and greet you by name! I ran into the bell person the next day and he made it a point to call me by name. I would recommend this resort and I personally can not wait to return, a great place to relax especially if you have a stressful job like myself.

Reviews.Title: “Citrus Bowl”
Reviews.Author: mjharris1000
Reviews.Content: Great resort that is very close to Disney. Located in a very populated area of Orlando. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. Multi bedroom condo's with full kitchens and flat screen tv's. Wireless internet and patios off of master bedroom and living room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kyqz
Reviews.Content: We took our family of 5 to Disney for a 3 day weekend. We looked at a number of Disney affiliated resorts (Animal Kingdom Lodge, etc.), but they were either too small or very expensive. We decided to stay in a 2 bedroom suite, and it was great. Plenty of room for the kids, and some privacy for my wife and me. Staff was very polite and helpful, and location was near a lot of restaurants, grocery storest, etc. Took me a while to figure out you could get an internet connection by asking for a ethernet cord from the front desk (no wireless). We would have a nice breakfast in the room prior to hitting the parks, and ended up ordering pizza one night when we didn't want to fool with a restaurant. Really, nothing negative to say. Favorite amenities: Full kitchen, dining room table, living room, TVs in every room (so no arguing from kids), huge tub with jets in our room, wonderful heated pool, nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: CathyOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband, children 9 & 11 and my in-laws stayed in a three bedroom suite at Floridays over Thanksgiving week. Overall it was a good experience. Here are the negatives: 1. The room had an odd smell when we got in. At first I thought it was some kind of heavy bleach in the cleaning products they used but then later realized that water does not smell great. I think it is an Orlando wide problem because I had some tap water at a restaurant in the Magic Kingdom and it was almost undrinkable. I used to live in Miami and I don't remember the water being a problem. It must be something with the south because on our way to Florida we stopped in Georgia to eat and the water also tasted like it had sulfur in it or something. 2. The suite does show some signs of wear and tear. One of the lamps had a whole in the side. But I am sure I could have called the front desk and they would have replaced it if I had really cared. 3. There is no wireless, but you can get plug in to your computer for $7 (one time fee). Positives: 1. The suite was huge. There were granite counter tops and there plenty of plates, cups, glasses and cookware. 2. If we ever needed anything the front desk took care of it immediately and then called to make sure we had gotten what we wanted. 3. The pool was nice although it was too cold to swim most of the time. There was a guy playing music on Friday night and they brought out heaters by our table which was great. 4. We took the shuttle to the Disney parks every day. We never had an issue with the shuttle. 5. We never had the cleaning people come so were never charged an extra cleaning charge. If you wanted towels or whatever they would just send them up. 6. Location - You are close to Publix, Outlet Mall and Disney. After staying in a condo I am not sure I could stay in a regular hotel room again. Each of us having our own space/tv was invaluable. Our main purpose of the trip was to go to Disney. Make sure to get a Fastpass first for Toy Story at Hollywood Studios. We assumed that Fastpasses would go first for the Rock 'n Roller Coaster but that was not the case. We ate at The Plaza Restaurant at the Magic Kingdom and had terrible service (we even got a free Fastpass from the manager because our waiter was so bad - although we were leaving the park so we had to give it away). Our meals at the San Angel Inn at Epcot and the Hollywood Brown Derby (be prepared to spend a lot even for lunch) were much better experiences. The Premium Outlet Mall was OK, the only good deals I saw were at the Coach store. Definitely don't think you will get a deal on sunglasses.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great, lovely accomodations, service beyond expectations.”
Reviews.Author: mjiukdey
Reviews.Content: The condo was fantastic, excellent value, great location. Our group lives in Florida & we travel to Orlando numerous times a year. This property was far better than anything we have seen even when compared with the high end hotels. But even better was the service. Every request was greeted with instant service & in every case the front desk followed up to see that we had been taken care of. Recommend this property in all area.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: suelodge
Reviews.Content: What a great holiday ideal location whether you drive or not h.aving been to florida several times it is an ideal spot close to all the theme parks , restuarants shops etc would go back tommorrow

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Paula61
Reviews.Content: Good central location, close to Sea World and an easy drive to Disney. We had a 3-bed apartment C101 (double en-suite; 2 twin-bedrooms and second bathroom; through lounge/diner/kitchen; balcony) and found it clean, comfortable and convenient. Daily $10 (+tax) charge included fresh towels and bin emptying daily and a more thorough clean after a week (more cosmetic than a deep clean, but good enough) as well as unlimited towels by the pool. Nicely contoured main pool of varying depths up to about 5' was just right for our children, aged 6 and 8, and we used it to take short breaks from going to the various Parks, including swimming in the early evening. Unheated, but OK once you'd got in, and there is a hot tub to relax in too. Having fridge/freezer and dishwasher made it easy to have breakfast/snacks at the apartment when the children couldn't wait long enough to eat out or needed a break from diner/restaurant food (Publix is just round the corner) and the washing machine and tumble dryer were quick and easy to use (we strung up a travel washing line on the balcony for drying swimming things). We didn't use the "resort" amenities much (other than the swimming pool) but the front desk staff were superb - service was pretty much instant when we needed things in the apartment (a corkscrew because the one we had was broken; wash cloths when housekeeping had forgotten to leave these with the new towels) and very helpful when we wanted advice (from where to eat out for breakfast to where to find a playground/park to take the children, to getting stamps for postcards). We found this a very easy place to stay and would feel totally comfortable returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Gasman1978
Reviews.Content: We booked three bed condo for my wife and I and my mother in law. Plenty room and very impressed with the facilities. Staff on front desk very pleasant and helpful. Pool areas and surrounds kept immaculate. We have been to Orlando before and know the area well and you can not have a better location. We would book again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KathyGran
Reviews.Content: My family and I just came home from a 10 night stay . Floridays Resort is a great place .We would stay there again had a wonderful time.The staff could not do enough for you very helpful .We were in B it was close to pool , bar, coffee shop . the condo did show a little wear and tear but it was ok . I will tell all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “All you Need”
Reviews.Author: MidgeIreland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Floridays.It is a lovely resort the Apartments have everything you will need.I would recommend for all .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mimi1979
Reviews.Content: I live by reviews so I decided to write one to help other people. We stayed for 5 nights at this resort and I think for the price, it was a really good value. The condo was nice size and clean. Although it's technically a condo, housekeeping still cleans the room each day and each time they would replenish the towels, they would leave us like 4 towels for 8 people. I had to call the front desk twice but they quickly rushed us up some towels. I called before booking and was told they are 2.5 miles from the Disney entrance when in fact it was more like 5-8 miles depending on what park. It is really close to a Wal-Greens and Publix which was nice and really close to shopping outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay, a speck from being perfect”
Reviews.Author: erlingormar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on October 30th - November 11th 2009, a couple with two children (6 months old, 4 year old) and a mother(-in-law). Had a two bedroom apartment in Building D. Based on a questionnaire I got from my booking website, here are the comments I made: "PROS: Professional staff attitude, clean surroundings, everything you'd want is on-site. Felt very well taken care of. Room very well equipped (furniture is really large and kind of take away from the otherwise spacious apartment). Awesome concierge service! CONS: In order of importance: housekeeping didn't clean toilets or floors during our 12-day stay (would have needed a run-through of the apartment at ~7 days). Also, when we left the apartment at about 1pm or later, we'd sometimes come back and housekeeping hadn't come back since in the morning (when we had the do-not-disturb-sign up) - even still, housekeeping operates until 5pm. Occasional absence of staff at the pool bar (had to call out to someone for service). Also had a baby crib and I've stayed at hotels where housekeeping makes the crib which I always appreciate (that wasn't done at Floridays, perhaps out of courtesy of us having our own linen)." This being said, the hotel and overall experience was awesome. We've since moved to another hotel and it feels like a huge downgrade. One thing I forgot to add is that the children's pool area has no lifeguard, so you're on your own lookout all day long. Also, all that water is kind of loud, but just parking yourself on the other side of the pool you'd escape that. I'd definately recommend this hotel as one of the best I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: retiredchemist
Reviews.Content: We (3 adult men) stayed here on a golfing trip in early November of 2009. The suites were very well designed. We had a two bedroom, two bath unit which came equipped with a small kitchen (equipped with dishes, pots, pans, silverware, dishwasher detergent), a dining room table, a living room with lcd TV, and a washer dryer in the suite (with detergent for a load). The resort is located on International Drive just a short drive to the Disney main attractions. There is a Publix supermarket and a Walgreens within a walkable distance but if you are staying in one of the back buildings it would be a hike. This is a very family friendly place very reasonably priced with the amenities you would need (especially low priced for Florida residents). The unit was clean and is no-smoking. Towels are changed daily and the bed is remade (using the same sheets). The only downside is that they charge a large fee for internet access ($0.20/minute) and printing ($0.75/page) if you don't have your own computer. A minor inconvenience is that the swimming pools are at the front of the resort complex which would be a long walk if you are staying in the back unit. Depending on your intent, you really need a car to make your stay much more enjoyable. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.. bad shower head”
Reviews.Author: mscarano
Reviews.Content: So I'm back in Orlando for Halloween Horror Nights '09. My friends and I have been looking forward to this trip for some time now. We opted to try a new place to stay this year & found this brand new hotel, which is more like a beautiful apartment complex .. WOW HIDDEN GEM!! The hotel is centrally located, well priced for the accomadations,very clean, the staff was excellent, it also has several ammenities.. like pools, coffee shop, market place, game room, gym, spa, and a restaurant (sad to say, I ddin't get to enjoy all of these). Minutes after checking into our 3 bedroom suite w/ fully equipped kitchen, living room, large bathrooms, jacuzzi, large balcony area, plasma tv's and good smelling toiletries, we received a "welcome call" from the front desk making sure everything was OK. Well needless to say, we had encountered our first "problem" prior to the call. The overhead kitchen lights were not turning on. We tried all the knobs we could find, turn them every which way we could but to no avail. The front desk advised us they will be sending someone over to fix the "problem". Minutes later (literally) a maintenance personnel showed up (boy were we impressed with the prompt service). Well turns out there was no problem at all.. we had to be TAUGHT how to use the lights. Instead of twisting and turning, we had to push and turn the knob in order to turn them on. LOL! The hotel has a "Tommy Bahama" home feel to it w/ it's beautfiul Caribbean decor. It felt like we were in Key West instead of Orlando. The following are the only problems we encountered: 1. Hot water ran out quickly. After 2 people finished taking their hot showers, the rest of us suffered w/ a cold one brrrrrr!! 2. With the beautiful decor, it's a shame they put the electrical panel box right smack in the living room area. You'd think they would opt to put it in the empty closet located between the kitchen and living room. 3. Need to invest in better shower heads! Felt like these were installed as an afterthought. They look very cheap and tacky in contrast to the beautiful bathroom. Needs Improvement! Regardless of these minor problems, I loved the hotel and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Go Wrong!”
Reviews.Author: lpooluk
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 7 nights at this resort, and I must say it's really difficult to find anything negative to write! We stayed in a 3 bedroom suite (1300 sq ft) and found that it met all of our needs. It's extremely helpful having a full kitchen (including utensils) when you're traveling with young children, as we were able to make breakfast each morning before heading out to the theme parks (Publix supermarket and Walgreens is within walking distance). Upon our return each evening, the kids played in the pool (although be warned, it wasn't heated during the last week of October and the kids complained that it was a little cold). The bar is outdoors next to the pool, and the there is live entertainment on Friday and Saturday evening (although it finished around 8pm). The hotel is within 15 minutes of the Disney parks and 5 minutes of Sea World. Despite some other reviewer's suggestions, I would definitely recommend renting a car. The only restaurant within walking distance is Benihana's (which was excellent!), and perhaps Outback Steakhouse (also very good). If you have a car and looking for dining options, try driving north on International Drive for 10-15 minutes and you'll run into dozens of family restaurants within 1 or 2 blocks of each other (Bahama Breeze, BB King's Blues Club, Olive Garden, Red Lobster, TGIF, etc.). The resort is large and currently has 5 or 6 buildings, and if you get chance, ask for Building A or B, as the lobby, concierge, pool, bar, store are located in Bldg A. Some of the other buildings are a LONG walk. We were in Bldg E and belive me, when it's 92 degrees and 70% humidity, you's rather not walk 10 minutes there and 10 minutes back just to grab a morning coffee. I was warned about this, but completely forgot when we checked-in. All-in-all, great hotel and would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, Great Resort, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Maxine43
Reviews.Content: We found a fantastic deal for this hotel and booked a three bedroom suite. The room was clean, the staff was extremely helpful, and the pool area was great for our entire family. This resort is very close to the Seaworld area which made it convenient for our trip to Discovery Cove. It is farther from the Disney area, but if you are only doing a day or two at Disney you should be fine. The only negative was our wireless was extremely slow in our room, but we were on vacation and didn't care. We've stayed at other Orlando properties for double the price, Floridays hands down beats them all.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel & location.”
Reviews.Author: MrCarefulManchester
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Florida with (now) 10 & 12 year old boys. We wanted an apartment with two rooms and this fitted the bill beautifully. The boys room had 2 double beds and a separate bathroom. Ours had a massive king bed and en-suite with a jacuzzi bath. It was very clean with a daily maid service and in a quiet location. Although there were 5 blocks to this resort - it did not feel big or intimidating. The pool was heated, large and ideal for a mid day swim - the boys loved it! The location was superb at the bottom of International Drive - 15 min drive to WDW, 5 mins to Seaworld / Discovery Cove / Aquatica. The Orlando shopping outlet was literally half a mile away and the supermarket was less than that! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: lincon2
Reviews.Content: Choose to stay at Floridays because of the large number of good reviews it recieved on Tripadvisor. A big thank you to them all. the hotel was fab - in a great location 10 minutes from both disney & universal parks. 5 minutes walk to the Premium Outlets & Publics supermarket. At check-in the staff were friendly. Had reason to phone on the 1st night as very loud party happening on the same floor as us and within 10 minutes security staff arrived and music & shouting stopped. They do not tolerate this behaviour as they pride themselves as a family hotel-Very reassuring that this was not going to happen every night. The cleanliness of this hotel was second to none-towels changed every day, beds made and bins emptied. What more do you need? Towels provided poolside so no need to bring your own-just throw them into used towel bin when finished. the rooms are huge and have plenty of space so you dont feel on top of one another. Never seen as many drawers in 1 apartment so plenty of storage space. I would highly recommend Floridays and would not consider staying anywhere else on return to Florids

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: missyWales
Reviews.Content: we had a 3 bedroomed apartment everything you could want very nice staff ,good cafe and pool ,near attractions but in a quiet resort, would recomend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, LOVED this place”
Reviews.Author: Snorkelr
Reviews.Content: This is my idea of a great place to stay. We had 2 adults and a 15 year old, and we were mainly in Orlando for the theme parks (of course!). We had 2 massive bedrooms (the master suite had en-suite bath with a jacuzzi tub, dual sinks and a separate shower. The 2nd bedroom had 2 queen sized beds and a separate bathroom with a tub/shower. We had a full kitchen, washer and dryer, dining area, living room. We had a view of the lake. Parking is free, internet is free, lots of pools to choose from. Fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, really made our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Tye_Bo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 2 weeks in September 2009. Although its only a base for us to do the parks etc, we wanted a nice hotel for the days we weren't out and about - we were blown away by the Floridays. The rooms are HUGE and equipped with everything you could want to have. It felt like a home from home. The facilities like the pool etc were great too and the staff were awesome and couldn't have been more helpful. Round the corner you've got a big supermarket (Publix) as well as some eateries and you are very conveninet for the parks - appox 5 mins from Seaworld/Aquatica, and probably about 10/15 mins from Disney and Universal. Top hotel, wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: mehtaltd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11nights and I am glad that we chose this hotel. Everything was very nice. The check-in was smooth and fast and we were given very nice room. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. We bought our groceries from Publix near-by. It was 10 minutes walk away though there was no proper side-walk to go there. Free shuttle to theme parks was not bad as mentioned in some of the posts earlier. The pool was great though it needed more cleaning. The best part for my little one was that it started from level zero. It was quite big size for the number of guests present. The small shop near the cafe was also good and had nice food. On the whole, I would recommend this hotel for everyone with kids.

Reviews.Title: “This was more like an apartment than a hotel suite!!”
Reviews.Author: JSMIZELLE
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the accomodations at Floridays. We had 3 nice size bedrooms. That includes the master bedroom which is off to itself with a bathroom that has a whirlpool tub and nice shower. The other two bedrooms are on a hallway with a second large bath. We had a nice little kitchen, dining area, decent living room with a screened in patio overlooking a lake with a fountain. The resort also has a great pool area, but unfortunately we didn't have time to enjoy that. Next time we may leave some "down time" so we can enjoy more of what they have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mwalkerBisbee
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice at Floridays. Very clean, lots of space, like being in your own home. The location is great if you're going to Sea World (which is what we did). We were constantly on the go, so we never even got to the swimming pools, or any of the on-site amenities. The only slight negative comment that I would make is that we never new from one day to the next what the housekeeping staff would or wouldn't replace as far as towels and toiletry items. Other than that, we loved our stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: Caz333
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early October whilst visiting Orlando with family. The apartment was excellent. There was lots of room in the 2 bedroom apartment with a full kitchen. Having a washer and dryer available was a godsend! We were given an apartment in Building E which was great. I don't understand some past reviews complaining about the distance of the buildings to the main pool and front of the hotel. It only took 1 to 2 minutes to walk to the main pool, cafe, bar and reception. As for complaints about the cleaning - it is advised clearly on a display stand in the kitchen that they only do basic cleaning (taking out the trash, make beds and replace towels). You can pay extra for additional cleaning, but we didn't need it as we were able to keep it fairly tidy. Our apartment looked over one of the lakes. I enjoyed standing out on the balcony watching the turtles and fish in the water. The bar have some awesome cocktails. It is a lovely place for a drink in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the price”
Reviews.Author: zaijian
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at this resort. We went through an optional time share presentation and got $100 off our stay. It was very low pressure, so well worth it. Some people say they didn't get their rooms cleaned, and such, but at check in they clearly explain that what is included in your rate is a refresh of towels and bed linens everyday, and trash emptied. If you want a complete cleaning of your suite, you'll have to pay more. Pros: -convenient location to all Orlando attractions -Nice Pools -Friendly staff -Nice size units -Good to have Washer/Dryer & Kitchen -Love the tub in the master bath Cons: -Some furniture looked worn -No Wifi

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort for the money”
Reviews.Author: ronlord
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in October, 2009. Room was clean and well equipped with 2 bathrooms, full kitchen, dining room and even a washer/dryer. Pool was clean and easy to find a chair. We got a great rate, only $107 per night. Location is great and close to restaurants and the airport. Would recommend this resort to families or groups of people looking for a change from the normal hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms for the money, but areas could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: lovevacas
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Floridays resort while attending an event at a theme park. I was with family and we reserved a three bedroom for one night. The room itself was very spacious and had everything you could want (full kitchen, plenty of beds, lots of space, great master bedroom,etc). I wasn't able to use the pool because of the weather but it looked beautiful. My complaint is the cleanliness of some of the common areas and parts of the room. The elevators were gross - the floors and walls of the elevators looked like they had not been cleaned for days and so did the common area floors. The beds, tubs,etc. in the room were very clean but the walls showed significant wear and tear (marks, liquid that had spilled and never been cleaned, the furniture didn't look like it was cleaned). I'm concerned that at this rate the place will look awful in a few years which is a shame because the place is really a great deal for anyone staying in the Orlando area. The staff at the front desk was great but the some of the cleaning personal were screaming vulgarites throughout the parking lot on a couple of occassions. Not what you want your kids hearing. Overall, I would recommend, but managment needs to tighten up the common area cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “ELEGANT, MAGNIFICENT, AND AMAZING PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: nyckjay
Reviews.Content: The Floridays Orlando Resort is an excellent place and especially for the price. The suites are spacious and superb. They have everything you need. The view was beautiful and the customer service was pleasant. Althought, we only stayed there for one night we really enjoyed the place. We will be staying here for our other future trips to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “FLORIDAYS HOTEL OUR REVIEW”
Reviews.Author: juliesFloridas
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,we had a 3 bed 2bath suite,we found couple of draw backs which was the location as this was far out even though it said international drive, but you was unable to walk along the i drive unless you got the trolley bus or used a car, the other was the hotel fees. Paid for a full package deal but got to the hotel to be told for clean towels and bins emptied daily it was 10.70 dollars a day wheather you wanted it or not , if you wanted your beds making and cleaned this was just over 30.00 dollars everyday,nice pool and staff very helpful,great hotel if you just need a base to stay but for children there wasnt much to do in the evening unless you get the car out or take a bus.If you book in ask for a block as this is near to everthing. Just a small reminder check and check again on hotel fees and be careful of maid service as we had a full apartment cleaned but when we got back it didnt look much cleaner and bathroom wasnt cleaned very well BUT COST JUST OVER 30.00 DOLLARS FOR THIS. .

Reviews.Title: “The time of our lives”
Reviews.Author: Full_Nesters
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a conference in Orlando, so we decided to take our teenage son & daughter and make a family trip of it. My internet research brought us to the Floridays Resort. We could not have been happier with our stay. The staff (front desk, concierge, housekeeping, etc) were so helpful and friendly. Our every request was handled immediately & professionally. The location of the resort is central to everything we set out to do in Orlando, so we were able to easily find all of our adventures easily. We will definitely be back to Orlando and will most definitely stay at the Floridays Resort.

Reviews.Title: “A LITTLE DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: sweetbi
Reviews.Content: I have been anticipating our trip to Floridays for quite a while, and was disappointed with my experience. You get Absolutely Excellent Value for your dollar, the suites are huge and are cheaper than most hotel rooms and what an excellent location, however the cleanliness of our room will keep me from coming back. On my second night there I stepped on a piece of glass and the tile floor was quite sticky so it was apparent that the floors had not been cleaned, nor faucets polished, which then made me wonder if even the tubs have been cleaned. I have stayed at many hotels and have to say that I would not stay at this hotel in the future. Restaurant & store onsite are absolutely excellent!! Overall Floridays is the best bang for your buck, but the cleanliness could be improved!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value. Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: MomOfTwoHappyBoys
Reviews.Content: We got a 3 bedroom suite for less than $110/night (resort fee included) through its own website. Very spacious. Very good value. No other charges were charged to us when we checked out unlike some other reviews pointed out. Walgreens and Publix are located next to the property. We actually walked there a few times to get grocery and prepared meals at the hotel. money saver! Shuttle service to Theme Park is limited. Only 3 times per day in the morning to Disney and only 2 times per day in the evening back from Disney. (if I remember correctly). Did not get the chance to use any facilities the hotel provided. But our little kids enjoyed watching the ducks swimming in the lake from our room's balcony. The appearance of the hotel probably needs some updates otherwise in 3 years, this place will look like a rundown place. this hotel is a very good value. Will stay again next time when we go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: x_paula_x
Reviews.Content: Myself & 4 other friends stayed here in September and we enjoyed every second of our stay at Floridays! We were slightly worried as we were a young group, ages ranging from 18 to 23 and none of us able to drive over there. However we were more than pleasantly surprised! The staff welcomed us with open arms, and seemed even more helpfull due to us being so young. We were worried that they might be slightly stand offish about the fact that we were a young group but this was definately not the case! The only thing was transport that we found quite annoying, however there was no where we could not get to. We used the I Ride trolley to get up and down international drive with ease($17 dollars for 2 weeks!), and for everywhere else there was the Lynx bus, which was also very cheap! There was also shuttle services from the hotel which was included in the holiday price. The rooms were amazing! Everything you need and way better than what you get from your comfort and quality inn's. It was like a home away from home, seriously! We're booking again for next year asap! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Cosmo06Cosmo06
Reviews.Content: We booked the Floriday's based on reviews we had read, and couldn't have been happier with our stay, from check-in to check-out! We were able to get into our room early, and the room was beautiful and spacious. We were with our 2 daughters, ages 6 and 8. They loved having their own bathroom and bedroom, and there was plenty of closet and drawer space. The only negative was the small balcony, but we never wanted to go out there anyway so it was not an issue. The hotel was close to Disney and Sea World, and grocery and restaurants. The pools were great also. We will definately stay there next time we go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: homecom
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Floridays. It was such a reasonable price. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo for less than we normally pay for a hotel room! Pool was huge. In all...and great time.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you see in the pictures”
Reviews.Author: brit68
Reviews.Content: From reading the reviews Floridays was just what I expected. The pool was large with plenty of loungers and clean towels. The pool cafe was adequate. The grounds are lush and well kept. The staff are pleasant and helpful. Tha apartment overall was great, clean and well equipped. There were only 2 things that I wasn't happy with - We had asked for a pool view if possible and we were given a 2nd floor room overlooking a parking lot. All 2nd floor balconies are about 4 feet tall and made of solid concrete as opposed to higher ones that you can see through and are pleasant to sit out on. This really disappointed me and as a result we didn't use it at all. It also made the apartment feel dark. We arrived at night and didn't realise what a crappy view we had until the following morning when we had unpacked or I would have asked to change. The complex was no more than a third full ( Orlando in general v. quiet in Sept) so I was bugged that they couldn't have given us a room with a better view. The other thing was the shuttle to Disney. We decided to go to Typhoon Lagoon and use the shuttle. The concierge didn't tell us it would take 3 buses and over an hour using the shuttle and Disney buses! Don't do it! Take a cab, it will be about $18. The other Disney parks are easier to get to I believe and also the Seaworld/Aquatica/Universal buses are great and take you straight there. We didn't hire a car this time and we managed ok although we were only there for 6 nights and visited just 2 parks. The supermarket is a 10 minute walk round the corner but there aren't many restaurants in walking distance. We used the I ride bus to get up and down International drive. A car would have been more convenient but for the cost of the carhire it wasn't worth it. Overall, for the price I would visit again but be more clued up about the room i was getting.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for families”
Reviews.Author: JJuca
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife, our 2 year son, my parents e my two brothers. We spend twelve days at Flioridays in 2 rooms (two bedroom suites) and everybody enjoyed this resort. In fact, our rooms were real apartments with living room, dinner table, two bedrooms, , full kitchen and two large bathrooms (one with a bathtub). Nice forniture in every room. Great, funny pools. Location is great, because the Walt Disney World is a few miles away. The resort is also very close to International Drive, Sea World, Discovery Cove and Prime Outlets Mall. And ten minutes drive to Universal Studios. There is a Publix supermarket, a Outback restaurant and a Wallgreens pharmacy in the neighborhood. Very resonable price for a great accomodation. What I disliked in the Floridays: housekeeping is very limited and if you want a cleaning service in the room you have to pay an extra fee. It was expensive and the result was not good. I recommend Floridays resort if you're looking for family accommodations, especially if your trip includes kids. What a liked best: location, full kitchen in the room and price. what a liked least: housekeeping and cleaning service.

Reviews.Title: “A Family Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Fungramma
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Floridays was relaxing and a great time away from home. The staff is extremely accommodating. This was our second time at the Floridays and we highly recommend this resort to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: CAK730
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel so much that we did not want to leave. We are already planning our next visit. This hotel had it all. Loved the pool and the seperate section they had for the children. The hotel store was a bit pricey but it was nice knowing you had everything there if you didnt want to leave. There was also a game/arcade room which my husband and daughter enjoyed. There is a grocery store nearby but it was not an easy walk. My husband came back with bags of groceries but was also drenched in sweat. But i guess he didnt mind too much because he went back a second time. We would definitely rent a car next time. Shuttles were ok but we felt a little limited. Also try to stay at the "A" building as we were close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravlersof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Sept. 23-29, 2009. A family of 4- Mom, Dad and 2 children. We highly recommend staying at Floridays Orlando Resort. The front office staff were very helpful, answered any questions we had, printed our boarding pases upon check out. The 2 bedroom/2 bathroom was clean, and enough room to spread out after all the theme park adventures. Near market, drug store, dining, outlet mall, very close to everything! Nothing more than 10 minutes away. Beds are made for you each day. We had a veiw of their pool/pond area. Pool is small, but we didn't swim. We were in Orlando for the theme parks. Highly recommended for families, or people that like to maybe make their own breakfast before starting the day..or maybe have some ice cream/coffe/tea to relax at the end. Had a washer/dryer which was nice because we got caught in a rainstorm.The only problem I felt was the housekeeping could of been a bit better. But when we called the desk they promptly brought up the supplies and whatever we needed. 5 stars for the front office and the place in general!

Reviews.Title: “Great suite and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AnimaniacOklahoma
Reviews.Content: We can't recommend Floridays highly enough. The suite was clean and very well-supplied, and the staff was always helpful and courteous. One morning when the air conditioning seemed to be failing (the only problem we encountered), the maintenance man arrived within 10 minutes of our reporting the matter to the front desk, and it was fixed within an hour. Before our next trip to Orlando, the very first place we will consider for our accommodations will be Floridays!

Reviews.Title: “HIdden Gem in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: lucky37
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a 2 bedroom suite during the weekend of 9/25/09 and I must say it was the most comfortable place we have ever stayed in Orlando. It is close to all the theme parks and has a grocery store and pharmacy close by. You feel like you're home because you have all the amenities you would need, such as pots, pans, cutlery, plates, glasses and even bakeware. There is a microwave and dishwasher in the suite too. The pools looked very inviting, but we did not have enough time to enjoy them. My family and I are already planning our next trip and this is where we will stay from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: EVIEGrandRapids
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mom and her friend. We had a 3BR/2bath corner unit exchanged with II (timeshare) We requested a higher floor w/pool or lake view but were advised that due to exchange being from owner; they were unable to accomadate our request. The unit was very spacious. Very clean. Only set back was the balcony. It looked out to a "dirt road" and many trees "hovering" by the balcony bannister. The beds/pillows were very comfortable. Pots/Pans available. Had to "fix" a pan's handle which was unscrewed. Dryer full of lint; small things but items which should have been taken care of by housekeeping. Also, though I have not contacted the resort on this yet (I got a terrible infection which I ended up in Med-Center two nites in a row - not resort related though) thus the reason I haven't made contact. However, very important to mention. The bedsheets had blood stains which looked like someone cut their finger or hand and dripped blood on the sheets. These sheets were the same ones all week! Very depressing. Feel they should have been bleached or thrown out. Will contact Resort and advise. Otherwise, no complaints on the room and supplies EXCEPT that we were given one tiny box of tide and when I called the front desk requesting another box (this is the only extra supply we asked for) the person at the front desk kind of "chastised" me for asking for another box. Went on a long "sermon" that it is the norm to only give one box, etc. etc. but would make an exception and send one up, however, he continued to remind me (though we were checking out the next day) that this was the last one he would send up. ??? Anyhow, this was the only staff member that seemed to be "unfriendly" Upon check out we were treated great; boarding passes were printed out; etc. WARNING: You will be advised upon CHECK-IN that your card will be "charged" a "pending" $350.00 fee which will be reimbursed at check-out minus any charges you incur. So make sure you have the funds as "surplus" on your card. POOL: Small, they make it sound like there is a BIG pool and a SMALLER one - in reality there is a small pool and smaller pool near building C. This is where we were located. NOISE: Almost non-existent! :) Ground staff / housekeeping were very kind; helpful; and friendly. Only thing was that though we were close to Internation Drive - having been in Disney area numerous times; I missed US192 easy access to just about everything. Also, being on US192 was nicer to travel at night from Disney. But that's just me. :O TIP: BRING YOUR OWN ETHERNET CABLE OR ASK FOR ONE AT THE FRONT DESK AS SOON AS YOU CHECK-IN. Free internet was a GREAT PLUS!

Reviews.Title: “Great plase will be back!”
Reviews.Author: atlantafamily9
Reviews.Content: Exellent place for a familys with a kids!Great pool area,nice and clean.Publix is at the corner,outlets too.Very close to the parks.Apartment is great and has everything you need for your stay.Will recomendet to everyone!We stayed 2 days at different hotel at Downtown Disney but was stinky and I am glad we pick Floridays to finish our vacantion!Will recomend to everyone!Great place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: goingawayRI
Reviews.Content: my mom and i stayed here for a week and it was the nicest place i've stayed at in a long time. i was surprised of those who said they didn't get their rooms cleaned. we always had a nice clean room...its not a typical hotel so you're not going to get the typical housecleaning unless you pay for it. the resort fee covers every day things like fresh towels, soap, shampoo, etc. we cleaned our own kitch messes, and put the do not disturb sign on the door every other day... there was no need to have them come and replace towels and stuff every day..... the room was very clean and beautiful. the pools very clean and spacious given the amount of children. there were only a couple of minor negatives....my blow dryer didn't work, the elevator was so hot you couldn't breathe in it and i shuttered at the thought of getting stuck in it!! the pool was way to hot for it to even refesh you.... other than that everything about the place was a 10. i will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays Resport in Orlando - Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: Kopitraveler
Reviews.Content: On a recent stay of 8 days / nights the staff at Floridays went above and beyond in service, room expectations and support. There were 4 persons who shared a 3 bedroom condo intown for a conference booked by a budget minded travel coordinator (me). The condo was well recieved with free wifi, free parking, a market nearby and plenty of pools to relax in. Thumbs up from all of us. Excellent value for the money, easy to use web site. The front staff, reservations people and billing were all a great help and have my gratitude. (even assisted shipping some goods for us) Good Job, we'll be back! A BIG Thank you to all!

Reviews.Title: “Super Week, very sad to leave!”
Reviews.Author: trackharrison
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our own two children aged 10 and 14 and extended family the week of September 5th. There were eight of us in a well planned 3 bedroom suite. The suite had two of the bedrooms down a separate hall way making the suite feel private and gave everyone their own space. The two sinks in the 2nd bath were also great for a large number of guests. The suite was clean and everything worked well except 2 quirky bedroom lamps. All of our calls whether for extra towels, plates, etc. were answered quickly and by super friendly staff. We loved the pools, lots of seating, clean towels and the kids enjoyed the game room. The location was great, really close to groceries and a ten minute drive to Disney World. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: rashot
Reviews.Content: I took my wife, my son and his wife, and our two grandchildren to Orlando. We stayed at the Floridays for 3 days. It was a great stay. Beautiful room. Lots of space. The pool was fantastic for the kids. We will DEFINITELY stay there again. I've brought my extended family to Orlando many times over the years. This is by far the best value that I've found.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Excellent for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: PeteShargo
Reviews.Content: I loved the website, and quite frankly the washer/dryer was the best amenity. My family and I loved the place, great location, alot of stuff close by, and great price. the bad things: I felt the keys were kind of shabby, they un-programmed themselves and I had to go the main office to reprogram them which was an inconvenience. Also when we first arrived the place had a bad odor, not a human odor but a bad cleaning agent odor... I don't know what they use to clean but it didn't smell nice. Either way, i recommend it, and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about all the hype/glowing reviews”
Reviews.Author: shadow362
Reviews.Content: We stayed (husband, wife, 3 teenagers and a 12 yr old) in B212 building 2 bed/2 bath at the end of August. I am perplexed at the glowing reviews. It was off season and we had so many choices at the same low rates as this place, but I chose it based on the reviews. Before I mention all the negatives, there are a few positives. The Good: As other's have mentioned the staff, and front desk people are very nice, and anything you ask or need they will do thier very best. The staff are always smiling, friendly, and helpful. The location is convienent (just off freeway, and has a grocery store very close) The pool bar is great to have, and the little cafe came in handy for sandwiches/food for the kids at reasonable prices The pool itself had a nice area for little ones The Bad: Upon entering the room I could not believe how dirty it was. All the walls had massive scrapes and marks on them, (I don't know how someone could manage to scrape up an entire wall in one of the bedrooms). I immediately called the front desk to explain how dirty the room was, looked like it hadn't been vaccummed in months and they sent house keeping to the room right away. I showed them the dirt on the floor, the crumbs and other debris on the couch, and the sticky kitchen counter. They began to clean things up. But the spider webs on the lamps and lighting stayed along with the dust on the shades and around the windows. The balcony had to be the worst I've seen with hair and other debris I can't even imagine what it was, but I decided not to use the balcony after I saw it. The kitchen is very dark and it made for cooking kind of depressing. The condo itself is not very spacious the bedrooms are average size and the living/dining/kitchen are like one fat hallway. We ran out of toilet paper and soap in the first few days and they do not replenish these items automatically. So I ended up buying it at the local grocery store. I wish I had stayed at Vista Cay, or Lake Buena Vista Village as these were the same price. Previously we have stayed at Sheraton Vistanna, Marriot Cypress Harbor and Blue Heron which are all good, but I like to try new places and we were on a budget this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, wonderful family experience!”
Reviews.Author: syletdan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-day weekend at the Floridays - what a great time we had! We were a party of 8 adults; had a large suite with a master bedroom (king-size bed and private bathroom), two additional bedrooms with two double beds each, 1 large bathroom, open space - kitchen/dining room and living room - dishwasher, washer/dryer, balcony. 10 minutes from Disney, close to Interstate 4. Two swimming pools on the premises - one large and one smaller surrounded by a pond. Took advantage on the online grocery service, so when we got there (late in the evening), we had food in our suite. Without a doubt, we had a wonderful time at the Floridays, where the staff was very nice and client-oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Price”
Reviews.Author: RegularGuy2
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews as I simply do not care to spend the time. I will for this place as it was all of what is was supposed to be. Read the positive statements of all others and put me in the mix as completely satisfied. Jim, concierge was overly pleasant and went above and beyond. Dominic and Brittany helped with flight confirmations and when there was issues they stepped up and went the extra mile without complaint. Rooms were big, clean and exactly what you see in the photos....great. Housekeeping earned daily gratuity. Best dollar for dollar value I have had to date in highly expensive Orlando. Stop looking as this joint is what it says it is and is worth the outlay. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best so far !”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Walsh
Reviews.Content: I had done a fair bit of research as i have been to Florida numerous times and seen all sorts of standards! Homes with Pools, Condos, Motels and Hotels .... Got a great deal and knew exactly where this was so I thought ... give it a go ! All the reviews pointed to it being good and I wasnt disappointed! Great value, Good standard and great location! No 30 minute drives from 'Homes' that say they are 10 mins!!!!!!!! I'd recommend this to anyone and I will be returning to this hotel. 5 mins - Seaworld etc 10 mins - Downtown Disney and begining of Disney area 15 mins - Universal Shops and Malls galore ! Give this one a go and you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great place - would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: nyLuv2tvl
Reviews.Content: We won a trip to Orlando with accomodations at Floridays and were blown away. This place is great. We traveled with three kids and had plenty of space. The two bedroom suites are very spacious and comfortable. Each room has a balcony. The pool is big and has something for everyone. We were supposed to switch hotels and ended up extending our stay at Floridays instead. We fell in love with the place. We even recommended it to one of our friends who was also visiting the area, and she ended up staying with her kids at Floridays, and loved it, too. We cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fab time at the Floridays”
Reviews.Author: Lasvegas01
Reviews.Content: The Floridays has it all!!! We stayed for two weeks and had a lovely time. The apartments are lovely, clean and really spacious and the hotel facilities were excellent. I travelled with my 2 years old daughter, who loved the pool jets and little beach area. The maid service is limited, but you can get your room cleaned everyday if you pay extra. The location is also superb, turn right out of the resort and you’re in Buena Vista with all the supermarkets, restaurants and shopping outlets. Turn left and you’ll be heading towards Universal, Sea World and Aquatica. Really impressed by the resort and Florida / Disney it’ self. Free Wi fi also. Only negative is that we travelled with Cosmos / Monarch, who stated that we did not have to pay the resort tax fee on departure ($10.00 per day), as it was already included in the overall price of our holiday, but it wasn’t. After two heavily worded letters to Cosmos, they did refund me the full amount. Well done Cosmos!! I would definitely return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “FLORIDAYS JUST TERRIFIC”
Reviews.Author: PEGASUS2Toronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with our teenage son for 6 days at Floridays and could not ask for a better resort. The Resort staff were extremely helpful and friendly from the time we checked in. The location was perfect for everything we wanted to do. The theme parks were all within close proximity , however we recommend renting a car. There is a Publix Supermarket around the corner where you can easily find food you would need if you want to prepare your own meals. If you would like to make use of the high-speed internet in your suite then you should remember to take an ethernet cable with you. We are already planning our next vacation to Orlando and we will definetly stay at Floridays again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and accomodation”
Reviews.Author: dougalandpoppy1
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Orlando for a few days to do the theme parks with my two year old son. Stayed at the Floridays for two nights. The suite is huge - one room for my two year old and another kingsize double room for us. The ensuite bathroom was huge with a Jacuzzi bath and seperate walk in shower. Great Kitchen with full size fridge freezer, cooker, and dishwasher, and fresh coffee and all cleaning stuffs are also supplied. And a sitting room to chill out in when little ones go to sleep. We were only staying a short time however the accomodation would be great even for those who are staying for a week or two. On site is a great pool - which has a fabulous area for younger kids, a pool bar which serves burgers, sandwiches etc, and a small shop that does enormous muffins. Next door to the hotel (no more than 2 mins walk) is a great Japanese Tepinyaki restaurant where we had the best food of the trip and the service was exceptional. All of this and the parks are only minutes away (Seaworld 5 mins, Walt Disney 5-10mins) - A faboulous place to stay when visiting Orlando and not expensive either - great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort with beautiful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: BobBun
Reviews.Content: We were a family of five and each one of us thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! We had no problem with making reservations with the shuttle to get to and from the parks. The staff is very well trained and professional, they greet you every time they see you. You can't ask for better accommodations, complete with a jacuzzi and separate shower in one of the huge bathrooms and a fully equipped kitchen. They say the DAILY resort fee (which we were aware of) covers the amenities and shuttle service. They start you off with some amenities and you can request more if needed, but they aren't supplied unless requested.. I had to ask for more toilet paper which they supplied quickly. You would think they would do this automatically. . . .Made us wonder about the daily amenity fees. The only thing this unit could use is a light above the sink, that area is very dark. We highly recommend this resort . If you are looking for a resort with class then you won't be disappointed with this choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, peaceful nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoAugust
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were treated magnificently, they wanted nothing more than to meet our expectations. The resort is abloe to cater for all types. We wanted peace and quiet but we could have also been based right next to the main hub and facilities. Accommodation was first class and the small additonal service charge of $12 covered a daily bed making, towels and top up of amenities (not cleaning) and was well worth the extra. We had everything we needed in our apartment. The location minutes from Walt Disney and at the Southern end of International Drive gave us access to all the local attractions as well as easy accees to major roads to take us elsewhere. I have been visiting Orlando several times a year for many years and this was certainly one of the best places we have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort! Terrific Location!”
Reviews.Author: Randi G
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14-yr old son and his 14-yr old friend stayed here and LOVED IT!! The front desk staff was extremely friendly (especially Brittany - she always had a smile and ready to answer any questions). The only issue ( minor) was that our confirmation documents (we did an exchange thru Interval) indicated a check-in time of 3 p.m., but we were told when we got there that check-in was actually 4 p.m. Not really a major bump to us - we just strolled to their cafe and had a late lunch poolside. Brittany brought our unit keys to us and we were good to go! The 2 BR unit that we stayed in was very clean, well decorated and laid out. We didn't feel cramped at all. The boys tried to claim our jacuzzi tub, but to no avail! The kitchen was well equipped for the week and although the Publix supermarket is literally just around the corner, we opted for Wal-mart which is only about a 10 minute drive. We were in Building B on the second floor - great for a short walk to the pool. Soundproofing was pretty good - didn't really notice any noise from the neighbors. The location of Floridays is a definite plus! It's at the opposite end of Intl Drive from all of the "tourist" things so we didn't encounter a lot of traffic. We did the Universal Studios/Island of Adventure thing during the week with a day at SeaWorld mixed in. SeaWorld is literally just down Intl Drive (5 minutes) and Universal was only about 10 minutes away. The biggest asset that Floridays can boast about is their guest services. As I said before, the front desk staff were outstanding and Dominic, the front desk manager was outstanding! The day before we were to leave, we tried to use the business center to print our airline boarding passes. You have to use a cash value card to use the computers, printers, etc. We couldn't get the value card machine to work but that turned out to not be a problem. Dominic called the company(a 3rd party vendor)to place a service call, then escorted my husband and I to the administrative office where we could use the office computer to complete our online check-in and print the boarding passes! We would definitely stay here again on a return trip and totally recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PAfuntime
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in a 3 br suite --- one of the few places that I was able to find to accomodate 8 adults in one unit. Found it to be very comfortable, spacious, everything you could need in the unit. Pool was nice and enjoyed---although our "kids" looked longingly at the hotel pool next door with its slides, etc -----they wanted to go to that pool. All employees were very friendly, nice and helpful. The only negative I have at all about the place is that we had to drive to go anywhere. As there were so many of us, had to take 2 cars to go everywhere. Went to the Magic kingdom and had to drive 2 cars to go there ---------- I had been really counting on taking the hotel shuttle to get to the park and one of the reasons I picked this resort was that it said it had shuttles to all the parks.. Shuttle did not have very convenient times and they said they dropped you off at Epcot (to get to Disney). The return shuttle at night for disney left from Epcot before the disney park had closed ----------we would have missed the parade and fireworks. So that was the only disappointment. Really hated driving our rental car all over. I would truly recommend that this resort upgrade its shuttles, Provide shuttle service to and from airport and better times to all the parks. Would make it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays, Orlando”
Reviews.Author: flojo7
Reviews.Content: We've visited Orlando for the past 9 years and have always stayed in the same area/resort. However, this year we decided to give somewhere else a try and we certainly weren't disappointed with sFloriday. We were a little apprehensive about staying near/on International Drive but the location of this resort was perfect as it's on International Drive South (the quiet part!). All the parks, restaurants, bars and shopping malls were within a short distance if you wanted to drive but the hotel also had a good (free) shuttle service and there's a bus stop outside the hotel which was very cheap ($1.25 one way to the busier part of International Drive). The accommodation was first class and had everything you could ever need. The whirlpool bath was a nice 'touch' (and perfect to unwind in at the end of a busy day!), fresh towels were provided daily, all the garden areas were well maintained and everywhere was spotless. The staff were always helpful and friendly and were able to answer any queries we had. The only complaint we had, and we realise this is a bit of a strange one .... the frogs on the lake outside our room made the loudest noises we've ever heard & some nights it was difficult to get to sleep but to be honest we were so tired out each night that it wasn't too much of a problem (just sounded really odd!!). The weather was a bit of pain as it rained most days (only for an hour or so) but it was still really hot. It's worth keeping a check on the forecast and work your park visits around the weather - coz when it rains it absolutely pours! (Tip: go to Walmart and get a poncho for $2 you may look a bit of a twit but at least you'll keep dry!!) Wecan't recommend Flloridays highly enough - book it, you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the rest of Orlando Area”
Reviews.Author: bromwichblue
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Floridays and our fifth visit to Orlando. As before the hotel complex and everything about it was excellent. I dont need to go into detail. Enough people on here tell you what Floridays is like. What they dont tell you though is how the Orlando area has really changed over the last few years. The main International drive area is like a ghost town, the shops are dead. People no longer go there due to the threat of Crime. If you are travelling with kids but like to go out late,forget Orlando completely. After 10 - 11 pm its not safe anywhere. Disney have closed Pleasure Island due to the trouble and nobody goes out around International Drive area after dark. We were told the only place to go out late was Universal studios City Walk. This is a fantastic area . The whole of Universal is fantastic , they have grown over the years and the parks and City walk now genuinely rival Disney theme parks. Problem is City walk although open until the early hours is no place for families aftter 10pm. We went there late one Eve and went inmto Bubba Gumps for dinner about 9pm. Bubbas was great, well worth a visit. By the time we cam out and started to walk round the security staff were very active with trouble making youths and we could not see any children left in the whole of city Walk. All the families flee around 10pm. By 11pm all families are safely tucked up in thier hotels Anywhere you stop after 10pm you will feel unsafe, Petrol stations, supermarkets, restaraunt car parks , its not safe.........just watch the local news while you are there, every day there are shootings, stabbings, robberies and murders. Orlando is quite large but not exactly a major city , violent crime however is probably 10 times what you would hear about in London. Obviously this is why the tourist areas are like a ghost town after 10 pm. International Drive is pretty deserted all day, the shops must really be struggling , they are always empty. If you are a family Orlando is a great place if you just want the Theme parks in the day , just keep your car doors locked when driving, if visiting a Restaraunt or shop in the evening, make sure you park in a well lit part of the car park . The car parks are very large and many areas badly lighted behind the restaraunts. My honest advice would be stick with Disney , all Disney areas are well lit, have great security and are far enough away from the main residential areas to prevent becoming hang out places for low lifes. While anywhere run by Disney , you feel entirely safe. If Florida is to remain the no1 holiday destination in the world, Orlando government must address the issue of crime. . One interesting fact to support my concerns is , on the local news while there I watched an article that claimed applications to carry a concealed weapon was at 160,000 for the area. A record high. Unlike the UK , Americans can carry concealed guns in public places . There are a lot of guns out there. WHY SUMMARY Floridays is Superb, Anything Disney is superb , Universal in the day is superb , just remain aware of your surroundings , keep your car doors locked whilst driving and dont expect anything to happen after 10PM

Reviews.Title: “Floridays is my holidays from a uk family”
Reviews.Author: flipflopguy
Reviews.Content: Sitting here by the lovely pool using the free internet sipping on a smoothie writing this report! Floridays is excellent for a young family situated on the top end of international drive within a 5 min walk to publix supermarket to get food supplies and a 10 min walk to mcdonalds and the prime 1 outlet where it has some good deals -use the voucher book.The hotel rooms are very big with full kitchen facilities living room area(bed settee) ,balcony and two bedrooms with sep bathrooms ours had a walkin shower room with a great jacuzzi relived our honeymoon night!!!! All the hotel staff were great ,concierge was helpful /info plus the free shuttle was fab to the parks book the day before, the on cafe /bar was good and my 3 girls loved the pool! if you fancy takeout i recommend -Citrus for chinese on [--] and pizza-italian world [--]. Our family used the I-RIDE trolley buses to get up and down international drive we got a 14 day pass = kids ride free but if u wanna go further a field you may wanna rent a car as the yanks dont walk and a car gives you freedom. Verdict i would come to floridays again it was clean good facilities , helpful staff, etc so have a fab holiday daz

Reviews.Title: “Still a PERFECT vacation - flawless”
Reviews.Author: SteveC5
Reviews.Content: If you'd asked me in early 2007 if I'd go to the same hotel year after year I'd have laughed at you and said, 'no way!'. However, I just got Tripadvisor to delete my 2007 review so I could update it having stayed in Floridays for the third year in a row. Location Someone said they couldn't find their way home from Disney. I'll give you directions to Disney here; Turn right out of the hotel, turn right at the end of the road. Disney is straight ahead. For that matter, turn left out of hotel, turn right just before the convention center (down the 528 toll highway, $2.75), Cocoa beach is (55mi) straight ahead. Seaworld, Turn left out of hotel, Seaworld is straight ahead. It's location couldn't get any better. Even to the extent of the supermarket (Publix, think Sainsburys quality if you're British), and Walgreens (quite like Boots) within walking distance (5-10 mins) and much more. This really is the perfect Orlando location with or without a car. You're close enough to Disney that a taxi is a possible way of getting there and the hotel runs shuttles. It's also directly on stops for the iRide trolley which will bring you to Seaworld/Universal and the delight that is I-Drive. Rooms I don't think anyone disagrees - you'll NEVER be able to go back to a hotel room once you've stayed in one of these. Our family of four (two young kids) loved everything about it. Fully set up to do any cooking you want, we've come home with everything laundered, I thought the fixtures and fittings were of good quality, granite worktops for instance. Grounds and Pool The pool is great for younger kids as it's got a zero entry and loads of play-fountains. Around it is well stocked with both sunbeds and towels. Even at full occupancy we had no problem getting a place to sunbathe at any time of the day. The second pool is also a great place to go for a quieter sunbathing experience but having two kids I only went over to have a look at it. Cleaning and other. So long as you're not expecting your room to be deep cleaned every day (like a regular hotel room is), you'll be happy with this. You get free Internet in the room (wired), and free Internet in other locations around the site (wireless). Techie grudge though - I couldn't make a MS-VPN connection due to firewall restrictions, Cisco and Nortel connections were fine though. Staff One of the things that Floridays are doing really well with is the staff. In previous years they were OK to good but now they're of 'Disney' standard. Happy, helpful staff that go out of their way to make sure that everything is perfect. This year I seemed to see Tom at reception a lot and TJ and Shanon at the bar so special mention goes to them, but everyone really was great. Conclusions Not many hints and tips as it's all been said. Best blocks are A, B and C. Blocks D and E are fine, but mean a walk across the carpark to the main pool/bar area, but no big deal. Avoid the second floor if you can as the balcony isn't as good. Couldn't ask for more. Never mind 5* hotels with posh reception areas and doormen, bellhops and 50 other staff all wanting tips for meaningless tasks. This condo/hotel idea is FAR better. Though, it has to be said, if you want someone to carry your bags and open your doors, I think they'll provide them.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: crazee063
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays four nights, our entire stay in Orlando. It was great - very clean, responsive front desk/room service, friendly staff and more than ample amenities. Very close to Disney and great areas for nightlife, dining, etc. We loved it and would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly helpul staff”
Reviews.Author: mandyann2000
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are excellent, nicely furnished with everything you could possibly need, washer and dryer, fully equipped kitchen, beautiful jacuzzi bath and Tv's in every room. Staff are so friendly and helpful. Swimming pool is wonderful. Hotel is fairly close to supermarket. In terms of proximity to parks, shopping etc I think it would be easier to hire a car, although the I-drive is close by. I would recommend this hotel to everyone..........

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort, but they get you with the fees - watch out!!!”
Reviews.Author: NJfamily_9
Reviews.Content: The resort is very nice overall, but not much to do for teenagers - only a game room. When we checked out I was surprised by the daily hotel service fee that we had to pay. Even though we did not have any cleaning in our room during our stay, didn't even get enough soap. Once I got home and checked my credit card bill, I also noticed a $440 charge from Floridays that I did not authorize. After talking to them, they explained that when you check in, the hotel puts a security deposit on your account, which will be removed once everything found complete in your room. This was not explained to us when we checked in, and I disagree with their methods.

Reviews.Title: “excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: geoffando
Reviews.Content: floridays resorts is situated at the end of international drive. It is a ten minute walk to the premium outlet mall, which has some excellent shops in it, but no A&F,we stayed there the first two weeks in august and decided not to hire a car as the hotel ran free buses to all the major attractions and the i trolley stop was right outside the hotel, we found no problem getting around and were glad we didnt hire a car. The hotel itself has excellent facilities, which included a large pool area with spa, a gym, shop( a bit pricey), and a starbucks!,. The rooms were massive and so were the beds, the most comfortable beds ive ever slept in, the kitchen had every gadget you could possibly want, the only bug bear we had was the service charge at the end of your stay, floridays should seriously consider scrapping this, you feel a little ripped off. On the whole the hotel was of a really high standard and i wouldnt recommend this to anyone on a budget, if you want cheap go to quality inn, if you want a bit of luxury go to floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Excellent Amenities”
Reviews.Author: AbercrombieScotland
Reviews.Content: We spent 24 days at Floridys in June 2009 and this was our Second visit and we are considering a third. We love Florida simply because it offers something for everyone. We do not do all the parks every year instead with teenagers we shop, go to cinema eat out all of which is ideally located to Floridays. We had a three bedroomed suite in Block A -after asking to be moved from F as it is quite far from main pool - It was well equipped, nicely decorated but If I am to be honest needed a LITTLE maintenance. Maid service is limited to once a week unless you pay extra and In my opinion not as good as it could be. Staff where all very helpful even when I lost my phone one guy jumped in the trash for me which was way beyond the call of duty. Again on moving to Block A bellman helped us move everything and the manager ensured that we moved within a couple of days. My main criticism was that of the security staff! Travelling with five teenagers it is perfectly normal for them to want to hang out at night, but everywhere they went they were moved on. They were not drinking or being loud simply mixing with guests from around the world. There is an empty lounge overlooking the pool, no where near bedrooms! This would be an ideal area for the hotel to provide a pool table, darts, music anything to give the older children something to do. That would make the hotel appeal to all ages. This would be the only reason we may not return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but the fee at he end is disgusting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maggyme
Reviews.Content: Hotel very clean, and spasoius would,nt go back to the hotel as you get fees at the end of your stay for what im not sure think it was for changing our towels we never once had our bedding changed and we were there for two weeks with a child of 12 and a child of 6 plus myself and husband.Ive traveled the world but never had to pay addital fee at the end for towels getting change.if i was to stay in a 2* hotel you would get your towels change included in the price that you pay the travel agent.The hotel is beautifull the rooms are lovely its just the fee that really put us off exspecially when you think you have budgeted for your holl then you get slapped with a 200= bill at the end of the holiday ..

Reviews.Title: “Floridays recommended”
Reviews.Author: eliseGb
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 bed condo for two weeks. Our kids are 4, 12 & 14 and the flexibility the condo gave us made a huge difference. Everyone was able to have their own space which cut down on the usual fighting that takes place and the master suite gave us a haven from the kids and the parks each day (parents will understand!). Positives; check in and check out; staff & service; there are always security/staff around making it feel safe; the room was clean with fresh towels daily; location is excellent for all attractions & eateries; good supermarket & drug store 2 mins away; well equipped, poolside bar & cafe is useful Negatives; Not much - I knew of the resort fee (explained at check in and at booking) but would rather see more frequent bedding changes & hoovering for the fee than things we don't use (we had our linen changed more often but you pay extra as the normal change is once per week) some rooms are a few mins from the main pool (minor niggle) there is no life guard by pools so if that's important to you choose a Disney resort The location of Floridays makes this an ideal base for families not wanting to pay top dollar for the Disney equivilent and we would have no problem in recommending the resort. It does lack a bit of sparkle though, nothing I can put my finger on but it is perhaps a bit souless. PS - Can't recommend Undercovertourist highly enough re tickets for parks, both on price & delivery so check them out before you book elsewhere. Ours were Fed Ex delivered to the UK in 2 days

Reviews.Title: “Good, but watch out for the Resort Fee on departure!!”
Reviews.Author: Isles-mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 29th of May for two weeks, having previously stayed there for two weeks in 2008, knowing it had everything we needed for our family holiday. Again, we found the staff to be very polite and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We chose to stay here because it really is a home from home. Knowing there is a washer and dryer in each condo meant that we could travel light and just do our laundry at our leisure. The negative of our trip this year was that a bill for "Resort Fees" landed under our door the night before we departed for $10 per night plus tax. That is a lot of money to find at the end of your vacation, especially as we had only paid $5 last year. The only difference in facilities appeared to be that there was Wifi available in the common areas of the hotel. The makes it a very expensive internet connection - especially if you don't use it!!! When I queried the 100% increase from 2008 I was informed that it should actually be $12, but because our booking was through hotelbeds we only had to pay $10.....gosh...thanks!! I really can't understand why your nightly rate can't include this charge. Already planning our next trip to wonderful Orlando, but considering other options.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: Kent-14
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 bedroom condo which turned out to be more than we expected. The rooms were spacious and clean, more than a home from home! The washer and dryer meant we could travel lighter as we knew these would be available and as a family of five, we only checked in 3 suitcases with space to spare for holiday purchases, out of our 115kg allowance we only used 65kg (hopefully doing our bit for the enviroment!). The staff were excellent in all aspects especially as this was our first visit to Florida, providing maps, transport and peace of mind. The facilities catered to all our needs and we were even given a complimentary late check out time to allow for our evening flight home. I could not recommend this resort enough, the condo space meant we all could have some alone time if necessary. We had read all reviews before travelling which did impact where we stayed and our choice did not disappoint. We were in building E which despite some negative reviews with regard to distance from main pool and facilities, we found to be perfect and wouldn't have wished for more.
