Thank you Floridays for making our holiday one that we will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: berniceliu888
Reviews.Content: My parents wanted to cook while we're vacationing in Florida (Disney World!), so we booked a week at a resort with a kitchen instead of hotels. We arrived a to discover the big parking lot with many buildings of Floridays Resort. We were delighted to find that the room is like a nice condo. We had two rooms, which was perfect for a family of four. The television was big and had many channels, with one in each room (living room, 2 bedrooms). There were also two bathrooms, one with a jacuzzi and shower stand, one with a tub. Overall it was a great stay, the washingmachine and dryer worked properly as well. Knives were provided along with plates, cups, and bowls and a dishwasher. We spent a few days swimming at the pool leisurely. I remember there were 3 pools, a small one that was nice, a big one, and a jacuzzi. (maybe there was four, I dont remember.) The gym was also very nice, with a television and a good amount exercise machines. Overall, a very nice place, with a Walgreens and Walmart nearby. A GPS along with this Resort was perfect with our Disney World vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: Ebert1
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sunday Aug 2nd and stayed until Aug 5th. Check in was very fast and simple and they were very friendly! We got to our room after a long day at Sea World and we stayed in a 2 bedroom it was nice we had a pool view which was perfect. It was nice to have 2 double beds in the one bedroom and the king bed in the other. The kids loved the whirlpool tub (they are 7 and 9) it was the perfect size for the four of us. And it was nice that they gave you as much laundry soap as you needed for free. Everything was close by the outlet mall was about a 2 minute drive as well as a Publix (grocery store) and outback steak house. We were about a ten minute drive to disney parks/seaworld. I would love to stay there again it was also very quiet even by the pool with the door open it was loud but as soon as that door shut it was quiet in there.Hands down to the staff they were great at getting you address for our GPS and anything else that we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic- do not book anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: flycheese
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel!! We arrived in Orlando after being delayed for more than 10 hours in Manchester Airport- which meant we didn't get to Floridays until 3am. We were allocated a ground floor room and as it was so late we just crashed out. The following morning on exploring the apartment (wow) we realised the balcony was concreted in at the bottom so you couldn't sit down and look out. We asked the reception staff immediately for a change of rooms- they said that normally, as we had 'used' the rooms (and so they would require a full clean) we would have to pay for this- but they waived the charge and found us a fantastic apartment on the second floor overlooking the smaller pool and lake (complete with turtle!!). The room was amazing, everything absolutely brand new, there were full laundry facilities, washer, dryer- two double bedrooms with ensuite to the master bedroom- with a jacuzzi- there was a lounge area and then a dining area with a kitchenette- very roomy- all looking out onto a fantastic view. The rooms were clean and kept clean (you don't need to pay for the extra cleaning service)- there was a dishwasher- just to make everything that bit easier! There was also a fantastic supermarket round the corner very convenient with lots of choice. We basically had the hotel pools to ourselves when we stayed at the hotel during the day and as we went after the school holidays had ended there weren't many children around- so very peaceful and relaxing. The hotel provide towels and there are plenty of sunbeds. There was a bus that took you up and down international drive for just a dollar- fantastic- everyone was so friendly! If you can afford it you should go to Discovery Cove- what a fantastic experience- you also get passes to SeaWorld/Busch Gardens and Wet and Wild for the rest of your holiday. Don't buy from the booths in Orlando as these are discounted as they take you for a morning trying to sell timeshares (unless you don't mind of course). We didn't do Disney as we wouldn't have had time in our 2 week to cover Discovery Cover/Busch Gardens/Seaworld/ Wet and Wild and Disney- we certainly didn't regret our choice- absolutely amazing- particularly going to see Shamu- we didn't think we would be bothered by this and just went as we were there- but it was such a wonderful experience- I would most definitely recommend it to anyone! We also went to Cocoa Beach and if you are thinking of going here stick around the pier as the facilities are better- we went too far down and it wasn't as 'pretty' We also went to Texas De Brazil (sorry about the spelling) as we had heard really good things about it- it was all you can eat but cost about $150 for 2 so was great for a special evening but there were plenty of more reasonable alternatives just as good in our view. The best place we ate was fudruckers- for less than $20 you could get a burger each (cooked to order in front of you) with all the salad and pop you can stomach- it had a very relaxed and friendly atmosphere- we both thought the staff were fantastic here. Anyway back to the hotel- you will not be disappointed- the hotel is really the most important thing for me in terms of my holiday experience and this was most definitely the best one- staff were great- so thanks for a wonderful holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RachelManchester_UK
Reviews.Content: We did lots of research, and had previously stayed in Orlando, before booking Floridays. Overall, we were delighted with our choice. The location was fabulous, as long as you've hired a car, in the middle of Disney/Universal and really close to Publix & restaurants. The apartment was very spacious and, as two couples, we each felt like we had our own 'wing' as we didn't have to share a bathroom. We couldn't believe how big the master bathroom was - almost out of proportion to the bedroom! The pool was great and the kitchen was really well-equipped. When I discovered that there was no corkscrew in the apartment, even though there was supposed to be, someone brought one over despite a thunderstorm. The washer/dryer was brilliant. The only problem we had was a really odd smell near the washer/dryer. Maybe there had been a leak previously, but it smelt damp. However, it really didn't spoil our visit and we would stay here again if we re-visited Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “All you will need”
Reviews.Author: Wilus
Reviews.Content: I and my family have just spent 10 days at Floridays and I can’t recommend it enough. We had a 2 bed suite in block B on floor 4 with a view over the pool. Things that are great: Location, near all the parks but you need a hire car. The rooms are we equipped and air-conditioned, the washing machine and dish washer were invaluable. Staff were fantastic, front desk and concierge. A special thanks to Yanira Fernandez. Housekeeping is in every day they makeup the beds and update the bathrooms. The main pool was great with fresh towels and loads of sun bed space. Look out for: The complex is not a Hotel. Do not expect on site restaurants etc. There is a small bar and café with a site shop selling a small amount of day to day things. We loved this Complex and would defiantly revisit. Thanks Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: One-N-Only
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this resort twice, and will return again when we go to Orlando. This resort has become a home away from home when we want to take a trip up to Orlando. The rooms are very clean, as well as the property itself. It is very convenient to everything, especially the amusement parks and the outlet mall.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: jz3811
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays Orlando Resort from July 30 to August 2, 009. We stayed in 2 bedroom condo in building C. The rooms are very spacious, checking in was a breeze. We arrvied at 5 pm and get our room within 10 minutes. The room were nice, cleaning lady came everyday to change the towels and take out the garbage. Their pool was amazing, better than a lot of the hotels that we stay at. Checking out was a breeze. We went to publix supermarket to purchase groceries. Overall it was a good stay. We will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: sillyaly
Reviews.Content: I spoke to Natalie and a few more agents from customer service to this hotel they dont understand a person calling them is charged for the call and transfer your call without even listening to you.. it is a very bad customer service. Hotel is The Best But the Customer Service Is SomeThing More Than Worst.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: lovemovies
Reviews.Content: The suites were perfect, a home from home. The master bedroom and spa bath really made our stay special. Staff coudn't have been more helpful. Very handy for supermarket and shopping. Great pool to relax around. Didn't need to carry the beach towels as supplied at the pool. Need to remember the resort fee charged daily, but good value as towels ect changed every day. Ver handy especially if you drive to all attractions. Only comment was that those who buy lots to take home that luggage allowance for some airlaines(globespan) at american end added the checked/ carry on bags together and some folk were charge $30 per kilo over the 25kg allowance.

Reviews.Title: “floridays resort”
Reviews.Author: jbossie
Reviews.Content: just wanted to leave a review for the floridays resort we just came back from florida last week and had a great time the floridays resort was great .we stayed in a 3 bed apt it was spotless and had everything we needed for a large family 3 adults 2 teenagers 3 kids and a baby the pool area was brilliant the kids loved it especially at nightime and it was relaxing for the adults too . we went to the wwe one night and asked the receptionist for directions he printed them out asked if we needed anything else and did we need an escort back to our room if we were late home we found them so helpful and we will definitely stay there again when we go back

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cov Traveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an extended family reunion/vacation in Orlando. We decided to arrive in Orlando a few days prior to the reunion to take in some of the parks, shows, and relaxation. I booked a room at Floridays Resort for four nights, months before the trip. Keeping track of the rates, I managed to get a rate of $118/night, under the AARP rate, for a 2-bdrm suite. I've read many of the reviews prior to visiting Floridays and I must concur with the majority of them. Here's my take: Location - the resort is practically centrally located on International Dr. between Universal, Seaworld and Disneyworld. Quick access to all the parks. Universal was farthest, but still within 10 minutes drive. A Publix grocery is right around the corner along with several restaurants. More eateries are across the freeway. The Orlando Premium Outlet mall is also right around the corner for convenient shopping excursions. Price - the rate I got probably was one of the best you can get for a 2-bdrm condominium-style room. They didn't even ask for our AARP card as proof. Grounds - they are well-landscaped and designed. There are two lakes sprinkled among the buildings. The main pool area is very large and nice with both a shallow side and water play area for children. There is a separate pool area near the rear of the complex for those who reside there. We were in Building F (way in the back), but the walk to the main pool was not arduous at all. Even when the main pool area seemed crowded, there was plenty of room for everyone. The entranceways to the rooms (exterior entrances) seemed a bit weathered in our building and could use some overall cleaning. Rooms - spacious with all the amenities you'd need for a family of 4 or more. Ours was very clean. Lots of elbow room to stretch your arms and not bump into anything. The kids enjoyed their own separate bedroom with the two beds, bathroom and TV. The master bedroom was spacious enough. The bathroom with a jacuzzi tub (which we didn't use, but was nice) was also spacious, with a separate shower. We cooked our own breakfast every morning to save money on going out to eat. The kitchen had everything we needed (even an electric beater for eggs or pancake batter). It was no problem putting the dirty dishes in the dishwasher to be cleaned by the next morning. The washer/dryer combo came in very handy, as we were able to wash clothes prior to checking into the reunion hotel (Residence Inn Orlando Airport - see my review there too). Nice balcony, though they could also use a quick washdown. The thermostats can be very tricky to operate, but a quick call and the maintenance man was eager to offer assistance on how to operate it. Housekeeping - only basic housekeeping is provided; towels, linen changes, supplies, spot cleaning, etc. You are charged for any additional services (vacuuming, full bathroom/kitchen cleaning etc.) We had no problems with the basic service. When we returned from a day of sightseeing, our room looked as clean as the day we checked-in. They even provide a vacuum in the second bedroom closet (just in case you wish to do it yourself). The rooms also come with free "wired" high-speed internet, so you need a network cable. I didn't request one since we had our own, but I"m sure they supply them from the front office. I particularly liked the ease of use; there was no "hotel gateway" access to bother with, just plug it in and your on your way. Overall - I would definitely recommend Floridays to family, friends and others. We spent one day just doing nothing, and it was nice to do it in a clean, comfortable and spacious room. We plan to return to Orlando again soon, and the Floridays will be on the top of our list of hotel choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - very reasonably priced for level of quality/service!”
Reviews.Author: CDP27
Reviews.Content: As always, we did our research on tripadvisor before booking this hotel. However, I will have to say this place exceeded our expectations! This was the cleanest, most spacious, and best smelling room I have ever set foot in! The kitchen area was more than sufficient in size and supplies (family of 4). The inside of the drawers and cabinets were all very clean and the sharp knives were even placed blade under the silverware tray toward the back of the drawer which was a nice touch for anyone with little ones who like to thouroughly inspect their new surrondings! The split bedroom/bath layout was nice so that we could get up early or be up late without disturbing the kids. The beds were comfortable enough and we loved the black out drapes so that it was possible to sleep in! There were plenty of fresh towels and other bath amenities provided - we never had to ask for more of anything. We only used the pool area a couple of times and while there were several people there, we didn't have any trouble finding a lounger and there were plently of fresh pool towels available for use. The kids had a blast under the water mushroom and other water features at the pool! There is even a small "beach" or at least a good little stretch of sand for the kids to play in - in case your travel plans don't take you to the coast! We only stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Sea World, but could have easily stayed an entire week. We will definitely be back the next time we find ourselves in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “FLORIDAYS is FLORIPERFECT!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NJ-Kelly
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a fantastic week at Floridays Orlando Resort. Floridays was perfect for my family of four. This resort has everything you need! Perfect location to all the local attractions-Disney, SeaWorld, Discovery Cove, and Universal Studios are just minutes away. We were impressed from the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out. We stayed in the two bedroom suite which was great. Everything was brand new and spotless. We are used to sharing one hotel room and will never do it again! We are completely spoiled. Two bedrooms, two baths, sitting area, dining area, and kitchen. Plenty of room for everyone! It was so nice to return from a full day at one of the parks, be able to unwind, and have your own space. My kids weren't fighting over the TV because we had three in our suite! I also loved having a full kitchen. We went to Publix (grocery store next store) and stocked up on drinks, snacks and breakfast foods. The resort also offers room service family style meals-pasta ones were great and more than enough for everyone. My kids also loved the pool and arcade. Floridays was Floriperfect!

Reviews.Title: “BIT DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: fancaseman
Reviews.Content: I have just retuned from Floridays after 2 weeks and I have to say we were a little disappointed with the overall experience. We have stayed at a number of different resorts in Orlando, and sadly this resort falls short of the others. The clenliness of the main swimming pool area-including the quality of the water- was below standard, and gave the impression that it was not checked regularly.This was pointed out to the staff by me on two seperate occasions (after witnessing children slipping in algae on the pools edge) and was eventually cleaned. Also, there is a lack of shade around the pool. Having said this, the rooms were very nice, although a little dark, and plenty of clean towels every day supplied and everything you need for a high quality self catering experience. All the staff were very polite and curteous at all times. The gym was clean, but if you're a regular gym user you will be disappointed ! The best aspect of the resort was its location as you are a few minutes drive away from all the theme parks and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays Resort is absolutley phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: firstclasstvlr
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend there and we had grown adults and college kids in our group and everyone enjoyed the resort immensley. The condos are very spacious, well decorated and have all necessary items for your stay. Everything is incredibly clean and well maintained. The staff goes out of their way to be professional and accommodating...and the resort offers tons of amenities in the way of internet/computer room, a great work-out center and their swimming pool is amazing! The restaurant food is very good and moderately priced, which is also a big benefit! The resort is close to the theme parks, restaurants and shopping. Best place I have ever stayed in a resort/tourist area!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lyricalkiss
Reviews.Content: My family and I really enjoyed our wonderful 6 nights here. It was just so relazing after a long day at Universal/Sea World/WetNWild. Everyday the kids were asking to go back to the hotel around 3:00 (Which is early for us). But no complaints from uss, We all wished we could have stayed a little longer. Only complaint is that we wished the Shuttle was a little more frequent. (don't think the Hotel has any control over that)I can't wait to go back. We loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place to Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: funtripsFlorida
Reviews.Content: Everything is absolutely beautiful at Floridays Orlando Resort, from the moment you walk into the lobby to check in, the building exteriors, the foliage, garden courtyards at every buidling entrance, and the condo unit! The condo unit gave us a weekend living in luxury. It had a beautful kitchen, TV's, bedrooms, bathrooms, etc. The master suite with jacuzzi tub is fantastic! Everything I asked for was brought to me promptly, from extra towels to an internet wire. The unit was immaculate. We especially loved the swan-folded towels and creatively arranged hand towels and wash cloths. We used the smaller pool located toward the back of the property, and it was paradise! My teenage son and I used the gym, and he was impressed with the equipment available. He is always disappointed other hotel gymst. All this and Starbucks coffee for me to brew in the morning in the kitchen and availble to purchase at the Palm Cafe. We love Floridays Resort and will return as often as we can!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest place I've ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: MickAndSandy
Reviews.Content: We booked through Travelocity. We called ahead and checked to find everything was in order. From the minute we arrived until the moment we left, everyone we came into contact with from Ray the Doorman, to the people at the front desk, to housekeeping and maintenance was just super. Very freindly and very helpful. The suite was perfect for us and had everything we needed. Very clean (and we are fussy about clean). Location was ideal for all the parks we went to. Floridays made this the vacation of a lifetime for me. We are planning to go to Orlando again next year and Floridays is the first place we are going to look at when we make our plans. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “If your tastes are dicriminating then avoid this "resort" because it's far from you expect.”
Reviews.Author: mcmalvarez
Reviews.Content: We went there with a group of teenage girls that were going to play basketball. AAA found the "resort" and without hesitation we accepted the reservation. The issues began from the time we left the airport b/c the resor's directions on their website take you on a wild goose chase. The actual resort is on International Drive, but the address is listed as Floridays, go figure. Upon check-in, my credit card is "authorized" the whole stay and "a little extra." It does not get approved and they calmly tell me that I cannot check-in and literaly dismiss us. Because of I insist to speak to a manager, I get afforded the opportunity and get lectured. I find out that the condo is worth $300,000 and because they cannot preauthorize the whole purchase, how are they guaranteed payment. They suggest that I pay in cash... The keys had to be activated on a daily basis. My husband and an associate had to get their keys reactivated. Our associate, staying in the same room, had his key activated while my husband was denied access. I dare you to ask why... The grounds are kept clean but the people in our party said the pool was filthy. The rooms were not "cleaned." We stayed in a 3 bedroom. The master's bed was made, but only one of the two bedrooms had their beds made. The trash is scarcely removed and towels were limited. There was a foul odor in the shower when it was turned on. Is it the water in Florida? There is NO wireless in your rooms. The only wireless is in public areas. The business center charges you .20 a minute for their use of the computer. The is a "resort" fee for each party that checks in. The rate I was quoted by AAA were not the same when I got to the "resort." Thank goodness I brought the email from AAA that had the price in print. Only then and with resent did the "resort" honor the price I was quoted. On Wednesday morning, there was screaming in the hallway. When I opened the door, there were many apologies. The argument was about the number of rooms that each of the housecleaning women had to do. The women felt it was unfair and the supervisor insisted that they get the job done. Must I go on?

Reviews.Title: “fabulous floridays”
Reviews.Author: MIRMUL
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the floridays from 1st july - 11th july. really great accomodation and the staff were very nice as were the cleaning ladies. as many towels, shampoos, washing machine and dishwasher detergent as we needed were provided every day. the condos were like a home from home. we were in block D on the 6th floor which I was delighted about. we watched the fireworks every night from the magic kingdom. if we go back to orlando again we will definately stay there. wish i was there right now!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic resort,fantastic florida”
Reviews.Author: harrymon
Reviews.Content: returned on saturday 11th from two weeks in floridays resort,international drive south,orlando.absolutely no complaints whatsoever.amazing rooms,amazing buildings and amazing pool area. arrived saturday 27th,mid afternoon,check in very quick,minutes,the reception offered to get a bell boy for us,but,we declined as i wanted to walk to the building and see the layout of the pool area and way to and from the reception.easy enough to navigate,we were in building b,room 606,overlooking the lake with a side view of the pool,perfect.on first view of the apartment our intitial reaction was,wow!!!!,kids over the moon with their room,and with our hot tub,they laid claim to that,kitchen had everything you could want,including a blender for smoothies etc.first day we had a rest and then went to pool in afternoon and evening,we all loved the pool,kids were in their element.ate at the pool bar and grill,great food,kids loved the fresh pizza and i usually had the bacon cheese burger,my wife had the grilled cheese sandwich with either fries or a fresh fruit salad,good value and good quality.second day we walked to publix supermarketand stocked up on cans of juice,cereals bread etc,publix,has everything you could need and also a 24hour walgreens next door,there is a chinese,liqour store and subway,all within 5 minutes walking distance.5 more minutes and you are at an outback steakhouse that we ate in on second night,if you like steak have the prime rib,honestly,half a cow,this thing had horns,sizzling!!!! then to the parks,on sunday afternoon we booked the shuttle for the next day for universal,you do this in the reception at the concierge,free of charge,various pick up times in a large air conditioned coach run by the orlando flexticket people,coach never full,and very comfy,always ran to time,perfect...normal driver whos name i cant recall,sorry,was great,he even gave my two kids a pin badge on the way home one day..this shuttle does all the flexticket parks at different times.so we used it for seaworld,IOA,aquatica,and universal.busch gardens was a different mears coach that you could book online or by phone,again various pick up poinst,we used the premium outlet pick up.again ran to time,nice coach,air conditioning great..cant say enough about the parks,all great.very accessible for weelchairs that we hired at guest relations...so we spaced out two weeks of parks and an alternate day at the pool in floridays,,storms mid afternoon,usually cleared within the hour..floridays cant be beaten for comfort and service,we had no issues with the housekeeping,you are given a notice informing you of the housekeeping rules,you can opt for a full service or a trash takeout and towel drop with bed making,to be honest ,we kept our room very tidy,and even hoovered one day,to keep it tidy,when it was raining heavily outside,sad,but there you go,a couple of dollars a day to the maids kept us updated with everything we needed,all the staff were great,special mention to cassie at reception,who was very helpful,especially when our pickup for the airport was late on the last day,PANIC!!!!!!...and carolina at the bar,,they thoughtfully employed a model to serve your drinks,honestly,this girl could be a movie star,so to end with,if you find faults with floridays,you must be looking for heaven,and you probably would find fault there to,go,enjoy and experience the wonderful concept of service and satisfaction that america has down to a fine art

Reviews.Title: “Few Hiccups, but overall a good stay!”
Reviews.Author: ZenkenJen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with visiting extended family. There were 7 of us, two children ages 3 and 5 and we brought along our dog. We stayed in a 3 bedroom suite. The price was right at $189/night. The location of this hotel is great--- you are close to all of the parks and there are restaurants, a pharmacy, and a grocery store literally right next door to the hotel. We stayed in the last building, building F and therefore, stuck mainly to the smaller pool located between buildings E and F. This pool suited our needs just fine. My only complaint would be the cleanliness of the bathrooms at the pool. They are single bathrooms. I went to use the women's restroom and found it overflowing and disgusting. I attempted to use the men's restroom also, but found sewage coming up the drainage grate in the floor. We drove to the main office to tell one of the staff there. She wrote it down and said someone would be by to clean it. We waited... and waited... and waited- finally a hotel employee came, but left quickly after seeing the mess. It was a pretty big inconvience to walk back to our suite every time someone needed to use the restrooms, especially with two small children in tow. Overall though, it was a good stay. I have no complaints regarding the suite itself. From my understanding, daily housekeeping was not included. This was fine, we just made our own beds. We did return one afternoon to find fresh towels left on the barstools in the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but cleaning people have to go.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyReservationist
Reviews.Content: We traveled from June 30th - July 7th and I wish we were still there. First off..my advice is don't trust Mears (taxi or shuttle...both over priced). I was told it would cost us between $34-$36 to go from the airport to our hotel and they ended up charging me $52! Floridays has a shuttle service they use and it cost us around $46 to go from the hotel to the airport (that was for 4 ppl). When we arrived at Floridays we were greated by a wonderful man named Ray. Check in was quick and easy. Ray wouldn't let us carry our bags (which was great service), he loaded the cart and drove us to the bldg (bldg B) we were staying in. Every time we would come back from a day at the parks or shopping there was one of the staff offering us a ride and showing us around the hotel. I expected the room to be a little more roomy but it wasn't bad. The master bathroom was huge with a jacuzzi tub. From our belcony we could see the fireworks from SeaWorld in the distance but we could still see them. Be aware, they do not offer an extra's (like soap for the dishwasher..). The cleaning ppl are "suppose" to empty the garbage, make the beds, replenish the towels, shampoo, conditioner and lotion...there was a few times I had to request it because the cleaning ppl didn't do it. They give you 1each of laundry detergent, dishwashing liquid & soap for the dishwasher...after you use that you have to buy your own..they didn't tell us that at check in. Other than the cleaning it was a great hotel. I was traveling with my two 17 year old boys and they loved it. It would have been nice if the pool stayed open later than 11. I recommend getting the I-Ride bus passes for the length of your stay. The bus stop is right there (stop 39) so all you have to do is hop on and let them do all the driving. It's a short walk from the hotel to shopping but there are no sidewalks...the I-Ride will also take you there...no walking involved :) The resort fee is a killer and the cleaning ppl need to be replaced but the front desk, Ray and the other staff were all wonderful. If booking this hotel check the hotel website first..you may get it cheaper. I went through Expedia and found out I could have got it cheaper if I went through Floridays website (but they might have had a sale going on).

Reviews.Title: “Floridays Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: Fungaw55
Reviews.Content: Two families shared a three bedroom condo for seven days. This place is very convenient to Sea World, Aquatica, and Discovery Cove. And, it is an easy drive to Disney World. Publix grocery store is very close. The place was clean and quiet. Don't count on the complimentary park shuttle, plan to drive. Good pool for the children. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay,top class”
Reviews.Author: AJ43
Reviews.Content: went on a 2 week hol 2 florida and stayed at the floridays. from the moment we arrived up 2 when we left everything was wonderfull. All the staff were very friendly and extremely helpfull.These apt are fantastic,stayed in 2bedroom,it was great. We had our 9yr old daughter with us,had her own tv in her room and had her own bathroom but enjoyed using our jaccuzzi.The pool was a short stroll from our block,we were in block c. what a great pool,clean towel available every day so no need 2 pack any. The pool stays open till 11pm every night which is handy if u have been in the theme parks all day,atleast u can still go 4 a swim when u get back. Nice bar 2,and bar staff really friendly. Could not fault this place at all. We had free transport 2 all theme parks and they didn't leave 2 early in the am. Found the i trolly very handy and easy 2 use,kids under 12 rid free. There is also a fantastic supermarket about 10 mins up the road,its called publix,it has everything u could want. Overall had a great hol in florida even though we got rain!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location ,Beautiful, Fun, and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicskitchn
Reviews.Content: Seven of us shared this amazing three bedroom hotel room-packed with kitchen gadgetry, a refrigerator which we packed with breakfast goodies for our three day stay, and a Jacuzzi. The hotels pool was a hit- the clan sat by the pool with its festive waterfalls and sipped cold drinks from the poolside bar. We had pizza delivered one nite from the restuarant, packed with cheese and lots of tomatoes just as ordered. We were just down the block from SeaWorld and Aquatica which were our destination for the week and it was perfect. Fabio at the front desk made sure we were just fine- Certainly a return trip is in order. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “TOP CLASS FLORIDAYS”
Reviews.Author: Dub65
Reviews.Content: Great value, great location, friendly, helpful staff and quality and size of accommodation (2 bed condo) was more than ample for a family of 5 and seemed very much like a home away from home. Perfect for lounging about after a long day in the parks with full kitchen facilities and a 37" plasma for the kids to watch the cartoon networks. We stayed in block B which was close to the pool but far away enough that we didn't hear any noise. Car Hire is a must I'd say( ten mins to Seaworld, 15 mins to Disney). We have only good things to say about Floridays and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: badboy2553
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with awesome rates. The hotel is clean and modern and the staff was friendly and helpful. The shuttle service to attractions is limited as to the times to and from the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays is a fine resort for the relatively low price!”
Reviews.Author: AliceLee428
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Floridays resort. Overall, we enjoyed the facilities very much. The staff members were wonderful---very eager to help and correct any minor problems we encountered. The positives: 1. A three bedroom suite for $179 per night. The accommodations were fabulous for this relatively low price! 2. The bell porters were so friendly and came to pick us up (buidling F...more about that later) in a super-size golf cart at our beck and call. We tried to tip Jeremy on the first day, but he politely refused the tip..."No worries!" 3. We encountered a few very small problems, and they were corrected almost immediately (missing a frying pan...room not made up one day...a missing reflecting bowl on the stove which made the largest burner unusable). 4. Very close to SeaWorld and Aquatica...easy to get there via trolley car. The Negatives: 1. Building F is FAR from the hub of the hotel (pool/main office/convenience store, etc.) Whoever designed the configuration of the buildings made a serious flaw in not providing a direct walkway....one has to walk around all of the other buildings and through the parking lots to get anywhere. However, as I mentioned before...the bellhops were happy to come and get us (but on occasion they were busy with other guests). 2. Do NOT come expecting to be able to get around efficiently without a rental car. We relied on the trolley, cabs (which we had not budgeted for, but used on several occasions) and shuttle buses which did create additional stress. Also, our walk from Building F to the trolley was about a mile (which is hard in the hot sun or after a long day at the parks). Getting groceries from the nearby Publix grocery store sounded easy...but was a workout in itself due to the long walk with bags of groceries! 3. Floridays is at the far south end of International Drive...takes a long time on the trolley to get to the north end (where more action is). 4. Housekeeping services were haphazard. Some days our beds were made and towels were prettily replaced in the bathrooms, but on others, only our trash was emptied and clean towels were left on the kitchen bar stools (beds left unmade). We called on Thursday to request that our room be made up, and housekeeping was on it immediately. 5. Resort fee of $11.50 per day---Yes, I knew about it in advance, but why? Just include it in the price of the room! 6. An on site restaurant would be nice!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to rest and relax after busy park days.”
Reviews.Author: bigmama13
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful experience staying at Floridays. Travelling from Northern Ireland with four young children ( ages 3,5,7,9) I wanted to make sure that I had booked a safe, clean and spacious apartment for what was a big holiday for our family. I like all of you trawled though the internet to find suitable accommodation and despite reading some not so good reviews, we really had the holiday of a lifetime and that was quite a lot to do with the resort. When we walked through the apartment door it felt like walking into our own home. It was clean, had everything we needed and more. The kids absolutely loved it. apart from asking for directions to various places ( which the staff where brilliant at printing off straight forward to and from directions) we didn't have to call reception once during our two week stay. The maids where in everyday with fresh towels, beds made and a general tidy and clean without fail. I would recommend hiring a car - don't be scared!! It made things so much easier and left us very flexible about how early or late we wanted to go to or stay at a park. Floridays is handy for all attractions esoecially Seaworld, Aquatica and Universal Studios. Disney is very easily found too.The kids enjoyed the pool and the little cafe had lovely food which we often ordered and brought up to our room after the the lids had enjoyed a jacuzzi bath. We were in building 'B' on the 6th floor which was great - very quiet at night. we thoroughly enjoed our stay and will definitely be returning guests - hopefully sooner rather that later. PS it is definitely worth the drive to Busch gardens - that was one of our very best days.

Reviews.Title: “All-around good experience”
Reviews.Author: mischivas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our little Maltese pup and my sister, her husband and their baby daughter spent 7 days at Floridays over the beginning of June. Definitely took what I read on Trip Advisor with more than a grain of salt, so we were armed with a lot of information before checking into the hotel. We stayed in building F - yes, far from the main pool, but we spent most of our time by the small quiet pool by building E. We found the big pool really noisy and people were NOT controlling their kids. Haha - I guess when you go to Orlando, you have to be prepared to see many kids running around - but it was a bit too much at the pool. The unit was very clean and the staff was very helpful. Yes, there were signs of wear and tear - scuffs on the furniture and stains on the carpet, but it is a family resort and it was fully expected, so it didn't dampen the experience at all. Staff were friendly and helpful - one morning there weren't any towels at the pool - a quick message to one of the staff and the problem was addressed very quickly. There was also an instance with the business centre usage of the internet and printer by my husband - one particular front desk person was very unhelpful - but the rest of the staff made up for it. The resort is located very close to all the attractions, is a great homebase for shopping and sight-seeing. Although we had a full kitchen, we only had breakfast there, but it was nice to have all that space and to use the laundry facilities all the time. If you have an unusual travel group like us, definitely recommend it. If you're just a single traveller or a couple, splurge and stay at a high end hotel (but let's face it - if you fit those two categories, I doubt Orlando would be your vacation spot!).

Reviews.Title: “very good floridays”
Reviews.Author: DANNYANDSTACEY
Reviews.Content: just got back had good time nice hotel with good location stayed in block f 4th floor if you want quiet ask for 6th floor as we had people above noisey late at night and 1st thing in the morning but that didnt spoil our holiday . our block was a little walk to the main pool which was very nice and good to come back to after the parks the pool is open to very late so again if you want early night dont go for the pool view . now the rooms were fantastic very big with every thing in it the cleaners were poor in our block had to keep catching them for clean towels and change the bins but they did it no problem and very freindly . had a drink fom the bar once as it cost £6 a bottle of larger! nice little shop next to the bar for little items . orlando is nice loads of places to eat glad we got care hire easy to drive over there got i trolley once and once was too much takes to long ! . liked all the parks and downtown disney on a evening . so liked floridays and orlando enyoy your stay and the hot weather we did and if your flying with virgin atlantic good choice they were fantastic airline ti fly with.one more thing on floridays you after pay a resort fee when checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Once again Floridays satisfies!”
Reviews.Author: MikeGChicago
Reviews.Content: This is one of many stays at Floridays for me. The staff is consistent with their hospitality and the property is always clean. I huge storm blew through on one of the nights and although the lights flickered and the cable went in and out a few times there wasn't any periods that I couldn't work in my unit. The next morning youcouldn't tell that a storm had hit as the grounds were immaculate once again. Great place to stay, always comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms + Good Price!!”
Reviews.Author: mike1173
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 days with the wife & kids, for a Disney/Seaworld vacation (June '09). The hotel had great amenities, with good service. The front desk staff is willing to assist with every request, and even made useful suggestions when asked. We stayed in building "B" 2bed/2bath unit. The rooms are gorgeous, very spacious, and well-decorated. The only downside to the rooms is that they do not have WiFi (make sure you bring a LAN cable). The pool area is just OK and was only a short walk from our room. The entire facility was beautifully decorated, and in a great location to Seaworld (3 min) and Dinsey (10 min). I would definately stay here for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit off on I-Drive but a great resort”
Reviews.Author: Nikon
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort with extremely roomy suites (had a 2 bedroom suite) and a nice pool area. There is a superb Publix supermarket 1 minute drive away. The resort is also close to an outlet and Sea World, Discovery Cove and Aquatica. It would have been even better if Floridays were situated at the "center" of International Drive. If staying at Floridays you need a car or use the I-Drive bus to get to the restuarant area of I-Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant hotel, excelland location”
Reviews.Author: jammydodger67
Reviews.Content: This resort is superb, the apartment was very spacious and spotlessly clean and had everything in it you could need, after a hectic day at the parks it was great to return to the apartment and sit out on the balcony and relax in the warm evening air. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was great it was situated at the quieter end of International Drive and only a short drive away from the parks, the Orlando Premium Outlets shopping mall is at the end of the road.

Reviews.Title: “So So @ Floridays”
Reviews.Author: Jme B 89
Reviews.Content: After reading all the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor I was really looking forward to a fantastic resort. Not really the case when we arrived. The location is very convenient to Sea World, Aquatica and Discovery Cove. There are also many places to eat on International Drive. Our unit (3bed/2 bath) was ok, but is starting to show wear & tear. The walls are marked up. None of the mini blinds would open. The beds are saggy. The unit was very shadowy - not enough light anywhere in the enitre place. No overhead lights - only lamps with low wattage bulbs. Thermostat "locked" @ 74 degrees.....too hot to sleep. We did call front desk. They sent a worker to "unlock" the thermostat. As an adult paying for the unit I do not feel my air conditioning consumption needs to be locked down. The main pool is nice and quite loud. We went many days late in the afternoon and were able to find chairs. Towles were always available. Pool bar is a great feature. Overall, the resort is so-so. Nothing spectacular. Very busy and very loud @ night when we were there. The price was right ($179.00 per night) and location great. I would not stay again as there are soooo many resorts in Orlando I think I could find something else, but overall, you could do a lot worse. If you are looking for an inexpensive, family-oriented place to stay and so not mind a lot of noise and tons of people you will like this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamily3Ohio
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Floridays Resort. My husband , myself and our 6 year old daughter stayed for 4 nights. We had a 2 bedroom suite- 2 double beds, 1 king bed w/ a fabulous master bath, full kitchen, washer & dryer. The location of the resort is prime. Sea World is about 10 minutes away and Disney is about 20 minutes away. The resort offers shuttle service free of charge to both places. There is also a trolley available all day long that takes you to the outlet stores, restaurants, etc. Kids ride free and adults pay either $1.25 each way or $5 to ride the trolley all day. The trolley picks you up/drops you off right in front of the resort. Our lfisrt stay was in April and the weather was much cooler and we actually walked to the grocery store, shopping center just up the street. It was too hot for that in June, so the trolley worked out great. There are always taxis available also. I can't say enough about the staff...they are so helpful and so friendly!! The pool is beautiful and very kid friendy. Overall, just a great place...we will be back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenjojo
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on my stay in June 2009. I booked a 2 bedroom, full kitchen, 2 baths (one with a large tub). Very clean and seemed new. The only negative thing I can say is I put a "do not disturb" card on my door and thery still came in a cleaned up. I'm just one whoo doesn't trust cleaning staff. Otherwise it was great especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “CC Tornadoes at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: travelinglizzy1909
Reviews.Content: In Orlando area for soccer tournament. Enjoyed resort tremendously ... plenty of room for the team members & family. Relaxed at the beautiful pool. Girls had fun in the pool and the adults relaxed in the jacuzzi! Great for all ages. Fully equiped kitchen enabled us to cook dinner every night & then relax by the pool, play cards, or watch tv afterwards. Great location to Orlando area. SeaWorld & Aquatica just up the street. Stopped by Prime Outlets around the corner on the way home. Would highly recommend resort for all ages. Clean, beautiful & very courteous staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: gsmithl
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful stay, very clean, friendly staff and a lot space for the money. They allowed us to check in several hours early (we arrived in Orlando at 11am and check in wasn't supposed to be until 4pm)- this was wonderful because we are a family of six traveling with children ranging in age from 2yr to 20 yrs old. They checked with us during our stay to make sure we were pleased and if we needed anything. Great location, a couple miles from Sea World, short drive to Disney, lots of dining in the area, Publix Supermarkets located down the street. The pools were great, we stayed in building E, it was short walk to the larger pool, but not an issue. No further then you may walk to get to your neighborhood pool. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious apartments, great rates”
Reviews.Author: PeeVee67
Reviews.Content: We had a two-bedroom apartment for 3 nights and we were really excited about the spacious suites. The master bathroom with jacuzzi was great, there is plenty of room in the kitchen and the living room as well. You even have your own little balcony to sit on. The pool was great, too, especially because of the fact that pool towels were provided for free. There is also a fitness room with two treadmills, two elliptical trainers and more fitness equipment which can also be used free of charge. The staff are extremely friendly and very helpful. We did not try the restaurant, instead we went to Publix, which is located right around the corner, and bought everything we needed there. Premium Outlets Orlando can also be found just around the corner. We really enjoyed our stay at Floridays resort tremendously, but there were also a few little, tiny things that bothered us a little: If you do not bring your own computer, you cannot use the internet provided at the "Business Center" next to the reception desk for free but have to pay 20 cents per minute. On the second day, we had used up the "body wash" provided in the two bathrooms, but we did not get a new one. Instead we got some more shampoo, which we still had plenty of. The beds were neither too hard nor too soft for us, but whenever someone turned around, the other one was almost catapulted into the air. When it gets dark, some strange birds (I guess) from the little forest next to the resort (we were in Building C) start croaking really loud, which goes on for half the night. Yet these negative points did not at all taint our overall extremely positive impression of Floridays Resort. We would always go back there and we can only recommend it. Besides, we got an incredible price for the luxury provided in these apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place.”
Reviews.Author: sarahandkevin07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a three bedroom room at Floridays for 6 nights, it was so nice. I loved it, all of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was a good size and nicely decorated, the pool is pretty nice, but it was very crowded everytime I went. My only complaints were the beds were very firm. You could hear people on the floor above you taking baths, and dropping stuff on the floor at night, and I am a clean freak so I notice these things, but the walls near the beds in the guest rooms and by the light switches were SO dirty, they really needed to be wiped down. But besides that the whole room is stocked with tons of utensils, some that I don't even have at my home. The master bathroom is awesome, it has a large whirlpool tub. They have granite countertops in the bathrooms and kitchen. I just absolutely loved it besides the stuff I mentioned earlier, it's definitely the place to stay if you have a family of four or more. I also forgot to say that they do not have wireless internet access in the rooms, if you need to use the internet you have to bring your ethernet cable with you, so don't forget or you'll have to walk down to the pool everytime you want to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Floridays”
Reviews.Author: djh_lau_sat
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 weeks at Floridays; I have already recommended this resort to my family and friends. The apartments are so well equipped (I want the bathroom from the master suite at home!!!) the internet access is quicker than I have at home. The cleaners changed our towels everyday and when we left a card (found in the bathroom) on the beds they changed all the bedding. All the staff are so helpful and friendly - they are a real credit to this resort. Around the pool there was never any shortage of sunbeds; plenty of pool towels (you just help yourself) and the pool was never crowded - just what you need after a busy day at a theme park! We didn't have a car for our stay in Florida. The taxi from the airport (MCO) to the resort was $60 (including tip & tolls) each way. We arranged for a garden grocer delivery to be made the afternoon we arrived, the delivery arrived just after we checked in. We had I-Trolley passes and found the service to be very good, reliable and easy to understand. We also used the hotel transfer services to the universal/Disney park (found it quicker to use I-Trolley to Sea world / Aquatica). I also got the bus to Disney downtown one afternoon (Lynx 50 from Seaworld) - all the drivers on the transfer coaches, I-trolley and lynx were very helpful. The walk to Publix / Walmart / Premier Outlet was 5-10 mins from our apartment (which was in Block A at the front of the complex). The Outback steakhouse was next to Publix - the Ribs were so nice! Floriday’s was ideal for our family as we like to stay somewhere that is quieter but you can still get to the hussel and bussle if you want to.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Floridays”
Reviews.Author: saralynb
Reviews.Content: We booked the Floridays resort solely due to the ratings on Tripadvisor. It tries to sell itself as a resort, when actually it is a timeshare, with a few added services. The rooms were nice, we wanted a condo with a kitchen. The bedding was average, and the beds were pretty firm. The pool area was nice, but they played loud music, and it got really dirty by the end of the day. The resort fee includes basic cleaning services, they don't replenish coffee. Wi-fi in the lobby and pool area only. Concierge recommended Denny's to us for breakfast. Not exactly what I had in mind, when I asked her if it was good, she hadn't been there in ages. Floridays isn't terribly close to restaurants, either. There was nothing really wrong with our stay, I just think the ratings are inflated because the managers tell customers to give them good reviews on Tripadvisor. I heard this several times while using the WI-Fi in the lobby! I was expecting a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “An all in one vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunny557
Reviews.Content: From the moment I drove onto the Floridays Resort property I didn't want to leave! Every single employee I met was friendly and more than helpful. We were on a "girls weekend" and I enjoyed myself beyond words. The three bedroom suite was breathtaking with a gorgeous view of the main pool. The tiki bar made it easy to get your first drink of the day while lounging at the pool or a night cap before heading to our room. I'm already planning my next vacation back to Floridays! You don't even need to leave the resort! It has everything I needed!

Reviews.Title: “I WISH I COULD STAY HERE FOREVER!”
Reviews.Author: LIZBETH1956
Reviews.Content: This resort was wonderful! The staff were very helpful, always pleasant and ready to help!. Both pools, pool side areas,cafe and tiki bar were kept very clean. There were 9 of us, so we stayed in one of the 3 bedroom suites. We had plenty of room and all were comfortable. The room had everything we needed - blender, microwave, fridge, coffee pot. We plan on going back again and again! The location is great for all the Orlando sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort going back 2010”
Reviews.Author: KEITH2010
Reviews.Content: the floridays was 1 of the best hotels to stay in with a family .the service was great the rooms were very clean and the location was the best ,the woman in our family loved been just a 5 minute walk to the premium outlets seamorld and the new waterpark was only a 3 minute drive ,each nite after a long day at the theme parks we went to aqutica and done the lazy river .every nite it was paradice .just cant wait for summer 2010

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever...”
Reviews.Author: nyy6242
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Floridays in Orlando Florida from June 3-10 2009. I have been to Orlando 6 times over my lifetime and this hotel was the best yet. It exceeded all of my expectations. I will be honest and give pros and cons for this hotel: The Pros: The hotel staff was the friendliest and welcoming group of employees I have come across. From the moment we walked into the lobby, they assisted us with every need, and always with a smile, a very accommodating team. We stayed in a 2 bed room suite which for the price, was a steal. The room was spotless, furnished beautifully, and within easy walking distance from the pool, lobby, and weight room. My favorite part of the suite was the master bed room/master bath. It was huge! The bath tub can fit 2-3 and the shower 2 people comfortably. Every room was spacious. All of the appliances were in great working condition. The suites come equipped with a balcony that can be used as an eating area that over looks several areas of orlando, if not the pool/lobby. The pool area is amazing with great sunlight, palm trees, and plenty of seating. The price for 7 nights here was also unbeatable for what you get. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking to save money, have a great time with family/friends, and enjoy a home-like environment. The Cons: I am pleased to say that there was hardly anything that I didn't like at this hotel. However, if I did have to name a few things that could use improvement, I would say this. The stove top had burners that were tilted and made cooking on the stove a bit awkward. The heating/air conditioning in the rooms is preset and can only be changed for a given amount of time, but needless to say, the temperature in the rooms was always kept comfortable. I would have liked our trash to be changed daily but that was not the case, many times we had to take it out ourselves (not really a bad thing). I would have liked the shuttle service to be available all day instead of a set time each morning and night. Other than these minor details, it was a great hotel. I def must for anyone going to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “OH MY GOD!! SO AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: jordangr8
Reviews.Content: floridays is the best hotel i have ever stayed in. the service you get is incredible, people are so friendly and the actual complex is so amazing. PLEASE READ!! i have looked at other peoples reviews about being quite a way from any shops and places to eat. TRUST ME there wrong this place is just in the right place not too close so you hear the partiers going all night and too far way that you can't walk it, if the worse came to the worse. Tons of food places such as a great steak house which i have forgotten the name of now, johnnys diner and a subway all within about a 10 min walk. THIS COMPLEX IS BRILLIANT!! go there it's such a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Very good resort in a great location”
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Floridays and it was very good. I wouldn’t go as far as to say it was excellent, but I would definitely go back. The location was excellent given it right between Disney and Sea world which is where we spent the majority of our time. The room was huge, 3bed room 2 bath which is the main reason we keep going back. Great with 2 kids. The pool is also excellent and another reason we kept going back. I have 2 complaints that kept it from the excellent rating. First, you get whatever room they give you. We got a lovely room overlooking the power lines and what looked to be a swamp. Not a huge deal, but we told them we were there 8 months ago and could we have a little better room closer to the pool since we have young children this time. No deal. Second, we requested some extra towels twice that never arrived. Again, not a big issue, but an annoyance. Other than that, very good resort and we will probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: GoHOGSGo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 24-30, 2009. It was our first time to Orlando and the location ended up being perfect. 5 mins to Seaworld, 10-15 mins to Disney parks; Walgreens and Publix 1 min; perfect for last minute items and groceries to fill up on for the room. We loved this place and it far exceeded our expectations. The pool was perfect for our 5 and 9 year old daugthers and the entire stay at the hotel was very relaxing. The staff was extremely accomodating and very kind. I read many reviews before our stay and have to admit we were a bit worried about the negative comments regarding cleaning, etc. We never experienced any issues at all. Our beds were made daily, refreshed with clean towels daily and our trash was emptied every day as well. Also, when we got low on paper towels or soap for the dishes or laundry they always left extra supplies in our room. This was our best stay ever and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort - Booking up for next year”
Reviews.Author: LES22Fife
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Block B on the 3rd floor. The condo was beautiful everything there that you could possibly needs. There were 4 adults and 1 child and we stayed in a 2 bedroom condo. There was plenty of room. Was good having the balcony, sat out at night with a few drinks. The pool area was great, lots of space and lots of loungers. My little girl loved playing at the beach area and met lots of friends. There was childrens entertainment on a Saturday during the day which was good and there was also a singer quite a few nights at the bar area which was good too. We didnt have a car and found the publix, walgreen, subway, outback steakhouse and premium outlets about a 10 min walk, which was fine. We loved floridays and are going to book up for 3 weeks in May 2010 but will have a 3 bedroom as there will be 6 of us going next time

Reviews.Title: “perfect resort and family vacation for first trip to Florida”
Reviews.Author: azdisneyfan
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed May 18-23, 2009. We stayed in building F102. Having two rooms and 2 bathrooms is perfect for any family. My husband and I had our privacy and our teenage daughter had her privacy. The resort is well maintained and beautiful on the outside, the rooms are spacious and comfortable (the beds were comfy), house keeping always left things immaculate, and the people are exceptionally hospitable. All the furniture, carpets, etc were in great shape. The big screen tv and the huge tub in the master was wonderful. The kitchen has everything you would need for any length of stay and the washer and dryer comes in so handy! Plenty of toiletries, laundry soap, dish soap, paper towels, etc. The front desk and bellhop (especially Ray) were so efficient, nice, and extremely helpful for anything. The free shuttle service to the attractions worked out smoothly. The downside is without a car there wasn't any restaurants or stores close enough to walk to. It's quite a distance to anyplace. The cafe didn't have much to choose from and no complimentary breakfast. Taxis were a bit expensive so make the trip to the store worth it. Make note that buildings D, E, and F are a distance away from the Registration so ask for the golf cart to take you to/from instead of walking especially when you are tired after a day at DisneyWorld. Keep in mind there is a $12 resort fee. Other than that, the resort is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “There is simply no better value for money offering available.”
Reviews.Author: cattgolf
Reviews.Content: Floridays Resort is a luxury resort which offers 2 and three bedroom fully furnished apartments of the highest quality. Everything you need is provided including a fully fitted kitchen as well as a washing machine and tumble dryer. The level of customer service we experienced both this year and in 2008 was exceptional. The concierge service provides a link with local attractions and services which allows you to get on and enjoy your holiday whilst they provide the support for tickets, shows and transportation. The new all day menu offering is competitive in price and of good quality. The pools are family friendly and maintained to the highest standards with an endless supply of free towels for use of residents. As an overall rating 10 out of 10 is reflective of our holiday experience. Value for money 10 out of 10. Customer Service 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amcNewYork
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel and hopefully will not be our last. Everything written on previous posts was absolutely true. This hotel has it all. Big, clean rooms, comfortable bedding, a full kitchen and washer/dryer (which we needed since it rained everyday we were there!) The pool is clean and large and always an abundance of towels and chairs. The staff is couteous, professional and very competant. As others suggested, I do recommend buying supplies at the local grocery store and stocking up. The hotel is centrally located between Sea World, Disney and shopping. Can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Paying extra for cheap equiped place and not cleaned well!”
Reviews.Author: JohnKatani
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great part of town with lots to do. The only problem was the room was not very clean. The blankets smelled bad, the floors were dirty, and there were stains on the furniture. The bathroom had mold growing on the walls and smbs hair on the floor!( . When we asked to change the sheets in our unit the staff was slow and disgruntled. I wont ever stay there again!!! John K. Miami FL.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ttthomson
Reviews.Content: We arrived in two separate groups and times. It turned out to be an excellent choice for our family and gave us all privacy. We were in the closest building to the pool. We had the space of a pool home with the conveniences of a hotel. Being able to cook and eat in saves time and money, so that we could enjoy our days. It was clean, well kept with good housekeeping and the kitchen had everything we needed, eventhough we brought some things with us. Good to know for the next time. We also found it to be quiet. We will definately come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Stokesfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: Thanks for a wonderful week. We all had a blast and it felt like home being there.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and charming”
Reviews.Author: ballerina595
Reviews.Content: as soon as you pull up in the parking lot you feel a sense of relaxation. our family of four stayed six nights in a lovely two bedroom. It was very roomy and florida like decor. It felt like home and the kitchen was very useful. The location was awesome, right of of international drive, close to all of the theme parks and around the courner was a Publix and the prime outlets (les than 1 minute drive). The hotel staff was very friendly and cleaned the room everyday. the only thing that was bad is that their big pool gets dirty by the end of the day because of all of the plant and it being outdoors, but overall, Very Impressive!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nickole814
Reviews.Content: We had planned a "girls" weekend to Orlando, Florida for May 14-18th. I found Floriday's for an amazing price and I just couldn't pass it up. And when I arrived and I completely amazed and the cleaniness and friendliness of this resort. The room was beautiful and the property was even better. The pool areas were clean as so was the landscaping (gorgeous!) The service there was phenominal as well. Ray, a "bell-man" type associate was so willing to take us back and forth from our building ("F" - the farthest one away) and when we requested more soap it was sent to us within minutes!! We even had a curtousy call to see if we recieved it. Never before have I been treated with such hospitality. Also, the front desk associates were all very friendly and extremely helpful. The store that is offered on property was convenient as well. We enjoyed having access to all amnenities at pretty much anytime. The bar by the main pool was fantastic as well. Especially TJ, one of the bar-tenders/Managers. He was extremely friendly and polite to all of the guests. He made us feel at home and the service he offered was exceptional! I am definatly planning another trip to Florida soon and I WILL be staying at Floriday's (mainly because of the great employees that work there). I absolutely loved my stay at this hotel and would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip!”
Reviews.Author: rwaring
Reviews.Content: This is the best place we have stayed in. The price was phenomenal. The suite was beautiful, spaceous, clean and friendly. The desk staff was very helpful. While not right on top of the parks, it is just far away so you are not in the noise and traffic. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Truly excellent”
Reviews.Author: hurmit22
Reviews.Content: The Floridays staff were a breath of fresh air after a long flight and a bit of car hire hassle. They greeted us with smiles and attentive service. Walking into reception felt like shedding a heavy bundle. The suite itself was wonderful, and quite exceeded our expectations. Plenty of space, comfortable beds, adequate kitchen equipment for preparing anything – even a hand-mixer – and everything in good nick and working. Self-catering was very easy here. The only thing I would suggest they add would be a dustpan and brush or broom. We had a bit of a disaster with a wine bottle one day, and Diego of the housekeeping staff was extremely helpful, bringing us extra paper towels and a vacuum cleaner. The concierge was also very helpful when we had questions about car hire for another member of our party. The main pool area is very pleasant and comfortable. Overall, this was an ideal place to retreat to after a day at the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! The best place we've ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: Sweets75
Reviews.Content: We justed returned from Floridays Orlando Resort, May 14-17, 2009. We took our son along with a friend to Disney for his 11th birthday. When I first starting looking for a hotel on the internet, Floridays appeared a couple of times. However, I over looked it , because I thought the price was a little too much. But after calling several other hotels the pricre wasn't really any different. Considering Floridays was a complete luxury condo. With the other hoels it was just a small room, or a mini suite. I took a chance and booked Floridays Resort @$105.99 the first night and $118.99 the other 2 nights. It was worht it. If you rely on ALL the reviews for hotels you will NEVER travel anywhere. When we entered the lobby it was beautiful, it looked like something you would see on tv, one of those luxury getaways. Check -in was very friendly,courtsey, and informative. We stayed in buliding E on the 6th floor. Upon entering out suite, we couldn't believe it. It was everything away from home. Wash/dryer, dishwasher, stove & oven, an island in the kitchen. The kids had there own room and bathroom, the master room was very nice, a hot tub, stand in shower, a lot of counter space. Living room area very spacious, Overall it was PERFECT. On our visit to the pool area, A very friendly gentleman named Jeffrey Morris he's(Director of New Media), started a conversation with my husband and I. We talked about everything we really enjoyed speaking with him. We inquired about more shading in the pool area. Because they didn't have anymore umbrellas on hand, he bought my entire family lunch at the Palms Cafe. After leaving my husband and the kids to the pool area, I returned to our suite and found a platter of freshly baked chocolate cookies and a note thanking us for staying with them from Jeffrey Morris. Another thing the pictures/images/vitual tour that's seen on there website, it's exactly how the rooms look. Our stay at the hotel was over the top, and with the generosity of of Jeff we certanly will be back for Thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, with pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: WackyWeazle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Floridays Resort for a total of 23 nights with 4 adults and 1 infant in a 3 bedroom apartment at the fifth floor of building E. Overall we had a nice stay, but we feel the hotel had pros and cons. We really wanted a 3 bedroom suite resort because of the baby, and got a good AAA-rate at this resort. Without the discounted rate, we probably would have stayed at another resort. The pros: -The apartment was spacious, and nicely furnished -Enough space to store 5 suitcases out of sight during our stay -The marketplace had a small but well assorted menu -Staff was friendly and fast -Short drive to all the attractions -Publix, Walgreens within walking distance -Premium Outlets within walking distance/2 min. drive -Outback Steakhouse is within walking distance, and a Benihana restaurant is being built next door, nearly finished when we were there -Plenty of room at the pools and more than enough towels -Daily shuttle service to the parks was available but could have been more frequent The cons: -The appliances (dishwasher, washer/dryer, airco) were noisy, the airco was situated right outside the door of the 2 bedrooms with double queen, standard at 74, tweaking needed to get it below 72 -Housekeeping (only bed/towelservice) wasn't consistent, we didn't have enough towels every day and communication was hard since most of them only speak Spanish. If only the housekeeping involved a full service, including cleaning and weekly change of bedlinens, the hotel could easily get another star. We had to do most of the cleaning ourselves and if we needed anything (clean bedlinens or extra kitchen supplies i.e.) we had to call the front desk. The hotel obviously isn't used to guests for extended stays. -The property isn't gated or guarded, people from outside the property used the pool (family coming by car or walking on to the property with inflatable toys, parking right outside the pool area and using the pool, getting back in the car or walking off property with all the toys or driving away when they were done on various occasions) -Playroom was replaced with arcade, our baby didn't have anything to play with on property. -Beach area didn't have any shade -Walls are thin, fortunately we had a quiet corner room but still the noise from the king bathroom was very audible in the queen bedroom -Roomservice didn't offer much choice, 21% gratuity and a service fee were automatically added to the bill

Reviews.Title: “An awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DisneyfanEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays for 10 days Apr 29-May 9, our first visit to Orlando. We picked this resort based on trip advisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. Our timing was great, the place was very quiet, no lines for check-in or check-out. We had a 2 bedroom suite in building B on the 5th floor, and it seemed like we were the only ones on the entire floor, we never heard any noise from other suites. The place was clean, the staff very pleasant. Our room safe indicated that the battery was low, we called the front desk and it was fixed within 10 minutes of our call. We then got a call from the front desk about 20 minutes after that, making sure that we had been taken care of. We used their internet hookup in our suite, there was an $8 deposit for the cable, which was credited back upon return of the cable when we left. The resort is on the quiet end of International Drive, no traffic, no congestion, conveniently located near the mall, grocery store, 15 minute drive to Magic Kingdom and about 8 minutes from Sea World. Although the resort offers shuttles to the parks, I would definitely recommend renting a car for your own convenience. We drove to Universal to spend the day at Islands of Adventure, but were very disappointed and left at 1pm. We would have had to wait until 7pm if we'd taken the shuttle. We were also able to leave the parks at noon when they began to get crowded and then head back at 6 in the evening when it was cooler. We loved this resort, the spacious suite, the well kept grounds, clean pool and pool area, the convenience of its location. It was reasonably priced, I'd recommend checking again shortly before your stay as the price may have come down. The resort made our vacation a great experience and if we ever go back to Orlando we won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: TBJeff
Reviews.Content: This is the second time with in a year that I had stayed at this hotel. For the price, it is well worth it. I also want to thank an employee, Fred Herbst, for his help and kindness. While I was trying to use the Business Center for the internet, my friend accidently push $30.00 instead of $3.00 for the card you need to access the internet. After being upset because you can't get the company of the Business Center on the phone, Fred took care of the whole problem and I eventually got my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: gericoolGalway
Reviews.Content: Just back from our first visit to Orlando where we stayed in the Floridays and we loved it. We were there for 8 days and we could not speak highly enough about it. The accommodation was very spacious and with two teenagers 14 and 16 and both over 6 ft we were indeed grateful for the space. We stayed in block C which was just around the corner from the pool and reception. We had a two bed roomed apt with both rooms en-suite. Master had a Jacuzzi bath and very spacious shower and vanity facilities. The accommodation also had its very own washer and dryer which proved invaluable after a day in the water parks. Cooking facilities had everything you could possibly need even though we only used them once during our stay. The bar down stairs although small had everything you could need and didn’t close until about 11 pm. Being from Ireland my husband was delighted they had an excellent pint of smithwicks after a long day running around after two teenagers in the parks. We didn’t get to use the pool but it looked clean and well serviced and didn’t close until 11 pm also. There was music there each evening from about 5 to 7 which was very pleasant to get you in the holiday mood. Reception staff was most helpful and it was also possible to buy your park tickets at the counter. They offered a bellboy trolley service which was cool to take you from reception to accommodation if you didn’t have a car.
