We didn’t bother with a car as the iride was just outside the resort and took you all along international drive and to the parks in Seaworld, Discovery Cove, Wet n’ Wild and more. It also took you between all the outlets in Premium (right beside the resort and in my opinion the best one) right down to Prime at the other end of International drive. The resort offer free complementary bus services at scheduled times to Universal and Island of Adventure during the day and City Walk at night. There is a taxi service from the hotel which is expensive but convenient when going out for dinner and you don’t wish to drive. The bus to Busch Gardens leaves from the back of Premium Outlets (walking distance from the Floridays) or take a short iRide so it’s easy if you are heading out there. Down side and believe me they were few – internet is available but at a premium, way too expensive in my opinion. Staff recommend the usual restaurants like Charley’s Steak House, Johnny’s Hide Away & red lobster, but they are over priced especially Charley’s and the quality is crap if you are used of Irish beef, Portion size is huge but its not possible to eat it all and my steak was tough. As it was our wedding anniversary we ordered the best cuts together with lobster tails which was also tough and the bill came to €235 for two people, yes EURO. This included bottle of wine and 3 beers. Ya bloody expensive! Johnny’s is better quality in my opinion and the prices are better too €245 for the 4 of us and our teenagers eat more than we do! The bill included desserts unlike Charley’s. Nothing to do with the hotel though their food was cheap and satisfying. Taxis could be temperamental, twice they arrived 1 hour late and that was after reception staff remained them several time. There is a service charge for the facilities and it’s about $14 a day, for this they take out rubbish and make the beds. A full room clean is about $20. Remember the place is really clean and someone’s got to pay for it! We complained when we were leaving about the Taxi service and the hotel wavered the service charge entirely – couldn’t believe it. They know their customer satisfaction! For those unsure I would GO FOR IT you will be happy you did. Do check with American Holidays if you are travelling from UK and Ireland, we got a cheaper rate from them than booking directly with the Florida’s. Happy Holidays and we would go back again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, would return, ideal place to say to be near everything!!”
Reviews.Author: ShuGray
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays Resort from the end of April to the first weeks of May. We had an excellent stay at the Floridays and would happily go back even with children. The only disgruntlement I had was that the housekeeping was very inconsistent; such as one day we had beds made, bins emptied, towels replaced (as agreed by the Hotel Beds agreement given to us by reception when we enquired how housekeeping works - apparently you get a different service to other people depending on who you book with), on other days we just had the kitchen bin emptied, a couple of days we had products etc replenished, one day we had no service and then the rest varied from some bins being emptied and bed made but no towels changed etc. I felt that the resort fee + tax (which initially I was informed was $5 a day when I asked in Dec, is now $10 a day) was a little steep considering the only thing we 'used' from it was the ability to park there and to use the pool. We never used the in-room internet facility, weren't entitled to replenishment of products etc based on who we'd booked through, didn't get a consistent housekeeping service etc however, the rest of the stay was enjoyable enough that I would give it a second chance. We couldn't complain considering the price we paid through Travel Repobulic was under half of what you would have to pay if you booked direct. Definitely give it a go though as we think it was worth it, especially room 603 which had a perfect view of Epcot and the fireworks every night. Infact building D was ideal. It overlooked the scrubland waiting on Phase 2 construction so was very very quiet, a minute from the small pool to the right and a 2 minute walk to the main pool to the left. This was an ideal location for Disney and the other parks, it was easily a 5-10 mins drive straight (literally) to Disney and 10mins drive straight up the I4 East to Universal, it couldn't have been better location wise. As the previous posters have mentioned Publix is next door as is the Premium Outlets, McDonalds, Outback Steakhouse and other food outlets in the Premium Outlets that serve decent takeaway. I would quite happily return and hope that our housekeeping service wasn't the norm. I should point out that the resort itself was immaculate and well presented and the staff extremely kind and helpful. I particularly liked having a Starbucks on site and plenty of sunbeds!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Danny Boy 123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 12 nights in March 2009. The resort is easy to find and conveniently located on the southern part of International Drive. Very close to all amenaties. Our condo was in block E by the quiet pool about a 5 minute walk from the main pool and bar area. Check in staff were very friendly. The cleaning staff were fabulous and our apartment was serviced on a daily basis. For the 2 of us we had plenty of room in our 2-bedroom apartment. Excellent amenaties. The downsides: (1) the high prices charged in the on-site supermarket. A Walgrens & a Publix are located under a mile away which we soon discovered and prices were more reasonable there. (2) the air conditioning in our apartment was extremely noisy and made a very loud bang when switching on or off. This was quite disturbing at night time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: laj2009
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Florida, and stayed 2 nights at the Floridays resort in Orlando. Its only a couple of years old, so expect new buildings. We rented a 2 bedroom condo and stayed in the F building. The only regret we had was that we weren't closer to the big pool (near buildings A and B). That pool is huge, heated , has a pool bar and food nearby. The Disney sights are 20 mins away by car. We chose to take our own car and not depend on the shuttle to get to Disney. Plenty of shopping centers to get food for the room nearby. I'll be back.!!

Reviews.Title: “Completley enjoyable...”
Reviews.Author: MrsD_dclady
Reviews.Content: Before choosing the Floridays Resort, my husband and I did a lot of research, looking for other peoples input on different hotels/suites/resorts. We were pleased that we chose the Floridays 3 bedroom suite. We have 4 children, 17, 13, 9, 5. The boys each had their own bed in their room and the girls as well. That all by itself made our life so much easier...We loved the full kitchen & dining area. Everymorning we could have breakfast before going to the parks and not worry about having to find a restaurant. And being able to do laundry with a family my size....its really a necessity. Although the majority of the reviews for this facility were great, I also looked closely at the poor reviews as well. We were in the building farthest from the regular swimming pool with the kiddie area. It was only a short walk to the pool. I liked the nightly entertainment. at the pool (it was a single guy with his keyboard). He was pretty cool. And I liked the pool bar and the mini restaurant/store. We ordered dinner there once and the food was actually good and the service was great. I read some reviews regarding construction noise...I must not have been near it because I never heard it. If I was going to complain about anything it would be a couple cosmetic things (the face of a drawer in the master bath was broken on one corner; one drawer in the girls bedroom wouldn't close, it was always a little ajar; and one drawer in the boys bedroom was hard to close). The only neighbor that I ever heard was one evening it sounded like someone was bouncing a ball in the kitchen area. Other than that I never heard anyone. And the location...it's extremly close to Publix (grocery store - and it was a big one), it was close to several restaurants, as well as a huge outlet mall. And the drive to Disney and Universal....such a short drive. It was great not having to get up at the crack of dawn to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: suzysunshine
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Floridays with our two grandchildren. It was great for them to have their own bedroom and bathroom. We also enjoyed our privacy in our own bed/bathroom. The kids loved the pool. there were always plenty of towels and chairs. It was nice having the bar area overlooking the pool where you could eat and drink and listen to music while watching the kids. Everything was very clean and well maintained. Really, very, very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific property for families”
Reviews.Author: DogFamilySWMichigan
Reviews.Content: My family recently spent five nights at the Floridays resort in Orlando and we're quite happy with the property and staff. Our's is a young family with two girls, a three-year-old and a seven-month-old, and found the condo-style rooms to be a great match for us. The rooms are large, clean, and well-appointed. The in-room washer and dryer was a great plus and, in hindsight, we could have packed just half the total clothes in total and still have been in great shape (while lugging lighter/fewer bags). Our approach was to hit the grocery store early for staples (milk, cereal, coffee & filters, bottled water, snacks, etc.) to stock up the kitchen. There is a Publix less than a mile south of the hotel so this was easy to knock out, even while relying on the trolley for transportation. I recommend packing some laundry detergent and dryer sheets or plan to pick some up at the grocery as well. The only downside that I'd call out are the relatively thin walls which allow parking lot noise to filter into the room pretty readily. In fairness, I've yet to find a hotel room that is adequately sound-insulated. My wife and I have both traveled extensively for business and leisure and this is one of the few properties we'd happily return to. We've stayed in more luxurious hotels and those in premier locations, but for some quiet and value-priced fun in the Florida sun, this property hits a sweet spot.

Reviews.Title: “We wanna go back”
Reviews.Author: Jobaby66
Reviews.Content: This place has spoilt my children for any other holiday anywhere else in the world. "It's not as good as Floridays!" they chime. Must admit Orlando has something for everyone. Dads love the Kennedy Space Centre, mums love the shopping and drinks by the pool and the kids love just about everything else. Floridays is very well located, has lovely, well maintained pool areas, great staff, spacious, well equipped rooms and you can always get a good car space. Its not stuffy nor is it downmarket. It's great for kids but it's not too "kiddified" that the grownups are just grinning and bearing it. We will go back for sure. Can't risk trying somewhere else when this was so good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: tw0c0ldhands
Reviews.Content: Great resort. Fully equiped for a family on vacation including washer and dryer. Publix and Walgreens just around the corner. Central location for theme parks and shopping on International Dr. A little noisy at times with kids running along the walkways outside the doors, I would recommend 5th or 6th floors. Buildings E and F are quieter but further from the main pool and lobby building. Still only 3 minutes to walk. Not Impressed with the ''resort fee'', many others have mentioned that too..

Reviews.Title: “Floridays needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler032
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays for a week. It has a beautiful lobby, pool area and rooms. However in our 1 week stay, we had nothing but problems with the room. The first night in the room our lock was broken, the next day the dishwasher broke, then the sink clogged the toilet was running. We had to call the desk numerous times to have all of these repairs made. The repair guy came and fixed most of the problems, but the manager and the repair guy made excuses for why things kept breaking, instead of just saying "sorry about the problems, we'll fix them right away". We are not easily bothered type people, but all of these little problems had a negative impact on our week at the Floridays. They do not understand customer service like the more well known hotel chains. Also, the walls are paper thin and you can hear your neighbors throughout night, our kids kept waking up during the night bc of the noise. Beware of the hidden fee "resort charge" for $12. each day, I am still not sure what that was all about. One last thing, the pool area is small and 5 out of the 7 days ALL of the pool chairs and chaises were completely taken. Bottom line, I would not recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great position, reasonable value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Graham3019
Reviews.Content: The hotel is positioned at the far end of International Drive providing easy access to Seaworld and Disney. The suites are quite large and are well maintained. The staff were very helpful and extremely polite. Whilst the Floridays is a good hotel which provides reasonable value for money, I have a couple of criticisms. Firstly, the pool area simply isn't large enough. It gets very crowded and there are not enough sunbeds. They are planning to construct another pool in the near future which would solve this problem. Although there is a smaller 'quiet' pool. this is not heated and is some distance from the bar/retail area. Secondly, Floridays charges an admin fee of $10 per day plus tax for each night of your stay. This is supposed to cover things like car parking, use of the gym and Wi Fi. It's basically a room tax, and having already paid to stay there, I wasn't happy to fork out again. Overall, Floridays is a good hotel and I would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amenities, Great location, Great Service - I would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: luckyme79
Reviews.Content: Great Accomodations! The best chocolate chip cookies ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not as nice as Marriiott!”
Reviews.Author: momof2qtpiegirls
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and pool area. We were there over Easter and they had something small for the kids, a bit dissappointing. The rooms are okay but need more space for suitcases. The family room is nice and the screen-in-porch as we were on the first floor. My only complaint is that you have to pay $25 for them to come and clean each day. They do make the beds and leave fresh towels and dump the garbage, but that is it. If there is a piece of garbage next to the can - they leave it there! I know that is little, but when you have 2 small kids, it is annoying. They also do not replace what you use with the towels so we were constantly asking for more towels. The water from the faucet is TERRIBLE!!! You cannot make coffee with it, so you have to buy gallons of water for that while you are there. Very nice staff though! The Marketplace cafe is a bit overpriced but good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and close to malls, supermarkets, etc.”
Reviews.Author: GT305
Reviews.Content: Very clean, spacious, and has a full kitchen. Not crowded. Excellent for the family. Very close to Sea World! We're on our way back to Disney...and I found this sight and wanted others to know this is a great place for the whole family. Worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time, but.....”
Reviews.Author: erock84
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a 5 day 6 night stay at the Floridays in Orlando. The "condo" was very roomy, and was nicely furnished and had full appliances. Great patio (ours screened on first floor) to enjoy the morning and evenings. The staff was very friendly, and helpful in directions to area attractions. The location was prime, with a 5 minute drive to SeaWorld, and 15 minutes to Universal. There are also grocery stores and an outlet mall within a minute's drive. The resort overall is very nice, but it has a few problems. (1) There is no dining. At a resort of this caliber, I would have thought there would be some type of dining facility. The Floridays does offer a small menu at the bar or in the small cafe. Anyway, be sure to use the condo's full kitchen to cook your own meals if able, as a meal for four will cost you $50-$60 dining out. (2) The pool area fills up quickly and becomes crowded. There are two pools at the Floridays. One large pool with bar at the main buliding, and one quite small pool at the rear of the complex. The small pool is not heated, not regularly cleaned, and does not have a bar. If you need refreshments or a snack you have to either walk back to your room, or walk up to the main pool/bar area. Not a horribly long walk, but it is inconvenient. Also the main pool area becomes very crowded by mid-morning. With the amount of rooms the Floridays has, their pool area should be larger, or they should have multiple large pool areas to accommodate the amount of guests(actually a second complex w/pool is being constructed). (3) Limited room service.There is no actual cleaning service at the Floridays. Guests are expected to clean and pick up their suites themselves. Cleaning staff will come to your room and make the beds (not change sheets), bring fresh towels and take out the trash. With this in mind, make sure you are aware that the mess you make is the mess you clean up. Overall this is a fantastic place to stay. I wouldn't come here if you plan to stay your whole trip in the resort, but if your days are spent at area attractions then this place is good to come home to. P.S. Don't make the mistake we did...bring your golf clubs! Just the sight of the multiple area courses make you want to get out and play!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Floridays”
Reviews.Author: marylouth
Reviews.Content: Just back from a our first visit to Orlando and we loved Floridays. We went for two weeks and the first week we stayed in Floridays. The second week we stay in a different resort which on paper sounded better than Floridays but actually it wasn't. This is a great place for families to stay. The apartment was great size for 2 adults and 3 kids, we stayed in a two bed. No problems with noise from outside or other visitors. We stayed in block C so when the kids came out of the building they ran to the pool. They loved the pool and the hot tub. My husband and I found the front desk excellent. They were so helpful with recommendations for places to eat and directions to shops and . Very close to Sea World and Disney. We had a ball and will definately be staying here again. Everyone from staff to other holidaymakers were so friendly. Loved the outlet shopping, only a 10 minute walk from Floridays and what a selection of shops.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: trvlwithkids91
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Floridays 2 times now with three kids (9, 7, 4). The rooms are modern and clean and spacious. The location of the resort is great for all parks and for groceries, etc. It is also in a low traffic area which is great. There are two pools and there was some entertainment at the pool for the kids on a couple of days as well as music at night which appealed to the adults. They also gave us a discount as return guests. We will stay there again when we are in FL.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: triptaker0126
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early April for 6 nights. As has been stated many times over in these reviews, the rooms are large and having the kitchen and other amenities is a great money saver. After shopping at the local Publix on our check-in day, we ate breakfasts in the room, made lunches to bring to the parks, and ate half our dinners in the room. We did laundry half way through our stay which kept our packing light. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. I had a number of encounters with them and they were always very professional dealing with the situation. Some examples: - Had requested a crib and high chair as part of my reservation, and called 3 weeks in advance to make sure it was in their records. Was promised it would be in our room. Upon check-in to room, they were missing. I called the front desk; they apologized and someone was at our door within 10 minutes with them. - The jacuzzi tub jets would not turn on. They sent a service man within minutes to the room and he fixed the problem which was a tripped circuit breaker - The A/C would not run when we checked in and we couldn't figure out the thermostat. A service guy came again wtihin minutes to get the thermostat running for us and show us how to use it. - After a couple days we realized the A/C was stuck on 71 degrees and our adjustments of the temp weren't taking affect. Again an engineer was sent and he had to reprogram the thermostat from scratch. After this it worked correctly - There was some kind of gross spill/mess from a hotel guest in one of the elevators that I encountered. I called the front desk and they apologized and had it cleaned within minutes. - I was having trouble using the wireless network in the lobby and 2 front-desk workers went out of their way to watch what I was doing to connect and point out what I was doing wrong With all of these encounters service was professional and courteous. Here's a summary of the pros/cons based on our experience: PROS: - Convenient location to parks (no need to interstate / toll-road drive to get there) - Supermarket and pharmacy around the corner - Close to outlet shopping, although we did not check them out - Dining nearby - Kitchen, full fridge, 2 bathrooms in unit, dish washer, washer/dryer -- lots of space - Family pool with graded kiddie area was perfect place to introduce our 10 month old to pools / water play - good staff / service - towels replaced daily and beds made daily, trash taken out daily CONS - Massive furniture (especially dining room table and chairs) and fake plants make navigating room very tight, especially once you have your bags/stuff everywhere - Maid service doesn't clean anything; although we knew this going into it - Parking lot long and slow to drive through, especially for us who were in the farthest building from the resort entrance - Parking lots dangerous to drive in due to drivers that do not obey the multitude of stop signs. I came very close on two occasions to getting in an accident with cars that were driving fast and shortcutting the lot and blew through stop signs. - There were no luggage stands in the room to put your suitcases on. You typically see these in hotel rooms. Kind of annoying to work out of suitcases that were on the floor since the bedrooms are already tight and don't have much floor space. - Lighting in the kitchen area was dark, especially over the sink and countertops. - Master bath is much bigger than it needs to be, with a lot of wasted space. I'd rather not have the jacuzzi tub and have more space in the bedroom. One last thing, our Garmin GPS unit which I bought in early 2008 did not have Floridays Resort Drive in its maps. This put me in a jam when leaving the airport in my rental car and I had no working address to punch in and I hadn't printed off directions in advance. Fortunately because I knew it was near Sea World on International Drive I eventually found it among the dozens of resort/hotel properties in the area. Try the address in your GPS before you leave and if it doesn't work, use 12540 International Drive instead to get you to the resort entrance. All in all, a good find and thanks to tripadvisor for tipping me off to this resort. We will stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: BarryLJeffersonville
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and 9 year old daughter had an excellent stay at the Floridays resort. The 2 bedroom suite gave me and my wife enough privacy while giving our daughter her own room. The grounds are beautiful. The pool is excellent. The rooms are clean and modern. Grocery is down the street. Location was perfect you can find anything you need on International drive. Not to mention the bend over backwards staff. Thanks Floridays for making our vacation one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Cumberlandmom
Reviews.Content: Floridays is in a great location near shopping and all the parks - just down the road from Seaworld. Our two bedroom suite/apartment was clean, well kept, and had everything we needed. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. There are two pools, the larger of which was more for families - and crowded. We preferred the smaller pool. All in all, a nice place to stay - my only complaint is that there is a "resort fee", and if you want to use their business/computer center, there is a 20 cent/minute charge. (You have to purchase a card to use the computers...silly.) I much prefer one charge that includes use of the entire facility.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyKR
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great in all aspects. Was close to all major attractions, the outlet mall and expressways. The shuttle to/from Universal was excellent and with convenient times. The room 3 bed/2ba was huge and accomodated 7 and an infant very comfortably. The rooms were clean and the price was incredible. We had a lovely view of the pond and 2nd pool, very quiet nice location. Originally wanted to be near main pool but glad we were in the back as the main pool can get noisey. The bar staff at the pool bar (Carolina rocked!) was great. We'd go back for many reason's but Carolina at the bar made our stay extra fun!! Highly reccomend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Floridays!!”
Reviews.Author: LuvFLorida25
Reviews.Content: When I booked our stay at Floridays, I thought that it was going to be too good to be true for the price-it isn't! This resort by far exceeded our expectations! The rooms were large, spacious and very clean. We saved a lot of money by preparing our own food for most meals in this wonderful kitchen with all of the amenities. The pool area was great! The service provided by every staff member we encountered was A+! We were going to stay at another hotel that was less expensive and loved it so much that we extended our stay at Floridays. Centrally located, shuttle service to SeaWorld was awesome, hotel is a stop on the I-Ride trolley service that runs all over International Ave for $1.25 adult kids 12 & under free. We visited during a very busy time and the resort was full. I never heard a peep from another room, no traffic, no disruptions. The beds were comfortable. Everything was clean-maids come to make beds and replenish towels. We didn't mind cleaning up after ourselves. The washer/dryer was nice to have. I could go on and on about positive comments about Floridays...I used these reviews to choose this hotel and I am glad that I did!! Get a AAA membership and save even more $$ at this resort. We will without a doubt be back here!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best -- surely not one of Orlando's Top 10!”
Reviews.Author: IowaRoadtripper
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights in a 3-BR suite at Floridays Orlando and would not return. The good: Lots of space, laundry in suite, two bathrooms, full kitchen. (We got a grocery delivery from gardengrocer.com and it was waiting for us in our suite--highly recommended and much, much less expensive than the little market/cafe on site, even including the modest delivery charge.) The not-so-good: Incredibly poor insulation that allowed us to hear EVERYTHING that happened in the parking lot and on balconies of surrounding buildings, all night. Every conversation (loud or not), every car horn locking beep, every door shutting. We don't have ultra-sensitive ears and live in a city, so we aren't strangers to noise, but this was intolerable. After three nights of being awakened repeatedly every night, my husband and I moved from the master bedroom to a small interior bedroom that was somewhat quieter. The times we called security they responded promptly, but as soon as they drove away in their little golf cart, the patio partiers were back at it and we were still awake. Maid service was ... interesting. They devoted themselves to folding towels into exotic shapes, but didn't clean sinks, glass dining room tabletop, or floors, or vacuum the carpet. But they did come every day, unlike some reviews I've seen. Overall, unless you are bringing a large family and most of them have hearing impairments, I would definitely look elsewhere. I just can't believe this is one of the 10 best places to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to go home!!”
Reviews.Author: grnidcsi
Reviews.Content: It was everything we wanted and needed! Transportation to and from Walt Disney World! I FELL IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE!!!!! The hotel is clean, nice, and friendly! It is two years old and is absolutely beautiful. We stayed in the two bedroom room and the room was decorated perfectly! It came with dishes and is FULLY loaded with kitchen equipment! THANK YOU FLORIDAYS!!! WE WILL BE BACK!!! The Withey Family

Reviews.Title: “Despite the shuttle, not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jreisenb
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this to discuss some of the issues brought up in prior reviews. The free shuttle has major short-comings. The biggest being that there is only 1 bus regardless of the number of passengers...you may have to stand. We went at a relatively quiet time of the year and had to stand on two legs in 6 days. The bus to Universal was significantly less crowded, newer and cleaner. The thing that really ticked me off about the shuttle was the fact that I inquired about it before booking and it was implied that it was on-demand, NOT. There is a per-day resort fee which I knew about before booking so I did not have a problem with that. The on-site cafe is small and limited but does provide the basics. It is expensive and the value is not great. We had no problem with the maid service in our unit. We were short some kitchen inventory items and they brought them up to us within an hour. Without them, we would have been unable to cook dinner. We had full control of our thermostat and the temperature setting in our unit. The internet connection (wired but they will provide a cord) was slow one night but that could have been due to the number of concurrent users. We arrived at 10:30AM and received an early check-in and got the 11:15 shuttle to Epocot. We were also granted a late check-out at 1:00PM to accommodate our 3:30 fight. The pool area is great for all ages. There are water "devices" and beach balls for the kids to play with and even a sand area. Overall, this was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for families....”
Reviews.Author: mtncelt
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from our stay in Florida at the Floridays resort and I had to take 5 minutes to sit down and write a review. We had a *fantastic* time and our stay at the Floridays resort was a big part of that. The pool was fantastic. The kids had a wonderful time playing in this very family friendly and well designed pool. The kids could play and the adults could lounge around and enjoy watching them play. Very nice and highly recommended. The condos - we stayed in a three bedroom condo - were very nice. Well laid out and very comfortable. Again, the kids had a place to go to bed and rest and the adults had a living area to relax in and enjoy. WAY better than being crammed into a couple of adjoining hotel rooms without question! By the way, for the parents our there - our condo had a washer and dryer so I only had to pack clothes for three days instead of a whole week and I came home with suitcases full of clean laundry. It was wonderful!! The staff were very friendly and helpful - until we checked out. The guy at the front desk was less than genial once he realized we had already checked out and were just there to pick up our luggage. One pinhead should not ruin it for everyone though and I would give the hotel an A for staff and service. It was very enjoyable. I have just two small grips - so small that I didn't bother with them, but others may find it a problem. 1.) The housekeeping is ala carte - so be aware of that. There are no published fees that I could find anywhere. We just put the Do Not Disturb sign on our door and cleaned up after ourselves and 2.) the shuttle service that this hotel uses left early from one of their scheduled stops one evening leaving us scrambling. The next night, the shuttle did not show up at SeaWorld, leaving us to rely on a cab to get us back to the resort. This should not reflect badly on the hotel itself, but it is something to be aware of - especially if you have small children in your party. Have the number to a cab service or another Plan B or some sort!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MichiganDigital
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because our time share would not be ready until Sunday. (we arrived on Friday). The staff was very friendly, loved our room and the pool was great. The food from the cafe was also good and fast. We would definately stay here again. Also the price we paid would be comparable to a Holiday INN, but had a resort feel.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay for the best value”
Reviews.Author: fshsa
Reviews.Content: This resort was clean and well stocked w/all amenities. I saved a lot of money of food expenses as I was able to work the kitchen in the room. Washer and dryer was a plus. Did not have to do much laundry when I got back home. The place is laid out well. The pool was heated, clean, and fun. Considering buying a unit. Excellent stay and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great facilities. Will definitely stay there next time round”
Reviews.Author: silovestofly
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel, we stayed there last summer just before it seemed to take off as a popular resort. Even though prices seem to have shot up this year I would certainly recommend Floridays mainly down to thew location. On previous visits to Orlando we have often stayed further out in Kissimmee and last time at Bahama Bay - which was also a great resort but seemed miles out from all the action. Being situated in the quieter south side of international drive, Floridays is only a few minutes from Sea World/Aquatica & Discovery Cove. A shuttle bus runs outside the complex taking you up the length on international drive so a night out without the car is an easy option. Also within a fairly short trip are the Disney resorts in the Lake Beuna Vista Area. Nearby is a Pubix supermarket for groceries. The 2 room condo we stayed in was clean had a decent kitchen, We prefer this self catered option as 2 weeks of restaurant food can get to seem too much. We opted for a pool view which can lead to a little noise but nothing excessive. The pool was great for cooling off after a day out or even just for having a lazy day and the bar was well run with friendly staff. On certain days the pool bar even had some entertainment. All the staff we met were helpful and friendly and made us feel very welcome. Overall a great place to stay and whilst other similar resorts such as the fountains resort have sprung up in this area we will be back this year

Reviews.Title: “This place had it all for me and mine.....”
Reviews.Author: TuttiFrutti8
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Floridays for one week from 27/12/08, to catch the last few days of Christmas in the parks and get in some shopping. Perfect location for both; transportation to parks was well organised and available, even at that busy time. We were a mixed party of young children, needy teenagers (shop-v-park??) and parents; this place met everyone's needs. We didnt have a car but Lynx and I-Ride stops literally outside the door. Some would say you need a car to stay here-I'd disagree (it's be nice but it's doable without). Also teenagers were free to come and go on public transportation so no taxi-driver mom. Ideal for Premium Outlets which had improved greatly since our trip the previous year. Travelling with small children access to the full kitchen/washer/dryer was such a bonus compared to previous trips spent in hotel rooms with a kettle and a microwave. It's not the most convenient for evening dining but we did most our eating in theme park restaurants or got delivery to our hotel room. We're park-people so often forget to eat!! Weather was just amazing! The pool was heated well, and temp during the day was up on high twenties/early thirties so for us this was glorious, having left -1 to -5 at home. The roomy spa was 'roasting'!! We also found it better than June/July trips where we tend to find the heat too much. Our 3-bed condo had everything we needed, though on our first night, arriving after 24 hours travelling, they didn't have a 3 bed for us, and asked us to accept a 2-bed for the night. It wasn't ideal, but we were exhausted and didn't bother arguing. It was also a little expensive on Hotels.com, totally due to the time of year - we were very lucky to get a room at all as it was sold out on every other web-site. Could i fault Floridays? No. Just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome condos! Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Boston_Ma_Traveler_9
Reviews.Content: We booked a VERY last minute trip to stay here (2 day notice) and had a great time!! The staff was great - very friendly and accomodating. We did have 1 problem - we had requested that a crib be set up in our room before we arrived. It was not there and I had to call twice to have it sent up. Not fun when you have a cranky toddler who just wants to go to sleep (arrived at the hotel at 9 PM). They eventually brought it up 45 minutes later and offered to set it up for us. Again, the gentleman was very friendly. The unit was so spacious and very clean. We had plenty of towels, loved the laundry machines in the unit, and the full kitchen. The jetted tub in the master bath was great too. This condo was perfect for a family of 4 - our kids were in the double bedroom, which was far enough away from the master and they had their own bathroom. The TVs in each room was great too! Our only complaint was that this resort is a little further away from Disney than we were expecting (they advertise 2.8 miles, but it took us 15-20 minutes each way, every day. It was definitely more than 3 miles away), The air conditioner was impossible to figure out (we just kept the windows opened the whole time we were there), and the water pressure in the master shower was very weak. All in all we had a fabulous time - this condo was one of the best places we have ever stayed at and was very reasonably priced (we paid about $110/night for the 2 BR).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: joek48083
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the luxurious floridays resort. With two small children the room was the perfect size to give us enough space for our needs. The place was extremely clean, the staff was courteous, and everything in the room was top notch - from the TV to the kitchen to the bathrooms. The staff was very friendly and quick to service your needs whatever they may be. I would definitely stay here again when headed to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family of 5”
Reviews.Author: cwp23
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights from Feb.18-21 and was extremely impressed. We had a 3 bedroom suite that was huge.Laundry facilities in suite were very handy. Very tastefully decorated and clean. Was booked to capacity when we were there and I can see why. We are pretty picky about where we stay and wouldn't hesitate to come back here, in fact I may even look at purchasing a unit there.Also location was great(10 minutes to Disney & Universal) and price was extremely good. This type of unit at Disney would likely cost over $600 a night and wouldn't be as big and with the amenities.Oh, and did I mention the pools are great for adults and kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: Needhamites
Reviews.Content: 3 bedroom unit for a great price, so I really like this hotel. Only minor complaint is my building, F, is way in the back. Clean rooms, really large, great pool and location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room, great pool, terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travelmom9
Reviews.Content: We took our 9 year old for 6 nights to Orlando to visit Universal and Islands of Adventure. (Best parks for a 9 year old) After much research on trip advisor we chose the Floridays. Great decision. We had a two bedroom in building B over looking the main pool. The rooms were spotless, roomy and as comfortable as home. Fully equipped kitchen with a dining area big enough for 6 people. There were two double beds in our son's room and a seperate bathroom. Our large master room had an adjoining bathroom with a shower and a jacuzzi tub big enough for two!! There was a small balcony and we were on the 5th floor with a nice view. The complex is not over-whelming like some of the other resorts in the area. You can walk to the pool, bar, game room and front office easily. There are golf carts at the complex with employees giving rides if you are located at one of the back buildings but the young and healthy really can walk. The front desk was very attentive and friendly. We didn't have an iron in our room and it was sent up within 5 minutes. If you want internet in your room you do need an ethernet cable but they have them at the front desk. The bar area is nice with two great bartenders, Katy and TJ. They were very sweet , giving service with a smile. Another plus was the ability to purchase a bottle of wine or beer at the local liquor store and sit by the pool at night while our son swam. ( plastic cups of course) We LOVED this place and will definately return. It is a bit further down International Drive and I highly recommend a rental car. We grocery shopped at the Publix Market 1/2 mile away and loaded up on breakfast items, juices, coffee etc. It lasted all week and we even packed lunches for the parks. ( Saves lots of time and money) The ONLY thing I will warn about is that there is somewhat of a noise issue. The ceilings are thin and yes you can hear plumbing from above. We had the 5th floor so request the 6th (top) if that is going to bother you. Also, my son's room was closest to the outside corrider and he heard noisy people at night returning to their rooms. We did not from the master bedroom. Over all though it did not bother us much. Can't wait to go back . If you go you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tink3
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Resort around 7:30 pm on February 13. Check in went real smooth and we were even given a short tour of where everything was. All questions we had were answered quickly and we were off to our room. The rooms were nice just like everyone describes them. We had a two bedroom suite and were in Building “D” which was close enough to walk to the pool and market. There is a shortcut through the parking lot of “D” that leads right to the pool area. I think building “B” is the best location. Anyway, we had a few incidents in the room with TV remotes needing batteries and some light bulbs out as well as a missing a coffee maker. We made a call to the front desk and all was resolved in no time. We found out later that our TV in the living room also did not work I assume it was batteries in the remote again but never called as we did not use it anyway. Our friends had the blow dryer missing from their room and they brought one right away. We found it funny that blow dryers and coffee makers were missing and we came to the conclusion that they take it from rooms that are not rented to replace them in the rooms that are and that is why this happens. The rooms were very clean and the maid would come and take your trash, make the beds and refresh the towels which there were plenty of and our rooms were always done when we arrived back. I also loved that we had two bathrooms with showers so it made it real easy getting ready in the morning for everyone. The food at the mini market was very good and my husband and I would split an egg, cheese and sausage croissant in the morning which also came with fruit. It was only 6.00 for the sandwich and was big enough to feed both of us. The mini market is the only place to get food and is not a full service resturant. They do have good sandwiches and breakfast and there are enough nearby resturants to eat if you arn't in a park. We ate at a Bahama Breeze and Olive Garden so all was well. The pool was nice but we never actually had the time to really spend by it but they had plenty of towels and chairs. The resort is in a great location to both Disney and Universal. We did Blizzard beach one day and Universal 2 days and had not problem with traffic getting in and it was painless. One thing I did not like is that they have the resort fee but then charge you in the internet room. We had to print off our Southwest tickets and had to purchase a card to get on the internet which I think was 20 cents per minute and 75 cents a page to print. This kind of put me off since we paid a resort fee that said internet was included but I guess that meant in your room if you brought a laptop. We did send the kids over on the shuttle to Universal early one morning (our kids were 17) and that was a great help as the adults could relax and arrive at their leisure. I would definitely recommend this resort and feel it is clean and nice for anyone who does not want to stay in the park. It is a great option for families who want a kitchen and plenty of room for everyone to stay together in comfort. We booked this trip last minute with friends and we thought it was a nice resort with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Floridays”
Reviews.Author: meissy
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by how nice everything was considering a 2BR suite was the same price as a room at Holiday Inn or other similar hotels. It didn't have the most expensive decor and fixtures as I read in another review, but when you get such a good deal on price you don't expect it to be fancy. It was TOTALLY worth every penny we paid to stay there. It was clean, the staff were mostly all very helpful, the free shuttle was a plus. It was great to have a fully stocked kitchen, washing machine / dryer and extra space. The pool area was large and nice. The new expansion of a little waterpark should be really cool! The only disappointment we had was that it said there was a restaurant onsite, but the menu was relatively limited. We would have liked to see a full-service restaurant, but there are plenty of those off-site so it didn't make or break our trip. If we wouldn't have expected a full restaurant, we would not have been disappointed in what they offered. We would recommend this hotel FOR SURE. My husband, daughter and I had a wonderful experience there.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort in ideal area”
Reviews.Author: Liath
Reviews.Content: The apartment/suite was everything you could hope for. We were in Block A towards the front of the resort with our balcony looking over a small lake and fountain. The apartment was so well laid out and supplied that it was like living in a small house. Two bedrooms, two bathrooms and of course the jacuzzi just off the main bedroom. Kitchen had every need including cooker, microwave, washer, dryer, dishwasher. Powders provided. Coffee and percolator. Air conditioning/heat. Towels changed without any requests. Bed linen changed twice during ten days. Staff lovely throughout resort. Pool area great. Pool bar and shop (pricey but handy). Concierge was, to our surprise, working for Expedia rather than the hotel. Had one bad experience due to this. Booked for Kennedy Space Center and we were told that bus would collect us at 7am, but would ring us the night before to confirm time. No call. Got up for 7am and no bus arrived. Eventually a concierge arrived, checked and found that Dolphin Tours had us booked for March (not February) - so she said. She changed the company and the day worked out well. I think I would do my own booking and buy my own tickets online in advance in future. Or buy tickets at the attractions. Be warned, especially if you are bringing a group ... attractions are expensive. Sea World cost almost $90 for one ticket. Much the same for Disney and Kennedy. We were not driving so we used the I RIDE TROLLEY. $10 for a 7 day ticket with 41 stops running between two outlet parks, one at each end. Two lines Red and Green, but you get used to their slightly different routes. 1, 3, and 7 day tickets are not available on the trolley; buy them at your resort. Validate the ticket 1st use and then swipe it each time you enter trolley. Individual trips cost only $1.25 but obviously the day tickets are much better value still. Pick up a map of the stops (and what is at each stop) in your hotel or on the trolley. No set times for trolleys so it can be frustrating if you just miss one because it can take 20 minutes for the next one to arrive. Stop 39 is beside Floridays.. it would be handy to know this for the taxi from the airport because there are lots of hotels and resorts on International Drive. PUBLIX is only about 200 yards of a walk away and you can buy supplies of just about anything here, including pre-cooked meals, meat, fresh fish, cooked meats etc. etc. You are sure to enjoy Floridays and I do not really understand some of the niggles reviewers scare prospective clients with. The resort is very easy to walk around no matter what block you are in. Finally, if you are looking for a Catholic Church during your stay, there is a beautiful one just past the outlets park and near Floridays. The info in your apartment will give you numbers for places of worship and your local calls are included in the extra payment you make per day to cover this and other amenities like free shuttle to some parks. Make sure you book the shuttle a day in advance. Enjoy your trip and enjoy Floridays. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Please search for other options!!”
Reviews.Author: papakube
Reviews.Content: The resort/hotel is built with very cheap decor. When we walked in the thermostat cover fell off, the toilet seat covers were broken, the carpet & furniture felt dirty, the drawers in the master suite would not stay closed and the provided dishes were filthy. We found hair in the fridge and in the shower drains and women's panties were left behind under the sofa. Staff was friendly when available, but when my wife called for assistance with our bags she was told there were carts near the elevators for guest use, so much for customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: drknows
Reviews.Content: We staying in a 3 bedroom unit for 10 nights in Jan, 2009. The Good: The suites are fairly new. Internet was ethernet (wired) and reaonably fast. The pool was warm and clean with an excellent kids area and large lap pool for the rest of us. The small white sand beach is a nice touch. The front desk and cleaning staff were friendly and helpful. Good location -all parks, stores, restaurants are 5-15 minutes away. The food offered in the cafe is good enough to feed hungry kids at a reasonable price. Reasonable rate - Resort fees were USD 12.50/day for internet and parking. On-site concierge was helpful and able to supply tickets to most of the theme parks, and recommended good, family friendly restaurants. Other: The windows are single paned and although we were on the 6th floor, we could hear people talking in the parking lot, doors slamming, and other general outside noise. Construction next door commenced at 7:30 am six days a week. - I suggest asking for a room away from the parking area. Hot water was an issue, not quite sure why, but got the old "run the shower for 5-10 minutes" which I haven't heard since the early 80's. Not very good for the water table... You have to pay US$ 40.00 to have the room cleaned mid-week which is a gouge and just plain unsanitary. House keeping is short staffed and often our garbage and towels had not been replaced before 5pm. *Most of the above mentioned issues were dealt with by staff quickly in a responsible and friendly manner. The front desk followed up with a phone call and apology for any inconvienence. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Please read before booking at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: Luvtotravelandsee
Reviews.Content: It is not a hotel, but a timeshare rental. There is only 1 front desk attendent, and only1 building maintenance person on site at a time for this large complex. If you have a problem, you may need to wait over an hour for any resolutions. Here is a list of shortcomings we experienced on our 3.5 day stay: 1. The thermostats in the rooms are preset. You cannot change them without calling a maintenance person, and then he can only reset the temperature to last only 8 hours at what you may want. the temperature went from 68 to 42 within hours and we had no control over the temperature inside. 2. The shuttle to the parks is not an all day thing. You MUST ride in the morning to get a ride back. When we arrived the first day, we were not on the outbound shuttle since they stop coming at 10:15 am. We asked them to call us a cab, and they call a specific car service which I believe they own. It charges twice the amount of a taxi. If you want a taxi, you have to do that on their own. Great concierge service, huh? Since we were not on the outbound, we couldn't take the return shuttle, that we paid for in the daily hotel service fee. We had to take that round-trip. 3. You pay a service fee everyday in addtion to your room rate. It only includes towel replacements and trash removal if you are lucky. This was very inconsistant. They do not replenish the toiletries if you use them up nor do they replenish the coffee if you use their coffee machines in the units. You have to call to get replenishment and you may need to wait over an hour for somebody to bring it and made to feel like you're being greedy. 4. They do not have a restaurant on site like they say. You can order food in their overpriced convenience store and sit at these cheesy tables if you want. It's like you would be eating your dinner at 7-11. No waitstaff like you would expect at a restaurant. The cost of the beverages nd food at the convenience store are the same price as in he Disney parks. Need I say more? 5. We did end up taking the shuttles. They are disgustingly filthy. They stink like stale smoke and they show up late and leave without you early. If you stay there, do not expect the amentities you would expect at a hotel. The front desk staff do their best, but the company that owns this joint is a disaster. Do NOT be fooled by the low nightly rates, because you will be surcharged for a bunch of nothing. You'll incur the cost of a rental car or their overly expensive car service if you need to get anywhere the day you arrive, since you cannot check in until 11:00 am. I will not stay there again and I vehemently discourage anybody to pay to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place with a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Tripswithbaby
Reviews.Content: Over all this is a nice property, but there were several disappointments. First, their reservation system is seriously flawed. I had to call several times, at different times of the day when trying to book to finally get ahold of in-house reservations. I had requested a first or second floor room because my one year old hates elevators, I also requested a crib to be in the room. As it was late when we arrived, I didn't notice during check-in that our room was on the forth floor. Since we had already driven to the back of the resort to our building(it is kind of far) plus the baby was sleeping and the crib should have been waiting in the room, we decided we would stay there. We got in the room, no crib. We called the front and we were moved to another room on the first floor in a different building, but we had to drive all the way back to front of the resort to take care of it, then back to the second to last building. We also received a message on our phone two days before we planned to check out to confirm that we were checking out the next day, they had our reservation one night short. And I know I repeated the reservation days and number of nights more than once on the phone when making the reservation. Again, it was quickly fixed but could have been a problem had it been the busy season. The play room that is advertised and you see pictures of on their website no longer exists, which was a huge disappointment since it contributed to our choosing this hotel. Several lamps in our room did not turn on, not really a big deal since there were so many. I think the broken lamps were so because they have tassels hanging from the turn switch, not the best choice for a hotel which is geared for families! I had to take off all the tassels because my toddler saw them and wanted to pull on them! I am sure other little kids have done the same which is how they broke. The furnature was really uncomfortable, super uncomfortable! I can't stress how poor the chairs are, the back of the chairs are so far back that you cannot sit back and relax. I have seen other reviews about noisey neighbors and thought it was being picky, but after staying in here, I understand. The exterior corridors are concrete and the buildings are U shaped, any noise made in the exterior U shape echoes through the corridors. You can here every last whisper through the thin walls and windows. It was loud, we were there at a slow time, and I don't think there were more than a dozen rooms occupied in our building. I can't imagine how loud it must be when the place is busy. On our last day, the internet (wired) did not work throughout the entire facility. I understand these things happen, but I have read other reviews where this has happened and think it is a common problem. The connection is also on the slow side. It is also true, as other reviews have said, that it is a hike to the main building and the road from the far buildings. About a 5 minute walk, and about the same to the road in a car because there are so many turns and speed bumps! We had planned on using the I-Ride during our stay, but didn't for several reasons, it was a long walk to the road, the bus came very infrequently, and most importantly there is no crosswalk! In fact you have to cross three lanes of traffic, up over a curb, across a grassy median, down another curb, then across two more lanes of 45 mph traffic! Not safe if you are trying to travel with children and/or a stroller~! Plus it is $1.25 per ride, not the $1.00 the hotel website states. There is a Publix close by, but if you walk there, you have to walk along the busy road in the grass in front of a construction site. Another issue worth noting is the heavy use of scented candles and/or air fresheners in the main building! While the smell was not unpleasant, it was STRONG! A member of our family who is allergic to perfumes could not even go in there to use any of the facilities. If you have perfume allergies, do NOT stay here. The rooms were large and clean. Kitchen was spotless, I didn't think twice about cooking there. The water has a strong Sulfur taste and smell, so if you are not used to sulfur water, plan to buy bottled water! Master bath is clean, large and nice, but could use a few towel racks. Staff were all friendly. Cribs and high chairs are available upon request at no charge! We didn't have any issues with the limited house keeping, other than the day we asked for hand towels and washclothes but were informed they didn't have any. They didn't even make an attempt to bring us some later. The pool area was nice and large. We also liked the 'sand beach', well my one year old liked the sand beach. There were no toys there like the pictures show. The land scaping and fountains in the ponds were also very nice. They also have DVDs for rent in the lobby, I think they were $6.49 per night. I found a RedBox($1 per day) at a Walmart a couple miles away. This 'Resort' ( I wouldn't call it that) is also for sale, as in the units are privately owned then the hotel rents them out for the individual owner to make profit. So when you reserve a unit, someone owns it similar to a time share, but they make a profit on your stay. They don't push a sale on the guests, only a few signs and brochures about buying a unit in the rooms. But I think the unit owners contribute to the number of wonderful and excellent reviews for this place. It isn't a bad place, but isn't exceptionally wonderful either!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about the condo!”
Reviews.Author: widdlew
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo at the Floridays Resort. The location was ideal! My husband was in Orlando for a conference at the Marriott Orlando World Center and my mom and I were there to go to Disney World with our daughter. It took my husband less than 10 minutes to get to his conference and 15 minutes for us to get to Disney World! The condo was better than any suite in a hotel room because you have two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a living area, a balcony and a fully stocked kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Floridays! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: nhuebler
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Floridays because of the condo style rooms they had. There were two bedrooms and two baths, full kitchen and washer/dryer. Everything was there that you could possibly need. There was a starter kit for laundry and dish soap, for coffee and the dishwasher! It was such a clean and beautiful place to stay that we will return. The Floridays offers a free shuttle to the local attractions, they have a pool bar, cafe and Starbucks coffee on site. They also have a fitness room and game room for the kids. The pool was very large with smaller activities for our toddler. They even had a small section with sand for the kids to play in, like they were at the beach. The staff was extremely friendly. Housekeeping removed garbage, made beds and stocked soap and shampoo everyday. They do not do a thorough clean of the room everyday, which was fine with us. You can have them clean your room for a charge if you want, there was a vacuum and mop if you wanted to clean yourselves. This was in a very nice area with grocery and gas stations near by. Not too many things in walking distance other than what was onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: Trip_Over
Reviews.Content: Great location at the quiet end of International drive with well stocked Publix supermarket and Walgreens Pharmacy etc 2 mins drive from the compleax. Sea world five minutes up the road and all the other parks within 20 mins. Apartments (we had a 3 bedroom) well appointed with great ensuite in master bedroom with jet-bath to relax in after hard day in the parks and big flatscreen tv in living room area and large tvs in all bedrooms. Complex pool quite large and never that busy and nice snack bar next to reception to pick up breakfast rolls etc. Staff were extremely helpful and concierge services to book tickets for parks although it is the same price give or take a dollar to buy on the gate at most parks. But buy before and you dont have to wait in line to get in (you will spend the rest of the day waiting in line) So I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone and did not see anyone within the complex who make you feel embarrassed to be from the UK. You know what I mean ! If in Orlando stay at Floridays

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back...”
Reviews.Author: ktfloss
Reviews.Content: We had an unbelievable time in Orlando this visit. Partly had to do with our accomodation. The Floridays resort was fab. Clean, friendly, convenient, great poolside bar, hot, hot, hot, hot tub. The condos were very well equipped. fantastic jacuzzi bath in master suite. TV's everywhere. Loads of storage. Its walking distance to Publix where we left a load of money. And has a Subway and Mac Donalds walking distance. 15 mins walk to Premium outlets. And when you want to visit the parks there is free transportation. Compliments of Ali who is a mine of local information.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: hound367
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotel experience I have ever had. The staff at this hotel is unbelievable. They all have such positive attitude and exude pleasant friendliness. I was impressed with the quality of the facility. Breakfast buffet was splendid! Over all, the staff at this hotel made all the difference. When you take care of the people who work at your hotel, they in turn display positive vibe in their work.

Reviews.Title: “We felt at home at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: avocado55
Reviews.Content: It's a Dad and Daughter trip to Disney - my 9 year old girl and I are checking out today after 5 great nights at Floridays. I snagged a rediculously good rate from Orbitz (prepaid but refundable up to 72 hours in advance for a $25 fee) after lucking out with two promo codes that worked together. Even without the coupons, the rates I had to choose from between Orbitz and others were an incredible value for what we got. We are in a two bedroom unit overlooking the beautiful pool and it's tropical surroundings. It's reaonably clean and well furnished (I could do without the overabundance of faux houseplants), the washer and dryer is an incredible convenience (next time I'm flying with one carry-on), the kitchen has really anything you should need for preparing the basics. The beds are reasonably comfortable. Three TVs (plasma in LR as well as a DVD/VHS player ), two full baths with both a shower and big Jacuzzi in the master bath. Now....others have commented on bad maid service. Well, I had "bad" maid service, having been missed the first two days. But it personally did not effect us, as there were six full sets of high quality towels. It turned out that housekeeping didn't have our unit on the list. This is probably the single and only reason why I didn't rate Floridays as Excellent - but again, it was far from a big deal for us, especially considering the overall experience for the rate paid. I'd come back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: uuhydro
Reviews.Content: Great Value. Probably saved close to a $1000 between not having to getting an additional room at another hotel and the kitchen. Close to everything. No issues with the maid service as we always make our beds anyway. The front desk staff was friendly and there were no construction issues. Were there a couple of things that were not perfect, sure, but they were minor in nature. I also will not blame hotel for the cool weather or the sun not setting at the right time. I would highly recommend especially if you enjoy your own cooking better than eating out every night.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays was top notch!!”
Reviews.Author: Carbonet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in their 2 bedroom suite and were very pleased with our accomodations. Floridays is the perfect resort for parents that want to provide a fun-filled vacation for the children, but enjoy their downtime after a long day in the sun to unwind. The private bathrooms and floor layout encouraged family time and adult time. The bedrooms were located at opposite ends of the suite - priceless!! We reserved a suite that was at least a building away from the pool area to allow easy access at our leisure without interruption from the pool goers. I am a self-proclaimed germaphobe and our room was immaculate. My boys were comfortable and felt at home. We couldn't have made a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough place but definitely some issues”
Reviews.Author: boothguy
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, new condo-type property with spacious, nicely furnished suites (ours was two-bedroom, two-bath). Be aware that there is the infamous "resort fee", and the daily housekeeping service is limited to towel replacement and trash removal. Floridays is difficult to find in the dark with just a small sign on International Drive. Seems this "temporary" sign and entrance has been on-going for two years now. At check-in, our reservation couldn't be found, but I luckily had my confirmation from AMEX Travel with me. So that made the process about half an hour or more longer than it needed to be. Next morning, there was no hot water, but informing the front desk got it resolved after a while (the building's boiler needed to be re-set) and the second morning, there was a minor re-occurence. Next day, someone was doing some sort of early-morning work in what may have been the unit above us and it sounded as though the person was in the bedroom with my wife and I. Lowest-bidder construction quality strikes again. The last two days of our stay, the in-room Internet connection (wired) went from its normal slow speed, to unusably slow and then completely out. The on-site maintenance guy couldn't repair it. Service was finally restored the last evening of our stay. The maid service alternated between insisting one morning that she be allowed to replace the towels although my wife and I were still dressing; to another morning forgeting us entirely. We finally had to set the kitchen trash bag in the middle of the room to get it taken away. The suites are nice, the staff does try and there's a little cafe on-site for a quick bite. We got a pretty good rate on our AMEX Travel package, but I'm not sure I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For xmas or anytime - Floridays, Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Yogmart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays Resort in Orlando for 15 days over the Xmas and New Year. It is a fabulous time to be in Orlando. The Apartment we had in the Floridays I booked through www.holiday lettings.co.uk, number 16850. I first found it through a review on TripAdvisor . We really did'nt know what to expect regarding the Complex and we were delighted to find such a great place. Some of the reviews had complained about its location. We found the location to be very satisfactory. It was quiet and well away from the Honky Tonk overly commercialized opposite end of International Drive. Right around corner from Premium Outlets and a Publix supermarket. Its also few min from Sea World. (Discovery Cove is a great day out and the Swim with Dolphins is amazing). Universal and Disney very near also. Some reviews also said a car is not necessary and although this is somewhat true we found a lot more flexibility with a rented car. Cars are not too expensive to rent in US. Busch Gardens is also worth a visit. Particularly if you like animals and very scary roller Coasters. The apartments are a great size and there was plenty of space for 5 of us. The two bathrooms and shower is a great idea. The pool area was great and the fact it was heated meant my children could use it over xmas when we got back from a day out. Starbucks on site also. We found the rental price to be very competitive and the staff very helpful. On returning one evening half the electricity would not work and on phoning reception they had an employee(who knew what he was doing) to us within ten minutes. There were plenty of Towels and there were also clean towels at the pool. There was no view from our apartment except the Carpark but then Orlando is not somewhere you would go for nice views anyway. I would recommend the Floridays to anyone and would stay there again in the same apartment. This is very central and if people closing car doors and setting their Car alarms(it is 2009 after all) isn't going to be an annoyance to you then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty shock of $1100 on our return home- will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: aggie31
Reviews.Content: Arrived home and ten weeks later they deducted $1100 from my credit card, despite them issuing a $0 balance bill on departure. It seems the agency we booked through hasn't paid yet, (despite us paying them 2 months before our trip) and they have the right to bill the guest!!! Despite emails, and a lengthy phone call, they still insist that we are responsible. Stayed previously at Sheraton Vistana Villages,and Floridays was disappointing compared to Vistana. We were in the block at the back,and actually had to drive to the swimming pool it was so far away. Sun had set on the pool by 5pm, and it became very cold and windy, so disappointing that you couldn't comfortably swim in the evenings. Overall, apartments clean, large enough for a family. However, we found there were huge groups of teens next door to us over the weekend - the larger apartments sleep 12 and it wasn't much fun having 12 coming and going at all hours. I will be staying at Vistana Villages next time, and I think you should do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Julie & Wally Our Time”
Reviews.Author: jatucker4
Reviews.Content: We had a WONDERFUL TIME at the Resort. The room was so BEAUTIFUL and CLEAN. The staff was FRIENDLY and very HELPFUL. They all made us feel at home part of a family. We look foreward to coming back next year for a longer stay. You made our much needed vacation a dream come true. A big Thank You to All Your Friends Julie & Wally Tucker (MA)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: mbechard
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I've stayed in when visiting Orlando. This was cheaper than the Embassy Suites, with more room and amenities. The grounds were beautiful, with several pools and hot tubs. The room was well kept, with plenty of towels. I can't say enough good things about our stay here. It was peaceful, relaxing, and thoroughly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: Tiger2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Floridays resort from 16th to 23rd December 2008. Overall the whole place and stay was excellent and highly recommended. The suites were perfect for a family and two seperate bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and 3 TV's a great touch. Cooking and washing facilities in the suites was also very good and had everything you could need. The main pool at the hotel was excellent with plenty of space and sunbeds available. Location wise I also found good. Although I would recommend that a hire car is needed to properly do the I-Drive/Orlando experience from this location. Just a short trip up the road to SeaWorld and Discovery Cove and near to supermarket and petrol stations and the premium outlet centre. Overall a great property to stay in. At the time of our visit there was no building work at the hotel and was very peaceful and quiet and phase 2 of the water park area had got to the point of land clearance only. When this is built I would say the resort will be even better but also would probably avoid when this work eventually occurs especially if you are allocated the blocks furthest away from reception near to the proposed new blocks and pools. Would def return.

Reviews.Title: “This is paradise[”
Reviews.Author: roythered
Reviews.Content: The title are not my words but my grand son's after arriving at the Floriday's We spent a week on the resort, we enjoyed the location which is south on International Drive next door to Sea World. We booked in early around 2pm not a problem, our accommodation as advertised was exceptional, the resort was spotless and the staff attentive when the need arose. The pool is fantastic for grand parents with young grand children (six years of age) There is a mall within walking distance of the resort and a number of restaurants. A huge brand outlet mall was also close by along with access to the I-4

Reviews.Title: “great Floridays vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ICUMary
Reviews.Content: The resort was very convenient to all the attractions. The front desk staff was exceptional from check in to check out! The rooms were very clean and comfortable and have all the things you could possibly need. The housekeeping staff didn't do anything except take out trash and replace towels which I thought to be a little strange. Our bath towels were left on the kitchen counter! Overall, we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: mommy2cuties
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with two boys, ages 4 and 6, middle class from a suburban metro area. We visited Disney and Seaworld and chose Floridays primarily because we could use our AE "points" to book this property (our last visit to Disney 1/08, we stayed at the Polynesian) we wanted to get more bang for the buck and also visit Seaworld, so we moved off site from Disney. I would have been very disappointed if we paid out of pocket to stay here. Our Amex travel agent really pushed this property and we were happy to be in a suite with a separate bedroom for our boys. While the inside of the suite was fine, the appearance of the resort was so-so. We were there over a cold snap and could not use the pool, so other than general appearance (which was clean) we cannot speak to that. Here are some observations/pluses & minuses about the property: Positive Large two bedroom suite. Suite was generally clean Kitchen was clean and contained and basic equipment to make dinner (full size fridge, electric range, plates, silverware, glasses, coffeemaker, blender, icemaker, pots, pans, etc.). TVs in each room two full baths large master bathroom with whirlpool tub Pool with water play area for kids Good location for seaworld (10 min to drive) and right next door to a Publix, Walgreens and near premium outlets (although we didn't shop). Many Luggage caddies were made available near the elevator which made bringing up stuff helpful. While they offer shuttle service to Seaworld -- a Car is a must. Negative General International Drive is loaded with "resort" properties. While Floridays is a "good enough resort" -- especially for a long term stay -- it did not appear to us a one that was worth "275-400" a night which it appears listed as on the Amex website; rather $125-150 would have been a fairer price. First of all, it looks like there were two halted construction projects on either side of the property (they appeared to have raised/cleared acres of property on either side of Floridays and just let the weeds grow) -- which does not look appealing when you approach the resort. Second of all, the outside hallways look a little weather-beaten, dark and shabby, with worn floor paint. Third, the landscaping/greenery on site looked a little sparse. While the inside of the suite was spacious, the furniture was too big for the room and made it hard to walk around --the table for six was always in the way (and we are skinny ; )). Second, bathroom tub surround was not tile, but some plastic type material (fine if your on a cruise ship, but not on land). Bedding was motel-like (like the second bath). Third, while there were perks, free coffee (on the first day only) and crabtree & evelyn soaps, towel animals that they used to gussy up the place, the overall appearance was mid-range. Noisy. Our room was over the parking lot (not like we needed a view), car doors and beeps from people locking and unlocking cars was a little annoying. Maintenance When we arrived at 6 pm from the themepark, there was no hot water to bathe our children.
