This inconvenience lasted only a short while (about 1 hour) but the front desk was less than helpful. There were a couple of blown light bulbs in the suite and it was difficult to turn off the automated air conditioner. Later that evening, I went to the market and returned up in a pitch black elevator (which was kind of creepy). The shower had VERY low pressure and I had to wash my shoulder length hair in the tub (yuk). I did find a stray hair in my kids tub (I cleaned it with clorox wipes), but this may have been from the maids. This is a long term facility and they do not change your sheets or make the beds -- they take out the garbage and replace towels only. We tried to get coffee for our second day, but despite requests, it never came. The gym was lacking. Three out of the four treadmill were out of order for days while we were there. Conclusion The two bedroom space was good, kitchen helpful but there were some minor glitches with the maintenance. We certainly would not mind this place if we were staying longer and got a slightly better price than was advertised (who doesn't like a bargain?); but we were disappointed b/c it did not appear as it was described to us by Amex Travel. We hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and public transport available”
Reviews.Author: sgh1
Reviews.Content: Had a 14 night stay here in a two bedroom apartment in December. There is no denying these are smart looking apartments and are well kept. On the whole everything is positive however there are some negative points. I’ll get the negative out the way first. There is a resort fee that is payable upon check out in addition to the room rate. For 2 bedroom apartments the charge is $5.33 per night. I believe the charge is higher for 3 bed apartments. I booked these apartments through Broadway Travel in the UK. The policy is they empty trash everyday which they did do but they were also supposed to replace towels and make the beds. Towels were only changed on request and beds were made about 3 times in 14 days. The sheets were supposed to be changed every 3 days, this didn’t happen. Also they are supposed to do a full clean every seven days this was not done either. The maids turn up at all different times. We did not have a car but the I-Ride Trolley stops outside the resort and we made good use of this. Supermarket is one stop away, it is only a ten minute walk away I did it quite often. Wouldn’t recommend it in the dark simply as the street lighting isn’t great. Floridays operate a mini bus service which you book the day before to all the main parks. There are 2 to 3 pick up times depending on the park. With Disney they drop you at Epcot. You can make your way free of charge to the other Disney parks free of charge from there. Used the mini bus for Universal/IOA seems reliable enough. The I -rideTrolley goes into Seaworld, Aquatica and wet and wild. Seaworld is a five minute drive away. Pool area is very nice it looks bigger in photos but none the less it is very nice. The café is over priced. A small bottle of water is $2.00! You can get a whole pack for that up the road at the Publix supermarket! The Market Place Café in Floridays do things like burgers, pizza and breakfast muffins again these are over priced. They also serve Strarbucks drinks here. Reception are very polite as are the concierge. The gym is nice as is the games room. Internet is available at $0.20 a minute. One recommendation is the local Chinese round the corner Citrus Garden. They deliver which is ideal if you have had a long day shopping or at the parks. [-] we used them loads and they really were good and the portions were huge. You will find you get lots of flyers for pizza places etc it’s best to ignore most of these as per reception. Stick to well known names like Pizza Hut and Pappa Johns who both deliver to this resort. If you are a not driving it is a good location as you can get around to main attractions and shopping quite easily. If you find you need a cab I would not use the company used by Floridays as they are very overpriced. There is a reliable cab driver we always use (Jim) when we are in Orlando he is fairly priced and trustworthy. If you need the number send me a message and I will give you the number. Few minor problems as mentioned but I would happily return to Floridays as positives far outweigh the negatives. If you are driving I would also recommend looking into staying at Hapimag Lake Berkley Resort we stayed there last year (It’s only approx 5 miles away from Floridays) it is also a great place to stay but only if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “The suites are gorgeous..”
Reviews.Author: Swede81Sweden
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from staying 16 nights at Floridays. We were three adults, my parents and I. So the two bedroom suite with seperate bathrooms were just perfect for us. My parents want to live in a suite like the one we stayed in. We arrived early morning due to a 10 hour wait/delay in Chicago and the staff were super at check in and even had someone help us with all of our bags to our building, we were in C. The bed is so comfortable and huge... and then the in the master bathroom the bathtub was so nice and so was the shower cubicle. There are three tvs, but we only used two. Everything you need to make meals are provided, except for spices and food itself. They even have an electronical tin opener. They have two pool areas, one that is mainly for adults and then the big pool area. I bet that is good at the peak seasons, but now hardly anyone was around when we went to the pool in the evening after Disney and shopping. Swimming in the pool at 8-9 pm in december surrounding by palm trees is what I call perfect. There are two elevators per building. Staff are superb and are there to help you with alot. You can even walk to one of the outlet malls from the hotel, although a short bit is walking on grass/gravel. But you can also take any of the buses that go by, I-ride, Lynx bus 8 and 42. There ought to be a crossing across International Drive to get to the bus stops on the other side, nr 42 goes to the Florida Mall. But the traffic was not heavy so we made it across. Anyway you have to stay here to try it out. It is just pure perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Floridays :)”
Reviews.Author: Katierose10
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (along with two other couples) stayed at Floridays for a week in October and loved it!! We had originally rented a 2 bdrm condo but after the first night my friend had an allergic reaction to something in the room. We asked the front desk to possibly change rooms, and were upgraded to a 3 bdrm almost immediately! Great customer service, everyone was very friendly - we loved the bar by the pool esp. Kyle! It was close to the Disney parks as well probably about a 10 minute drive to the Disney entrance. Our last night we went to Sleuth's mystery dinner show in Orlando (the girls had a great time, the boys not so much)! I've stayed on Disney many times and would now rather stay at Floridays- very friendly people, nice pool and bar, close to attractions, and a great value! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat!”
Reviews.Author: DCLJJBR
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and had a great experience! My husband and I had our 16 year old son and our daughter and her husband and our 2 grandchildren, ages 5 and 15 months. The space was great for such a varied group. Everything was clean and well kept. The pool was gorgeous and hardly used when we were around. We spent most of our time at the parks, but it was a pleasure to come home to this place. It was convenient to good restaurants and shopping too. We were concerned on arrival that there were no child-proof "plugs" in the electric sockets. We called the desk and the manager went to the store to buy them. We got a call that he was unsuccessful on that trip but would keep looking. The next day we returned from the park and found a new box of them on the counter! We also thought the air filter needed changing, so called the desk and maintenance came within 15 minutes to change it. Excellent customer service! We would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Familly fun with a touch of luxury”
Reviews.Author: SofiaTignes_France
Reviews.Content: Best luxury stay in Orlando. We spent two weeks at Floridays, me my husband and our two girls 6 and 4 years old. It is super situated near a supermarket, Iride trolly stop, free shuttle sevice to all the main parks....But the best of it all is such a friendly and efficient staff. The units are clean and VERY nice. But then there are the details that gonna make all the diffrence: * towelservice by the pool - super * complimentary cleaning products for washer, dishwasher, sponges etc - super * sheets are changed regulary - super * everyday cleaning service, towels etc - super * child friendly swimming pool - super If you choose to stay at Floridays you are going to have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Most Uncomfortable Mattress Ever- Nice Room Budget Mattress”
Reviews.Author: jonref
Reviews.Content: Room was nice, it had a terrible odor in room. Checked everything out and was excited since the room was very nice. Laid down on the mattress and I was shocked how poor of a quality the mattress was considering all the good reviews this place had received. This place needs to check out a MArriott and see the quality of the bedding. This morning went to make coffee and it was missing filter, so had to drive to get coffee. If you want a room with space but you like sleeping on cement, this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Business +2 Kids <3 + Lifesaving Nanny”
Reviews.Author: SevenSees
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel due to the number of people I would be traveling with (Myself, 2 children and awesome Nanny), in this regard I was not disappointed. Floridays large suites really comfortably accomodated us all and even could offer my Nanny some extra space to be away from my hyper children in the evenings. Given the fact I had to stay in Orlando for roughly a week I was happy with my choice. The full sized kitchen and dining area was also a huge plus. The pool area is great for children. However, for me the style of the decor and the overall look of the compound left me feeling less than dazzled. Yes, everything was very clean, new and well maintained - but the style had little finesse. The staff was extremely accomodating, helpful and friendly. If on business I would stay here again, but for pleasure definite NO. Disclaimer: I live in Miami and am not trapped by the cold in anyway! :)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at Floridays Resort”
Reviews.Author: TheBigKahoona
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at Floridays Resort. This was my home away from home when I was not at Disney World. For the most part it was quiet and relaxing. Nice room with plenty of space for everything. Good beds with support and a TV in every room. Having a kitchen saved lots of money and was convenient. There is a grocery store and a 24-hour Walgreen's or CVS right around the corner. I do agree with another review, the housekeeping is hit and miss. We had problems with a couple of the lamps not working, a faucet that would only turn the cold water on and a slow tub drain. Once reported they were quickly repaired. The main pool area is awesome. Plenty of room to stretch out and activities for the kids to enjoy. There is an outside patio Bar and Grill by the pool and a store with food and drinks. The rooms are very secure. The resort personnel were very pleasant and helpful. This is a very nice family resort. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, Would Recommend to Anyone”
Reviews.Author: glengibson
Reviews.Content: Hi all We had a wonderful 10 nights at the Floridays resort. I chose this resort purely on the comments and rating that had been posted on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed at all. After reading several reviews we kindly asked at the reception when we booked in if we could stay in Block B (next to the main pool) and the man was very helpful and obliged willingly. We were allocated Condominium 407 in that particular block. The condo was 2 bedroomed and very spacious (compared to what us English & Europeans are used to) the condo was very clean tidy and upon inspection of the cupboards we found a full inventory of utensils and crockery/cutlery right down to an electric whisk (not that we planned on doing any cooking on holiday) The condo boasted a 42" Flatscreen Tv in the main living area, a table that seated 6 in the dining area. Fully equipped kitchen and a Whirlpool spa bath in the master bedroom ensuite. Overall we had a wonderful stay. excellent amenities, great staff at the resort and i would say that for the price i think anyone woul find it difficult to find somewhere else comparable for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Whole family loved Floridays Resort”
Reviews.Author: Syracuse_snowgirl
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a week stay at the Floridays Orlando resort. I travelled with my husband, who was attending a conference at Disney's Yacht Club, my children ages 4 and 5, my brother-in-law and my elderly mother-in-law. it was our fourth trip in four years to the Orlando area. In the past, we have stayed at Sheraton Vistana VIllage, Residence Inn by Marriott and Disney's Grand Floridian. Floridays was a excellent choice for our extended family. With small children and an elderly relative, it is not always convenient to go out for every meal, especially breakfast. Floridays worked out very well for us. We stayed in a three bedroom condominium in building F. Our kitchen was well stocked with dishes and kitchen utensils and appliances. There are several pools at the resort. The ones closest to building F are more oriented toward adults even though children are allowed. The zero entry children's pool is a bit of a walk, which was not a problem for myself, my children and my brother-in-law, but was a problem for my mother-in-law. If mobility is an issue, you may want to request building A, B or C. The pool is heated and has waterworks which my kids thoroughly enjoyed. The resort is conveniently located to the Disney theme parks, Sea World and Universal Studios. We visited the Magic Kingdom, Universal Studios, Sea World and even drove to Busch Gardens in Tampa. The International Drive restaurants are only minutes away by car. I choose this resort based on reviews that I read on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. Should you stay on Disney property or at a resort such as Floridays. I guess the answer depends on what your needs are. Having stayed at the flagship of Disney properties, the Grand Floridian, I can say that the Floridian is beautiful, it has character meals, and is very close to the Magic Kingdom and the other Disney parks. However, a standard room at the Grand Floridian fails in comparison to a three bedroom unit at Floridays. And the pools are much better at Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “overrated, but price was good”
Reviews.Author: coloradomichelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the 3 bedroom condo. The rooms were well sized. the master bathroom was nice, with large tub. The cleaning was hit/miss, and I think the owners would be disappointed to find mildew in the grout (quite a new hotel) The living room furniture is very uncomfortable, cannot relax to watch a movie. The kitchen is normally equipped. The coffee maker is horrible, must be the cheapest on the market. The biggest problem was the NOISE. We were on the ground floor, and could hear people upstairs talking, walking, EVERYTHING. The cleaning crew was very loud. They were shouting throughout the complex, and having a great time. This is only a big deal if you have a baby/toddler that NEEDS TO NAP. Our schedule was basically to get up when the people upstairs did so, due to the noise. I was never asked if I was interested in purchasing, which is good because I would not. I paid an extra maid service fee to clean my room thoroughly, and they left an olive on the carpet, and some food in the sink. When I requested a crib, houskeeping brought it, and as an afterthought, said " oh, do you want me to put it together?" The crib is small, metal, does not seem safe. The tub literally took 4-5 hours to drain. I would actually consider staying here again, but only at the discounted price we did get ( $150 per night) and only on a top floor away from construction. The grocery store next door is really nice, a little pricy. Rent a car!!! but not from budget~ The front desk staff was nice, concierge was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: drummondsrus
Reviews.Content: stayed for 10 nights and found floridays excellent place to stay. local supermarket,good cooking facilities,i ride trolley outside hotel,clean rooms ,concierge to find tickets,huge pool complex,bar,restuarant.only ten minute drive to seaworld,discovery cove,wet n wild,aquatica and many more.stay here to get away from the busy end of i-drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holidaydiva28
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 10 day stay at the Floridays with my family consisting of husband and girls aged 3 and 5. The hotel was exactly as expected. Rooms were very spacious and well equipped (provided with welcome tea, coffee, shower gel, soap, conditioner, shampoo etc). It is perfectly placed for getting provisions also, with Publix 1 minute by car around the corner. Also around the corner is the Premium Outlet Mall if you require to do a little retail therapy. Everything ran very smoothly with our stay and we had no need to contact the hotel at any time during our visit. The girls loved the pool area (towels provided) as it had shallow splash around area with water jets to run about in. We spent our entire stay visiting the Disney parks only which was ideal given the ages of our children. Magic Kingdom is around 10/15 minute drive away with Epcot (and downtown disney) even closer and Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios slightly further away, but no more than an extra 5 minutes. The hotel was well placed for all these parks. The livlier end of Intermational Drive is only a 5 minute drive and there there is a number of different restaurants to try out there. We had a brilliant holiday and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: tallandglam
Reviews.Content: After much deliberations and many weeks spent on Trip Advisor we decided to book Floridays. Always wary of what you are going to get when you check in but EVERYTHING was fantastic and we have nothing to compain about. No problems finding the resort, check-in was quick, efficient and friendly. Had requested a room away from any building works and got one in Block B which was ideal as it was near the main pool and reception area. Condos are spacious and spotless. Dishwasher with detergent which was regularly replaced, washing machine (again with powder regularly replaced), tumble dryer, iron, board, huge fridge freezer and icemaker. Enough pots, pans, crockery and cutlery for our party size. Bathrooms huge with big walk-in showers and divine smelling shower gels and shampoos (also regularly replaced). Ample free parking. Brilliant pool with plenty of sun loungers. Good games room with air hockey and the usual games machines. Publix supermarket and Walgreens pharmacy about 1 minute away by car. Quiet area at the very south end of I-Drive and felt completly safe, even at night. Took us about 15 minutes to drive to Universal and Disney, and about 5 minutes to Seaworld. Can't contemplate staying in a normal hotel room again after being spoilt for space at Floridays and if we return to Orlando we will stay there again - no question about it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: erikaj25
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great location. We traveled with a 2 yr old & a 6 months old and the apartment was very convenient and clean. Although they are still under construction, everything was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Floridays”
Reviews.Author: Janney1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay at the Floridays Resort, What can I say but this place is amazing. Stayed in Building B on the fourth floor with a lake view. Absolutely beautiful. The staff are very friendly and they go out of their way to help you however they can. ( Eddie you are a star doing a great job- Keep up the good work) The apartments were very spacious and had everything you could possibly need, they were clean and very well kept. Housekeeping was sufficient for what is needed doing. The two pools are fantastic but the smaller pool is less busy. Just a short 5 min walk away was the Publix which was really useful. The I-Ride and Lynx bus stops are right outside the entrance to Floridays so you don't even need a car to get around. The resort provides shuttles to all the parks which was really handy and the drivers are all really polite and proffesional. (Thanks Guys). I can be quite fussy about where I stay on holiday but this place ticks all the right boxes, Cannot wait to return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Pool for kids”
Reviews.Author: KO75
Reviews.Content: I have to say that when we don't stay at one of the Disney Hotels we stay at the Floridays. We stayed in the two bedroom condo. They are fully furnished and equipped. The bathroom has a jacuzzi tub. You can actually watch the tv while in the jacuzzi tub if you open the shutters in the bathroom. My favorite thing about this place is the pool. First of all it is heated and it starts out like a beach (without the sand) and then progressively gets deeper. They have all kinds of water spouts and water mushroom for the kids to run around in. They usually have pool games for the kids on the weekend and island music. It's very clean and close to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: BrianIbsen
Reviews.Content: Never have i stayed at a better hotel than this. The whole family was totally amazed by the rooms and didnt want to leave the room :) As said, the rooms are big, clean and everything works at should. The pool area is very nice and children friendly. Hotel is very close to all the attractions/parks in the area. The only thing that we found a little strange was that there was no breakfast buffet.. But that might be "normal" for such type of family hotel. (not that it was a big problem.... one should just remember to stock the fridge). All in all a super stay... We all hope that we can return to this hotel next year. Thanks so much for the best 4 days we have ever spend at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: jwjones
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from 8/23/08 to 8/26/08 in Building E room 405.The 2 bedroom unit was quiet,well appointed, very clean and upscale.The smaller of the pools is located at the other end of the building.Our group of 5 was very impressed with the resort.We had no problems with anything,including parking.Its location is central to all of the major attractions in Orlando.However,upon checkout I was hit with some "resort" fees that I was unaware of at the time.Since I had prepaid months in advance,I thought my total bill was taken care of,but I was wrong.I would suggest that anyone staying with them ask about these fees in advance and try to negoiate.Overall though,it is a fabulous place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: loupylu
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a week in the Floridays resort. I really cannot fault the resort in any way. It really feels like home from home . The beds and lounge furniture are so comfortable. We were perfectly happy with the level of cleaning and bin/towel changes. The staff are really excellent and so helpful. On 2 occasions we were locked out of our room as the access cards didn't work. It only took a quick call to reception and they sent someone straight away to help us. We booked on the shuttle buses with no problems and the concierge was really helpful with local information. We didn't have a car for the duration of our stay. Although you don't need a car to get to any of the parks and the I-ride stop is right by the entrance I think it's much better to have a car. There are a couple of restaurants and amenities close by but if you like flexibility you really do need a car and taxis are not cheap at all as we found out! Also, if you don't book a car, definitely try and stay in one of the blocks nearer the road. We stayed in block 'H' and it's a ten minute walk just to get down to the main road to get the bus so it's a bit of a trek in the heat! There is a resort fee you pay when you arrive of $5 per day which we didn't know about. We didn't mind but it would be good to be aware of that cost before you arrive. Overall I would definitely recommend staying here, and will hopefully be going back as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Floridays Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: giovanniOrlando
Reviews.Content: Floridays Resort gave my family the most comfort and satisfaction we have ever experienced in a resort. I would recommend anyone who is looking for a great atmosphere and convienence to stay at Floridays. Not only are the rooms spotless and very classy the staff is very professional and helpful with all aspects of your stay. Please feel free to contact me anytime for more input about Floridays Orlando Resort.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: finn22SheffieldUk
Reviews.Content: there is no dout that these apartments are lovely but service is none existant . on our first morning both toilets blocked up it took them over 12 hours to send someone to fix them by this time we were paddling in dirty toilet water we had to ask for someone to come and clean the floors we should not have had to do that.the The same morning we reported the ceiling fan on the balcony not working after two days they told us that they needed a part to fix it so we went the whole two weeks with out it and believe me it was baking on that balcony as it was august so we didnt use it .we only had one clean in two weeks.and it was not to my standed I,m not fussy.All in All these problems did not spoil the holiday the pool was exellant. but as we had our little granddaughters with us age 3 &4 years we tought if we stayed in a good resort it would be better for them. I did expext a better standed than we got

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever, so far.”
Reviews.Author: 2xWestLondoners
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying between 31st August and 10th September, excellent hotel and already thinking of returning as soon as possible. Thanks to Tripadvisor the reviews on here are justified, the two of us stayed in a two bedroom condo, this included a dining table which could seat six people, a kitchen with large microwave and large fridge, dishwasher, Jacuzzi, 37" plasma televisions in the bedrooms and living room. We never stay in hotel rooms for long, but we enjoyed waking up and coming home to this great living space. The front desk were always very helpful, you have to pay a five dollar fee each day to Floridays, this gives you things such as free internet access, free shuttle service to seaworld/disney/universal and general up keeping of your time there. LOCATION: The location we thought was perfect; it's near the end of International Drive in the South only two bus stops away from the Premium shopping outlets (I-Ride stop 41). The I-Ride mentioned is basically a bus going up and down International Drive from morning till 10.30pm (stop 39 outside floridays), the cash price per ride is just one dollar but for even more value buy a ticket from the Floridays concierge to save even more money (1,3,5,7,14 day passes). The Calvin Klein shop has to be the best shop there, amazing value for money on lots of quality clothing. As the hotel was on the southern end of International Drive, it was easy to get on and off even seated without the I-ride being overcrowded as it approaches the middle of International Drive. One word of warning, you will find a different pizza menu each day slid under your room door when you get in the evening. We stayed in one night and ordered one from 'Orlando's Pizza' - do not buy from Orlando’s Pizza, terrible quality and didn't feel too well the following morning. Also if you want to walk along International Drive, you can't! Not at least in the Southern end where Floridays is, we had to walk along the grass with other people as their were no pavements/sidewalks. And the I-ride stops urgently need to have lights fitted for the night, bus drivers cannot see you standing at the stop in the darkness unless you start waving or nearly stepping out into the road for them to see you, one I-ride driver agreed he cannot see people and ends up driving past people. WEATHER: After all the worry of the weather reports online showing the recent hurricanes it forecasted thunderstorms every day of our stay! Turns out you should never trust the forecasts, it only rained for an hour for only one of the days we were there. All other days the weather was roasting hot 31-34 degrees. PARKS: Highly recommended is the Orlando Flexticket, superb value for money. We bought the one which covers five parks (Seaworld, Universal, Islands of Adventure, Aquatica and Wet n Wild) - £125 for one of these tickets and we made great use of the parks. We also went to Magic Kingdom and Blizzard Beach which are Disney parks just to see what they were like, unless you have kids or enjoy kids entertainment it's not for you - the rides at Magic Kingdom I thought were very poor in comparison to the other parks on the flexticket, Blizzard Beach was good but AQUATICA is by far the best waterpark without a doubt. Also the Disney parks were very overcrowded, this was simply due to the parks being popular of course with younger children and the many Disney resort hotels in the area. Favourite ride has to have been the new Simpson’s ride at Universal, closely followed by Spiderman at Islands of Adventures. Terminator 2 was stunning for a special effects show. And for an absolute soaking on a hot day, just go on Bluto's Barges at Islands of Adventure, you will be drenched! I think the Jaws ride at Universal is very dated now 15+ years on and should be replaced with something more up-to-date. FOOD: International Drive has loads of various types of restaurants; our favourites were Tony Roma's (ribs,seafood,steaks) and Maggiano's Little Italy. Charley’s Steakhouse is the best steakhouse in town, a little costly there but well worth it. Worst happened to be Pizza Hut, one couple even stormed out of the restaurant as they were so appalled by the service and food - very bad. To sum up, Floridays was the perfect hotel in what we think was the best location on International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Floridays”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfamily08
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Floridays having stayed Aug. 18th - 1st Sept 08 cannot fault this place easy check-in and out given written info on houeskeeping to avoid any confusion {none on our part as we knew what to expect} the facilities of staying in this type of resort far outweigh staying in a hotel especially when your children are different ages like ours - 18 and 11. Stayed in building D on the 5th floor no noise from other residants or from construction. Close to all amenities, parks,shopping and restaurants we could even watch Wishes at the Magic Kingdom in the distance. We were given written information on Tropical Storm Fay and contacted via telephone so we fully informed. We will certainly return in the future as this offers a great location for a holiday to all the theme parks, offering a great place to unwind, staff are helpful and pleasant to speak to,when the water park is finished it will just add to the plus points of Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Floridays!”
Reviews.Author: Craddock23
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a two-bed condo (block A 408) at the Floridays Resort 13-27 Aug and loved it. Everything you need is there. There is a very well equipped full kitchen, two excellent bathrooms and very comfortable living area and bedrooms. The jacuzzi in the master bedroom is big enough for two and great for relaxing in witha glass of wine after a day of queuing at the parks. Our balcony faced the front of the property, overlooking a lake with fountain, ducks and turtles, and International Drive beyond (not at all noisy). I believe our block was the closest to the main pool, bar, cafe, gym etc. Towels are provided for the pool and there was no problem getting loungers. There are also towels and water provided in the gym. The reception area is impressive and everyone is very helpful and friendly. (John offered his muscles to help with our luggage!) We were very surprised at the kitchen essentials provided, even a new scourer, small washing-up liquid, sachets of dishwasher liquid and a single pack of Tide. There were even tissues and kitchen roll! They really seem to have thought of everything. Having stayed in Disney hotels and a villa in the past, I must say this is by far the best . You have all the space you need but with all the facilities of a large hotel. Our daughter is already planning a return trip next year with friends and we certainly hope to return just as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jamsmom951
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from a 6 day 5 night stay at Floridays. We were in the area so my husband could run an international race, do business, and squeeze in a family vacation! We decided to book Floridays vs. staying in Disney because we had so much business to do outside the park and figured it would be easier getting around. We really had a great stay. The hotel/condo is spacious and clean. If you are looking for pampering and spa treatment then this is not the place for you but if you are looking for a home away from home with privacy and convience then you've come to the right place. We stayed at the 2 bedroom and it was great. It made it so much easier traveling with children to have a full kitchen. On the day we arrived we headed to the grocery store right down the street and stocked up. It was very helpful and economical to feed the kids breakfast at the hotel before heading out for the day. There is a cafe on site where you can get sandwiches and drinks. A little pricey but delicious. It was great having two bathrooms with 6 people in the room. and the balcony was great for relaxing. The property is very large so if you are placed in the back like we were (building F) then it can be a long walk with kids to get to the pools and cafe but if you call the front desk they will pick you up in a cart and take you where you need to go. We only had a few minor porblems like one of the hair dryers didn't work, the remote didn't work (they fixed it) and we had to call several times to get needed items. If you are traveling with small kids and need a crib they are available but PLEASE double check the crib before you put your little one in it. They didn't secure ours and it's a good thing I checked before putting our 18 month old in it or it would have folded up on him. Also, if you are going to use their cribs I strongly advise that you bring your own crib sheets. They don't use crib sheets they use regular sheets that they fold around the mattress and if your child is very small then it could be dangerous. We had requested a crib and high chair before we arrived but still had to call once in the room to request it again. They brought the crib right away but it took us 4 phone calls to get the high chair. Another thing I would strongly suggest if you have small children is to bring some outlet covers. Some of the outlets were at eye level for my son and I had to use chairs to block them so if you have small ones take some of those plug in covers; you'll feel better knowing they can't get hurt. So overall it was a good experience and nice to have the comforts of home. One more suggestion i'm going to make re: traveling with small children. I found that it was much easier to get through the theme parks by carrying my son in a snuggli with him facing out. Standing in lines for rides and attractions can be long and my arms were straining carrying him but this way I was able to walk through the attractions and then he was able to ride on my lap and be secure of not falling. If your are traveling to the theme parks they are very close by and easy to get to. I will issue out a warning to be careful of the time-share scavengers! They are everywhere and will offer you fantastic deals on park tickets. If you don't mind listening to a time share lecture then you can get park tickets much cheaper than at the gate but if you don't have time for that (or the patience) avoid them like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Skip74
Reviews.Content: I spent somewhere between 20-30 hours online looking for a place to stay for our family of 3. I finally decided on Floridays and we were all pleasantly surprised when we arrived. We rented a 3 bedroom suite which was basically a condo. There were 2 large bathrooms w/ one in the master bedroom. The kitchen came stocked w/ just about everything you could need except for food. The place was perfectly clean and the beds were comfortable too. There was a small desk area for those of us who cannot be w/o our computers. I do recommend bringing an ethernet cable as the wireless router had poor signal strength at times. I purchased an ethernet cable at Wal-Mart and did not have anymore connectivity issues. I never made it to the large pool, but I did use the smaller pool and it was perfect. Another thing I recommend is renting a car for the duration of your stay. It will give you freedom to do what you want when you want. Relying on shuttles to get around will make you miserable as Disney is filled w/ people who do not use their manners. If you do rent a car DO NOT buy the toll pass. The people at the counter will show you a map of all the local toll roads, and you'll think it is a good idea to pay extra for the toll pass. However, the only times I ever went through a toll was leaving the airport and coming back to the airport. For what we spent on the trip I am extremely glad that we did not stay in a Disney Resort. We got more room and saved money (yes, even w/ the rental car) that we were able to spend at the parks. If you are planning on going w/ kid(s) under 6 or 7 I recommend planning a relaxing day in between the Disney Parks. We actually drove to Clearwater beach and it was just what we needed after 2 full days in the Parks w/ a 4 1/2 year old. There is so much to say about our experience and coming back to a wonderful condo each night really helped. Choose wisely where you stay or your trip could be a lot tougher than it should.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy Not To Go There”
Reviews.Author: MUGWUMPS10
Reviews.Content: As I've told everyone I know since I came back from my vacation, this is the very best place I've ever stayed! My family and I reserved a 3-bedroom "suite", and what we got was more of a 3-bedroom - extremely glamorous - apartment. It had a granite kitchen, granite bathrooms (yes, two - 1 in the master (which had a stand-up shower AND a jacuzzi) and 1 to be shared on the otherside of the apartment - 2 sinks in there!) Both had tons of cabinet space, as well. In addition to the master bedroom, the 2 extra rooms had 2 double beds in each, and the living room had a pull-out sofa. Now, THAT's just to describe the PLACE. The PEOPLE there are awesome! Unfortunately, my family and I chose to go the week of Hurricane (Tropical Storm) Faye, and the people there took care of us extremely well. The day it was supposed to hit, we were visited 3 times to make sure we felt safe, check on doors, and to confirm that our vehicle was alright. In addition, while it was a skeleton crew, they DID still offer the cleaning service. What I feel really recommends this place is that, although we were homebound (it definately felt like a home!), we still had an absolutely wonderful vacation! My 77 year-old mother, my husband, and my 7 year-old daughter. This entire age group was not in the least dismayed to be "stuck" in the hotel. Would I go back? YOU BET!!! And if you don't.... you're missing out...

Reviews.Title: “Happy Days”
Reviews.Author: MartyMcfly1985
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks at the Floridays Resort (party of 4). Stayed in a 3-bed condo in Building E (room 609). Prior to arrival, emailed Floridays requesting a high floor, preferably with lake or pool view rather than overlooking any construction. On check-in, the staff advised they had 3 rooms meeting requirements but recommended Building C as closer to the larger pool/reception area. Made our way to room 312 but soon discovered this was overlooking a dirt track & the construction site that is to become Floridays Phase II. Called reception to enquire about another room & was relocated to Building E (room 609). This room was top floor, overlooking both a lake and the smaller pool. Not sure why this wasn’t the first choice? The neighbouring resort to that side of Floridays is now built & isn’t the construction site as appears on some map websites as at time of writing. We were also handed a letter on check-in ‘to clear up any confusion’ regarding the cleaning service. We chose to remain with the basic service – trash emptied daily, beds made/towels replaced every 3 days & a full clean after 7 days. Didn’t have any issues with the service. We were also aware of the resort fee ($5 per day) prior to arrival (advised on Travel City Direct website). The room was clean & very large, especially the bathrooms. The kitchen had every utensil/appliance you could need. The layout of the room was great – never felt that you were under each other’s feet. The safe deposit box is located in the en-suite bathroom cupboard. Minor issues – there was quite a bit of wear & tear, considering the resort is only a couple of years old, and the carpet was in need of a proper clean – they should perhaps go for fully tiled floors, especially with the Mediterranean theme of the resort. The resort was spotless though & the welcome centre, condo buildings & gardens impressive. The smaller pool is much quieter & there is plenty of parking around each building. The location is great – very close to SeaWorld, Aquatica & Disney. Could see Epcot ball & the Magic Kingdom fireworks from the 6th floor corridor. Universal was about 25 mins away & Busch Gardens 1 hour. About 1 minute drive to Publix, 2 minutes to Premium Outlets & a number of gas stations nearby (closest at I-Drive/Vineland). Sanford Airport was just under 1 hour (via 417/528). The resort doesn’t have a two-way intersection onto International Drive so you will have to make u-turns either side of the Floridays entrance, i.e. when driving to SeaWorld or when returning from Disney. Gaps in the central reservation are very close to the entrance though & there are left turn lanes (in both directions) so isn’t an issue if waiting for any traffic to clear. For non-drivers, the I-ride stops right outside the resort (stop 39). This will be a large resort once Phase II is complete. There is a Sales office on site but we were never pestered about buying. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Needed And More”
Reviews.Author: rokinrobyn
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the floridays resort for seven nights and was very satisfied. We have stayed at several all inclusives and hotels in the U.S and the carribbean. The condo was super spacious and had every appliance you would need to make a complete meal. We also loved having a washer and dryer although we only used it once or twice after rainy days at the parks. The pool area is large and clean with plenty of towels and chairs and relaxing feel. The resort is in the middle of all attractions and very close to int. airport. Housekeeping only changes towels makes beds and disposes of trash. If your gonna make a mess be prepared to clean it yourself unless your willing to pay $25 daily for full room cleaning. We didnt need it since we didnt spend much time in the room. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. We didnt experience any type of entertainment at the hotel but they did have a small game room and play room for toddlers. Look for discounts on the web we payed for five nights at got two free.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: runner110
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at Floridays, and thoroughly enjoyed it. We booked a three bedroom condo through Expedia at an excellent rate, instead of staying on Disney property like we have in the past. There were six of us - my wife and I, and four kids, aged 7 through 16, and we had plenty of room. The room was immaculate, and although housekeeping missed us completely one day, every other day they did a great job. It was generally quiet, although we were on the ground floor, and we could hear the people in the bedroom above us walking around and hear the vibrations from their master bedroom jacuzzi. The property is close to all of the resorts and the aiport. We had no complaints, but do have a few cautions. (1) When they say that check-in is at 4:00, they really mean it. We're used to arriving early at Disney and getting our room. Not here. (2) Because of the construction, there is a small sign noting the entrance from International Drive. Even though I had read many warnings on this site about how hard the sign is to miss, we still missed it. (3) Parking can be tough. We were in building F at the back of the property, and if you returned from the parks late (after 10:30), all of the spots in that part of the property were full. These were minor things, though, and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Rave Review From a Finicky Traveler”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyFolks
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed at a managed condo before, we didn't know what to expect, and were wary of booking a stay here. After some research on Travelocity, mainly reading other reviews, and some prodding from the Mrs. we decided to give Floridays a try. It was absolutely great. The rooms were spacious, well-appointed, and clean. With 2 teenagers in tow, it was great to have a private bath in the master bedroom, and the Jacuzzi was a very pleasant surprise. Granite tops on all kitchen and bath surfaces gave the condo a nice upscale feel. There were TVs in both bedrooms and a large flat-screen in the living room. Outside, the grounds are well-kept, with the requisite palm trees and tropical plantings. The pool is large & shapely with some fun water features for kids. The poolside bar and deli was a great convenience for late-evening eats after returning exhausted from Disney or Universal, or a quick quart of milk etc. The resort is nicely situated between Disney and Universal, and a short drive to either. There are shuttles to the parks, but we didn't use them. We rented a car, after reading that Floridays was not within walking distance to much of anything, and were glad we did. In baseball terms, we would call Floridays a Home Run, and would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at Floridays Resort”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelmore
Reviews.Content: After doing research on TripAdvisor for the Orlando area, we decided to give this resort a try. I was able to get an excellent rate through AAA, it was the same price as a regular hotel room at Marriott. We arrived early and it was well before their 4:00 check in. They took my cell number and called about 1:30 to say it was ready. We stayed in building C, room 406. The minute we walked through the door, we were impressed with the size and layout of this two bedroom, two bathroom condo. It was very clean, had a full kitchen, a washer and dryer. From our balcony we had pond with fountain, surrounded by lovely landscaping and we could see the pool surrounded by palm trees. The location was perfect (we rented a car), there was a Publix grocery store right around the corner, since we had a full kitchen with everything you could possibly need, we only ate one meal out the entire time we were in Orlando. SeaWorld and Aquatica was only 10 minutes away, Universal Studios was about 20 minutes. The traffic was never bad which surprised me since there are so many amusement parks in that area. Housekeeping came around 2:00 every afternoon with fresh towels and toiletries (no need to bring shampoo, conditioner, soap or body wash). We had already purchased all of our theme park tickets on line, but I did see a desk dedicated to ticket sales / information right across the check in desk at the lobby. I also saw the I-Line bus stop right in front of the resort. They also have a business computer area to the left side of the check in desk. I was also able to mail postcards from the front desk. Everyone was always very polite and friendly. The night before we checked out, I received a phone call from the front desk thanking us for our visit and they asked if we needed any assistance with our bags, a wake up call or anything else. I was really impressed with that type of customer service follow up. I could easily picture living full time in one of their condos, we will definitely be back on future trips to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Expierence”
Reviews.Author: Soph34s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays Resort for ten nites, although it was as seems from the web site I too have to agree on the house keeping issue, our sheets were changed twice and fresh towels everyday (they had no chose we used them all) but nothing else. Although we kept our end and made their jobs easier yet still they did nothing else. Although I can honestly say that yes I would return, everything else was great!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Floridays Resort”
Reviews.Author: Panagioti1
Reviews.Content: I had booked a 2 bedroom & when I arrived I was surprised that I was upgraded to a 3 bedroom at no charge. The staff service were very friendly & helpful!! I was very impressed with the condo. They are better than a 5 star hotel & I have stayed in many of them!!! There was even a mini cafe to buy anything you may need like milk for my baby, which was so convenient!! I would definetly recommend this resort & look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Floridays”
Reviews.Author: Miamilights
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 days and 4 nights at this resort. We had a big group of 6 adults and 2 kids. We had a great time. The apartment was beautiful. It had all the things you would use at home. The beds were super comfy and the bathrooms were really nice. We spent alot of time at the main pool which is great for kids big and small. The bar area was also nice, although some of the drinks were a bit overpriced. They have a snack bar and a Starbucks which was very nice. Every employee we encountered was super friendly and willing to accomodate you in any way. I recommend this resort to anyone wanting a relaxing time in a great resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Lots of Room”
Reviews.Author: Picky_Picky111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights while visiting Sea World and Aquatica. Overall, we had a very good experience. The condos do look exactly as on the website photos. The furnishings remind me of a Residence Inn - very nice but definitely not a "luxury" condo. We were upgraded to a three bedroom unit which thrilled my 9 year twins because they had their own rooms and TV. The spaciousness was welcome after staying in a regular hotel room for four nights. Having a washer and dryer was wonderful. The large pool is great and there is an excellent guitar player/singer on the weekends. We had two problems which were resolved quickly - thankfully they have 24 hour maintenance. The first night there was no hot water but it was fixed by 7 am the next morning. The next night the battery in the smoke detector went low and started chirping at 10 p m - it was fixed in 10 minutes. I would not stay here without a car. The I Drive Trolly is near, but really didn't look that convenient to me. We got a good AAA rate on Floridays website. I'd recommend staying here - nice property, good value for the roominess you will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Dissatisfied047
Reviews.Content: The Floridays is a beautiful property with much to offer. It is a perfect place for a family that doesn't want to eat out for every meal. The housekeeping needs a lot of work. We stayed for nine nights and our beds were made three times. Towel changes were comical. Sometimes they would put them away, but most times they were thrown on the stools in the kitchen. Sometimes all of the garbage was removed but most of the time we needed to do it ourselves. You never knew when housekeeping would come to your room, it could be at 10:00 am or 5:00 pm, there was no consistency. We had to ask for toilet paper, garbage bags and towels on more than one occasion. Check in was 4:00 pm and we didn't get our room until 7:00 pm. No compensation was ever offered. I would not recommend this property to anyone until they get there act together. It is the worse housekeeping I have ever seen and there customer service was just as bad.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: charlotte57
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 week stay at Floridays. Spacious and well situated apartments. However cleaned only once, towels changed 3 times and beds made every 3 days which wouldn't be a problem if you were made aware of this beforehand. Vacuum cleaner and dryer provided, in fact we were advised to dry our wet towels in the dryer provided if we wanted towels dry - we did this and vacuumed. However as someone who does housework the other 50 weeks of the year I had wanted to holiday without having to do additional housework. After 1 week it was explained that the apartment was to be cleaned once, towels, beds changed and trash removed every 3 days, this would appear not to be standard policy as reviews vary. Pleasant stay in Florida and you could say that it was home from home.

Reviews.Title: “"Mind Your Belongings"”
Reviews.Author: niamhtexas
Reviews.Content: I agree with one of the previous reviewers. Don't let housekeeping in your room while you are out. We are very security aware and always lock our belonging away. We were delighted to have a safe in the room ...however one morning my daughter left her ring on the side of the sink. We left the room only to discover 10 mins later she had not put her ring back on. Unfortunaltely we didn't return untill late that night to discover the ring was gone. We called housekeeping and had to leave a voice mail..Nobody called me back and I had to call again the next morning. Eventually we discovered the only other person that entered the room that day was housekeeping. We were told by staff they trusted this person and could they at least offer us breakfast to make up for our upset.....We reported the missing ring to the police. They were very prompt in coming to the hotel. Be aware and lock up everything. The resort was close to what we needed but starting to show alot of wear and tear for a new resort. Our washing machine kept cutting out the electrictiy. Not the cleanest place I have ever been. we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Spot for Disney”
Reviews.Author: ljkaine
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at this resort. The first time was in Oct 07. Both times we used it as our home base for Disney. Once we stayed in a 3 bedroom unit and the second time in a 2 bedroom. It was a very convenient location. It was a ten minute drive to the park and we had purchased the AAA diamond pass so we could park closer. The grocery store is 2 minutes away as well as a small shopping plaza. It's not fancy but it has a nice pool with a splash area for the children. It was comfortable and since we were only there in the evenings it was a good price and close to Sea World and Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort but Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Rachel1014
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Floridays and the condos were very nice. We felt very comfortable in the 3 bedroom condo but the overall service was not very good. We had to call the front desk frequently in order to get towels and it took on average 2 to 3 calls to get someone to show up. There is a lot of construction around the resort which makes it a bit unappealing when you first arrive. Overall we enjoyed the pools and the rooms were very nice. Don't expect good service as it appears the resort is very understaffed.

Reviews.Title: “Good condo if you're looking for a lot of room.”
Reviews.Author: ltess
Reviews.Content: Floridays is a great place for a group of people/families to stay together. The Condos are huge! We had a 3 bedroom and were pleased with the room it offered. However, I had to call down to have the kitchen swept and mopped upon arrival. The front desk was very helpful, but it took ages for any request such as an iron and baking sheet to be delivered to the room. We were shocked to learn they only make the beds, empty the trash, and give new towels. There is an extra charge for the maids to clean the room or change the sheets. Beware...The pool is MUCH smaller than the pictures. And there is a lot of construction around the resort. We had a nice time but will look for a more entertaining resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Floridays”
Reviews.Author: TNGuest
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Floridays in Orlando Florida. We truly enjoyed our vacation with you. We were welcomed by a very knowledgeable and friendly staff. We were asked many times by staff and management if we needed any additional assistance. Our accomodations were immaculate with clean linens, clean dishes, clean towels, and met all of the reviews we read about on the net advertisements. . I really enjoyed my stay with you and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place”
Reviews.Author: coptercfi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Floridays and we had an outstanding time at the resort. Rooms were very spacious and comfortable. Staff was friendly and accommodating to any of our requests without any problems. Loved the pool-easy access to the towels which do not run out and their is a nice little cafe/restaurant right there that makes it easy to get a snack/sandwich/drink if needed. Pool area has plenty of chairs/tables and shaded areas if needed. We have a 3 year old son which loved the pool. There was a wide variety of ages playing so anyone with children will be pleased. I could have just stayed and relaxed there at the resort instead of all the parks as it is a very relaxing and nice atmosphere. Recommend to anyone for sure---we are heading back in August.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays- great property!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShawnHall
Reviews.Content: This property is a fantastic!. Everything about our weekend stay at the property was great. The rooms have a comfortable, spacious lay-out and the pool is built for both adults and children. A poolside bar, a cafe/store, and a game room (for kids) served all the needs of my family for the entire day we spent at the pool. I would also like to compliment the house-keeping staff for the cleanliness of the rooms and their very friendly and helpful attitude. Floridays will see us again and I would highly recomend it to anyone as one of the best places in Orlando to stay!

Reviews.Title: “gooood times”
Reviews.Author: fdny247
Reviews.Content: now, ive stayed @ alot of resorts in my days, but i gotta say the floridays resort did it for me. cant lie, the bartenders by the pool are legit (Cristina!!) shes a fox AND knows how to make a good drink. i worked on my international relations @ your pool bar as well... have to admit it was the first time i had an englishmen and an irishman buy me a drink in the same night...all in all it was great.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: moll068
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays from 28th June to 12th July. We had a 2 bed apartment for myself, my husband and 3 kids. The apartment was spotless with plenty of room with every thing you needed washer/dryer, dishwasher, etc. The housekeeping couldn't have been better with fresh towels left every day, beds made, and garbage emptied. We did not hire a car and used the Shuttle service from the hotel to Disney and Universal, which we found great, there were a choice of 3 morning shuttles to disney and 2 to universal, you need to book these a few days in advance as they get booked up quickly. The Publix was a 1 min walk and one stop on the I Ride. It was so easy to get the I ride from outside the gate which we used to get to Seaworld, Wet n Wild, or just to go into International Drive some evenings for dinner. One of the large outlets is only 2 stops away also. A day pass on I ride cost only $3 and it is valid until midnight the following day, kids are free. The kids loved the pool which was never too crowded. On the day of our departure we were allowed to stay in our room until 1.30 at no extra charge as our flight wasn't until the evening. It was very quiet and suited to families with children . If you are single and want to be in the middle of the nightlife and bars it is at the quieter end of international drive, so you would need to get a taxi back late at night, but for families it is ideal..I would definately go back to stay at Floridays. We found it clean, comfortable, ideally located, great pool and friendly, helpful staff. Mary Wicklow

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room!”
Reviews.Author: mmquin2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice for our vacation. For two adults and two teenagers, it was a great amount of space! It had plenty of TVs, so no one had to fight over what to watch. Having a full kitchen was great for saving money on breakfast and for eating leftovers. It is not far from any of the parks and there is a grocery store down the street. If you stay here, I highly recommend Thai Thani as a good place for dinner - best Thai food I have had! If you stay here, I would not rely on the hotel shuttle for the parks, they run infrequently.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: abbyLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in floridays resort for 7 nights in April. Loved it very convenient to all parks shuttles included to all parks which is excellent. Publix about 10 minute walk premium outlets 15 minute walk. Trolley stop outside resort which is useful to get around all International drive. Great facilties washer,dryer oven dishes etc. Massive fridge freezer compartment. Loved jacuzzi and spacey rooms. Would highly recommend and when I return to florida will definetly stay in this resort. good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: F1ireball
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 14 night stay 7th July 2008 .What can I say ,accomodation over exceeded my expectations ,I shared a 3 bedroom condo with 3 other adults and 2 children and there was plenty of space.I was a little worried before the holiday that everyone would be under each others feet due to the size but this wasn't the case. 5 mins from Sea World and WDR & international drive.Rooms very clean and staff very friendly.Food from the cafe was very good and value for money ,kids loved the swimmimg pools ,some nights in till about 10 pm .Only one observation but only a grumble ,we felt that they could have changed the towels more often although all we needed to do was call reception and they delivered clean towels immediately. Inrernet service excellent although remember to take a connecting cable ,no wireless in the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice stay- beautiful and close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: clphelps
Reviews.Content: The suites are very nice. We had a wonderful stay- lots of room- ice cold AC and great amenities. I would stay here again in once second. Publix is right around the corner as well as Walgreens and Outback. Really easy drive to Disney- one big L- shaped drive. 6 to 8 miles depending on the park. Free internet- which was nice. Absolutely no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: Seawind66
Reviews.Content: Can't wait to return. Already recommended to others. Floriday's has the market on Orlando suite properties with an affordable rate, great location, high class amenities, friendly staff, etc., etc. We stayed for 6 nights with two kids and loved having separate bedrooms and bathrooms. The jacuzzi tub was a big plus as well as the huge master bathroom. The kids enjoyed the hotel pool with the sprinklers.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: bmacma
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 17 night stay in Floridays resort, Orlando. My wife and I were there for our honeymoon and we couldn't have been happier with the hotel. We had a two bedroom apartment with a view of the lake. The hotel had everything we needed; the room was huge, the staff were helpful and pool was never too busy. Location was very central to all the major attractions but you do need to rent a car in my opinion. The only slight drawback was that it wasn't very close to any bars/nightlife so you needed to drive or get taxi's for dinner/drinks. Overall though a really nice place to stay. Brian

Reviews.Title: “Loved Floridays”
Reviews.Author: davisito45
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a two-bedroom condo at the Floridays Resort and loved it. The kitchen was a good size and the decorations were up to date. The bedrooms were big and the living room was adequate especially with the plasma tv and small but nice patio. It was nice to have a bar, small grocery store, and cafe/grill on site. I would definitely recommend driving or walking to the Publix grocery store down the street. Also, if you are going in the summer do purchase some ponchos (due to rain) at the Publix $3.99 instead of paying $9.99 at Disneyworld. This resort met and exceeded all of my expectations in a resort. It is not a five star resort but a family friendly place to enjoy your vacation in a clean and comfortable environment.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: enjnir
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights during June and it was wonderful. We were in Orlando to visit Discovery Cove and we could not have picked a better place. Discovery Cove is only a short distance away. The room was exactly as the website indicated and was clean. The staff was extremly friendly and check in and out went very smooth. The have a very large swimming pool, and activities for kids around the pool during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Floridays!”
Reviews.Author: MsTee01
Reviews.Content: Okay, this may be a little long, but... We had an excellent stay at Floriday's Resort. I was not sure about the resort because most resort websites will show you the best images and amenities and blah, blah. So I checked with TripAdvisor for unbiased reviews. The reports were good so we booked. For 7 days, it was my husband and our two children. We reserved a 3 bedroom that was fully equipped (except for lacking a spatula!) - washer, dryer, dishwasher, microwave, full kitchen, nicely decorated, flat-screen tv in living room and large tv in each bedroom. Our room view was excellent as we were able to see most of the property on that side - the fountain, the 2nd pool and wonderful sunlight! We were plesantly surprised by the comfort that we felt there. There was a small game room for the kids, playroom for the little kids, cafe/bar for the adults and free wireless access. You would never know they were doing construction - the only noise we heard was the lawn mower. Only some minor fixes in maintenance and this place can easily upgrade it's star status. (i.e., elevator was missing a number and the one of the rolls to hold the tissue was loose). We had our theme park tickets and a rented car so we didn't use the shuttle or ticket services. The housekeeping service was very nice - although the few we ran into didn't speak very good English. They checked the rooms daily and although we did not need full services, they fixed the beds, provided basics like garbage bags, paper towels, etc. The hotel sits on International Drive and it is close to everything. We loved it and you will too. It's my new favorite place with vacationing on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “We Will Always Love U!”
Reviews.Author: oysteingilje
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great hotel for 2 weeks, and loved it. The apartments are very comfortable and luxurious. The pool area is very good. We loved the location. Not far from disney world and close to sea world. We would definetly go back...

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: jennifer1307
Reviews.Content: I just spent two days at the Floridays Orlando, and wish I had stayed more. The two-bedrrom suite was beautiful and spacious, The kids loved having their own room and our master bathroom was decked out with a jacuzzi tub. The kitchen supplies were adequate, a few baking pans would be nice. Some reveiws have mentioned that there was no coffee maker, but we had one and two large packs of ground Starbucks coffee as well. Washer and Dryer in the unit, a blender, a toaster...really all the essentials! They are still doing construction, and we did face the barren land, but we heard no noise. We never even made it to the smaller pool, the large pool was fantastic. Great for small kids. Plus the live music and bar next to the pool made it great for adults. The arcade room could be improved, pretty small. But our son loved it. The shuttles to the parks stink. They don't depart very often and can only hold a few guests. We didn't even bother. If you don't rent a car, you'll be stuck with pretty inconvenient times, call before you book to check the times. Friendly staff, well maintained, and a great bargain. Will certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort- Perfect place for a couple or family”
Reviews.Author: joemelendez2587
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in Floriday's for 6 days, and we would both agree besides Disney and sea world, Floriday's single handedly saved our vacation. The room was huge, which included everything we needed and more, such as a kitchen, refrigerator, and washer and dryer. The jacuzzi and shower was great because of its design. We also enjoyed the flat screen 40 inch TV. The staff was great and the cleaning service was superb. The only issue we had was in one room, the TV did not work. Which really wasnt a problem. Also the patio has a great view but unfortunately there was too many bugs for us to enjoy it. If you are looking to come back from DISNEY or SEAWORLD or any other attraction to a great resort, i would recommend floriday's, because it is more then just a room, it is home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Resort”
Reviews.Author: KC_travels08
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a family of four, including two teenagers, I picked this resort based upon TripAdvisor reviews and the price. We were not disappointed! The property is new, well maintained and located in a very convenient area between Seaworld and the Premium Outlet stores on South International Drive. There are lots or restaurants within a few miles and you're relatively close to all the attractions as well. We reserved a 2-bedroom suite and were greeted at the front desk by a young man named John who had a great personality. When we entered our suite, we knew we had made the right decision. The units were exactly as pictured with nice amenties and very clean. During our one week stay, housekeeping service was prompt, efficient and courteous. We had ample towels and toiletries. Beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows. Three TVs (one large screen plasma) with lots of cable channels and a DVD player let everyone watch whatever they wanted whenever they wanted. We also had free wired high-speed internet service. However, there wasn't an Ethernet cable in the room and we did not have one with us. When we called the resort office they pleasantly provided us a cable (they charged an $8 deposit that was refunded upon check-out without any problems when the cable was returned.) If there was anything to rate lower than 5-stars in the room, it was the sofa and coffee table that were already beginning to show some wear -- however it was nothing major. I would have also liked wireless internet access. In addition to the accomodations, the resort had 2 beautiful pools with towels available (at the larger pool.) You could also purchase a cocktail at the bar, snacks at the deli and essentials at the convenience shop. However, we chose not to do so because of the plentiful number of stores nearby from which to choose that had better values -- including Publix and Walgreens. We would have used the Business Center at the resort to do some business, but pricing for internet usage/printing/faxing was very high --- the only disappointment about the property. Overall, this is a very nice resort. You will be very pleased. I highly recommend it for families of all ages and sizes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Floridays”
Reviews.Author: BevyNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at Floridays Resort.We spent 9 days here with our son,daughter-in-law and 2 grandkids.We had a 3 bedroom condo.The rooms were very clean and spacious.The condo was equipped with everything including the washer and dryer.Towels were changed and bathroom cleaned daily.The patio was very relaxing especially at night watching the water fountain.The staff as well as housekeeping were very friendly and helpful.The pool area was very nice.The grandkids loved the spray fountains and the sandy beach.The hot tub was so nice also.There is another pool and hot tub away from the main pool that is nice and quiet.The grounds are kept very clean.It is close to the theme parks.It is a very nice resort for a family with children.We highly recommend Floridays Resort to everyone.We sure will be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Resort”
Reviews.Author: sushiking
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the two bedroom suite. Overall very nice accomodations! Some of the doors in the suite need some WD-40, they squeeked really loud anytime you opened and closed them. The shuttle service to the Disney Parks needs improving. Need more return times, currently you are stuck with either 6:15pm or 9:45pm return times to the resort. You completely miss the 10pm fireworks show at Magic Kingdom with these pick-up times. Also, the fitness center needs to be larger with better equipment. For a resort this large, I expected better. Overall, Floridays is a pretty decent resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but hard mattress”
Reviews.Author: vmsjacksonville
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays resort in Orlando the first of June for 4 nights. It is a very beautiful resort, the area is still building so there is construction nearby. The resort is on south International drive away from all the traffic and headaches of the "main strip". The resort is close to all the Orlando attractions and having a fully equipped kitchen saved us money on food, not to mention being able to get up in the middle of the night for a snack. :) There are two pools. The main pool is large and has several waterfall areas for the children. There is also a smaller pool that is less crowded. There is a couple of negatives for me. One being the king size bed in the master bedroom. The mattress was very hard and the pillows were small and hard also. Also the "Starbucks" in the resort didn't know how to make even the basic specialty drinks. As for me, I would probably not go back as the mattress cost me several night sleep

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Lovely, Clean and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Baba_L08
Reviews.Content: Just got back today from Floridays and I'm SAD to be home! The only word that comes to mind is, WOW! I really cannot think of ONE thing bad to say about this place. The suite was clean, modern, had all the amenities of home that you could think of. Every kind of store was 5 minutes away, e.g. grocery stores, drug stores, department stores, you name it they had it. Most major theme parks were near by, uh..... I'm sitting here thinking about it, and we had absolutely everything you could desire within and outside the suite. The staff was awesome. I read a few reviews for months before the trip to Fl., and read where some people thought the staff were rude or stuck up? Not true, at least in my opinion. Everyone we dealt with were nice and helpful and professional. If anyone decides to go to Floridays, and plan on just being in the Orlando area, there are shuttles and buses to and from... and don't forget the I-ride trolleys, which go everywhere! You don't even need to rent a car if you plan on staying on/within the I-Drive area. If you rent a car, and like play games of chance, you can take an easy 65 mile to Tampa and visit the Hard Rock Casino and Hotel. It couldn't be easier to get there and back to the Floridays Suites (Thanks so much to Mr. E. Otero ( : for directions and help)! I recommend the 1$ Video Poker machines. I don't know what else I can say to convince anyone to stay at this lovely resort. It's modern, clean and the price is right. I'm already thinking about another trip there in the future. Although the suites are alike, they are comfortable, cool and clean. The website pictures are right on point, but it's much better in person. If you plan on driving around Florida, I recommend a GPS unit. It already paid for itself after this trip. I stumbled upon this very nice resort, and so glad I did!

Reviews.Title: “5 star potential”
Reviews.Author: Fayetteville12
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay a lot and thought the resort was great and that the employees were very friendly. The room met our needs perfectly. It was very convenient to Disney and SeaWorld as well as restaurants and the grocery store. We also never heard any construnction noise, which had been a concern based on other reviews on line. We also appreciated that there was no hard sell to buy a timeshare...they simply told us if we were interested to fill out a postcard and return it to the front desk. We would have given it an excellent rating if a few items were better maintained. There was mildew in one of the showers. By the end of the day there were towels everywhere at the pool that should have been picked up. Also, clean the pool throughout the day...there was mulch and debris in it the first night we got there, while in the mornings it was clean. They need to add frying pan and baking sheet to the cookware supplied in the room. It's hard to make breakfast with pots. We are looking forward to the coming addition of the water park, shops and spa, and plan to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous secret”
Reviews.Author: scbleo
Reviews.Content: This is a modern, clean, accomodating resort. Six buildings each have six stories, with u-shaped terraces that are centered by a cobblestone walkway take you to the elevators. The whole place is either 2 or 3 bedroom condos, with complete kitchens, 2 bathrooms, dining table, computer/bar station, living room with sleeper sofa, washer/dryer combo closet, and balcony. The kitchens and bathrooms are modern and the master bath has a jaguzzi. The place is spotlessly clean and decorations are soothing tuscan colors. The condos are privately owned and are well maintained.
