A family can easily pick up the groceries at the Publix next door, stop at the Walgreens, shop at the prime designer mall around the block, hit any of the amusement parks, or simply order delivery and hang by one of the two resort pools. There's a small video gameroom, playroom for small kids, a pool bar and a Starbucks on the property. There is a 24-hr front desk staff to answer any questions you may have. The property is big enough that you feel like you are living in an apartment complex, and yet you are only steps from your car or the entrance to your room. Well-lite parking lot too, with lots of available spots, makes it another attractive feature. This is a great Orlando secret. I have come here with my teenagers, my mom, or just the four of us. What a great place that is centrally located in the peaceful and newly developed International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for saving our vacation”
Reviews.Author: spyderman99
Reviews.Content: We originally booked at another hotel and checked out after only one rough night. We booked at the Floridays based on the reviews here even though we knew nothing about the facility. When we arrived we immediately knew we had made the right decision. The front desk staff was pleasant, professional and helpful. The pool is great, to quote my 7 year old, "The pool rocks". We stayed in a two bedroom suite in tower B right behind the pool. Room was wonderful, quite, clean and comfortable. Publix and Walgreens is less than one mile away and you can get Starbucks in the cafe not to mention it is only one exit from Disney. Overall we had a fantastic stay and definately will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money...”
Reviews.Author: lisandbri
Reviews.Content: Great 2 bedroom suite with king in master and 2 doubles in 2nd bedroom. Exceptionally clean and smelled fresh. Fully equipped kitchen with toaster, pots & pans, dishes and silverware, etc. Ice machine in fridge and great eat-in bar AND dining room table. Nice LARGE whirlpool in master bathroom where you can watch TV from the tub. Oh yeah...I loved it. Nice pool for kids and small 3 1/2' wading pool too. Small patio with 2 chairs that was wonderful for sitting and drinking coffee in morning. Only one complaint...we were given a coupon for the Starbucks on site for a buy one, get one free large coffee. We would not have needed to use, except only coffee in suite was decaf which forced us into buying. Great value for the money if you are seeking a nice hotel for a family. Nice place to cool down after a hot day at the theme parks. Must love kids as you can hear them playing in the pool from early to late.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Close to Everything a family would need!!!”
Reviews.Author: 5fromchicago
Reviews.Content: This resort is obviously one of many in the Orlando area. We chose it because of all the great reviews. I will not repeat what everyone else has already said because it is all so true. HIGHLIGHTS: 1. Grocery store is 2 minutes away 2. Great, clean pool area 3. Room is EXACTLY like pictures 4. Plenty of utensils, cooking needs for family meals 5. Nice little diner/bar by pool 6. Staff was all super nice 7. Disney is less than 15 minutes (door to door) 8. Clean (really clean) rooms and common areas 9. Not so much to do that kids are overstimulated, still have energy for the parks 10. Can bring food/drinks to pool area Everyone complained about the construction noise. It did not bother us at all. We went to Orlando to go to the parks not sleep all day so we never even saw or heard one noise due to construction. As far as the entrance being difficult to find.. I have no idea what that is about we found it in the dark no problem. I very rarely return to a resort due to the fact I like a new experience when I travel but I can honestly say, due to the cleanliness and convienence of this resort I will probably return. I have no issues with this resort at all (and I am pretty picky). I would reccomend people to pack a ziploc bag a laundry soap and plan on buying dish soap as they only give you a sample size. Other than that, everything we needed was there for us. Perfect size 2 bedroom for a family of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pryveteye27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. Check in/out was fast. No lines and friendly staff. Had a first floor room which I wasn't to thrilled about at first, but ended up loving it!!! We were able to feed the ducks right from our balcony which made my 3 year old very happy. The rooms were clean and well stocked. Had a very small AC issue which was tended to ASAP with a follow-up from the front desk. As for location.....it was great. Near EVERYTHING. Great for families. The pool was pristine. I didn't even see one bug floating in it at night!! Pool area was immaculate. I will definitely be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Stay”
Reviews.Author: regis1809
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our vacation. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. Everybody was so helpful and pleasant. Great service. The first day we didn't go to any parks we enjoyed the pool and the bar. The rest of the days we came back so tired but the kids went every night to the pool until 11PM. We were 12 people and had a 2 bedroom and a 3 bedroom. It was plenty of space. Everybody was so friendly. On Friday nights they have free food, live music and Margaritas. I researched for a couple days for the park ticket's and waited to get them there from the concierge. We really got a good deal. I really enjoyed staying at the Floriday's Resort. Thank you everybody for all your help and kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and location for price !”
Reviews.Author: miraNyc
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an 8 day stay at Floriday's (5/5 to 5/12) and highly recommend it, particularly for families with small children like us.First, the price was amazing - American Express had a special for 5+ days ($125 a night for 2 bedroom apt). Second, service and facilities are very good. Third, location is close to all attractions. We would definitely stay there again. The aprts were big - at least by NYC standards :). We had 3 adults and 2 toddlers and the 2 bedroom suite was perfect for us - plenty of room for everyone to run around. Having a kitchen and 2 baths make it much easier - give kids baths, prepare quick (and much cheaper) breakfast or lunch vs going to restaraunts. Everything we needed was stocked in the kitchen (pots, pans, utensils, tupperware). Toiletries were provided (Crabtree & Evelyn). Towels are changed daily, garbage cans emptied, and beds made. They do not clean unless you order the service. However, we asked for a vacuum and they brought one up immediately . Everything was very clean when we got there. The staff at the front desk as well as housekeeping were very friendly and helpful every time we interarcted with them. Check in and check out was fast and easy. I asked for a room close to the kids pool area when we checked in and we got 5th floor in building A. Perfect for us - maybe 30 feet from pool/reception, but away from all the noise of the pool. Our room faced the parking lot and I Drive. Couldn't hear anything outside the whole week - no traffic or construction. I would imagine the apts facing the pool would get much more noise. The pool is really large, with a section for kids with watear works and a slow grade into the water rather than steps. There is also a 2nd smaller deeper pool next to it. Towels were always available as were lounge chairs. My kids LOVED the pool waterworks. There is also a small game room with a couple of video games, air hockey, and abasketball, and a little car ride for toddlers. It was cute, the 2 and 4 year old liked it. There is a little market / cafe on site which I thought was awful. didn't have much, food was $, and not that great. I waited 30 min for a chicken ceaser salad. But, there is a Publix and Walgreens w/in walking distance so we just stocked up there. Its a great location - 10 min to disney parking lot, 5 min to Sea World, close to all malls, restaraunt, etc. There is also a really nice outlet mall near by with some very high end stores . I trolly stops right by the resort too. I was originally concerned given some of the negative posts here and on the forums, but I have to stay this is a great resort. Definitely worth the $ to stay here. We'll definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great!”
Reviews.Author: Kate043
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great accommodations, Great pool We really enjoyed our stay at the Floridays. SeaWorld is around the corner - Disney's close. The condo was spacious - 2 bdrm, 2 bath, full kitchen, balcony. We were able to relax while there. It was clean and the staff friendly and helpful. We had a small problem with a room service matter - they normally don't do that but my husband tried to arrange a special delivery for Mother's Day. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay except for 1 thing!!!”
Reviews.Author: IrishDave2005
Reviews.Content: Weve just stayed in a 2 bed suite at the Floridays resort. We booked direct with the Resort and good a good package. I had requested twice by email for a Pool View. The resort is easy to find, just get on I-drive and follow it North, go slow and watch for the Floridays sign as there s curently a temporary entrance. On arrival, the check in was very quick, but let I was let down by the manner of the front desk girls. They never smiled, and llooked like they hate thier jobs. I go to Florida twice a year and love nothng better than the america hospitality and Customer Service, but these girls obviously have done the wrong training course. We were given a 2 bed suite in Block D which is very near ther main pool so we were happy until we got to our Suite. It backed onto a car park and the balcony had a wall and not a se through guard to look over so hence the suite was in the dark. I phoned reception and requested a change an a pool view. We got room 407 in block F. This looks over the 2nd pool and lake view. To be honest, this woked out much better for us as we preferred the 2nd ppol, its not as noisy and more relaxed. The main pool is a noisy area, the constant flow of water from the childrens area could be annoyiong if overlooking it. The Suites themsleves are spacious if a little narrow but have all amenities neccessary for a home away from home. The beds and pillows are very comfotable. I had read in reviews that there was building work going on, there is, but we heard nothing. The maids cleaned our bins every day and made our beds and tidied the bathrooms, they did a great job. The cleaning staff in general were very friendly overall which made a huge change to the front desk staff. I used the gym near reception every morning and found it great, never many in it. There is a pool bar and shop, both a very good, great choices and the bar food is lovely and reasonable. We left this morning and again could not understand the stern face of the girl (different girl this time) checking us out, such a let down. But overall, this is a great property in a GREAT location. Turn left onto I -drive and you are in the middle of it all in under 5 mins, turn right and you are at Disney world in under 10 minutes. Enjoy your stay here and yes i would return. Dave.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool - great room!”
Reviews.Author: Lou-and-Pat
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife and our 3 kids (10, 12 & 13) stayed at Floridays for 5 nights - April 17th to 22nd and had the best lodging experience we've had since travelling with children. The staff were excellent and truly helpful. When my wife decided that she wanted to go to a Cuban restaurant, the consierge took the time to find several choices and gave us the pros and cons of each place and made sure we understood the directions to get to the one we chose. The rooms all have wired internet service (included) and when I realized that I forgot to bring my cord, the front desk provided a loaner. The photo of their pool does not do it justice. There is a beach like sand area just off to the side of the pool where a lot of the younger kids (including my youngest)played. They should really put a photo of that on their web site because it really is a nice attraction for the younger kids. The water was perfect temperature and that is a big issue for me because my kids like to spend a lot of time in the water late in the day when we get back from Disney and the other parks. Floridays' location is perfect - it took us 15 minutes to get there from the Airport and it is literally smack dab in the middle of all the attractions that we visited (Sea World, Discovery Cove & Disney). The resort is very new and the rooms are in great shape. Unlike some places we've stayed, Floridays had a true working kitchen and there were more than enough dishes, silverware and related cooking tools for our family of 5. Also, this resort seems to attract the type of people that I like to rub shoulders with - and that's probably the best compliment I could give any resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Floridays Resort !”
Reviews.Author: Mary34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I searched the Internet for a resort/suite hotel in Orlando for our Anniversary. We found Floridays Resort in Orlando that combines designer detail with its beautiful decor and a relaxing haven. The rooms are stocked with complete accessories like home. There is a MarketPlace on property for anything you can imagine to eat and drink and it overlooks the pool with seating outdoors. The exercise room is GREAT and the location could not be handier to the major Attractions and Disney. The experience that I encountered that made this a top notch Resort happened upon my departure. I forgo my cell phone and called the General Manager....he had to drive to a McDonalds a quarter of a mile and get the phone and ship it to me. He was extremely understanding of my problem and assured me that guest satisfaction is priority at the Resort. He was a real angel and that was just icing on the cake for us. I highly recommend this property to anyone staying in Orlando. I would also recommend this for long stays as they have 2 and 3 bedroom suites that are gorgeous. The Managers name is Robert Haywood and I'm sure he will take great care of anyone who stays with them. Mary & Peter

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, spacious, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: benjamin24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on April 22 for one full week. We had 8 people staying at a 3 bedroom condo. It was very spacious and accomodated all of us. It was very clean and new. I loved the view, we had the full lake view and partial swimming pool view(building B). The staff was friendly. The swimming pool looked really nice. It also has a kid's swimming area with spray fountains, etc., plus it has a sand beach area which was great for the kids. They also have a business center next to the front desk and you have to pay a little to use the internet. But you can bring your own laptop ; wireless internet is free by the pool area. Also there is a dvd rental machine so you can rent movies. The living room has a dvd player which was nice. Hotel has a small game room, exercise room, and playroom for the kids, a little market, a bar-- all the rooms were next to the swimming pool. I felt that the hotel was safe because all through the night and day you always see workers on the golf carts going around the complex. Parking was great, there's a lot of space to park . The hotel was close to Publix grocery store, Walgreens, a sushi place, a chinese restaurant and a Subway all in one complex and a 7-eleven across the street. And it's just a 3 minute drive to an outlet mall (coach, burberry, polo & etc..) with a food court. We read other posts about construction noise, but there was no construction going on during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: denisfido
Reviews.Content: The stay was excellent. Although construction is ongoing it is such that it does not disturb a guest. We stayed 8 nights and all were uneventfull (the best type). The 2 bedroom suite was very nice, clean and well appointed. The grounds and location were very good. The bedrooms were totally seperate from each other. Customer care was also very good. I would definetly recommend this condominium/hotel. The pools are contraversial ie:does 4 feet a pool make, I don't think so. However they are a nice place to cool of in. Thanks Floridays and Tripadvisor for a very nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for the Dollar”
Reviews.Author: Onpoint
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays resort for a total of four days. The exterior and grounds of the resort are very nicely kept and clean. Overall the room was clean and in good condition. The Bathroom showers are starting to show some wear and can use some refreshing. Our A/C was not functioning properly and with a call the maintenance staff was on the scene to reset the system without problem. The one down side is that the second bathroom does not have a bathtub so if your staying with another couple who is using the master suite it can be a bit of an inconvience if you are needing to bath a toddler in preperation for an early park departure. I did not hear the noise from the construction that is taking place on the final phase of the resort. If we had to go back to tomorrow I would choose without question to spend another week at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: Cyngal
Reviews.Content: It is a nice place to stay, however we spected more. Our stay was from march 10th to 17th and was a little crowded. The suites are like the photos in their website, nice, roomy and clean. Every room with TV and the living room area with a Plasma. The kitchen is very helpfull and we had breakfast and some snacks at the evening. I read great reviews but got a little dissapointed. The staff was not nice and we had a missunderstanding with our operator about the form of payment. We wanted to pay with Diners Club and they DO NOT accept Diners, so our keys were blocked and we couldn´t get in to our suite !!!!! We went to the reception desk and we found out (the fourth day of our stay) that Diners is NOT ACCEPTED, so we were forced to pay in that moment for the stay or gave them another credit card. It was very late at nigth and our children were tired of our very busy day at Disney....Like a favour to us they activated the keys but with the promise to return in the early hours with money or other form of payment. They were very rude ! We are from Ecuador, so our credit cards are limited and we did some shopping in Miami before got to Orlando. We had to do some cash advance and PAYED the whole stay next morning. PROS: - Well located, near the parks and restaurants - The Publix around the corner and the Walgreens 24 hrs CONTRAS: - The staff very rude and zero customer service - The pool area very crowded

Reviews.Title: “Fanatstic Resort and location”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowgal21
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 11 night stay at Floridays, we had a three bedroomed apartment which was fantastic. The maid service was very good. I agree with an earlier post that there was a member of reception staff who was not very customer friendly but it did not spoil the holiday. The concierge Aixa was extremely helpful and helped point us in the right direction. The location of Floridays is great, so handy for all parks and the I trolley, i would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite place”
Reviews.Author: jfelizondo
Reviews.Content: After spending many vacations cramped in a hotel room (or spending megabucks to stay in a suite) we stayed in a 2 bedroom deluxe suite at this resort and we have now been spoiled. It was very affordable and we had so much room; felt like staying in the vacation home that we wanted to buy but couldn't afford to. This resort is one of many new condo rentals that have become available in the Orlando area, located on south International Drive about 2 mile south of Sea World, it is just far enough out of the way that you don't get traffic and close enough that you can get anywhere you want to go with a 15 minute drive. The resort has two pools (one with a pool bar/restaurant) and a small convenience store. This complex is a cluster of of building each with 2 and 3 bedroom units and buildings A,B, and maybe C are the closest to the pool with the bar. If you stay in D or the others then prepare for a hike to get to the main desk and restaurant . Each unit has free internet access but it had variable connectivity and you need a cable. In the pool area there is free WiFi and I thought the connection was just right (got work done while lounged in the shade by the pool while my wife sunbathed. The resort attempts to entertain by offering activities (karaoke, a pool party, etc.) and they succeed. The staff is pleasant and laid back, this is not a pretentious place- it is designed for families that are trying to have a good time while keeping an eye on the budget. My wife and I have been staying at the Hyatt Grand Cypress for many years now we have an alternative place to stay- The Floridays is great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Netsgt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at your resort for 4 days and cannot say enough about it. The condos are lovely. The pools clean and close to the buildings. All the Orlando attractions are closeby. We enjoyed sitting on our balcony in the cool breeze watching people come and go. The staff was excellant. The gentleman at the front desk was incredibly helpful and the housekeeping staff was in and out everyday quickly. They make your bed and remove your trash everyday unlike some condos and cabins we have stayed in before. I couldn't believe how they waited on us. We are already planning a stay in October and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear!”
Reviews.Author: lissybubs
Reviews.Content: Gosh I can't believe I'm writing a review which goes against virtually everyone else's! We experienced terrible trouble with Floridays house-keeping. What we found lurking just under bedskirt of our beds is almost too horrible to print (old smelly socks, empty coke cans, toe nail clippings and the clippers, false nails...the list goes on). To be fair, you couldn't see these things as the bedshirt was hiding them - we happened to find them whilst on our hands and knees ooking under the bed for something we had lost. Also, night one my daughter complained that her bed felt "sandy" and when we checked the covers it would appear that the bed hadn't been changed??!! YUK! Most of the plates and cutlery put away were dirty and we found stale moldy bread in one cupboard. When reported to House-Keeping they were surprised and looked at us as though we were mad! However, they offered to do a complimentary "full-clean" for us the following day but guess what...the above mentioned items were still under the bed! Sorry to say but it really put me off the whole resort. The guess the message is...always look under your bedskirt if you want to know how good the cleaning is!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star whenyou consider the details”
Reviews.Author: jazzyerick
Reviews.Content: Floridays Resort Orlando is certainly a beautiful facility. The suites are spacious, the pool area is gorgeous and the grounds are kept clean. In fact, this was actually my second time staying there. Although they certainly earn their 4-5 star rating when considering only the facility, they fall very short when you consider the details. What I’m going to list are small things. However, there are many of them and they tend to add up. Although my 2 BR suite had a beautiful view of a lake with a waterfall, each day when I approached my suite from the outside I was greeted with housekeeping carts complete with dirty brooms, cleaning chemicals and rags. Although this is certainly acceptable during the housekeeping cycle, they left that stuff out even after they were done. I saw carts out at midnight. Additionally, there was a room across from the entrance to my suite labeled “trash room”. That would not have been a problem except that they left the door open everyday. So each time that I opened my door, I saw an unsightly trash room, which was clearly not designed for customers to see. I personally closed it several times only to see it open again shortly after. I would imagine that their policy is to hide that kind of stuff. But, the mgmt team certainly isn’t checking behind the cleaning crew. The suite kitchen provided all the needed appliances including a very efficient washer/dryer setup. However, the kitchen was equipped without non-stick cookware. Now, I know this sounds very petty, but we found it impossible to cook with their cookware. We wanted to do breakfast each day in the suite. However, everything stuck and burned on that cheap cookware. In fact, it was so bad that I had to go to a nearby Publix store and buy a non-stick frying pan just to survive. You have to go out of your way to find cookware that doesn’t have the nonstick coating, but they found it. It’s clear to me that the people who purchased the cookware for the suites have never actually cooked on it. I would have preferred to pay an extra couple of bucks per night for access to cookware that I can actually use. The site sports a so called “business center”. Since I didn’t bring a printer for my laptop, I went into the business center to print out several important, time sensitive documents. After going through an elaborate system of purchasing time via a special, overpriced, key card system, I attempted to print my documents but the printer was out of ink. I immediately called over a manager and he indicated that “the business center is not ours” (it’s outsourced) “therefore, we don’t have printer ink”. He said it as though it was okay that I was not getting what I needed because it wasn’t “theirs”. Their strategy around who runs the business center should be transparent to me. The fact is that I’m a guest, you are marketing a service, I paid for it, it’s not working, and you can’t fix it. I had to leave the hotel and find a Kinko’s store to get my work done. I was beyond angry and still await the 4+ bucks that I paid for the bad printouts (.75 per page)! Finally, as I checked out the hotel, I approached the desk to hand over my key. Instead of the clerk greeting me with a smile as asking me about my stay, she instead sarcastically looked at me and said, “check out time was an hour ago”. Taken aback I said, “so what are you ultimately saying to me?” She says, “I could charge you, but I won’t”. I immediately asked for a survey form and recorded her name. She snapped back with, “this isn’t my real name tag. So, you may want to make sure you get the name right” and provided me with a different name. I was horrified to see that I hotel like that would allow some young kid, who clearly doesn’t understand customer satisfaction, leave their guests with that kind of image. Young clerks are often too immature to know to think before they open their fat mouths. The result is this fairly bad review on the Internet for the world to see. Much of what I’ve outlined is what I think is just bad management. Many of the people aren’t properly trained at the “4-5 start hotel level”. However, I must say that the bar staff was great. However, the bar manager (TJ) was often there personally to ensure that things were always topnotch. I’m not really sure if I’d go back a 3rd time. The facility is beautiful and a water park is on the way. However, since there are so many great choices in Orlando, it’s difficult to tolerate anything other than perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: jenlev
Reviews.Content: After much consideration, I booked a 2 bedroom suite at Floridays based on reviews by other travelers. We were really disappointed. The room was extremely dark and the main living area was narrow. The pictures are pretty misleading. The bedrooms and bathrooms were adequate. The service was TERRIBLE, especially the front desk staff whose people skills left much to be desired. The “maid service” was inconsistent – one day, they seemed to pick up and leave in the middle of tidying up our room. The manager was very nice and accommodating when I complained, providing a fruit basket and a complimentary full cleaning service. Still, with all the competition in the area, I would look elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Floridays Resort”
Reviews.Author: mimi1234
Reviews.Content: This resort is wonderful !! The rooms are super clean and decorated beautifully. The staff is excellent. The resort is in a great location. Close to Seaworld, Aquatica and Outlet stores. A shopping center with Publix is right next door. My family has stayed at other resorts and paid much more for just a bedroom. The rooms include a full kitchen, dining area, living room and bedrooms. One bedroom has a huge jacuzzi that my daughter loved. My children also had a wonderful time in the pool area. The cafe has a Starbucks. We will be staying here many more times !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for everyone1”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoPlanningmom
Reviews.Content: The Floridays was a great place for our vacation. We had a 2BR, 2BA suite that includes a spacious kitchen, living and dining room as well as washer/dryer in the room. The kitchen was well equipped...we made breakfast in the room every morning, as well as had snacks throughout the day. The space was large enough for our 15 month old who is ready to run all the time! The check-in process was smooth, I asked for a room close to the pool and although they were at full capacity we were able ot stay in Building C, facing a large pond and view of the pool...we couldn't have asked for a better space. The pool is great for kids and families of all ages. There were always a lot of people there, but still plenty of room and chairs available. The on-site restaurant offered a great selection and reasonable prices for a resort...$4.95 for any kids meal, includes fries, applesauce and a drink. $8.00 for a hamburger and fries... Utilize the conceierge for reservations and general help. They are great. We had no problems with construction noise, and as other reviewers noted the entrance can be a little tricky to see, especially at night. No problem once you get used to it. Publix grocery store as well as Walgreens and the huge outlet mall very close. THe publix really caters to travelers with individual sizes of almost everything. Great stay, would definitely go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: LizOnalaska_WI
Reviews.Content: We had a five-night stay from April 3 - 8, 2008 at the Floridays Resort. The rooms were very spacious and accommodating. We had a two bedroom suite that has one room with a king bed that my husband and I shared and another bedroom with two double beds that my boys shared. The beds were extremely comfortable. We were in building B, which was close to the pool and the main building. The kitchenette had everything we needed (utensils, pans, silverware, glasses, dishsoap, etc) . There is Publix grocery store very near the resort where we were able purchase groceries so that we could cook and prepare sandwiches, etc in our unit, so that was convenient. The room even has a washer and dryer, so I was able to do the laundry before we left, so I didn't have to take home a bunch of dirty clothes! The staff is very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend it to anyone heading to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Expected...And More”
Reviews.Author: dgloo
Reviews.Content: Our original spring break plans included camping for 7 days in Tennessee. After a looooong Wisconsin winter, though, my wife was feeling the urgent need for sunny, warm weather. Two days before our spring break, we changed plans and booked a flight & lodging package through Travelocity that included direct flights from MKE to MCO on Airtran, and lodging at Floridays. I'll admit it: I had low expectations for Floridays. How good could it be if it was reasonably priced during spring break in Orlando... and still available with only 48 hours notice. Well, we loved it. Clean, modern, well-decorated, very spacious, and yes, quiet. The resort is beginning construction on Phase II, to the south, so I suppose there could be some construction noise, but we didn't have any. Great pool, just-as-expected housekeeping, fast & friendly front desk. If there was a negative, it was that Floridays is easy to miss on International Drive because it uses a "temporary" entrance while construction is ongoing. To help you find it: As you are going south on I drive, look for trolley stop no. 39. The driveway is just beyond that sign. Give Floridays a try. I know we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not all its cracked up to be.”
Reviews.Author: mommy6
Reviews.Content: After much consideration, I chose the Floridays resort because of all the glowing reviews and the great deal I got thru the resort directly. My family of six arrived for spring break on march 31 and stayed for seven days. Aware that there would be construction at the property, I requested a quite area since I have a small child that I did not want to see disturbed. I was placed in building F, which is the furthest building in the complex to the main pool area and we overlooked the maintenance building, where we heard noise thru out the day and evening of the staff. Further on the horizon, we had the view of a construction site, exactly what I had asked to be away from. The rooms were quite nice, and very roomy. Everyone had plenty of space, however, I was not thrilled with the cleanliness of the room. I dirty wash cloth was hanging in the shower, the pans in the ovens on burnt crumbs on it, the main tub had hair in it, and to top it all, something had exploded in the microwave that was not cleaned up. I will give management the benefit of the doubt that they would have made up the room again for us, but it was easier for me to clean up myself. The drawers in the bedrooms did not close and the doors would not close as well. Perhaps we got the bum room, but I would not stay here again. Just as a side note, I have stayed at many Orlando resorts, we visit the area four times a year, and I have never written a bad report before. The pool was fun for the little ones, but this resort is over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Get Excited About”
Reviews.Author: bgmeidl
Reviews.Content: We selected the Floridays Resort Orlando out of the countless hotels and resorts in the Orlando area because we thought it looked good in the photos and the price was great. Would we stay there again-no. There were 4 adults and 4 children in our three bedroom suite. I have to say that the pictures are better than the actual rooms. The kitchen, dining, and living room areas are very narrow and not at all spacious. The master bedroom was great as well as the master bathroom but as great as they were does not make up for how disappointing the other bedrooms and bathroom was. We literally had to call not less than three times every other day for towels and once for toilet paper. There is no house cleaning except for making up the beds and having the garbage removed if the staff felt like it. We could only find two pool areas and they were not that great. I would say this hotel is ok for couples staying in the Orlando area that only wants a place to sleep. The poolside bar was a let down as well. When we checked out, we were not asked how our stay was, I think that they were afraid to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pubear
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this resort. We stayed here a year ago and was very pleased with our stay so we decided to return. We were there from March 26 through March 31st. We stayed in Building C on the 6th floor. We came back to this resort because of the location, the quality of the rooms, and the price. The only things I was disappointed in from the last time we stayed here was our condo really show some wear and tear. You could tell where the towel rack was pulled down off of the wall but they did a poor job of repairing it. The walls had black scuff marks on the wall, the artifical plants were damaged, and the back of the remote in the master bedroom was missing. (leaves you wondering how these people live in their own homes). Still I believe this was better than staying at a traditional hotel because you have a all the amenities of home. There is a publix, walgreen, 7-11, Mcdonalds, subway and an Outlet Mall just around the corner. Wendy's and KFC is only a couple of miles up the road. Condo is close to all attractions. Other than what I mentioned the condo is nicely appointed and a lot of room. We stayed in the 2 bedroom Condo this time. We had a great view of the little lake and the pool. I would recommend getting a corner unit becuase when people begin to leave early in the morning for the parks you can hear all the kids running up and down the hallways and in the evenings they left their kids run wild in the hallways again and play on the elevator (no regard for others). As far as the pool. You have to get there early before 9 am to get a lounger or you will have to wait until the afternoon. They allow people to place towels on the lounger then go back to their rooms for a couple of hours before they return poolside.

Reviews.Title: “Resort .... No. Construction Zone ... Yes.”
Reviews.Author: Rose611
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights during Easter Week. Check-in was fine, Eduardo at the front desk was friendly & welcoming. Unfortunately, things went downhill from there. Our room was pretty much was we expected for a 2-bedroom suite, it appeared clean. But, the room location was terrible. We were in Building A which overlooked busy International Drive & we were subjected to a busy highway view & construction NOISE. This facility is huge & offers many buildings far removed from the main entrance & the noise. We booked our room well in advance. So, there was no reason why we were given a room that should be reserved only if the hotel was fully booked. Housekeeping was non-existent. Not once did we return to our room to find anyone ever entered while we were gone. We called every evening for replenishment of towels & removal of garbage. The grounds were well kept, the coffee shop offered a small but adequate menu of breakfast & lunch. The pool area was much too small & crowded, thanks to inconsiderate quests who grap every chair around them, whether they need them or not. Overall, I would not return to Floridays and will stick to the Marriott Grande Vista, a true resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: Brookke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a great location, 5 minutes to Disney one way and 2 minutes to Seaworld the other way. We had a large 2 bedrooms and 2 baths room and it was very clean, comes with a kitchen with everything you need to cook *if you choose to do so* has a washer and dryer....fridge..stove..dishwasher, they supply the soaps. The pool area was always busy and there werent enough long chairs, but it was very nice and clean. The construction next door (new apartment complex) did not bother us at all. The staff were all very nice. Benefits: * Walgreen's close proximity * Publix grocery store * GREAT outlet shopping 2 minutes away * Close to Disney and Seaworld * Pool area nice * Can cook in the kitchen (saves a bit of money) and dont have to eat in restaurants ALL the time. * Lots of free parking Cons: * Not enough long chairs (they really should not allow people to leave their towels on chairs and leave for hours) * All the good restaurants are down International rd towards Orlando... (we only found that out on the last day there) * Construction next door

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: JanneCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We live in europe and stayed at the Floridays for 5 days. The hotel is very beautiful- looks like something from southern europe. The rooms are lovely- burned colors, glasstables and lovely materials. The bathrooms are nice and there are a lot of artificial plants. The hotels has 6 buildings a-f and only 2 of them are near the mainpool- you have to walk or as we did take the car to the childrens pool. There are no restaurant only a cafe- the poolbar is nice and they make nice pinacoladas. The front desk manager is VERY professionel, however she was not there upon c/i- the receptionist was NOT smiling and as a welcome we got " what is your name-please" Working in hotels all my live- this is NOT the way to great your guests !! The cleaning is wonderful and the location is great - 2 min in car to the premium outlets ! the pool is ok- but I missed a playground and maybe a slide. We wish to come back, when the part 3 renovation is over. By the way, we heard NO construction noice , but we saw a lot of construction on international drive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Condo, great location for all the parks.”
Reviews.Author: Bungie67
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a pivately owned Condo, block C, number 303. which you can view on www.holiday lettings.co.uk, number 16850. We stayed their between 16th March - 29th March 2008 with our 2 children aged 11 and 7. The Condo was excellent, with all the home conforts you need. Very clean and spaciuos. I only ever stay in privately owned Condos' and appartments and can honestly say this is the best one I have stayed at. Cannot comment on the resorts pool because we never had any time left to visit, although people I met said it was great. Great central location for all the Parks. Universal Studios about 10 mins drive east, Disney parks 15mins drive west and seaworld is virtually on your door step about 3 mins drive. Would highley recommend staying at this Condo and will be staying again when we return in a couple of yhears when the youngest is tall enough to get on the large rides. International drive restaurants about 5 mins drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time at Disney”
Reviews.Author: t6080n5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending a Week at the Floridays Resort. The rooms were large and having the kitchen made it easy for us to give our littleones breakfast before going to the parks. The pool area was quite nice although crowded. Unfortunately I didn't take any pictures of our room or the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: Belgrade07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom condo which had a lot of room. The master bedroom was very nice with a large bathroom. The second bedroom was also nice with two full size beds. It had a nice balcony. It was decorated very nicely. The pool is smaller than it appears in on the Web-site. it is also 4'8" deep. We could see the Marriot Horizon's pool from our balcony and that looked huge and fun. The pool bar is just o.k. also. It is outside and while we were there it was cold so we had to sit out in the cold with our drinks. The location is in a good spot to get to all of the attractions in Orlando. The service was very good. Despite the weak pool I would stay there again because of the price and condo.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: EyeofAngkor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort in January 2008. The accomodation was first class. The staff were friendly. We did not benefit much from the facilities since we spent most of our time at Disney. If staying here for the purpose of visiting the theme parks a car is essential.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Nana1956
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay at this facility if you value your belonging. Our room was robbed with no evidence of a forced entry. Security was useless. Hotel management staff was useless. To add insult to injury we were accused by the hotel insurance agent of misplacing 3 laptops,digital camera, HD camcorder,PDA,and numerous other items. Hotel management has dragged their feet as has the Orlando police. We were told to make claim with our insurance company but how do you claim pictures and movies of a graduation and week cruise taken the week before. Calls to hotel management are not returned. A vacation that was to be special was made a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ryefly_98
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Floridays (2 bedrooms suite) during the first week of March. It was a great place to stay with a family. Much more room than a regular hotel room and it was actually easier to eat our breakfast and light snacks at our room or bring them down to the pool. Dislikes: - construction was noisy in the morning - not enough loungers around the pool. They have lots of space for them Likes: - rooms were very nice and spacious - very close to Publix(grocery) and the outlet stores - nice large pool that was heated - FREE parking - close to everything - wasn't super busy around the pool - Laundry in the room Feel free to email me with any specific questions about the resort...what to bring, what is availabe in the room etc. They did have some dish soap, dishwasher detergent and a couple small boxes of tide for laundry. lflynn2@cogeco.ca

Reviews.Title: “Everyone enjoyed Floridays Orlando Resort!”
Reviews.Author: ShellieBelly123
Reviews.Content: The Floridays Orlando Resort was great! We had a three bedroom condo/hotel room that was clean and sufficiently stocked when we arrived - the housekeeping service was reliable and appropriate for a condo - we had PLENTY of room. The pool was more than adequate and the amenities were extremely well cared for. The entrance was a little hard to find, because they are re-vamping that area. Other posters had reported construction noise, but we did NOT hear construction noise when we were there from Thurs- Sun.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTraveler0
Reviews.Content: This place was beyond my expections. Meet family for a birthday celebration. Check-in was fine, the room was a little bit further than I expected. But when we got there, what a great surprise. The place was beautiful and very clean. Awesome furnishings and decor. Very nice kitchen. Everything you'd want. Convenient to attractions and shopping. Very nice pool, great lobby. It was a wonderful place to stay. If you have the Entertainment card, use it to get the best rates.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: maryanne62
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights (feb 20 2008 thru Feb 26th) at the Floridays. We were also here the same time last year. We were not bothered in the least by construction, and the rooms and property are in wonderful still new condition. I would recommend tis for any group looking for plenty of room and a lovely pool. We also took advantage of the free park shuttle, that worked out great.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays = Great value for families!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Mumma
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel, we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with our 2 yr old daughter. The suite was very spacious, nicely decorated and clean. We stayed in one of the Disney on-site hotels last year, and it was such a wonderful difference to have the extra space, kitchen, dishwasher, washer/dryer, etc. There is a Publix grocery store and a 7-eleven a couple minutes drive away. Pretty much everything is provided in the kitchen, even things you don't always find like tupperware, bakeware, cheese grater, etc. They also provide dishsoap, laundry soap, toiletries, coffee, etc. Housekeeping made the beds, changed towels, and emptied garbage daily. Since we stayed 10 days, we did end up with one full clean during our stay as well. Pool is a bit on the cool side, although the weather wasn't really hot when we were there, but there is also a hot tub and small sandy area for kids to play in. The grounds are lovely. The on-site Starbucks is also handy. The food counter didn't interest us a great deal, but there are lots of restaurants and some fast food places nearby if you don't want to cook. Also, there is a DVD player in the living room, so bring some DVDs, or I think they also may have rented them in the lobby. We stayed on the 5th floor in building C and our balcony did face a construction lot, but we only noticed some beeping from the construction vehicles a couple mornings, not a big deal at all in my opinion. As others have mentioned the temporary entrance is not lit and very difficult to see at night, we missed it twice. During the day it is not too bad. Disney is only about 15 minutes away and we found driving/parking and taking the tram (and monorail or boat for the Magic Kingdom) didn't really take anymore time than staying onsite and taking Disney transporation. It's also only a couple blocks away from the premium outlets. We booked online through the hotel's website and got 1/2 price with our entertainment book card. You can see the different rates online. For our dates only $115 per night plus tax which I thought was an amazing deal. When you book, I suggest asking for a suite that is not at ground level and requesting a building close to the pool if you plan to use it. The staff were all friendly and very accommodating. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was because the security is a little lacking. The windows were installed upside down so did not lock tightly. The maintenance manager checked a couple different suites with us and this seemed to be a problem in all of them, so check your windows when you check in! He put screws through the frame to keep it shut in the bedroom that was on the exterior walkway. This is not a gated property and there are exterior corridors to all rooms, so you will find pizza flyers stuffed under your doors (we ordered from one of them, I can't remember which and it was horrible, don't waste your $$). I am used to having an alarm system at home, so I am maybe a little more cautious than most though. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: vacfeb2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of Feb. 2008 from Fri night - Tuesday afternoon, and were pleasantly surprised to find that the construction noise we had read about in other reviews was not an issue at all. There are fountains all over the resort that really do a great job of providing pleasant background noise, and we honestly would not have noticed any construction noise at all had we not been looking for it. By the way, International Drive is full of construction sites, so anywhere you stay in this area is going to have that going on nearby. Floridays truly lived up to the rest of the great reviews on this site, the accomodations were fantastic, and we were not disappointed in ANY way.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Floridays”
Reviews.Author: HandsomePete
Reviews.Content: Floridays is a perfect place for a family of five people or more to stay while visiting DisneyWorld. A family of five or more who wishes to stay in a Disney hotel is forced to stay in a deluxe room. Gettiing a room for four and sticking two small children in one bed doesn't fly with Disney. So for a family of five who doesn't want to spend a ton of money for a deluxe room inside the park, Floridays is a very attractive alternative. Seven of us - my wife and me, our three children, and my in-laws, stayed in a three-bedroom suite for four nights, and it was perfect, with plenty of room for everything. It also had four TVs, which eliminated ANY argument between the kids over who was going to watch what when we got back to our room in the evening. The two large bathrooms were excellent...one with a Jacuzzi style tub that my kids loved. Showers were fine as well. The full kitchen made it easy to prepare food to bring with us into Disney, and the washer and dryer allowed us to pack less clothing than we would have needed to. Floridays is a 15-minute, very easy drive to DisneyWorld, a few minutes from SeaWorld, and around 20 minutes from Orlando Int'l Airport. All perfect. A supermarket and drug store was a stone's throw away as well, which was nice. Check-in was easy, as was parking. The pool was large and the bar was open until 11pm, so that worked for us as well. All told, we had no complaints whatsoever. A great place to stay if you don't need to stay inside DisneyWorld itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: terpnut
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many timeshare and suite hotels in the Orlando area and, for families, this is the definitiely the best way to visit Disney and the other theme parks. Due to a cancelled and delayed flight, we arrived at the Floridays very late at night. Due to the construction in the area, we missed the resort's temporary main entrance and drove off the road and over a curb! Be very careful, this temporary entrance is neither well lit nor marked! The location on International Drive is very convenient to Disney, Sea World, Universal, Outlet shopping and the Convention Center. The front desk staff was courteous and check-in was a breeze. Our room was very clean and well-kept however there was NO soap to be found anywhere. A call to the front desk took care of that but the omission was very odd. Housekeeping provided daily towel refresh and made the beds--sufficient for our multi-day stay. Would've been nice if they had replenished the coffee and some other supplies, but oh well... It was too cold to check out the pool or other resort amenities. There was no in-room wifi access but wired access was available. Oddly, the hotel ran out of cables so if you want internet access, I recommend bringing your own Cat5 ethernet cable. Due to the exterior entrances, there was occasional but but noticeable noise outside the units. We could hear the rumble of the hotel staff' golf carts towing their plastic trash and/or supply carts here and there. Also, occasionally, we could here other families making noise in the parking lot. Overall, we had a great stay for a great rate and would definitely recommend the Floridays Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family of four”
Reviews.Author: familytravelers04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays for a one week. Upon arrival we were able to check in with no problems. We booked a 2 bedroom suite. Plenty of room for the whiole family. Resort is well maintained. Great location to seaworld and discovery cove, as well as all other attractions. We had no problem driving to and from resort to attractions. We spent 2-3 days at pool. No crowds at all, pool water was clean and heated. We will come back for another vacation in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place away from Disney”
Reviews.Author: flame6883
Reviews.Content: A new condo/hotel resort still under construction. When we pulled in, the front entrance was still under construction and next door there was another huge condo project still under way. AAA said it was posh, it had some nice perks but it's not posh, not yet, it has potential. A full kitchen with a full size seperate island greet you, a cramped dining room table and the tv (42" flat panel) watching area follow. The master suite was small. The master bath was overly large. There was a second bedroom and bath. Just as I had suspected we were awakened by the beep beep beep of heavy construction equipment, on a weekend no-less, they call it progress, I call it a pain. We over-heard the staff talking about employees not showing up for work, again something that happens but I don't want to hear about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for those planning lots of time in the room”
Reviews.Author: gatorfreud
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister and I stayed here for a long weekend to celebrate my mom's birthday. We did a lot of scrapbooking, and mostly just stayed in the room for the entire day for 3 days... went out to dinner, etc... at night. It was a nice room with comfy beds, plenty of room for the 3 of us and all of our scrapbooking gear. The TV was great, we watched a lot of movies too. There were many minor annoyances... the last day we did take a list to the fornt desk of all the things that were broken, but I asked that they not be fixed until we left since we were spending so much time in the room. They made no offer to do anything extra, but also I was not really very upset. None of it really hindered us, but if I was with my kids it may have been more difficult (and I would have demanded they be fixed, which I think they would have done). *The burners on the stove were not "plugged in"... took us 15 min. to figure out why the stove wasn't working. We did call and they were sending someone from engineering, but then we figured it out. *The iron was broken, but replaced with a phone call (well, 2 calls really). *Garbage disposal broken. *Back sliding door did not lock, but we were on the 6th floor (balcony) so I didn't really care. *Toaster had to be "jiggled" to work. *One lamp in bedroom did not work. *We did not have a do not disturb sign, although housekeeping gave us one when they saw our handwritten note on the door. *Alarm clock did not go off, but was ok since I set my phone too. *One outlet in the kitchen did not work. I think that was it... all minor, but when when added together sort of irritating. The front desk called us a cab one night (I think it is a service they contract with) that was very good and reliable. Did not visit the pool, but looked super fun for the kids. Can't really give any advice if you're looking to visit the theme parks since we didn't do it... with the kids we always stay on Disney property because I like the full immersion. If you are willing to be farther from the parks and drive in (I think they may have a shuttle too?) and are looking to have a big room with a nice pool, I think this would be a good choice. We were in building C, top floor. We didn't hear any construction noise, and we slept semi-late, until about 8:30 or 9. I didn't hear any during the day either, and we were there all day. It probably depends on your room. Thanks for reading!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: KanataTraveler
Reviews.Content: After having just spent 7 nights at the Floridays Resort, it is easy to fully recommend this place for an Orlando visit. The location is ideal - very close to the amusement parks, shopping, and restaurants. The resort grounds are very well maintained, with an elaborate family pool area and a much quieter adult pool located near the back of the resort. Both had very warm water in January! Near the main pool is a neat kids games room, a Starbucks, and an outside bar with a basic menu. The service was extremely professional throughout the stay. The maintenance and cleaning staff, without fail, always said "Good Morning". There were also none of the dreaded Florida timeshare sales pitches or offers of free stuff to endure a sales pitch! Located in Building E, the room we had had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a washer and dryer, and a full kitchen with a dishwasher. Traveling with a baby, we found these amenities very handy. The bathroom off of the master bedroom included a big Jacuzzi tub and a separate shower. The second bedroom had two beds and a TV. The hotel brought us a crib at no charge. In the living room area, there was a nice flat panel TV with lots of channels (but no HD) and a big dining room table. The kitchen was well stocked with utensils. Local phone calls are free, something we found convenient. The balcony had a nice view of a small lake with a fountain. There was also a small nook in the room with a spot for connecting to the Internet. The free high-speed requires a cable, so avoid our mistake and bring one with you. In terms of complaints, the biggest one we had was the horrible pillows on the beds. All 7 pillows in the room were identical and equally bad. A few of the ceiling fans were a bit noisy too, but not extreme. The elevator cabs were a bit industrial looking, but still very clean. The nearby construction didn't seem to create any noise problems, although our room faced another direction completely. Overall, the resort provided excellent value. We booked directly through the hotel's website several months in advance and got a fantastic deal. I've noticed since then that similar deals for this property are on several other travel sites, even without the advanced booking.

Reviews.Title: “Too much construction noise”
Reviews.Author: TM42
Reviews.Content: Might be nice when completed, but 6:30am wake-ups due to construction noise made it a less than the peaceful and quiet getaway we were hoping for. Room was nicely appointed and amenities were fine. We might try it again in a couple of years when the area is built out.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Place!”
Reviews.Author: churchsecretary
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 visited the Orlando area for the 1st time. I selected this resort from the options given by Travelocity - what a great place! The pictures posted on their website doesn't do this place justice! The grounds were very well kept - the room was wonderful (very clean and high quality from top to bottom). The pool was warm and my two kids loved it! The location is perfect for visiting the Disney Parks and the SeaWorld Parks. The grocery store down the road on Vineland has anything you could want (Publix). The room was well equiped for any cooking one would want to do - on vacation though - the most I did was open a pizza box or unscrew a bottled water lid. There was ample laundry detergent and personal items every day. The towels were replenished every day. None of our personal items were tampered with - we were out of the room every day - all day - leaving plenty of time for someone dishonest to have taken advantage of the situation - but nothing was touched! We will definately stay here the next time we are in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round.”
Reviews.Author: brianwilliams_uk
Reviews.Content: Firstly the resort is positioned in just about the perfect area, on International Drive South. It's a very short drive to International Drive restaurants and attractions and an absolute dream to drive to all the Disney parks. Myself and my wife and my two boys aged ten and seven loved the place. The appartment had two bedrooms. Queen sized beds for the boys with a TV in the room. Our room had a king sized bed. Each room had it's own bathroom:ours with a shower and a jacuzzi bath. There was a comfortable lounge and dining area and a fully fitted kitchen with a huge fridge. The place was kept spotless and the maid always provided clean fresh towels. My boys were most impressed with the fact that the pool stayed open unitl 10pm and even then there were nights when they swam (under our supervision) until nearer 11. Would I go back there, without hesitation. In fact I'll very probably book there when we DO go back. Oh! and there's a huge Publix supermarket (excellent in every way) and a huge Walmart's (pharmacy cum everything shop) literally round the corner (easily walked in fact). After travelling all that distance from the UK I was looking for a comfortable place with quite high standards. I wasn't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great for large family”
Reviews.Author: catherp
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent rate off the hotel's website with the entertainment card. Check there first because I found that it beat all other sites for our dates. I agree with other posts that it's a little worn for being only a couple of years old. Despite that, it's still beautiful. My kids loved the jacuzzi bath tub. I was able to cook a complete meal one night with the help of the Publix down the road. We were able to add my in-laws onto the reservation which gave them their own parking pass and key. Be careful with the key - it gets demagnetized very easily sitting next to your WDW tickets, for example. You have to get the cable for internet from the desk. We asked for a place not near construction. Whether we got one or not, we could hear the beeps at around 6:30 or 7:00 every morning. Some mornings it bothered us while others didn't - it seemed to depend on how much we had done the day before. The location of the place is perfect. 5 minutes from Sea World and fairly direct into WDW with no traffic problems even at rush hour. My one major complaint about the place is that this is one timeshare that doesn't seem to have extra activities. Outside of the pool, there isn't much else. If you're there for the parks or for golf and don't want any extras like a kids program or a lake large enough for boat rentals, then this will be great for you. I can't quite put my finger on why I can't give this place a 5, but it just didn't feel like it was an excellent experience. it was certainly above average, though, and especially if you find such a great rate like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 5 adults”
Reviews.Author: UFGator
Reviews.Content: With 3 bedrooms (2 with 2 double beds) and 2 bathrooms (one with Jacuzzi), full amenities in the kitchen, plenty of TVs and space, this wonderful resort fit the bill for our time visiting Disney and Universal. Publix supermarket is just a few blocks away, as well as a 24 hour Walgreen's store. Outlet mall and eating places close by as well. Easy access to I-4. Reasonable pricing for all you get. Maid service is fresh towels/ trash/ making beds daily...additional price for extra service. Excellent choice that we would do again.

Reviews.Title: “Too Bad We Didn't Stay Longer!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2
Reviews.Content: If only we had known it was going to be so great, we would've stayed here longer. We arrived at the Floridays after spending two weeks at Disney's Beach Club Villas. Considering the cost of a night in a 2-bedroom suite is 1/6 the cost of the same suite on the Disney property, Floridays outshined Disney in almost every category. Pleasant, efficient front desk. The bellman was terrific. Our 2-bedroom suite was perfect for our party of 6 adults ... not only were the beds and pillows very comfortable (the same cannot be said for Disney), each room had its own TV (flatscreens with digital cable service) and there was plenty of sink/counter/mirror space for all of us. Particularly appealing (our kids are in their 20s) was that the resort was within walking distance of the Premium Outlet mall and several wonderful restaurants. After feeling very gouged at Disney, the selection of food choices at reasonable choices was a wonderful and welcome relief. The rooms were clean, well appointed and very comfortable. Towels were thick and they left more than needed. Soaps and shampoos were high quality milled varieties (Crabtree & Evelyn). Our view was out over the fountain in the lake. The pool is heated to a lovely 28C with a great little waterpark for young kids. There is a poolside bar (not swimup) and a grocery store/cafe with excellent food at very reasonable prices. Adjacent to the Floridays is a small strip mall containing the Publix supermarket, a liquor store, a few quaint take-out restaurants and a Walgreen's. A longer stay here would have saved us considerable money and truly we're sorry we didn't discover this gem until our last day in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “This was a Great Condo!!!”
Reviews.Author: comingforthesun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays for 4 nights. My husband and two teenage sons were very impressed with the size of this suite. The kitchen was fully equipped. They had a washer and dryer too. The Master suite was wonderful as was the jacuzzi tub. Good value for the $. I would stay here again. Thank you trip adviser for another great recommendation! Close location to everything. We bought our tickets to DL and Universal at the hotel. We also went to the Arabian Nights. The food was ok but the show was good!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent family vacation”
Reviews.Author: hamilton13
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were wonderful. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was very roomy and comfortable for my family with two children aged 11 and 17. The grounds and the pool area are beautiful. The whole resort has a definite holiday feel about it; very relaxing and inviting. The staff were very helpful and quick to make sure any requests were handled swiftly. The resort is in a great location; 15 minutes to Disney, 15 minutes to Universal, 15 minutes to the airport and 5 minutes to the outlet mall. Everything you need is real close.

Reviews.Title: “Large suite, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: joelsol
Reviews.Content: Just got back a few days ago from Floridays. Me, my wife and 5 & 9 year old daughters had a great 5 days. The suite was very spacious and clean. The master bath was huge with a nice jacuzzi tub. It had a large shower stall also. The kids enjoyed the main pool with the sprinkler park. Since we were there during Christmas week, the pool deck was packed, so the second (secluded) pool came in very handy. There was much more room and quieter there. We did not have a problem with the construction noise at the adjacent property. Yes, you could hear it, but it was a non-issue. The resort is located near everything. We went to Sea World (4-5 minute drive) and Universal (10-15) minute drive. We skipped Disney this time, but it was within 10 minutes away. The outlet mall is just about around the corner - avoid this place the day or 2 after Christmas. What a zoo there! Publix is right around the corner and saved many calories and dollars by eating in. Since you only get one days supply of coffee in your suite, we found it a must to get to Publix for coffee and filters. We will definately stay there again next time we're in the Orlando area. A few pointers - I would definately recommend having a vehicle for your stay there. I believe there are shuttles, but I never saw them. Also, the hard wired internet connection in the suites is not Vista ready, so my laptop would not work. The wireless connections are only in the main lobby and occasionally found on the main pool deck. The wireless connection is Vista ready. Not all the front desk staff were aware of that. I learned that on the last day, after asking on previous days. Another pointer, we were not impressed with Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. Too many soaking wet and/or high intensity rides there. Most of these rides were not appropriate for our 5 & 9 year olds. We should have gone back to Disney, Epcot, or MGM instead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Tub”
Reviews.Author: SARRECAT
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Floriday's Resort. I liked the location in relation to the Disney Parks. Nice Master Bath with a wonderful, large whirlpool tub. We had a very nice experience there and I would certainly recommend it to anyone. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: michelleprincesslee
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from this hotel after being there for a week. The first night was GREAT (we arrived at 9:30pm) we loved the room, we got a 3 room suite, the pool was great for the kids... we thought we had found OUR hotel in Orlando that we could return to over and over again. That is until the next morning at 6:45am when the sounds of construction started going off and none of us were able to sleep. (No one bothered to tell us there was construction going on right next to the hotel) Then we found out there was no room service, no in room movies, no extended cable, no maid service beyond stocking new towels each day unless you paid additionally for it EACH day. The floors of the out side hallway get polished at 11pm, maids yell from room to room in the morning laughing while cleaning, and there were ants in our room by the second day. The good part about the hotel was it was close to the outlet malls, and had a shuttle to the attractions that were included. However, for the money we spent on this three room suite, it was a disappointment all the way around! Next time we will stay at the Hilton. PS DON'T ORDER FROM EITHER PIZZA PLACE THAT THE HOTEL ADVERTISES.... THIS PIZZA IS UNEDIBLE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT! Will never stay on WDW property again...”
Reviews.Author: NCMouseketeer
Reviews.Content: As a bonafide Disney snob with 100+ trips to Mouse Mecca under my belt, I hesitated to stay off property. We have always stayed on WDW property because we knew we'd get a clean, comfortable room in close proximity to the parks. However, we have a 3-year-old daughter now, and experience has taught us that sharing a hotel room with her will not work. So I looked long and hard for off-site family-oriented, suite-like lodging that wouldn't cost an arm and a leg or put us out in podunk Kissimmee. Floridays is PERFECT; I will never stay anywhere else every again. The property is beautiful although still in the midst of development. We were in building E. I don't know whether it was the time of year or maybe this property hasn't been discovered yet, but our building was practically vacant. Our unit was serene and beautifully decorated. Housekeeping was attentive and detail-oriented. We got a 2-bedroom unit that we shared with the grandparents so that each couple paid only ~ $85 per night. Our only "complaints" -- such as they are -- was that the temporary entrance was difficult to see, especially at night. And the bathrooms need more towel racks (or, as my father said of the master bath, " 'A' towel rack would be a good place to start!") Taking back roads into WDW property, we were about 5 minutes away, and didn't have to mess with the traffic or congestion of I-4 or International Drive. And CLEAN -- the place was really CLEAN. All in all we were thrilled -- like I said, we will always attempt to stay at Floridays first from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jensamsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays for 5 nights while visiting Disney and Seaworld with our 4 year old son. You just cannot beat the value of Floridays. Our room was enormous, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen and spacious living room and included a washer/dryer. The room was clean and nicely appointed. The staff was courteous and helpful. Only negatives were the soft bed and less than convenient times for the Disney shuttle (left each day at 9:20am and 11:30am and returned each day at 6:15pm and 9:45pm). Perhaps they have more at other times of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very nice property”
Reviews.Author: amysue01
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 2 days, but we were very impressed with the property. We had a 2 bedroom suite. It was very nicely decorated, very new looking, and clean. (We were also amused and impressed with the variety of towel folding "artwork" in the room. ) Much nicer than some other condo rentals that we've experienced in the past. The kids enjoyed the pool, but other than the pool, coffee at the little cafe in the morning, and the room, we didn't use any more of the property. We would have enjoyed trying the bar, but not enough time. It is extremely close to the outlet mall, and really only a few minutes from Downtown Disney. There is a Publix just around the corner, so those staying longer would have easy access to groceries. We usually stay in Orlando for a couple of nights every year, and will definitely return to Floridays. It's a great value. There is currently construction going on on the perimeter of the property as they are expanding, but it didn't bother us as we were not hanging around during the day anyway. If I remember correctly, part of the expansion is a larger waterpark.

Reviews.Title: “floridays Novemeber 2007 - BEWARE OF CONSTRUCTION -”
Reviews.Author: rikhanson
Reviews.Content: We booked a 7 night stay at the Floridays resort - The rooms were very spacious and had every thing you would need. For such a new property there was a lot of wear in the rooms. some mold on the shower and molding falling off. All very minor but surprised that it was not kept up better. The worst part of our vacation was the construction that happened every morning at 7am. The hotel is expanding and construction is VERY LOUD. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and at our door within minutes for our requests for towels,crib and smoke detector battery replacement. One other note to pass on - DO NOT ORDER FROM THE PIZZA PLACES THAT STICK MENUS UNDER YOUR DOOR - We made the mistake and paid so everyone else who reads this does not have too. This food is disgusting at best.... This would have been a great stay if not for the construction noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: krgl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an even better location. A couple of swimming pools, bar etc. I stayed for two week and did not want to come home. we had a three bed room unit and it was great. The staff are helpful and it was one of the best holiday ever. I will be going back and would find it very hard not to stay again. Give it a go, I had a great time. Gary

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Head78
Reviews.Content: We had rented a 2 bedroom apartment for my husband and I and another couple. The hotel was great !! Nice clean spacious 2 bedroom apartment. The pool area was great and the pool bar had really good food. The only thing is if you stay at this hotel you should really rent a car. I felt that the shuttle service they offered wasn't that great. You had to reserve a time in the morning and they only let you choose 2 times you can leave in the morning and then you have to book your time you want to come back which again you had to choose a time from the list. If you didn't leave with the shuttle you couldn't come back with the shuttle. We only utilized this service once .. it was much easier to take the trolley which picks up right on International drive outside the hotel and only cost 1.00. Much more convenient to get around that way then it was for the shuttle service provided at the hotel. Other then that Floridays was great !! Would definately stay there again !!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: harrissix
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 was at Floridays In July 2007. We had a 2-bedroom unit. It was great to have the two baths as well with four children ages 11, 9, 7 &6. The washer/dryer were wonderful to wash your daily clothing and not have to pack nearly as much and better yet not carry dirty laundry home! I loved to get up and cook breakfast every morning in the full kitchen. I did have a little trouble getting dishtowels left in our room. They did empty the trash daily and give fresh towels. This was a plus, because it is not that much to wash them yourself. We were only visiting Disney parks while in Orlando and if I had it to do over; I would stay in a Disney resort simply for the transportation and meal plans available. (When you have been in the park for 11 hours with four small children it hard to even get your bearings as to which way we have to go! and the meals at Disney for a family of six are steep.—the meal plan would have saved much even with me cooking breakfast daily.) The Publix is so close; it was nothing for my husband to go get anything we needed while I got the kids ready for a day in the parks. The entrance as I have heard others say is difficult to find at first due to the construction, but once found not a problem. The main lobby seems to be in a weird place because they are using a temporary entrance now and you have to drive around to what seems to be the back. Overall, we loved the Floridays and would probably stay there again if visiting Orlando for anything other than Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Condo!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jkonijeti
