Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Floridays while at Disney. We moved there from the Embassy Suites in Lake Buena Vista which was really old and smelled. We loved the Floridays. The pics do not lie, all the rooms are so nice. We were in a two bed suite which was wonderfully furnished, nice big master bath, and great large balcony. The kids pool is awesome, has all of these spray things to play in and even a little area of sand that kids can play in. Also we ate from the pool bar twice and enjoyed both the food and drinks. We travel often and are extremely picky so if we liked it most people would. A previous review commented on construction in the area, this is true but did not bother us while out at the pool and we never heard anything in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: It'sTimeToTravel
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to board the Caribbean Princess in Ft. Lauderdale and spent the night before the cruise at this property. There were 4 adults in our party and we got a 2 BR suite. The location was great and check-in was a breeze. I like NEW properties and this is fairly new. The suite was beautiful...we were happy with the kitchen and appreciated the washer/dryer and got in a quick load of laundry. The flat screen TV in the LR was BIG and the furniture was very comfortable. We liked sitting out the patio too. The only problems we encountered were: 1. Each time the air conditioner cycled on or off, it would make a LOUD banging noise. 2. The tub in the 2nd bathroom didn't drain well. Also, there was no soap - we had to call the front desk. 3. The TV remote didn't work in the 2nd BR. I'd definitely stay here again....the staff was very accommodating. If you like Italian food, I'd recommend Maggiano's restaurant...it's only about 5 minutes away and we had a great dinner there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful place to stay and EXCELLENT value for money.”
Reviews.Author: honey40
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my husband and 2 teenage children for 5 nights in October 2007. We booked through hotelopia and it cost £360 in total for a 2 bedroom apartment, The apartment was spotless clean with everything you would expect to find in it and more. We had 1 bedroom with 2 double beds and its own bathroom and the other bedroom had 1 queensize bed with en suite jacuzzi bathroom. It was located on the south side of International drive but we hired a car and it only took 10mins to drive into the main part of Idrive, there was the regular I train which we did not use. Although there was a gym at this resort we did not use it and I never went to look at it to see what it looked like. There are 2 pools but we just used the smaller one which was very well kept and had its own childrens section which looked good for the younger children. I would definately recommend this resort to anyone who is planning a holiday to Orlando. It is within easy driving distance to all the main theme parks as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mistyblueNassau
Reviews.Content: My family were second time vacationers at the hotel, having stayed there in July 2006. Upon check-in to our room, we discovered that the room they gave us was a room that was still unclean from the previous occupant. Crumbs were over the breakfast counter and beds were not made. Went to the young woman at the front desk and complained and was given a key for another suite. Even though she apologized in front of the manager on duty, they both seemed nonchalant. We were given another room, only this time to find that one of the keys did not open the door, so it was back to the front desk. (what an exhausting experience after traveling all afternoon and with a special needs child!) We spent 6 days and housekeeping serviced our suite 4 days. The food disposal in kitchen sink did not work. However, it was fixed after a few days. Whirlpool in master bedroom leaked and each night carpet in bedroom was soaked. Plumber who came to check it out on the day before we left mentioned that they would have to move tub to repair. My daughter and granddaughter were vacationing in Maryland and scheduled to meet us in Orlando that weekend. She kept calling the hotel to reach us and leaving messages on voice mail. After not hearing from us, she finally got through to the hotel's front desk (she claimed phone rang consistently unanswered) and was told that the phone system was not working properly and messages were not going through to voice mail in our room. My son in Miami, who tried to reach us got the same information from the front desk. Because we were unreachable at the hotel, he was not sure we had arrived at the hotel as planned and this resulted in him coming to Orlando a day later than he planned to visit us. I summed this all up as a bad experience this time around and very disappointed, after having such an excellent experience last year. Apart from the shortcomings, the area is the place to stay if you want to be away from the crowd on the other end of I-drive.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Floridays!”
Reviews.Author: DavidRAF
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the floridays resort and found it to be fantastic! We have stayed at lots of 5 star hotels before but some how this place seems better! The rooms are large, clean and have everything you need. The staff are friendly and nothing is to much trouble. location is great just a couple of miles south of seaworld on international drive and we used the trolley bus service a few times meaning we could leave the car behind and have a few drinks with dinner. Will definitley be going back next year when the new sea world water park opens!

Reviews.Title: “Good holiday resort”
Reviews.Author: KazMB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom apartment with a 17 and an 18 year old boys in July 2007. The location is great and the rooms large and comfortable. The boys loved the pool area and spend every night there after a day at the parks. Although the pool is supposed to close at around 10pm the bar staff allowed them to stay on as long as they wanted - usually well after midnight. Housekeeping could have been a bit better. The linen wasn't always changed every day and only basic cleaning was done. However, it was cleaned to a high standard on the day that the boys left out their quarters for the games machines as the maid must have thought it was her tip!!!! I would recommend these apartments to anyone visiting Orlando and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “loved having a washer and dryer in the condo”
Reviews.Author: Campers5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays with our three children ranging in age from 6 to 11. We all loved the resort, the condo and the pool area. The condo was very nice and clean. We did not have any problems and we were minutes away from Disney and Sea World. We will stay at Floridays again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: hangingout
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another great stay at Floridays. There were 8 of us this time. My husband and myself, my son and his fiance, and my daughter and a friend and 2 nephews. We booked a 3 bedroom unit in building C. Our stay was even better than last time. Upon checkin the staff was friendly and helpful. Our unit was clean and beautifully decorated. I was happy to receive a unit on the ground floor. Partly because the kids felt so close to the pools but even more so because I am not entirely comfortable with letting them ride elevators alone. It was just perfect.We always felt totally safe and comfortable, and the kids loved not having to be accompanied everytime they left the room. The pool area is just wonderful. One of the best I've seen in Florida. My husband and I enjoyed having an evening cocktail while the kids played in he pool. It was a fabulous vacation. We look forward to staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “bittersweet...........”
Reviews.Author: brutus8472
Reviews.Content: Hotel room....A- Customer service...A Bar & food prices....F My only problem was the prices on the food & liquor. Too high for what you received. The food/snack/convenience stand served basic things (bugers,toated ham sandwhiches, quesadillas ect...). $8.95 for a burger?! come on-lets get real here. now if it was room service & delivered to your door on a cart with a dome lid on it I can see this. Not the case here. all you get is a to-go plastic plate/lid with plastic utensils. I just dont see where their getting these prices from? all their food is about $8.95-not worth the price. reduce it by $2.00 & it's about right. Now the pool bar...You order two drinks & your tab will be $19.95.(before tip) for just two drinks! A shot of Smirnoff vodka (2 oz.) will cost you $7.45 These drinks are not huge so your not getting your moneys worth. very overpriced! if you went Maggiano's restaurant (fine Italian dinning)& ordered two martinis (in frosted glasses) their cost is $7.00 each-total $14.00. So again, I dont see where they get charging $19.95 for two drinks in plastic cups? We let the manager know of our dismay his reply was that nobody else had complained about it. Well im doing just that. There is a Publix market around the corner from the hotel so your best bet is go there & stock up on food & liquor. Just because your on vacation doesn't mean people have to gouge your wallet on certain items. Nice hotel,rooms needed some minor detal cleaning & fixing(cobwebs on overhead dinning light, crack in glass bedroom window, no screen on balcony door) nothing major. Big rooms which make up for the little things. The staff was great, all friendly & very helpful. concierge was helpful with our stay. Travis & Samanth were above the call in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “In a Nutshell -- Great!”
Reviews.Author: hpliz
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a 3-bedroom unit at Floridays for a family occasion. Even though we knew WHERE it was located, we missed the entrance our first swing by due to construction on International Drive South and a poorly-marked sign. After that, things improved. Check-in was efficient. We were in Building E, which was NOT walking distance to the main pool, especially given the heat and humidity when we were there. Our unit was on the second floor, and as I noticed later, that is the ONLY floor where your balcony is cemented in with a solid "railing" ... and sitting down, you cannot see over the edge. It felt very claustrophobic. The bedrooms are small, the bathrooms large and the kitchen was well stocked with cleaning products and tableware, glassware and utensils. It was a treat having FOUR TV's ... everyone was happy! The 3-bedroom unit is billed as sleeping 12, and technically you could, but it would be a VERY tight squeeze. Our party of 6 was perfectly content. Eight adults would have been pushing the space boundaries. We swam in the main pool twice, and it was clean and well-maintained and the pool towels were wonderfully fluffy! All in all, it was a very pleasant, inexpensive stay in a convenient location ... though I long for the days of old when International Drive South was not so busy!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and nice!”
Reviews.Author: abfp23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Floridays Resort this weekend while visiting the Food & Wine Festival at Disney. We wanted an inexpensive but nice place to stay for the night and waited too long to book one of the value Disney resorts and they were full. Our search of hotels in the area led us to this one. Since we were going with friends, we liked that we could book a suite for a reasonable price. The price we paid per couple was less than what we would have paid at one of the value resorts on Disney property and we had comfortable beds and nice bathrooms as well as a full kitchen, living room and balcony. We had a two bedroom suite, so there were two bedrooms (one with a king bed and one with two full size beds) and two full bathrooms. The property appeared very nice-unfortunately I can't comment too much on the extras around the property because we only stayed the one night and didn't spend too much time at the property. I was happy with the accomodations though and won't hesitate booking here in the future when we visit Disney again. I think this resort would be a great place for a family visiting the Orlando area for a long weekend or week stay as there is a full kitchen so meals can be made there, and there are also laundry facilities. The living room has a full pull out couch also, allowing space for a few more guests. The staff was very pleasant and helpful-offering recommndations when asked. We arrived earlier than check-in time but since our room was ready they allowed us to check in early with no trouble. If you live in Florida as we do, ask for a Florida resident rate when booking. We called the hotel directly to book and they quoted us the price we found online, however when my husband asked if that was the best they could do they inquired if we were Florida residents and then gave us a better price. Also, a tip we learned...we took a cab to get to Disney and called a cab company the hotel gave us. The cab driver explained to us that Disney has a contract with a specific cab company (not his) and he is charged parking to drop visitors off at the parks. Coming back from Disney we used one of the cab companies that Disney contracts with and it was about $7 cheaper. Unfortunately as I'm writing this I can't think of the name of the company! The hotel offers a shuttle service too, we just happened to miss the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: alwaysissy
Reviews.Content: If you want value for money and close to Disney and Sea World I very much doubt that you will find better. Firstly let me say that our holiday was in September when the schools had gone back so we never saw this place anywhere near full - in fact at one stage only 72 rooms were being occupied - so I cannot say what it will be like during the holidays. Fantastic location but walking is not an option due to the humidity but the trolley bus up and down I Drive is frequent - this place is very near the Premium Outlets and the Hilton GVC with a mall including Publix around the corner. Stayed in block C room 606 which was top floor overlooking one of the lakes and the pool - great spot! At first however we were allocated in block B overlooking the carpark but the front desk were very accomodating in moving us. I note that many travellers try to reserve or request specific rooms etc as I did but this did not work - their computer simply randomly selects a room upon your check in.Therefore if you are desperate for a view as we normally are it really is a lottery with limited possibility for changing rooms during busy periods - I did notice that there is a good chance of overlooking the carparks with the layout of the property. Block C overlooking the lake is highly recommended - just far enough from the noise of the pool but close enough to everything in the resort. I was informed on site that by Sept 2008 the resort will be completed which will mean that it will double in size - not a problem because extra pools and restaurant/bar included in new build. Room spacious and clean - maid service excellent everyday. Pool/bar/grill bar spotless and well set out- the food served is very good indeed,infact we had an evening meal there one night just to avoid the maddness of I Drive following a long day at the park. Good size pool with lane swimming area for the serious swimmers! Pool towels provided which they let you take to the water parks as well! 15 minutes to Disney and 10 to Sea World. Great concierge team who will point you in the right direction for everything if you need advice. Never once approached about making property purchase on the resort. In conclusion I would definately return and recommend to anyone whether it be singles/couples/families.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have had better”
Reviews.Author: martymel
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect if you want somewhere that is away from the hussle of downtown I-Drive. It is perfectly located for the freeways and getting to/from Disney and Seaworld. The apartment we booked was two bedroomed, and the kids loved it. TVs in the bedrooms and the lounge meant that we were not living on top of each other, we we were there. We could come home from a long day out and about and relax as if we were at home. The kitchen allowed us to make breakfast most mornings before heading out. The pool are was open late every night and we mostly used it then, from 10pm onwards. The bar staff were friendly and it was really nice to sit having a beer at 11pm while the kids are enjoying the pool within 10 feet. All very safe. During our stay we were never bothered by anyone trying to sell us anything, as usually is the case in some Orlando resorts. The phone did ring twice but we just didn't answer it. The location is handy to the Outlet shopping centre, the local Pubix, and the Dolly Parton Show. We thought about walking but, as another poster has said, it is not a walk you would want to do in hot weather. Couple of things that I found annoying though. One is the entrance to the resort - the roadsign is not visible at night and as we arrived to check-in at 10pm we missed the turn a couple of times. There are roadworks ongoing and it has meant that the entrance is coned and not in good condition. The other thing is the building work beside Floridays. They start work at 7am and all you hear is beep-beep-beep from then on, if you are overlooking the site. It is not Floridays fault but it just got on the nerves, especially when you want to get much needed sleep before the long day ahead!! All in all, a great spot to stay at and we will definitely be back! Other things worth a comment : Outlet Shopping : God, things are soooo cheap compared to back home. Didn't mind her spending, but don't tell her that!! Wonderworks : Keeps kids occupied for hours. Go to the magic show in the evening as it was very enjoyable. Ripley's : Good fun Titanic Exhibit : Pleasantly surprised. Very well done and presented. Even the kids felt moved by what they learnt. Kennedy Space centre : More for the adult (me) but kids enjoyed the simulation take off and the rockets. Great idea mid-visit, to get away from the park crowds and break up the week. Priates show : Encourage the kids to get involved if asked, and have the camera ready! Dolly Parton Show : Good night out. Universal : Loved it. Seaworld : Shamu Rocks!!!!! Disney : Nothing really more you can say! All lands visited was what we expected, and more! Not every day, because too much of a good thing............. Near the end of our visit, we discovered DisneyQuest in Downtown disney - free car and bike games etc. Kids wanted back there every night after that. Raglan Road Irish pub in Downtown : I know.....Irish man goes to Florida and ends up in an Irish bar!! But I tell you, the crowds queuing don't lie. Great food, great service, and great beer. Music was good too. Cheers, Martin

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: spotrock
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place to stay, perfect in every way. Quiet, clean, spacious and well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Longhorn82
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Loved the double shot peach daiquries at the little pool side bar. Very nice pool. Big rooms and nice TV's in the rooms. Very laid back - loved it.

Reviews.Title: “"Made us believers as first time visitors to Orlando"”
Reviews.Author: shaneera
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Floridays resort from March 19 - 24, 2007. After extensive research, I selected the resort primarily because of its location and affordability. But, added bonuses were the facts that my family of four could be comfortably accomodated and the hotel was brand new. The two bedroom suite was beautiful and spacious. My husband and I enjoyed the shower and whirlpool bath in the master bedroom. Also, the privacy was unmatched. The master bedroom was far enough from our teenage sons' room that it was like a second honeymoon for my husband and me. The beds were large and extremely comfortable. I didn't want to get out of bed each morning though we're very early risers at home. Still, the call of the parks and the college our elder son plans to attend next year forced me to leave the plush luxury of the room. Let me not forget to mention the hospitality of the staff, which was greatly appreciated. Finally, the pool areas were tops. Although the larger pool near the bar was always crowded, the atmosphere was fun. We simply preferred the smaller pool because it was less crowded and the jacuzzi is located there. All in all, we had such a wonderful time I booked our vacation at Floridays for next March as soon as we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Amentities”
Reviews.Author: blondiemomof3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Floridays in May 2007, I researched and researched, before I finally picked this hotel, and I think for the money, it was the right choice. My husband is a hotel manager (totally unrelated to Floridays), we were there for a conference he was attending, and we were suppposed to stay at the Gaylord Palms, but after reading reviews, and since we had our soon to be 2 yr. old daughter with us, I thought a condo type room would be much more comfortable. Don't come to this resort and expect pampering, the staff was pleasant, but nothing special, but I didn't expect special, because we weren't paying through the nose. Housekeeping just gave us new towels most of the time and didn't make the beds, which again I really didn't care about. They give you coffee for you coffee pot free for the first day, but if you want any more you need to buy your own, same for laundry soap, shampoo, soap, etc....again this is not like a regular hotel......it's a condo. I loved having the washer and dryer in the room, did a load before we left and it worked out great. The rooms are lovely, and the decor is very tasteful. One of the reasons I booked this hotel, was for the indoor playroom, which was tiny, and pointless. The pool was very nice with a little one. We had "Super Sitters" baby sitting service come and it was really wonderful....I couldn't have felt more comfortable leaving our little girl with her. It was nice they come to your room and watch them, again much more comfortable than being in a regular hotel room. Nice to have tv's in every room. Also had a dvd player. I really wrestled between this hotel and the Sheraton across the street, but the nice thing about the Floridays is, it is all pretty new, you don't have to worry about getting stuck in the old section, like over at the Sheraton. I don't know why people say that the Outback, and Publix, and the Outlets are in walking distance, I guess you can walk, especially if you have been walking miles around the parks, but it would be a little bit of a hike, and I wouldn't recommend it with small children. If the weather is really hot, you would probably be pretty disgusting by the time you got to Outback to eat, which is probably not how you would want to feel to go enjoy dinner. I thought it was nice to have a rental car, and we got a super rate using the Entertainment guide and used Enterprise at the airport, and when we got there we were just supposed to get something like a pontiac G6, and there weren't any readily available so they gave us a Pacifica for the same price, much more comfortable to ride around in. I hope this helps, I was just trying to put in the things that I was concerned about when I was booking this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: baebeecakes
Reviews.Content: I got a deal off Bookit.com for about $143 a night for a two bedroom suite instead off $199+, which was GREAT. The hotel was beautiful, granite countertops, safe in the master bathroom, beautiful tiling..Loved the jacuzzi and the shower..! It was very quiet and there were a total of 3 pools I think..and a washer and dryer and dishwasher right in the unit..The only thing was that when you get close to the elevator, it gets unbearably hot. The cleaning lady, though, spoke no English, so we had to speak to her in SPanish so that she could come back..It took a while to get towels when we requested it..but overall, it was a great experience. The Shopping Outlets was right down the street, which was a plus...

Reviews.Title: “Loved Floridays”
Reviews.Author: japw82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite over the Labor Day weekend and couldn't have been more happy with the accommodations. From the cleanliness, to the decor, it was well worth the price. The location was close to everything. The only complaint we had was the temporary entrance is very bumpy and not well signed. Once the new entrance is open, it will add even more appeal to the resort. I would definitely recommend this resort if you want a great place to stay that is within close proximity to I-4, Disney, the convention center, and shopping, along with a beautiful pool area, exercise room, and cafe' that serves Starbucks coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tmcav
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day stay at Floridays, we had a two bed suite, everything was clean, and the maid service each day was excellent, the staff were extremeley helpful. If your looking for accomodation near to all the parks but want more space than a hotel room you will struggle to beat this.

Reviews.Title: “Our Floridays experience”
Reviews.Author: shari26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays from August 16 to the 20th this summer. From the very begining of planning our trip, this was the hotel I wanted...We flipped back and forth, but ultimatley decided upon Floridays..I am so glad we did. Extremely helpful staff, and the rooms were clean and spacious. We had booked the two bedroom unit in Bldg.B...We have an 11 year boy and 8 year old girl. They loved their room and esp. having their own bathroom. There isn't much in the way of choice of foods, but there is a supermarket and walgrees very close by. Had a couple of Pina Coladas from the bar, which to me were very refreshing. Pool was great, my kids had a ball playing with all the water features. The private balcony was perfect on a beautiful morning with your coffee..All cooking utensils are included, which I LOVED!!.My coffee maker was missing the pot, but when i called the front desk, Housekeeping came within a few minutes. I don't believe they do housecleaning every day, but we always came back to a clean room with the beds made and always enough towels for everyone. Could've used a little more detergent, but that's ok...very minor..Overall we had a wonderful time at Floridays and would always recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: AdventureMom7
Reviews.Content: This was our first Orlando trip and I was not sure about booking a resort online, but tripadvisor was so helpful in that I could see "candid" photos of traveler's stays at a lot of the hotels that I was considering booking on-line. I advise everyone to check tripadvisor now!!! We changed our arrival date from Friday to Thursday and the hotel reservations clerk could not find the change in the computer. I had printed my confirmation of the change and had it with me. We were upgraded to a 3 bedroom from a 2 bedroom at no additional charge. I did have a problem with ants in the master bedroom crawling up the curtains, so I slept in one of the other bedrooms with the children. The light was out in the corridor and we were in a corner room at the end of the hallway--which was a little scary. I contacted the front desk and they sent someone the next morning to spray for the ants and replace the hallway lightbulb. I then found blood on the comforter in the master bedroom, but they sent new bedding. They were courteous & helpful. Other than those issues, which were resolved, I thought the condo was very spacious and clean. The grounds were well kept and the staff was extremely nice. Housekeeping could not speak any English which was a little difficult, but they were very nice. Orlando was very easy to get around in and we loved Universal Studios. We are planning to go back very soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: happyandsmiling
Reviews.Content: The two bedroom suite was spectacular, clean, VERY CLEAN, neat, spacious with appliances that were sanitary and new. I can't stress enough the appearance and condition of the room, it was magnificient and roomy. We searched numerous hotels and resorts, reviews and prices prior to our booking with hotels.com for the Floridays Resort. This resort exceeded our expectations. A clean and spacious room was desired and a spotless, classy and elegant family suite was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: teppy
Reviews.Content: Overall the resort was nice. It was just my 15 year old daughter and I and we had a two bedroom unit in Building C which was very nice and in a great spot overlooking the lake. The 37" flat screen TV was awesome! We were just a short walk to either pool so it was also in a convenient spot. There were only a few things we had issues with-one major and one minor. Word of Caution-make sure you place your valuables in the safe! We made the mistake of not doing so and had money stolen from each of our wallets to the tune of $140! I lodged a complaint with management but didn't get much of a response other than an indication that they would check the records of who had entered the room. I requested an update upon checkout and was only told that they had a record of my complaint but no update. Our minor issue was the lack of equipment in the fitness center. There were only 2 ellipticals of which one was broken, and 2 treadmills for cardio and one Universal for weights. One helpful tip-you can use floats in the pool so you can stop by the Walgreens or Publix down the road and pick some up for some water fun!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: irish_invader
Reviews.Content: Floridays as already described by others is a very spacious set up. 2 and 3 bed condos. a few faults with them if one wanted to be fussy, the dining table and chairs takes up way too much space,. the artificial plants should all be binned, they are revolting. A little hard to get the sheets changed when promised every 3 days. the 2 beds are about 1100 square foot, a king and 2 queen sized beds with a pullout couch. Pool is excellent for kids and splash area stays open til 11. pool still open after midnight. Pool bar / cafe seems small but not very busy either. can't comment on food. Location is excellent whether with or without car being on the queiter end of Idrive. short walk to Publix, though a little tricky with the current roadworks would resommend to anyone especially at the prices which can be got on the discount hotel sites

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Yolio
Reviews.Content: I loved the Floridays! We stayed from Aug 6-Aug 11, 2007. It was beautiful, well-maintained, and spacious, AND SO AFFORDABLE! I couldn't believe we paid: $229/nt for 4 nites, with 5th nite free. The suites are big, like an apartment: 2 rooms (king and 2 doubles), mastersuite with jacuzzi jets in bath with double sinks. Beautiful lighting, and elegantly decorated. Huge flat screen t.v. in living room with dvd player, and nice-sized t.v.s in each bedroom. We got Unit C107 -- ground floor, overlooking the man-made lake. It was right by the elevator, but the noise didn't bother us. We sleep like rocks. My girls (ages 2 and 8) *loved* the pool. It was the first hotel/condo pool where I felt like the kids were absolutely safe. It's sloped like a beach, with the shallow end perfect for toddles; they think they're swimming. :) No nasty baby pool full of pee-pee and what-not. Everybody's in there together. The kids' pool included: lots of little fountains, little "geyers, for the kiddies to play in, and spouts that dumped water on your head. :) In the same area, there's a separate pool with jacuzzi jets and fountains, and a hot tub! Adults who want a quieter scene can check out the pool that's away from the lobby area. Other amenities include: gameroom (with air hockey!), free wireless internet around pool and at lobby, exercise room, sandy play area for kids near pool, bar and restaurant near pool, unlimited towels at pool area, business center with printer and computers, and concierge who can sell you tickets to attractions. It's also conveniently located. You're 3 minutes from a shopping center with Walgreens, Publix grocery store, Subway, Liquor Store, UPS Store, Sunglasses shop ,etc. -- we spent TONS of time there picking up what-nots. The Premium Outlet Mall is just around the corner. It is a little bit of a hike to Disney Parks (5 miles or so?). It would take us 45 minutes from condo to park gates with all the transportation rigamorole (drive to Magic Kingdom, park, wait for tram, ride tram, walk up steep ramp, ride monorail). The heat was unbearable (96-100), and my kids were worn out just by getting to the Park, so we gave up on Disney a couple of days and just stayed at Floridays. I've considered buying a unit someday; they are JUST THAT GOOD!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: campaj71
Reviews.Content: We (2 families--4 adults and 4 kids) stayed here for a week from August 3-9, 2007. We had a 3 bedroom condo on the 5th floor in building B. The condo was very nice--new, well-decorated, comfortable. We felt it was great location--close to Disney, Universal, Sea World, etc. The pool was very comfortable--good size, temperature, hot tub, cold tub, great pool towels. We never found the pool area to be overly crowded. the kids really enjoyed the pool, especially after a hot day at the parks. it was great having a kitchen and washer and dryer. We would definitely stay here again. It is en excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “clean, spacious and good value”
Reviews.Author: debrahj
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 1 teenage son spent 10 days at Floridays end of July and we have to say it was above our expectations. The suite in building C was spacious, clean and very well equipped. It was lovely to have two bathrooms and the space to move around. On previous visits to Florida we have stayed in various properties but to date this is the best. Our suite was kept adequately clean, we chose not to pay for the full housekeeping, we had change of towels etc when required, we had no issues with housekeeping at all. Provided good quality toiletires which was a nice touch. Everything worked well. The pool area was fine for us as we spent very little time there due to going to parks etc. We felt all the public areas were kept very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The Palm Cafe could have had more choice of food, and a breakfast restaurant would have been a bonus, they do have some breakfast items in their little coffee bar but limited choice (though 1 morning my son fancied a grilled chicken sandwich at breakfast time and it was no trouble for them to cook this to order for him) - guess that a lot of people might decide to cook in the suites therefore may not be a lot of call for a full catering service. It was close to all the parks etc and a few shops nearby. There was construction going on next door and our balcony faced this, and could be a little noisy in the morning, but it was fascinating to watch them planting large palm trees!! There was some noise in the corridors on a couple of occasions, children running along and shouting, but you do get that most places. Overall we found Floridays very comfortable and for the price very good value for money - a hotel room would not cost much less and you only get the one room - it was just lovely to have the space and would recommend Floridays to anyone who wanted a base for the parks, with a bar for drinks, good location,(the further north on IDrive you are the more congested it becomes and Floridays is at the quieter end of IDrive) decent pool and comfortable bed to collapse into after a long day at the parks. We would go there again if we chose to holiday in Orlando in the future. We would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A different perspective”
Reviews.Author: atredfish
Reviews.Content: Well, let me start out by saying how much my husband and I love this resort, so much so this was our second visit in six months. We rebooked here based on the superior hospitality we received the last time we came.pon arrival I knew I wanted a suite in building C, this was where we were last time overlooking the pond and It was fantastic. There were no rooms available there and we were put into building D overlooking the pond and small pool. This location turned out to be even better than our original booking, It was so quiet and we were able to view the fireworks from Disneyworld from our balcony in the evenings. The only downside was the new cheaper hotel that was just built next door that faces Floridays, that obstructs all of your view to the south of you now. My husband and I would spend many late evenings on our balcony watching the tenants from that hotel sneak over to use the Floridays pool. The room service was our biggest complaint. Again, we were not used to this as our first time there we felt so pampered. We went 4 days with no new toiletries. I ended up having to go down to ask the woman at the desk for some. Our beds were never made, we had to ask for fresh towels after 3 days, the closet door knob in the spare room fell off when I opened It. There were urine stains on the toilet seat when we first checked in and strange stains on the walls in the second bathroom that I ended up removing myself. If you are planning on using the I Trolley to commute throughout the day you will be risking your lives trying to cross the street to catch It. There are no pedestrian crossings or lights, stop signs or anything to assist you. The most ironic thing about our stay was given the lack of room cleaning from housekeeping, they had the nerve to call me in my room on our departure morning at 9am to ask what time we would be out so that they could clean the room for the next group. There are so many other beautiful resorts going up in the area, I think It may be time to try something else for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Tracy926
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. We have previously stayed at other resorts at Disney and would highly recommend staying here instead. The rooms are bigger, have full kitchens, and washer and dryers. We are a family of 5 and stayed in a 2 bedroom condo. We were not on top of each other like we would have been a regular hotel. The price was cheaper than alot of the hotels in the area. Pool was very nice. Rooms were new and clean. Beautiful decor. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The two sides of Floridays”
Reviews.Author: JFish07
Reviews.Content: Date: August 5, 2007 Six of us spent 8 days at Floridays. Building C. The plus side, Great location, clean , well manicured grounds. Polite staff. plenty of parking. Great looking main pool area. Nice rooms. Good rates. The minus side, Noise, and lots of it, open corridors, pool areas much too small and always crowded. Housekeepers did not show up for last 2 days of our stay. Handicapped parking is a free-for-all. You have to call the front desk for everything from towels to toilet tissue. Did I mention noise? It's too bad this place really does not have it all together, it could be great but it settles for much less,

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: FERG12
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't been covered already? We were at the resort from the 13th thru 27th July 2007. We had booked through our timeshare exchange company (Interval International) but as they could only offer sunday - sunday weeks at the time we booked and we wanted to do Friday - Friday, we booked a couple of extra nights directly with the resort to add to the start of our exchange and left a couple of days before our exchange was up. The resort sorted it all so that we had the same 2 bedroomed condo for the full 2 weeks of our stay which, as anyone who exchanges regularly, may know is not always possible. We were really grateful for that. We loved the pool area and never had a problem getting a sunbed or chair. The hotel provide towels for use at the pool and once, when we went for a quick swim at about 5pm they were out of towels, but it was no big deal. We always made sure that when we were leaving we put our used towels in the bins provided. Maybe that's why people think the sunbeds are in use but maybe folks just haven't bothered to dispose of their used towels. The poolside bar and small store were great and the take-out food there is very tasty and good value. It would have been useful to have provided a menu in each condo. Saves you trying to remember what was on offer if you want to have one of your party do a take -out run! We were in building E which is right next to the small pool but our family prefered the 5 minute walk to the main pool as we liked the atmosphere there but if total peace and quiet is what you're after, the small pool seemed to hardly ever get used. What maid service you get seems to depend on whether you're there as a timeshare exchange or you've made reservations directly with the resort. Either way, you should get your beds made, clean towels and removal of trash daily with clean sheets every third day. (It tells you on the card that comes with your room keys so if there are any issues, it's all there in print what to expect.) You have to pay extra if you want your bathrooms cleaned, vacuming etc. There's a vacume cleaner provided but no cleaning materials. Provision of dishwasher soap, laundry soap etc. was a bit eratic. There was a supply when we arrived and we bought a supply of laundry soap at the grocery store but I kept forgetting to pick up dishwasher soap. Some days the maid left some more and some days she didn't. I'd say better to take/buy your own. There is a hairdryer in the master bath (I assume there's one in the other bath too but I never looked as our boys didn't need one!) and it's perfectly fine so if your not too fussy, don't bother packing your own. There's no full length mirror anywhere (sorry! it's a girl thing!) but the hairdryer is right in front of the mirror so at long last, hotels are starting to get the details right! I've seen lots of posts about some buildings being better than others but I wouldn't get too worried about where you're allocated. Even building F, which is farthest from the reception, is only a 5 minute walk from the main pool and parking is throughout the resort so you should be able to park at each individual building. Hope I didn't get too bogged down in the details but was trying to cover some of the stuff that hadn't been mentioned in other recent posts that others might find useful. All in all, we loved the place and will definitely return when we next visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: jourdansmom97
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 visited the Floridays for 5 nights and we were all pleasantly suprised. The kids loved it! We stayed in a 2 bdrm/2 bth which was great when you have children. Everything you needed was provided. Housekeeping was very prompt and accomodating. If you are looking for a full service type hotel, this would not be the place for you. However, trash was emptied daily and fresh towels were provided each day. The grounds were nicely kept and the pool area was really nice. The kids preferred to be at the pool more than the parks! All staff were very friendly. There is a small gameroom on the grounds that was small, but the kids didn't seem to mind. We stayed in building A and I suggest you request one of the buildings close to the front. We were told by the staff that the back pool area will be extended and have slides added. We would definitely stay here again when we visit the Orlando area. The only down side to our stay was not being able to thoroughly enjoy the patio because we were on the first floor and on the lake and the mosquitos were really bad. However the 37 in plasma TV made up for it. I truly recommend this resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jeni_31
Reviews.Content: Just back from our first ever family holiday to Florida ( very sad to leave!!!) We booked the Floridays resort after reading the many positive reviews on trip advisor and this is why in turn I feel obligated to write my own review as someone who has nothing to gain but only to recommend this fantastic condo hotel for others to consider and enjoy as much as we did!! As we have 2 children we booked a two bed condo which was spacious, beautifully decorated and had just about everything you would ever need and more in the kitchen! We were on the 1st floor of building 'C' overlooking the lake - beautiful :) I had read on some other reviews about the lack of sun loungers etc at the pool but thankfully we did not experience this at all. The resort itself is ideally placed for everywhere by car - Disney, universal, seaworld, Premium outlets, good restaurants etc but still manages to be in a private, quiet location. The only slight nag i had was after one long day at a park we came back to find that there had been no maid service at all - normally would't mind a little blip like that but it was on a 3rd day ( when bed linen gets changed) and i was looking forward to a leisurely bath in the jacussi and then jumping into nice clean sheets! I rang reception to inform them and they could not have been more apologetic sending someone round straight away with clean towels and to empty the bins and arranged a full service clean the next day for the inconvenience caused - excellent customer service. Will definately stay in the Floridays resort again on our next trip ( which if i can talk my hubby into it will be next year ;) Jenny - Northern Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: kublaicat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Orlando, 5 nights at Floridays. We stayed in building A and did the Sunday -Thursday special rate that Floridays offers on their website. Pool was perfect for children, zero entry access so that even our 2 1/2 year old could run in and out of pool without assistance. Condo was spacious, clean and quiet. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape!”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_TexasSuzy
Reviews.Content: Perfect for families visiting disney! We have 4 kids under 8 and they loved the pool! The bedrooms are split so we had privacy from them in thier bedroom(that had 2 full beds) and kitchen was a plus, i came home w/clean clothes(a first) and less stress. Driving to Disney could have been made very very simple but concierge gave us mapquest direction w/out street names...basically if you see a entrance sign of "disney" w/no street sig n or directional sign TURN there anyways!!! Tou will get there! Also Floroidays has Starbucks, good food and small but fun gameroom for kiddos.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: jill401
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a good deal for a 2-night stay and found Floridays. Our rate (about $120) for a 2-bedroom condo was comparable to some of the nicer Orlando hotels, such as Embassy Suites. Our friends who were also visiting Orlando had a deal ($99/night) to stay at the Marriott Cypress Harbor about a half-mile away, but they had to listen to the timeshare pitch. Our room at Floridays was much nicer! The amenities were pretty basic for a "resort" but it was fine by us, since we spent most of our time at the theme parks. If you plan to spend time at the large pool with the kids' amenities, request Building B or C. The condo was clean, nicely decorated, well-supplied and very well laid-out. A family could easily spend a week here without tripping over each other. Each bedroom had its own bathroom, which is very convenient. There was a full kitchen, with everything you need to cook, as well as a washer/dryer. The location is fairly central to all the Orlando parks and attractions. You will need a car, however. It took us 15 minutes to get to Disney and to Universal. A tip - traffic planning is a foreign concept in Orange County! Streets go unnamed, get renamed without warning, turn suddenly into toll roads, etc; a GPS unit is a plus! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Floridays was Great For Family of 7”
Reviews.Author: DestinyNewMexico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Floridays for a 5 day Disney/surrounding area vacation. We stayed in the 3 bedroom/2 bath which had a very homey feeling after long days at the parks. We chose Orlando as our vacation destination this summer due to the great condo accommodations and price for a family of 7 - we wanted to be together but not in several hotel rooms that would have cost much more. This was perfect for us. Great pool area especially for little ones. The main concierge is very helpful; however, the others misdirected us on restaurants and locations sending us miles whenever just around the corner were numerous great dining choices. Yes, there was construction going on next door (looks like another great condo to open soon!), but we were always early to rise to begin our day anyway. The condo was clean, maid service could use some improvement - washcloths daily without special request would have been great! The location was absolutely perfect for our trip, wish there were more condos like this to stay at in all resort cities of the U.S. The kids can't wait to go back next year - a new SeaWorld waterpark to open Spring'08 is just down the road from Floridays also!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: rtruschi
Reviews.Content: Loved the space, had a 2 bedroom suite! Everything you could possibly need. Whirlpool tub was wonderful!! The only complaint was that the pools closed at 11PM and my kids like to stay up later, so they were a little disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KerryNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our daughter, son-in-law and two-year-old grandson, spent two nights at Floridays (June 26-28, 2007). We had a two-bedroom apartment, and it was perfect-very clean and well-appointed! The best we've ever had in Orlando.The towels were even somehow folded to look like baskets! The apartment was fully equipped, right down to a fly swatter! (which we never needed)! We enjoyed having a washer and dryer right in the apartment, and we particularly enjoyed sitting out on our balcony overlooking the lake and large pool. We had planned to go to Disney World for a day, but instead chose to stay where we were. Our grandson probably had more fun at the pool at Floridays, which is perfectly designed with young children in mind, as well as much larger than most resort pools. There is also a second pool, which is more for adults and located in a different part of the resort. The price was very reasonable, and we were very pleased with our choice. Floridays is located a ways out on International Drive, so it is easier to have a car, although they do have shuttle service. Also, there is no restaurant, but there is a bar and cafe, and both Publix and Walgreens are located within walking distance. I would recommend that guests ask for Bldg B or C, with a view of the pool or lake/pool. We stayed in C, but we noticed that if we had been in D, we would have had to cross a parking lot to get to the pool and the view was of the parking lot! We would recommend Floridays to anyone, but it is especially good for families.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the property but...”
Reviews.Author: HowfarNewton_Ma_
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 nights at the Floridays Resort. The property is nicely maintained with very nice rooms, great pool for the family and good location to all the parks. However 2 areas need improvement. If you don't know the area, the concierges are not very helpful other than to buy attraction tickets. They should be more knowledgable about the Orlando area. One was using Google to search for restaurants to recommend. The daily room "refresh' service was overlooked twice. We had to call often to get fresh towels on those 2 occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: murphinky
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the good reviews about this resort, I booked five nights June 24-29, 2007 for $150 a night through the floridays resort website. We stayed in Bldg. B which is the closest to the pool. We had a two bedroom for my husband, our 15 mth old baby, and myself so there was plenty of room. The kitchen was nice. I think it had most everything you could need except for the fact that I couldn't locate any potholders or dishtowels. So I resorted to using a washcloth for a potholder. Daily housekeeping was supposed to be provided, however, we had one day that we received no such service. Another day, we received fresh towels, but no washcloths. Not a big deal, just had to call and request some. I guess with a new place I expected it to be a little bit cleaner. The floor was the only thing I noticed was rather dirty, but that is pretty typical with most hotels. With a baby crawling around on the floor, I frequently had to clean his black feet from the dirty floor. On a positive note, the master bath is huge and has a large hot tub. My baby loved it and thought it was his own personal pool. There is a lot of construction going on from the neighboring resort. The fire alarms were being tested one day and the alarms were ringing all day long which was pretty annoying, but wasn't Floridays fault at all. The pool area was very nice and never crowded although the water was very cold. And the "hot tub" was no warmer than the pool water. All of the staff we encountered were very nice and friendly. The location of the resort is on International Drive, but at the more remote end closest to Disney. Very good location, midway between Disney and Universal. There is a McDonalds, Publix, and a large mall nearby. Overall, we had a nice time and would probably go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Superb! Great location for Disney/Seaworld vacationers!”
Reviews.Author: vac8tions
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of April for 6 nights/7days. We couldn't of been more pleased! The grounds are well kept and staff was very friendly and helpful and a conciere is available in the hotel lobby. The room was immaculate with maid service everyday and fresh linens every 3rd day of your stay. We were in a 2 bedroom suite which had split bedrooms with 2 full baths (master had a jaccuzzi and seperate stand up shower) We had our own laundry in our room so it was as comfortable as home to us. The other best thing was the awsome location-it is situated 2-3 miles from Disney's main gate and 2 miles to Seaworld which was perfect for our family vacation. We drove our own car and spent most of our time at Disney and Seaworld and then we would come back in the evenings for a swim. There are 3 pools-we used the main pool which was beautiful with a bar alongside the pool gates along with a little store, fitness room and hotel lobby. The pool was surrounded by palm trees and the water was like bath water-96 degrees-wonderfully refreshing and yet not cold-like somthing you had to "adjust" to-even in the evenings from 8 to 10 pm! This was a wonderful vacation and a very nice hotel that my family of 4 would highly reccommed to anyone! It was well worth the money. There is a great place to eat pizza closeby called Flippers pizza - AWESOME pizza. Set up more for carry out-it's small and gets a little crowded-they do have a few seats indoors and outdoor seating is available as well. Hope this helps anyone who is cosidering a Disney/Seaworld vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Sooooooo great!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bruiserjohnson
Reviews.Content: This was such a fabulous hotel/condo and such a great deal! We had a 2 bedroom. My husband and I were traveling with our 18 month old son. It was wonderful to have all of the space to lounge around. The pool was spectacular for little ones with all of the different waterscapes. The hotel food was great too and it was nice to have the little market at the hotel as well. It was located close to all of the amusement parks. We booked a special online that included the room and amusement park tickets which was a great deal. I am a 5 star resort kind of gal and this definately was 5 star all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family fun!”
Reviews.Author: JeffFL
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place near the Magic Kingdom that could accomodate 6 adults and three 6 year olds - Floridays was one of the choices, and a good one at that - Our three bedroom unit was in the B building, and close to the pool - Everything was as shown on the website and in the brochure, except we thought that there was a bathtub in the 2nd bathroom, and instead it was a walkin shower - Not a big deal! Extra towels came within minutes of our request - kitchen was well equipped, and for the price, the rooms were far superior to many of the Disney hotels - pool was somewhat crowded, and it could be that they need a second large pool! Otherwise, will recommend it to other family members! Outback, McDonalds,Walgreens and a Publix within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Floridays Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: spiceyred812
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at Floridays Orlando Resort. Thanks tripadvisor for all of your in put! We had no problems finding Floridays. (again, thanks tripadvisor) No problems checking in. (Luiz) was great! We were in builidng C. We were near the contruction noise. (Not a big issue.) Our room was very clean and it was quiet. We always met someone new daily at the pool which was warm by the way. We loved the fact that we had plenty of space. 2 bedrooms 2 bath. ( one for my hubby and me) and the other for 2 preteens. We didn't really cook, enjoyed going out to eat but it was nice to have the option to put things in the fridge or to heat something up if needed. We received fresh towels daily and trash was emptied daily as well. No problems with feeling unsafe. The beds were decent. In general we were very pleased and would return to Floridays again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay for business and Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: themeparkfan2005
Reviews.Content: After seeing all the good reviews at Floridays, I decided to give the place a chance and I am glad that I did. I took my family with me ,and the kids and wife went to Universal while I did my business. They have bus's that take you to the park certain times of the day. Our villa was a 2 bedroom in building C. Great location as the pool is just a short walk away and you don't get the noise from the pool while in your room. After seeing some reviews on the rooms being dirty, I was pleasantly surprised as our room was clean. I talked to other guests and nobody complained about dirty rooms. Give them a break the place is new!. They give you a choice of upgrading your maid service when you check in but we just went with the standard service . With standard you don't get daily maid service but they come a few times a week. There is some construction on the road in front but it was nothing to bother our stay. The pool is great and they have a game room for kids, exercise room and a bar outside by the pool. Also a small store where you can get sandwiches and supplies. Publix is also just around the corner so I advise going there to stock up the kitchen before you check in. Would definately come back and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great value for families”
Reviews.Author: MichiganEmma
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five: 14 year old twins and a 7 year old, and we stayed at Floridays for 5 nights in June. I booked my stay based upon good reviews from trip advisor, and I was not dissappointed. As other posts have said, this is not a hotel with top notch restaurants and room service, but it is PERFECT for families who wish to have some space of their own and don't want to eat every meal out. I loved being able to wake up and make my own pot of coffee, turn on the morning news, and let my kids have their cereal and bagels without rushing out the door to a sit down breakfast where I would spend $60. The grocery store was conveniently located, the parks were all 10-15 minutes away, and the pool was beautiful and large. As for the no heat on weekdays, it was 91 degrees when we were there, so the pool was still quite warm, and very refreshing after hiking around the parks each day. The rooms were nicely appointed and LARGE. We stayed in building B, a short walk to the pool. We had a 3 bedroom, and I liked that the master suite was separated from the other two bedrooms. Our rate was 189/night for weekdays, and I think 210/night for weekends...a BARGAIN compared to the cramped Disney hotels. I also wanted to mention that the staff were very accomodating. We were able to check in EARLY at 1100 am, when check-in wasn't until 4pm. Also, our flight out was 7pm, and we were allowed to check out late, at 4 pm! We were thrilled, because we could go to the parks, come back and swim, then shower before checking out our last day. I know that they can't always do this, but it worked out well for us. I would highly recommend Floridays for any family larger than 4, or larger groups. Oh, and one more thing. The small deli/poolside restaurant food was awesome, I had a chicken enchilada that was delicious, and my kids had the personal pizzas. You can sit poolside in a shady cabana area and watch your kids swim while you have a margarita!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, if you have realistic expectations...”
Reviews.Author: FlGirlinVA
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel about 3 months ago based on the reviews on this website and was very pleased with my overall stay. Everyone I dealt with was very nice, both on the phone and in person. We were in building E which was far from the main pool, but had it's own smaller pool. We stayed in a 3 bedroom which fit our family nicely .The room was nice, clean and comfortable. We were able to stock the fridge with breakfast so that we could be a t the parks early. Here's the main thing. If you are like most people who visit Orlando, you plan to spend most of your days at theme parks, and only hit the hotel to sleep and maybe swim a little, if that is your plan, this place is GREAT and you will not be disappointed! If you are looking for world class service and dining, stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Just a 3 bed condo.............”
Reviews.Author: timeforfun247
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree with some of the previous reviewers that this place is overated, these are simply blocks of 2 or 3 bed condos with a pool and no real onsite eating options - I would struggle to class this as a resort.. you must be prepared to cook or get in the car when you want to eat. The 'resort' is still under construction, the entrance from the main road is temporary with road-works going on in front of the buildings. The Fountains next door is having major building work which we could hear from 7 am Monday to Friday, we were woken each morning from the 'beep beep beep' of trucks reversing etc. The apartments are new, huge, well equipped and on first inspection very nice, although as previous people have noted the finish is poor. Lights not working, sink wouldn't drain, ill fitting doors etc......Fine for a holiday but I wouldn't like to be an owner. Housekeeping is 'light-touch', which was adequate - beds made and towels changed. What I didn't like much was from our building B the short walk to the main pool was through the car park. The main pool, which again looks very nice especially for children, zero entry with fountains etc was only heated at the weekend! This pool is alongside the carpark (no big trees to shield it) which is adjacent to the building works next door - we were there during a windy week and dust constantly blew over the pool area and our car was covered in dust everyday. There is a pool bar for lunch and drinks and a small store, which sells a few cereals, crisps and coffee - it shuts early. The business centre is good and the staff were all very nice. I did not notice any security and in theory anyone could come in and use the pool or wander around the apartments. These units are at the far end of International drive south, near the premium outlets and Hilton Grand vacation club. There is a walgreens, Publix supermarket and Outback steakhouse 5 mins away. My feeling is that in a year or so when more in the area is completed it will be a very nice place to stay but at present no-where is finished and it feels a little bit soul-less. Having stayed in both hotels and condos, I think that I am not really a 'condo-girl' although I love the space, I don't really like having to stock up on groceries on holiday to cook meals etc. I prefer the atmosphere of a hotel with the onsite facilities and daily housekeeping. Although if space is a priority then this place is good for the dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious,Clean,Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Lope43
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay in a 3 bedroom unit. We had 2 adults and 8 girls all age 16! It was a Sweet 16 weekend and it was perfect. We were in an end unit in building B. Off of our balcony we had a pond with a water fountain and out the windows we could see the main pool. I am not sure what other people expected when staying here and why they were unhappy. The property is brand new so everything is very clean and new. The kitchen is fully stocked with anything you would need. We had plenty of dishes for our large group. We asked for extra towels and they came right away. Each bedroom had a nice tv with many channels and the livining room had a dvd/cd player and the girls sat comfortably to watch a movie. The extra mirror in the dining area came in handy with all of the girls getting ready. There is no maid service...they only took out the garbage and pulled up the covers on the beds. There is a washer and dryer and it came in handy when we all got soaked in the rain at Disney World! We enjoyed the pool and the large hot tub. There is a Publix grocery and a Walgreens pharmacy just a minute down the road. Also Subway is there too and it was a great stop for a late night bite. I shopped around since we had a large group and we had to be all in one room for supervision and the rate was an excellent value! This property is very quiet with no activities. The entrance is hard to see the first time, but then you know where it is and to look out for it after that. There is constuction going on next to this property but it never bothered us. We did not deal with the staff other that to get towels. The room looks exactly as it is on the website pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor Right Again!”
Reviews.Author: A_and_B_from_PA
Reviews.Content: Spent seven nights at Floridays in late May, 2007 based upon the fine reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. Our party included two adults (age 42) and three young adults (two age 20 and one age 16). WHAT WE LIKED... Floridays is still being built, though there was no active construction when we were there. It is already fairly large, situated just south of SeaWorld on International Drive. I drove to Magic Kingdom parking lot in exactly 10 minutes. It is a very nice location (outlets, drugstore, grocery store very close). We were in Building 'A' and that worked well. We rented a two-bedroom unit and found it to be plenty big enough even for five grown ups. Bedrooms: The master bath had a king-sized bed and a fine walk-in bathroom that included a decent jacuzzi type bath tub. The second bedroom featured two queens and there was a second bathroom right around the corner. Both bedrooms had nice, large TVs with plenty of channels to choose from. Living/Dining: The living area had a comfortable couch and sitting chair and a fine flat-screen TV with a DVD player. The dining area included a nice, large dining table, full refrigerator/freezer, stove, microwave, plenty of shelves and all the utensils you could wish for. There was also a very small deck on the back. Misc.: The suite included a washer/dryer, a full dishwasher and a sweeper along of course with all needed towels and linens. We found the fitness room to be quite a bit better than the typical hotel. The equipment was new and worked well and there were two TVs. WHAT COULD'VE BEEN BETTER The resort doesn't feature a whole lot to do other than a fair-sized pool and hot tub. I also like a warm pool and this one wasn't heated during the week. Only on the weekend. Unlike some other places we have stayed in Orlando, there was no complimentary food or drinks of any type and there wasn't much food on site. A very nice Publix is very close. We also had more than one burned out lightbulb waiting for us and the concierge service was poor in my opinion. There was only one person helping folks even on a crowded Memorial Day weekend and they didn't have a quick, easy list of packages and options.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Driscoll2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and two boy's (ages 1 & 5) stayed at the Floridays Resort from May 20th until May 25th for a Disney Vacation. We found this resort to be very clean and very convenient to the parks. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. It was beautiful and fairly new! My older son loved the Jacuzzi in the master bedroom! We were located in building C. Would rather of had a room with a pool view. We tried to get our room changed, but I guess those rooms were booked for the week. The main pool was terrific. Contrary to the past reviews I read, there was always plenty of poolside chairs. The staff in the reception area and in the deli area seemed very inexperienced. But all in all the service was ok. But for the $$ this is a wonderful place to stay outside of Disney. I would highly recommend this to anyone with small children. It was a pleasure not having the 4 of us crammed into a 1 small hotel room. The outlet mall is 1/2 mile down the road and has every store imaginable! We will be back someday and will surely consider FLORIDAY's again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, but bargin workmanship.”
Reviews.Author: MacTavish
Reviews.Content: This is a okay place for the money if you're simply looking for multiple bedrooms, kitchen facilities, and a quiet location on International Drive. We still nodding our heads wondering why the rating are so high. It doesn't make any sense to us. Thankfully we only needed to stay two nights, just long enough for our "real" vacation resort to become available. As a note, we booked this vacation on short notice. Please keep in mind when reading this review, that we are not "picky people" when it comes to the small stuff. We understand that we're only staying a short period of time and others have come before us, and others will certainly come after us. We feel it is important to help those that are considering a stay after us, accurate reviews have always helped us (except this time) and we'd like to provide the same for others. Our experience is this...my wife and I were traveling with our daughter, my mother, and our aupair. We rented a 2 bedroom villa. The room we were initially assigned wasn't cleaned from the previous guests. It took about an hour to discover that though...everything looked okay until we unpacked and decided to have a bite to eat and use the facilities. Not good. Although one call and we were moved to another room. It was a bit of a pain, but worth it. Oddly the new room was wider - it was the same unit per say - but noticibly wider. The original unit was bldg D and the new unit was bldg C. Weird. BTW, the "D" bldg has a view of construction equipment and the balconies have concrete walls, not railings. The new room was a ground floor unit in bldg C. The lock on the sliding door did not work. A simple call to the desk and in two minutes it was fixed. That was nice. The people are nice. The pool is also nice. The playroom for children is basic, although much of it is broken. p.s. A few noteworthy mentions regarding quality. Keep in mind that these units are very new! Some examples are: cabinent doors falling off, lights flickering, lights sporitically working, sliding doors not locking, broken coffee maker, etc. Many of these things can be repaired with a phillips screwdriver. They should invest in one. We will NOT return to this place. We hope this review helps you in your decision. Happy vacationing and enjoy Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: beachtraveler1111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays resort for 3 nights in May of 2007. While it was clean and comfortable we felt it was overrated. It's a new property and still under construction. We felt that the quality of the units wasn't as high as we expected based on the reviews, and that in a few years when it's gotten some use it won't be nearly as nice. Housekeeping was spotty: some days they emtpied the garbage and did the dishes, other days they didn't. It's hard to find the entrance to this property right now because of road construction (you don't see the sign until you're almost past it) and we thought they could warn guests better when asking for directions. Nice pool facilities for kids though. Overall, I wouldn't rate them anything particularly special, just average but new.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: JOJOFtMyers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort for the weekend with my family and had a three bedroom suite. My three sisters and their girlfriends came to town and we had an awesome time. The rooms were very clean and the location is so close to everything which made it convenient to go to the parks and shops on I Drive. The pool was also great!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: FaLei
Reviews.Content: We went to the Floridays during April vacation - after a long drive from Massachusetts it was a dream to finally arrive here. Everything was great. The service was awesome. The pool was really fun for us all, we had our three children and my parents with us. Kids of all ages (our are 8, 3 and 8 months) and adults will love the pool. Try to get a room near the pool if not there are employees driving around on lil golf carts asking if you'd like a ride. Its close enough to I-drive and all the tourists spots, yet quiet. Right next door is a walgreens, and down a lil are the outlets and a # of restaurants. Its only about 5 mins from Seaworld. Would def. come back again, it truly felt like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: IN_Roadrunner007
Reviews.Content: This place is BEAUTIFUL!! Everything looked brand-new. We had a 2 bedroom suite it had everything we needed. Very clean. Pool and spa area was very clean and well stocked. Downside: there was a lot of construction happening at the neighboring resort and construction started around 7:30 a.m. with a lot of noise. Mattress was "okay"; I've had better, more softer bedding at a cheaper hotel. Hopefully they will upgrade the mattresses. Hot tub was very relaxing; washer/dryer in unit very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: paige_ssi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Floridays with my mother and 5 girlfriends for my bachelorette weekend May 18-20. The condo had everything in it that we needed (even a wine bottle opener!), and there was virtually no noise. We were in Bldg B, the second floor. There was plenty of room for all of us in the 3-bedroom and I would definitely stay there again. It IS sort of a distance from the "stuff" on Int'l Drive, so I'd recommend a car instead of trying to walk, for sure. Two of the girls needed a cab to the airport at 5 am Sunday morning and the resort arranged it. It was very appreciated. I absolutely recommend the Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: MicheleLubbock
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and was a little nervous because I had never heard anything about Floridays. I was looking for a two bedroom room as we had my parents, my 5 year old daughter, and my husband and I. I figured that it was new so it had to clean clean. I am very picky. I was pleasantly suprised. The rooms were very large. It was a great place to stay if you have a large family. They replaced our towels and shampoo every day and made the beds. They do not clean the suite during your stay however but it was a bargain and right in the middle of everything... For $159 plus tax for a two bedroom condo that would sleep 5 comfortably, this was a great deal. The facility is about a year old. The pool is great for kids and very warm. The only negative comment I have is that the condos are built to look good and not necessarily built to last. I can see the facility needing a facelift in about a year or two. However, if you are planning to go in the next year, this is an ideal location that is clean with a great pool and is really cheap. Almost too good to be true given the high cost of other places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Springerhog
Reviews.Content: We decided to try the Floridays Orlando Resort based on Tripadvisor reviews. Well, we weren't disappointed. Without a doubt, the best deal in Orlando! Great room, super clean property and pools. We booked our room through the resort's own web site and got a great deal at around $158 per night for a two bedroom suite. The staff was wonderful and very professional. The washer and dryer in the room were perfect, especially since we had packed lightly for our motorcycle trip. We only had time to visit one amusement park (i.e., Epcot), but the property was only about 9-10 minutes away. Plenty of shops, markets and restaurants nearby. The next time we visit Orlando, we'll definitely stay at the Floridays Orlando Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Sunbathers”
Reviews.Author: LRazz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 3 year old son and mother in law for a Florida vacation. I am very picky about accomodations and did a lot of research before choosing Floridays. The 2 bedroom condo was very clean and well as the grounds. It was an overall nice place to stay. I love laying by the pool in the sun. The problem with this resort is they DO NOT have enough lounge chairs. They have too many tables and regular chairs by the pool. Who wants to sit in a regular chair by the pool. Most people want to lay in the sun. Some people were forced to lay their towels on the cement.. You better get to the pool early to save a lounge chair!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: jkeister
Reviews.Content: After reading the numerous reviews we picked The Floridays for our week stay in Orlando - I am pretty picky about clean accommodations & I was very pleased with our 2br condo - they made our beds & replaced towels everyday & replaced soaps & cleaners when we needed more - I found the location was ideal for Disney - received AAA discount - great deal for $151- would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful place but a few kinks to work out...”
Reviews.Author: ATS4905
Reviews.Content: Me, My Mother and my 2 year old daughter stayed here from April 14th thru April 20th. Overall, I highly recommend with just a few concerns.
