You really can't go wrong for the price - $163 a night for a 2 bedroom. Close to SeaWorld, Disney, etc. Definitely take the kids to Joe's Crab Shack. They'll have a blast and the food is great! Back to the resort...it is clean, well designed, the pool was warm and clean and fun for kids and adults. I didn't expect extensive housecleaning, so I was satisfied with the service we received. Always had clean towels and made up beds. They even loaded and ran the dishwasher for me the first day! The negatives... I have to agree with another reviewer... I, too, arrived around the same time as the prom kids and they were obnoxious and rowdy. I was quite shocked that the resort would even offer them rooms, considering the "family" atmosphere. It was very noisy and security was inadequate. After spending Sat. & Sun. in Bldg. A, I asked to be moved come Monday because the construction noise was disturbing. They moved us to the other side of Bldg. A facing a vacant lot. It was much quieter. The biggest peeve was that I booked a crib over a month in advance but was told when I arrived that there were none available and 6 people ahead of me waiting for one. The next day they brought me a pack & play. While I was moving to the other room two days later, I saw a crib in a utility closet not being used. I called the front desk and they had it delivered to me but they were surprised it was there. Communication could be better. I also have to agree with other reviewers that lounge chairs by the pool were in short supply. All of the chairs were always reserved with towels but I found it interesting that there were never as many people by the pool as there were towels on chairs. My feeling is that people came down first thing in the AM, plopped their towel on their chair, and left. Overall, I feel you get alot of bang for your buck at this resort but be prepared for little inconveniences. We had a great time. One thing I wish I didn't do. Don't take a 2 year old to Disney any time soon. Mine couldn't take the 45-60 minute lines for rides and the crowds were insane. SeaWorld was a hit.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but hard to find from Disney”
Reviews.Author: PurceyFamily
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four. Two adults and two children. We really enjoyed all of the room we received for the price we paid. Don't forget to ask for your AAA discount. Everything you could use is in the kitchen. Except a sponge or dishrag. There are kitchen towels. Before we came I had read that the maid service wasn't that great. They actually only go in to make beds and refresh towels. That was fine they did a great job. They provided dish detergent and even a little laundry detergent. They did not provide windex and they have a glassed top dining table. So, if you tried to wipe it down it never really looked clean. I thought they would windex it if I removed everything from the table but they didn't so we had a streaked table because I wasn't buying windex for our short stay. I loved having the washer and dryer right there in the place. Lint remover is on the back of the inside of the dryer--look closey and you'll see the part to pull out. We could never find our way back to Floridays from Disney. We went to Disney--United Kingdom three times and each time got completey lost. At night we were tired and it just never seemed simple. When we left during they day we had a bit of an easier time but still got lost. Even the directions that the front desk gave us never got us right to Floridays. So..............not finding our way back (just from Disney) was our biggest problem with our stay and would probably find another place next time just because of that-but only if we were going to Disney again. Finding our way to SeaWorld was no problem and I think if we went to Universal we would have no problem as well. Pool was nice. Plenty of nice big towels. Water temp. was perfect. Good drinks at the bar. There is no connection from the buildings to the pool. You have to go down your elevator back out to the parking lot and walk to the pool. We really enjoyed our stay. I would recommend. Just would cross my finger for you that you would find your way back from Disney. I wonder if anyone else had our directions problems? Maybe it was us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: JMGRNEYZ
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience staying at this location, suites were very comfortable, very clean and stocked with everything you could need even for an extended vacation stay. Full kitchen was equipped with a full size stove with oven (bake wear inside it), cabinets contained everything needed to cook nearly anything (even a cheese grater). Master bathroom was huge, whirlpool tub and separate shower, granite counters and windowsills. The beds were comfortable; we appreciated the separate sleeping bedrooms for the kids and adults. Buildings are shaped like squared off letter “C’s, each with a lush center courtyard with abundant landscaping and tall palm trees. Corridors were open, facing the center courtyards. Terraces faced the 3 outer sides of each building, some having parking lot views, others having pool or pond views. We had no terrace door lock issues and could find no fault with our 6th floor suite. There are actually 3 pools on property, one being the main pool (seen in the resort photos) then there was a smaller pool (cool dip pool with fountain) just adjacent to the main pool and another fairly large pool across from Block C and behind block D. Both pool areas each have a hot tub. Each building has suites with available views of the 3 large ponds, each of which has water fountains. The pool areas were immaculate, water was very comfortable, towels were plentiful and there was a show for children that went on for over 3 hrs poolside Saturday afternoon (games and prizes for the children). Construction next door (The Fountains) might be an issue for north facing suites in building D but other then that we could hear nothing from our Building C. I would highly recommend Floridays Resort and personally, after being spoiled by what is basically a full condo, I will never look at a hotel suite the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great for small kids”
Reviews.Author: go_away_quick
Reviews.Content: For families with the small kids it's a great place to stay. Please note - we had our own car and were able to drive around. If you are thinking of using the shuttle - please call hotel and ask about it. First of all - heated zero-entrance pool which means I was able to leave my 2 years old and 4 years old to splash all by themselves in the shallow end of the pool and watch them while I was sitting in the chair. It has all kind of sprinkles and fountains for kids that love to play with the water. Pool was open till 11 pm so we were able to let kids play after the day in the parks for several minutes. They also allow food in the pool area (no glass though) which is good for small kids that are constantly hungry. Plenty of towels - very good quality and very clean. 2 bedrooms apartment - separate bedroom for kids, separate bathroom for kids. Publix supermarket right around the corner - 1 minute drive. You can also walk there for about 15 minutes in case you need juice or chicken nuggets or some other stuff you forget to bring. 3 TV sets - one in each of the bedrooms, one in the living room. I was excited do not watch cartoons every morning - kids watched few minutes of the cartoons in their bedroom while I was preparing breakfast in the fully equipped kitchen. Added bonus - they had reasonable Sushi place near the supermarket so my husband and me were able to have a nice take out dinner at night. Apartment was about 1000 sq ft and a little cramped to my taste. Chairs and tables a little too big for the room. They also big on fake plants which I do not really like. Bathrooms and kitchen are very up-to-date. Granite counter tops everywhere, glass shower enclosure, jacuzzi. So to my great surprise we had a very relaxing vacation which with 2 and 4 year old kids is kind of hard to get.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Jiggythat
Reviews.Content: As with the previous positive reviews, me and the family had a fawless stay at Floridays, Stayed in Block C, which is very convienant for both pools, but does not have the noise associated with block B. There is construction taking place, but this is from the resort next door. Staff on the whole were friendly and helpful, a tip would be to call housekeeping rather then the front desk for any maintenance issues as we found this to be a far more responsive method. All the main shops are convienantly located as the resort is on the north end of the I drive so the more classy end in comparison to the south end. You will still however need a car to get to the parks although the resort does provide a shutlle service, sea world is a 20 minute walk away. One word of warning for those flying from the U.K, we flew with virgin on two occassions and found the service at best inconsistent and at worst poor, especially for a family orientated carrier, there was no family focus at all. Would definately suggest booking with alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: JJinMI
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an 8-day stay there. I would say it is a tremendous value for the money. A 3BR/2BA condo for $220 a night in a convenient location with a real nice pool. Clean and good, not great service. It is a timeshare, but we were never pressured in any way to buy. BUT, you have to iunderstand when staying at these types of places, they do not have the service mentality of actual 4 and 5 star hotels. Compared to another similarly priced/eqipped time-share resort we stayed at in Grand Cayman 2 yrs. ago, the service here was far and away better. Still, the night we checked in a woman guest was in the lobby throwing a hissy because her in-room coffee packets weren't replaced daily and she had stayed at 5-star resorts where they do that. Well, you won't get a 3BR condo at a 5-star reort for $220 per night either. And some 5-stars charge $6 for the mediocre in-room coffee. Sorry. The pool is wonderful, huge, a neat little shallow water park type set-up at one end. The poolside cafe/bar was great and I would not call it overpriced, though one of the bartenders was abit skimpy on the booze in a $7 drink, IMO. The furnishings in the rooms are kinda cheap hotel type stuff and the main living area was a bit cramped because the dining room table and chairs were a bit large for the room. Overall, WELL worth it. Would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Bachelorette Weekend to Remember!”
Reviews.Author: PaigeLO
Reviews.Content: I just got back from an unforgettable weekend in Orlando centered around Floridays Resort. I threw a bachelorette weekend here with 13 girls and we fit comfortably into the 3-bedroom suite. The only trouble we encountered were a noise complaint one night, so beware of thin walls, and a lack of lounge chairs at the pools. Other than these two tiny problems, the resort was amazing. We especially loved how large the condo was and the bathrooms were adequate for big parties as well. It was very nice having a big screen TV with a DVD player too. The Publix down the street was convenient and saved us a lot of money enabling us eat in. I reccommend this resort to large groups. We caught vans into City Walk and to Church Street and this was a fairly cheap service from Floridays!

Reviews.Title: “Watch When You Stay at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: AnAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Beware! Although this property had a great pool and spaciuos rooms, there was one incident that causes me to caution others about staying here. Our stay started out great. The pool was great. The food at the cafe was great. Our suite, in building B, was great. There were a couple of issues with noise levels. We could not lock our balcony door. The door just would not close enough so the clasp would lock. The windows are thin. We were up a few levels and could hear a conversation taking place in the vehicle below our room. We were unfortunate enough to stay here Saturday, April 14th. It seems one of the high schools had their prom that evening and kids were staying at the resort overnight. After a long day at the parks we were hoping for a peaceful evening. Well that did not happen. Starting at 10pm, numerous cars started arriving. At midnight, the party really started. Both inside the rooms and in the parking lots between the buildings. Again, the windows are thin and the noise levels were high. The kids were trucking speakers into various rooms. There were kids openly urinating in the parking lot. The next day, one guest had to clean his car because the kids were throwing cigarette butts onto his windshield from balconies. There were coolers being trucked into the rooms and it was openly visable that there were alcoholic beverages in those coolers. The legal age for drinking in FL is 21. These kids were definitely not 21. Management was aware of the problems because they sent "security" around - but this was only cursory. The parties, with load music and noise continued until 3am. The kids were revving their cars in the parking lots. That Saturday night was unbelievable. What would have been a fantastic stay was ruined. Was this a family oriented place? Not on that night. Filling the rooms was more important, not the comfort of the other guests. When discussed with the front desk the following morning, the only response was "sorry." With all of the other choices in the area, I will find it hard to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: penelope_13
Reviews.Content: We arrived here a few hours before check-in and were told there were no rooms but that we could sit by the pool or in the lobby area if we did not wish to leave the property. We did so and had a lovely time sitting at the pool bar for a couple of hours until they called us and gave us our room. The "room" was huge. It had an extraordinarily well outfitted kitchen, nice dining and living areas and 2 nice bedrooms. The king sized bed was quite comfortable and we noticed very little noise. The master bath was great with a jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The staff we interacted with were very friendly and helpful. We did have internet access in our room (with a borrowed cable) and we were not charged for it. We had a nice balcony but not the "pool view" we were supposed to have (it was more of a parking lot view) so that was a tad disappointing, but we were still able to enjoy the balcony. As others have pointed out there is limited housekeeping but we did get fresh towels each day & the bed tidied up, which was sufficient for us. The business center did seem small & pricey. The only other minor complaint would be the pool over by bldg E was small and not really very convenient. A bit of a letdown after seeing the main pool.

Reviews.Title: “B.Y.O.T.P.”
Reviews.Author: caroleg
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 days at Floridays in Orlando, Florida for our first trip to WDW. Our experience there was consistent with previous travelers who have reviewed the property. We were placed in building C with a view of a wooded lot, which afforded more privacy and tranquility compared to a pool or parking lot view. We had some maintenance issues that I feel should have been addressed before we arrived, such as fixing the lock on the sliding glass patio door, properly anchoring the hairdryers to the walls (one was dangling perilously over the sink and the other was still in the box in the cabinet), fixing a running toilet, replacing burnt out bulbs and broken lamps. We were perplexed by the housekeeping program there; despite tipping them, we never ended up with as many towels as we started with and one day they dripped liquid from the trash all over the floor without cleaning it up. Also, we were never certain if that raw sewage smell in the shower was created by some cleaning products. Finally, we requested a late check-out which they granted for an extra $75.00 to stay until 3:30 p.m., however, be advised that your hotel keys won't work after 1 p.m. Last but not least, they didn't replace the toilet paper and both bathrooms ran out. We shouldn't complain since we only paid $163.00 a night, but these annoyances can add up to really sour the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay for the $”
Reviews.Author: lowell62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridays for just one night during an unplanned spring vacation road trip, but would have happily spent another few nights if we'd had time. The suites provide nearly everything you will need, and the ability to run some laundry was a welcome bonus. Furnishings are quite nice, and bathroom is well stocked with toiletries and soft towels. We were a family of 3 and enjoyed although did not need all that space, a larger family or two small families could stay here quite comfortably at significant savings. We liked the pool and did not find it to be overly crowded even during a busy season; we did wish there was a hot tub for the cooler afternoon/early evening hours. Be sure to purchase food and beverages off-site, as the hotel shop is quite expensive. Our room had no noise issues, but we did ask for a room situated away from the nearby construction project. All in all this hotel is a great find and should please most guests.

Reviews.Title: “truly outstanding”
Reviews.Author: JerseyDoc
Reviews.Content: Needed to get away at the last minute, found an inexpensive deal on this place $150/night, checked Trip Advisor and decided to take a chance... and this was one of the nicest properties that we have stayed in. A 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite with an in room jacuzzi that fits 3. The suites are decorated with the highest degree of quality and style. They have multiple pools, very kid friendly, close to everything (within 10 mins) of almost everything in Orlando. The staff went out of their way to assist with anything. The pool bar had good food, tremendous service. I have nothing negative or even marginal to say, only if I could I would give it 6 stars out of 5!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best place I've stayed in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: johnnyocc
Reviews.Content: I've been coming down to Orlando for years, Floridays has the best Location, talk about convenient to everything, this is it!! The people working there were great, friendly, and a pleasure to speak with and get information from, the families that went there were a pleasure to socialize with, I loved the pool, kid friendly ,also offered a second pool for more of an adult setting, Towels were available easily by the pool. My family really loved the spacious rooms, we opted for the 3 bedroom for just a few more dollars a day, Truly a class act, thanks to all the hotel staff, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations for a family for a great price, but....”
Reviews.Author: travelinband
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with very nice accomodations, they are comfortable, up to date and the rooms are quiet. You don't hear any of the usual hotel traffic because they are condos. Pros- -beds are wonderful, slept great. Separate rooms for my husband and I and our children. And separate living area in case someone wanted to stay up late and watch tv... -Housekeeping responded promptly to call for clean up after my daughter got sick, they came right away and cleaned the floor. -Pool area is fun- my five and one year old loved it. Our most relaxing day in Florida was spent lounging by the pool. Hot tip for families, don't buy the five day Disney passes and try to hit every park. Go once or twice and lounge around the rest of the time. Rushing from one place to the next is just stressful! - I loved having a full kitchen so we could cook breakfast in the morning and store leftovers from restaurants. After having stayed in a condo, I wouldn't go back to a hotel- it's just really convenient and nice and felt very safe. -There is no extra charge for extra guests. My family of four went to Orlando and our friends drove up from South Florida to meet us. They were a family of three and the accomodations worked perfectly. Plenty of room for everyone and everyone was comfortable. Would not be the same in a hotel... - Pretty close to all the theme parks, just make sure to get a good map so you don't get lost at 12:30 am. -Free parking Cons- -Housekeeping. Lack of attention to detail and superficial cleaning. I got into bed one night and basically the bed had been superficially made. The sheets were still down around the bottom of the bed and all I could feel was the blanket. Essentially, housekeeping pulled the bedspread up over the messed up bed and called it good. - Room was beautiful, but dusty. Just seems like this property needs to brush up on its maintenance as far as thorough cleaning goes. My friend who used the spare bathroom found a plastic razor cover in her tub, if it had been cleaned thoroughly before we got there then it wouldn't have been in the tub. - Regarding cleaning, there was a ring around the jacuzzi tub the entire time we were there. No one cleaned the tubs. Housekeeping seems to be limited to changing the towels, emptying the trash and quickly, very quickly, making the beds. No surfaces were dusted or touched. In the hotel's defense, maybe this is what is expected of them. But, it's a hotel with a potential timeshare capability and as a potential owner that is staying on the property, I would want to be impressed by the level of service- and I wasn't. (In particular, the cleaning, everything else was good). -Balcony on second floor was cement- about 4 ft high, so you couldn' t see outside if you were sitting in the living room. Higher rooms had wrought iron that you could see through. With little kids, the cement balcony was actually safer than wrought iron but didn't like that it obstructed the view. -You pay for internet in your room, coffee is free in office if you buy one- and it's Starbucks drip coffee, nothing fancy. The hotel does offer wireless internet but you have to bring your own laptop and sit by the pool or in the main office to access it. -Business center internet costs 1 dollar/5 minutes and 75 cents to print one page. Little pricey. If internet access is important to you, bring your own laptop and sit out by the pool. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. I did like the accomodations, I just wish cleaning would have been a bit more thorough. Cleaning staff was extremely friendly, just did a rush job. But.. I would return to this hotel. I would just make sure to let my cleaning expectations be known when I arrived and I would ask that the staff meet those expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner6
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our apartment, well furnished and had everything we needed as well as several things we didn't - e.g. the blender and electric can opener! Maids came in every day, although I wish they cleaned as well as changing beds and towels. I was woken one morning by the tv in the adjoining apartment but apart from that it was fairly quiet. We were in Block C, close enough to reception and pool but not too close as music around the pool was often very loud in the afternoons. Also there is an issue with people reserving sunbeds and chairs, as there was often nowhere to sit unless you had been out early and reserved a spot, which I won't do. Because of the lack of furniture and the music, I hardly spent any time around the pool. The children loved it though and it didn't get too crowded. The location is good, very convenient for local shops and about 6-8 miles from Universal and Disney parks. The gym is small and equipment limited, but wasn't busy when we were there and I often had the place to myself. Overall, a good place to stay and although we would go back, there are so many developments in the area that I may prefer another apartment that has a cleaning service and plenty of pool furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BigFamily101
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here and changed my reservation from a much more expensive location to this one-what a smart move!!! It is very close to everything Disney and Sea World-Publix and Walgreens right around the corner. Very quiet place-lots of families and no one right up on top of you!! Our room(3 BR-2 BA) was gorgeous and very clean. Towels were excellent(usually my pet peeve of hotels) and the beds were better than average. Staff were excellent and very helpful-with the one exception of a very young girl at the desk without much experience. I found a week day deal on the hotel website that was much cheaper than other travel sites-then booked my final night through Travelocity-that saved me $100.00. Pool was nice and big-be sure to request a bldg. close to pool. Parking was a little too far for me after a long day at the theme parks-but we could have gotton closer had we arrived home earlier. Overall we loved the Floridays and will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PretentiousTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great place for families. Lots of room to spread out. Rooms were very well equipped. Wonderful Pool. One thing to note about the "free wireless internet" - that is only in the lobby and some of the pool area, so bring your laptop. For the business center computers and to plug-in in your room there is a charge. The construction next door was not an issue for us, we were in building A. I would highly recommend FloridaysResort.

Reviews.Title: “Family Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: Duey11598
Reviews.Content: Stay 5 nights at the Floridays Orlando Resort over the Easter Weekend. We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit in the A building. We found the rooms to be very roomy and well funished, comfortable enough for 4 adults, 4 kids from 7yrs to 12yrs old and a set of 18 month old twins. The unit had all the necessary kitchenware. Check-in and check-out was an absolute breeze. The resort is about a 20-25 minute drive from the airport, down the road to Seaworld and about 15 minutes to Disney. The Publix supermarket is a 1 minute drive away. There are some shops in the Publix shopping center. A pretty good Chinese restaurant, The Citrus Garden, for take out. The Premium Outlets are across the street from the Publix Shopping Center. Further down on Vineland ave is an Outback Steakhouse. The pool area is very nice, water is heated to a very warm 85 degrees. While we were down there, Florida's temperature was in the low 70's, a bit cool, but did take a dip or two in the pool. The resorts "Market Place Cafe" offered burgers and sandwhiches but not that much in terms of grocery items. Concierge was very helpful with ticket purchases and Golf course discounts. The cons that i found at the resort was minimal, would have preferred some additional amenities such as a Spa and some children programs, not a big deal because spent most days at the theme parks. Saw the construction next door, but didn't hear any of it while we were there. Overall we found the Floridays to be agreat resort. Has all the things needed for a stay in the Disney area. Would recommend to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drinxx
Reviews.Content: We had never heard of this hotel when we booked it. The hotel we usually stay at was booked solid. So we decided to try the Floriday's Resort. It turns out that this is now our favorite hotel in the Orlando area. The rooms were super clean. Everything was pretty new. We had a 2br room which had a full kitchen, dining room, and 2 baths....One with a big jaccuzzi tub. This hotel is VERY family and kid friendly. Huge pool with big water sprayers for the kids, smaller kiddie pool, separate hot tub, and even a smaller pool in it's own section for adults who want peace and quiet away from the main pool area. There is a decent restaurant and tiki bar near the pool. Free in-room internet access was a nice bonus. Wireless by the pool. All in all, we have stayed in close to a hundred hotels, and this is by far our favorite for leisure. Recommended for families, romance, or business. It suits them all. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!! You must come! Location Location Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Coastermando
Reviews.Content: Floridays is right in the middle of everything! Food and shopping next door, golf not to far away, and Disney,Seaworld and Universal very close by. Room was very nice. We stayed in a 2 bedroom in buidling C. It was near the pool on the second floor. The second floor balconies have a wall which give you more privacy. The main pool was very nice and the food at the cafe was good. Staff at the hotel was very attentative. Would recommend Floridays to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are all correct!”
Reviews.Author: FinsterLongIsland
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews posted on this site prior to our vacation and found them to be accurate. In short, it's a great place with a few minor (very insignificant) flaws. Pros: New building Very close to theme parks and stores Nice sized apartments Nice pool, bar and cafe Right price Very comfortable Cons: Construction next door (not really a big deal) Too much furniture and fake plants in apartments (felt cluttered to me, but maybe some people like that) Pool always very crowded (I guess cause it was nice) Staff was just okay (but we had very little to do with them) Other reviews are much more detailed and I can attest to their accuracy. Read on....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mhood7
Reviews.Content: One of the best resorts I have ever stayed at. Great for the money. Had a 3 BR unit that was top notch. Pools were never crowded. Appeared to have a lot of guests in town on business rather than pleasure which made things around the pool nice and peaceful. Good kids play area at main pool. More food options would be nice but there are plenty of places within 5 minutes on International Blvd. The room was superior. Beautifully decorated. Stove/oven isn't the best in the world but it worked. Staff is very good. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Look for Deals”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Man23
Reviews.Content: We spent Spring Break 2007 at the Floridays Resort. On previous trips to Orlando we always stayed at one of the resort properties (e.g. Disney), but this time we decided to visit multiple parks, and wanted a place close to all but that did not commit us to one set of properties. Floridays was great in several dimensions. Location; very close to SeaWorld and less than 20 minutes to Universal Studios. Disney is close also (we could see the park from our balcony, but we decided to skip Disney this time). The suites are very large and well equipped; our room had an HD TV, full kitchen, and very comfortable beds. Staff was friendly and helpful. The pool area was very clean and was designed for people of all ages - wading area for the toddlers, deeper area for teens, and lap pool for the adults. Service in the cafe was slow, but food was pretty good. Lots of shopping nearby, including a large discount mall. Look for deals - we got a package that included one week at Sea World. We also purchased one week passes to both Univesral parks and spent the week alternating among the three. After a day of walking and waiting in lines, it was nice to come back and jump in the pool. Only negatives: construction activity next door started at 7:00 each day. Also, the temporary entrance makes it difficult to get in and out, but that should be resolved when the permanent entrance opens up. We would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Floridays Resort”
Reviews.Author: pjbm
Reviews.Content: Orlando: Floridays Resort; "Absolutely Magnificent!" Date: March 28, 2007 Reviewer: Moriarity family This was our first trip to Orlando area and Disney attractions. We elected to stay at the Floridays resort and I must say the accomodations were absolutely fantastic, and probably what I enjoyed most about the trip! There were so many good things about our stay at Floridays that it's hard to list them all. Our 3 bedroom suite gave my husband and I and our 3 daughters, ages 10, 13, and 15, plenty of room and privacy when we were ready to escape from the noise and crowds at the theme parks. My favorite time of the day was getting up in the morning and enjoying a cup of coffee on the balcony overlooking the pond and fountain while the sun was rising. The Floridays had 2 pools that the kids enjoyed. There was the convenience of having a washer and dryer in the suite that made packing light a bonus. The full kitchen allowed us to cook meals, at least a nice breakfast so we could keep the costs down for eating out. The service was excellent and staff was very friendly. Location was very convenient to Disney, it took us less than 20 minutes to get from our resort to any of the 4 main theme parks. If we ever were to return to Florida, I would insist on staying at the Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Floridays”
Reviews.Author: sam66Providence
Reviews.Content: Our party of four adults spent 8 days at Floridays and, except for some relatively minor glitches, we had a great experience. We had a three-bedroom sutie which was comfortable, clean, and spacious. Everything that one expects will function in a hotel did so. Upon check-in we discovered that our room would be facing the parking lot, however when we asked for a change the front desk was more than accommodating. We ended up with a suite that faced the pond. With its fountain and waterfowl, this was a delightful view from our balcony. The minor glitches were around housekeeping issues; specifically towel replacement. We always got our towels in one way or another. This would not keep us from returning to Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Floridays for a Memorable Holiday(s)”
Reviews.Author: vacman100
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Floridays twice in March 2007. First week we booked a two bedroom Condo and were upgraded to 3 Bedroom. 2nd week stayed in 2 bedroom. Both accomodations very similar with positive and pleasurable experiences. The Check in by Luis 1st week was very friendly and efficient. The first impression when you open the front door is that the rooms are stunning. Very well appointed with quality furniture. The Master bedroom is spacious and the Bed itself is huge and very comfortable. The ensuite bathroom has a Jacuzzi with a rather strange stable-type door above it that opens into the bedroom. The shower is powerful, although it is diffcult to adjust the shower-head and you cant avoid getting a cold blast when you turn it on. (Just being fussy here) We were in block E, 4th Floor which overlooks a pond and the nearby Fountains resort. The Fountains construction complained about in many of the other posts is now nearly complete, at least as far as it will affect Floridays guests. There was only a very light murmur in the mornings which should disturb only the very, very lightest of sleepers. The pool area is attractive and appears popular with kids. The Bar staff is very friendly and helpful. Particularly TJ who remembered every drink that our party liked, even after we left for a week and returned. Bar Food is good. Starbucks coffee. The convenience shop could do with more stock. If you need groceries there is Walgreens nearby as well as a 7-11 about a half mile away. We stayed in Vistana Villages last year which is excellent. This compares very well indeed. The only real difference is slightly less attractive landscaping, which may improve when a further part of the resort is developed. Slightly better shop at Vistana. This is one of newest resorts in International Drive area so you can be confident that everthing is still fresh, bright and unworn. Would definitely recommend. One tip. Book on the Floridays website for the very cheapest midweek prices you can find for this resort. Very close to Seaworld, Discovery Cove, Dolly Partons Dixie Landing and a large Designer Outlet Mall. Nike, Adidas, Guess, etc etc Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: canswede
Reviews.Content: Great! This was a great resort. We stayed in building E. However, the shuttle to Disney is not on demand. It runs twice in the morning (8 and 9.15 am) and twice at night (6.15 and 9.45). It only stops at Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap name but excellent resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: edub02
Reviews.Content: I just got back from spending 3 nights at Floridays... 3 adults and 1 child. I was a little reluctant just because of its name, but finally decided on that because it was cheaper than The Fountains, The Hilton Grand Vacations and Sheraton Vistatana. All of these resorts are within a 1/2 mile of each other. When we arrived at the resort it looked just like the pictures. I had a quick and easy check in. My room was in building C on the first floor. LIke the previous review I also faced the fountain and could see the pool from my room. Only drawback is that I had to look through a bush of some sort, not a big deal to me at all. The room itself was VERY CLEAN as was the entire resort. The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable. Plenty of dishes and cooking utensils. The room also has a washer and dryer which was a big plus as well. The master bedroom has very nice big bathroom with a whirlpool tub and separate shower. However, this bathroom was poorly lit as well. The other bedroom has 2 nice double beds and a big tv as well. The only drawbacks to the 2nd bedroom is that it is poorly lit and the light from the outside hallway shines into the room even with the blinds closed. The pool area was really nice as well. My son loved it. The deepest area is only 5 feet. The hot tub was nice as well. There is also a separate pool area of about 4 feet that shoots out a fountain, that pool seemed to be rarely used though. I could hear people at 8 or 9 in the morning in the pool until it closed around 11 at night. The pool gets crowded rather quickly and stays that way, but I think there is plenty of chairs and tables to sit at. There is a nice bar area facing the pool as well. The game room is pretty small with only a few games as is the kids play room. Though I never used it the marketplace served some hot food and cold food and the prices didn't seem too bad when I walked in. If you can't get into building B then C is your next best choice. The higher letter in the alphabet the furher away you are from the pool. Other postings have commented on the annoying construction taking place next door at the Fountains. That is not a problem in Building C. From my room I could only hear and see the construction if I came outside to leave. The resort itself is only 7 miles from Universal, 3 miles from Seaworld and real short drive to downtown Disney. RIght around the corner is a very nice designer outlet Going past the outlet will lead you right to International Drive were there are several restaurants to eat and downtown Disney. Also there is another strip mall with a Walgreens and Publix grocery store. For the drinkers there is a liqour store in this strip mall as well, but it is way overpriced. The only damper I had on my trip was that on my second night we didn't receive any housekeeping service, no new towels nor beds made. At check out I mentioned this to the front desk rep who then made a call (after a few minutes of discussing) to the manager of housekeeping and I received a $20 credit for that day. I got a 2 bedroom suite for a little over $600 for 3 nights. Well worth the money, I am sure they next time I visit the price will have jumped. We talked to several other guests at the resort and they all loved it just as much as we did! GREAT GREAT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Floridays was Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaSunny_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We went to the Floridays Resort because we wanted a nice, but reasonably priced vacation. In our group there was two young couples. We had an absolutely fabulous time. Reception was just wonderful, and very accommodating to our questions and requests throughout the week. Before heading to the resort I read reviews on this website and decided to call ahead to request a room away from construction with a nice view. We were placed in building C (rm 405) a 2 bdrm/2bth suite,and it was fabulous! The full kitchen was well equipped with granite countertops, dishwasher, garbage disposal etc. Other reviews mentioned no laundry/dishwasher soap but they do indeed give you these supplies in your room when you arrive along with Starbucks coffee and Crabtree & Evelyn products. They are also more than willing to refill these as needed. There was a balcony with a small table where we ate most of our meals. It even included an outdoor ceiling fan and light. The view was great, as requested. We could see the pool, but weren't directly over it for noise reasons, and we had direct view of a pond/fountain area. It was quite lovely. The rooms were very nice. There were two double beds in one room with a TV and the bathroom was next door. The master bedroom had a king size bed, TV and an ensuite bath. The bathroom was huge with a whirlpool tub and separate shower. It was quite lovely. The only complaint about the rooms was the lack of lighting in the smaller bedroom, it was a bit dim unless you opened the blinds - but then you were looking into the corridor of the hotel (not very private). The pool areas were gorgeous with hot tubs, palm trees, even a sandy area. Be forewarned, people go down early and use towels to book the lounge chairs around the main pool. If you want one during the day you will most likely have to do the same, especially for a group of 4, or go to the smaller pool. We were informed that the third pool/waterpark area won't be built until later this year and into 2008. Be careful if using the Disney/SeaWorld shuttle. Make sure you know where and when you are getting picked up. At the end of the day the shuttle never came and we waited over 30 minutes for it. We finally took another shuttle back to the resort, although reception was very accomodating and paid the expense of $20 before calling their own shuttle company to inquire about the problem. Overall, we had a wonderful time. At the resort, it often felt like the Caribbean more than Orlando with the palm trees, landscaping and poolside bar and grill. We ended up having a fabulous time at this beautiful resort. I would recommend it to anyone wanting to take a great vacation to Orlando. It is close to everything (2 min from Publix, Walgreens, and premier outlets) and it provides a beautiful, relaxing, vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and convenient for families”
Reviews.Author: TheWongClan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews and happy to say they were all accurate. We stayed at Floridays for a family vacation and had a 2 bedroom suite for 2 adults, 2 seniors, 1 toddler and a baby. The suite was located in Bldg F at the back of the resort (a "fireworks" view room- yes we did see fireworks!). It was extremely quiet (no construction noise), but you had to drive to the pool. The suite was spacious enough for us even with the long and narrow room set up. We requested and received a highchair and crib (playpen) very promptly. There were no linens for the crib however. Appreciated all the luxury amenities (ie. TV, Crabtree toiletries and Starbucks coffee). The pool area was great and they even had a playroom for the young ones. The location of the resort is great (loved that it was so close to the Premium Outlets). We were also able to get to Disney and Sea World with ease. Housekeeping was indeed a bit spotty and yes the resort lacked landscaping with "green" areas. That being said, the positive points far outweigh the negatives. It was a great stay and would hope to be back again soon. Tip: If you book early enough (Floridays website), the rate is only US$150/nite for 2 bdrm Sun-Thur stay. Excellent value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Floridays!”
Reviews.Author: sfrieze
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Floridays. It has everything you could ever want or need. Only a couple of blocks from the Premium outlet mall, and a short 5 minute drive to Seaworld. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: pelny
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place with 2 bedrooms and came across the Floridays. Did some homework (as I was a travel agent for many years) and it sounded fine and the price was very doable. It was less than a yr. old, so how bad could it be. Well, let me tell you it was great. Publix was around the corner as was a hugh outlet mall. The kitchen was well equiped, the bedrooms were large and the master bath was very large. They had a shuttle to Disney, Sea World and Universal. We were 4 adults and they have a quiet pool as well as a great main pool. I would tell any of my clients and friend to give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Tried this after staying in WDW resorts 16 times - GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: mozgotch
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at WDW resorts - 16 times (have tried all of them from Grand Floridian to Dixie Landings etc.). After being unable to book a Disney room for under $300 a night, I reluctantly agreed to stay here. I can honesly tell you we were very pleased. The suite was immaculate and it was nice having all the conveniences of home. I am very fussy about the sheets and towels they were spotless, and the bed was exremely comfortable. I will never waste my $$$ on WDW resorts again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: FlTraveler2
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at Floridays. Stayed in Building C which is very close to the clubhouse and pool. Service was great, beds made daily and fresh towels. Starbucks coffee at the cafe. The pool was very nice. Location is close to Disney and shopping and other attractions. Great value for your money!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Boca2007
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservations at Floridays after reading the many positive comments left by others on TripAdvisor. Our stay was wonderful. The rooms are large- we booked a 3 bedroom and the kids loved retreating to their own room at the end of a long day at the parks. Everything is new and very clean, I loved the little extra touches of the Starbucks coffee and Crabtree and Evelyn products. Although we did not have full cleaning service, our beds were made daily and supplies were replentished, including clean towels, everyday. The pool area is large with a nice water play area for the little ones. We were in building 5 which was a bit of a hike to the pool, ask for a closer building if being close to the pool is important to you. Floridays is an excellent value for your money- we paid less here for a 3 bedroom than we would have at most of of the single room, cramped Disney accomodations. It is perfect for a family. I will stay here again and recommend it highly. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: jmay7
Reviews.Content: I visited Orlando last June with my fiance, future mother-in-law, and future brother-in-law. I did not book the trip so I am not sure how much of a "deal" we got, but I can still say we HAD to have gotten a good deal because our room and the resort was beautiful. We stayed in a two room suite, which included a full kitchen, washer, dryer, a sitting room, and a balcony with a beautiful view of the pool. The beds were extremely comfortable and had lots of extra pillows. There were two bathrooms, one of which HUGE and connected to the master bedroom. It had a large whirlpool tub and a separate shower. The sitting area had a flatscreen television with a dvd player. Both bedrooms had regular televisions with dvd players. The room was very clean, and we had a good amount of towels and very nice soap, shampoo, and conditioner. The pool was very large and had a cute little area for children to play in with various objects shooting out water. There was a deeper area for laps, a separate, smaller pool that went to about 4 feet, and a jacuzzi. The staff was always very courteous and we had absolutely no problems!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: chmido
Reviews.Content: My mother and I took my two kids (3,5) to Floridays for 3 nights. The condo was unbelievably clean and brand new. The staff were all helpful and extremely nice. My only complaint is with the supposed "shuttle" to the resorts. You have to sign up for the shuttle 24 hrs in advance and it only holds 15 people. It has a run to Universal and Epcot only in the morning at around 8:15 and another at night at 6:15. You have to go on the shuttle in the morning in order to return on it in the evening. With the schedule of parades and events in the parks and the number of people in the hotel already signed up to take the shuttle, we found we had to drive ourselves to the parks. However, the parks are close to the hotel so it wasn't that big of a deal. There is a nice Publix, Outback Steakhouse, outlet mall right next door as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn05
Reviews.Content: Took the advice of other Trip Advisor users and gave the Floridays a try. Family of five stayed in a two bedroom unit. Very clean, comfortable and penty of room. We usually stay on property when either visiting Disney or Universal, but with our kids growing (ages 18, 16 & 7) a regular hotel room doesn't cut it anymore. The Floridays was in a great location, close enough to everything, but not in a high traffic area. The pool was beautiful and the staff very nice. They are doing construction at another resort next door, but it was not a bother. It was nice to have breakfast in the room before heading to the parks, and nice to have snacks available when we returned. I would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to friends. Enjoy - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: OntarioBarrie
Reviews.Content: I just got back from spending 9 day's at Floridays resort with my 12 year old son. What a great resort. Could not have asked for anything more. Staff were excellent all so friendly and helpful. We had a two bedroom unit, lot's of space. A publix just around the corner made picking up extra's easy and fast. Great location.However you would need a rental car to get around. I hope to come back next year. This is now my favorite resort in orlando. Jill

Reviews.Title: “Best Yet”
Reviews.Author: LURGANMAN
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 8 days here.I found the location excellent ,the staff very helpful and the accomadition was better than anything i have stayed in before.The main swimming pool is great for kids and families. I found it odd that the bar closed at 11.00pm however we were that tired from all the theme parks it didnt bother us.although the resort is not finished i would definatley stay here again.My room had 3 plasma tvs a hot tub and even a dvd player.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: kjododson
Reviews.Content: We only spent 2 nights @ Floridays before heading home from a 2 1/2 week vacation but the Floridays Resort was the best yet. The pool was popular w/ the kids for sure and we were lucky enough to have clear blue skies and sunshine! The Palm Cafe located right outside of the pool was great for snacks, breakfast, lunch and drinks! The drinks were a little pricey but that's to be expected. There is Publix, Walgreens, etc very close to the resort. Resort staff were always onsite, very helpful and super friendly! The rooms were AWESOME...washer and dryer a major plus and the master bedroom/bathroom was great!!

HotelInfo.Name: Floridays Resort Orlando
HotelInfo.Address: 12562 International Drive, Orlando, FL 32821
